    <DIV class="WordSection1 node-law">
 

 
<P class="shorttitle">Employment Standards Act, 2000</P>
 
<P class="chapter">S.O. 2000, Chapter 41</P>
 
<P class="ConsolidationPeriod"><B>Consolidation Period:</B>  From July 1, 2023 to the <U>e-Laws currency date</U>.</P>
 
<P class="comment">Last amendment: 2023, c. 9, Sched. 29, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" href="#sec11_smooth">s. 11</A>.</P>
 

 

 
<P class="MsoNormal">  </P>
 
<A name="part_i_definitions_413"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK0"></A>part i <BR>  definitions</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="186" data-noteup-count-display="186"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="1" data-viibes-start="0"><A name="BK1"></A><B><a name="sec1subsec1" id="sec1subsec1"></A><a name="sec1" id="sec1"></A>1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this Act,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“agent” includes a trade union that represents an employee in collective bargaining; (“mandataire”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“alternative vacation entitlement year” means, with respect to an employee, a recurring 12-month period that begins on a date chosen by the employer, other than the first day of the employee’s employment; (“année de référence différente”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“arbitrator” includes,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a board of arbitration, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the Board, when it is acting under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" s="133" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html#sec133_smooth">section 133</A> of the
<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html">Labour Relations Act, 1995</A></I>; (“arbitre”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“assignment employee” means an employee employed by a temporary help agency for the purpose of being assigned to perform work on a temporary basis for clients of the agency; (“employé ponctuel”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“benefit plan” means a benefit plan provided for an employee by or through his or her employer; (“régime d’avantages sociaux”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“Board” means the Ontario Labour Relations Board; (“Commission”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“building services” means services for a building with respect to food, security and cleaning and any prescribed services for a building; (“services de gestion d’immeubles”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“building services provider” or “provider” means a person who provides building services for a premises and includes the owner or manager of a premises if the owner or manager provides building services for premises the person owns or manages; (“fournisseur de services de gestion d’immeubles”, “fournisseur”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“business” includes an activity, trade or undertaking; (“entreprise”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“business consultant” means an individual who provides advice or services to a business or organization in respect of its performance, including advice or services in respect of the operations, profitability, management, structure, processes, finances, accounting, procurements, human resources, environmental impacts, marketing, risk management, compliance or strategy of the business or organization; (“conseiller commercial”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“client”, in relation to a temporary help agency, means a person or entity that enters into an arrangement with the agency under which the agency agrees to assign or attempt to assign one or more of its assignment employees to perform work for the person or entity on a temporary basis; (“client”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“collector” means a person, other than an employment standards officer, who is authorized by the Director to collect an amount owing under this Act; (“agent de recouvrement”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“continuous operation” means an operation or that part of an operation that normally continues 24 hours a day without cessation in each seven-day period until it is concluded for that period; (“exploitation à fonctionnement ininterrompu”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“Director” means the Director of Employment Standards; (“directeur”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“domestic or sexual violence leave pay” means pay for any paid days of leave taken under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49.7" href="#sec49.7_smooth">section 49.7</A>; (“indemnité de congé en cas de violence familiale ou sexuelle”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“employee” includes,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a person, including an officer of a corporation, who performs work for an employer for wages,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a person who supplies services to an employer for wages,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  a person who receives training from a person who is an employer, if the skill in which the person is being trained is a skill used by the employer’s employees, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  a person who is a homeworker,</P>
 
<P class="definition">  and includes a person who was an employee; (“employé”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“employer” includes,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an owner, proprietor, manager, superintendent, overseer, receiver or trustee of an activity, business, work, trade, occupation, profession, project or undertaking who has control or direction of, or is directly or indirectly responsible for, the employment of a person in it, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  any persons treated as one employer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">section 4</A>, and includes a person who was an employer; (“employeur”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“employment contract” includes a collective agreement; (“contrat de travail”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“employment standard” means a requirement or prohibition under this Act that applies to an employer for the benefit of an employee; (“norme d’emploi”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“establishment”, with respect to an employer, means a location at which the employer carries on business but, if the employer carries on business at more than one location, separate locations constitute one establishment if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the separate locations are located within the same municipality, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  one or more employees at a location have seniority rights that extend to the other location under a written employment contract whereby the employee or employees may displace another employee of the same employer; (“établissement”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“foreign national” has the same meaning as in the <I>Employment Protection for Foreign Nationals Act, 2009</I>; (“étranger”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“homeworker” means an individual who performs work for compensation in premises occupied by the individual primarily as residential quarters but does not include an independent contractor; (“travailleur à domicile”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“hospital” means a hospital as defined in the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="197-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h14/latest/rso-1990-c-h14.html">Hospital Labour Disputes Arbitration Act</A></I>; (“hôpital”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“infectious disease emergency leave pay” means pay for any paid days of leave taken under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A>; (“indemnité de congé spécial en raison d’une maladie infectieuse”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“information technology consultant” means an individual who provides advice or services to a business or organization in respect of its information technology systems, including advice about or services in respect of planning, designing, analyzing, documenting, configuring, developing, testing and installing the business’s or organization’s information technology systems; (“conseiller en technologie de l’information”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“labour relations officer” means a labour relations officer appointed under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html">Labour Relations Act, 1995</A></I>; (“agent des relations de travail”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“licence” means a licence issued under Part XVIII.1; (“permis”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“Minister” means the Minister of Labour; (“ministre”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“Ministry” means the Ministry of Labour; (“ministère”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“overtime hour”, with respect to an employee, means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  if one or more provisions in the employee’s employment contract or in another Act that applies to the employee’s employment provides a greater benefit for overtime than Part VIII (Overtime Pay), an hour of work in excess of the overtime threshold set out in that provision, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  otherwise, an hour of work in excess of the overtime threshold under this Act that applies to the employee’s employment; (“heure supplémentaire”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“person” includes a trade union; (“personne”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“premium pay” means an employee’s entitlement for working on a public holiday as described in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="24" ss="2" href="#sec24subsec2_smooth">subsection 24 (2)</A>; (“salaire majoré”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“prescribed” means prescribed by the regulations; (“prescrit”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“public holiday” means any of the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  New Year’s Day.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.1  Family Day, being the third Monday in February.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Good Friday.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Victoria Day.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Canada Day.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  Labour Day.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  Thanksgiving Day.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  Christmas Day.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  December 26.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.  Any day prescribed as a public holiday; (“jour férié”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“public holiday pay” means an employee’s entitlement with respect to a public holiday as determined under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="24" ss="1" href="#sec24subsec1_smooth">subsection 24 (1)</A>; (“salaire pour jour férié”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“recruiter” has the meaning set out in the regulations; (“recruteur”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“regular rate” means, subject to any regulation made under paragraph 10 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="141" ss="1" href="#sec141subsec1_smooth">subsection 141 (1)</A>,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  for an employee who is paid by the hour, the amount earned for an hour of work in the employee’s usual work week, not counting overtime hours,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  otherwise, the amount earned in a given work week divided by the number of non-overtime hours actually worked in that week; (“taux horaire normal”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“regular wages” means wages other than overtime pay, public holiday pay, premium pay, vacation pay, domestic or sexual violence leave pay, infectious disease emergency leave pay, termination pay, severance pay and termination of assignment pay and entitlements under a provision of an employee’s contract of employment that under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" ss="2" href="#sec5subsec2_smooth">subsection 5 (2)</A> prevail over Part VIII, Part X, Part XI, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49" href="#sec49_smooth">section 49</A>.7, subsection 50.1 (1.2), Part XV or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.10.1" href="#sec74.10.1_smooth">section 74.10.1</A>; (“salaire normal”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“regular work day”, with respect to an employee who usually works the same number of hours each day, means a day of that many hours; (“journée normale de travail”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“regular work week”, with respect to an employee who usually works the same number of hours each week, means a week of that many hours but not including overtime hours; (“semaine normale de travail”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“regulations” means the regulations made under this Act; (“règlements”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“reservist” means a member of the reserve force of the Canadian Forces referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12899-current-1" s="15" ss="3" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-n-5/latest/rsc-1985-c-n-5.html#sec15subsec3_smooth">subsection 15 (3)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12899-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-n-5/latest/rsc-1985-c-n-5.html">National Defence Act</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12899-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-n-5/latest/rsc-1985-c-n-5.html"> (Canada)</A>; (“réserviste”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“standard vacation entitlement year” means, with respect to an employee, a recurring 12-month period that begins on the first day of the employee’s employment; (“année de référence normale”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“statutory notice period” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the period of notice of termination required to be given by an employer under Part XV, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  where the employer provides a greater amount of notice than is required under Part XV, that part of the notice period ending with the termination date specified in the notice which equals the period of notice required under Part XV; (“délai de préavis prévu par la loi”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“stub period” means, with respect to an employee for whom the employer establishes an alternative vacation entitlement year,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  if the employee’s first alternative vacation entitlement year begins before the completion of his or her first 12 months of employment, the period that begins on the first day of employment and ends on the day before the start of the alternative vacation entitlement year,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee’s first alternative vacation entitlement year begins after the completion of his or her first 12 months of employment, the period that begins on the day after the day on which his or her most recent standard vacation entitlement year ended and ends on the day before the start of the alternative vacation entitlement year; (“période tampon”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“temporary help agency” means an employer that employs persons for the purpose of assigning them to perform work on a temporary basis for clients of the employer;  (“agence de placement temporaire”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“termination of assignment pay” means pay provided to an assignment employee when the employee’s assignment is terminated before the end of its estimated term under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.10.1" href="#sec74.10.1_smooth">section 74.10.1</A>; (“indemnité de fin d’affectation”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“tip or other gratuity” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a payment voluntarily made to or left for an employee by a customer of the employee’s employer in such circumstances that a reasonable person would be likely to infer that the customer intended or assumed that the payment would be kept by the employee or shared by the employee with other employees,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a payment voluntarily made to an employer by a customer in such circumstances that a reasonable person would be likely to infer that the customer intended or assumed that the payment would be redistributed to an employee or employees,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  a payment of a service charge or similar charge imposed by an employer on a customer in such circumstances that a reasonable person would be likely to infer that the customer intended or assumed that the payment would be redistributed to an employee or employees, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  such other payments as may be prescribed,</P>
 
<P class="definition">  but does not include,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  such payments as may be prescribed, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  such charges as may be prescribed relating to the method of payment used, or a prescribed portion of those charges; (“pourboire ou autre gratification”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“trade union” means an organization that represents employees in collective bargaining under any of the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html">Labour Relations Act, 1995</A></I>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="587-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1993-c-38/latest/so-1993-c-38.html">Crown Employees Collective Bargaining Act, 1993</A></I>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"><B>  </B>3.  The <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="38378-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2014-c-5/latest/so-2014-c-5.html">School Boards Collective Bargaining Act, 2014</A></I>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Part IX of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="649-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-4/latest/so-1997-c-4.html">Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997</A></I>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"><B>  </B>5.  The <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12653-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2008-c-15/latest/so-2008-c-15.html">Colleges Collective Bargaining Act, 2008</A></I>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  Any prescribed Acts or provisions of Acts; (“syndicat”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“vacation entitlement year” means an alternative vacation entitlement year or a standard vacation entitlement year; (“année de référence”) </P>
 
<P class="definition">“wages” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  monetary remuneration payable by an employer to an employee under the terms of an employment contract, oral or written, express or implied,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  any payment required to be made by an employer to an employee under this Act, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  any allowances for room or board under an employment contract or prescribed allowances,</P>
 
<P class="definition">  but does not include,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  tips or other gratuities,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  any sums paid as gifts or bonuses that are dependent on the discretion of the employer and that are not related to hours, production or efficiency,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  expenses and travelling allowances, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (g)  subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" ss="3" href="#sec60subsec3_smooth">subsections 60 (3)</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="62" ss="2" href="#sec62subsec2_smooth">62 (2)</A>, employer contributions to a benefit plan and payments to which an employee is entitled from a benefit plan; (“salaire”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“work week” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a recurring period of seven consecutive days selected by the employer for the purpose of scheduling work, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employer has not selected such a period, a recurring period of seven consecutive days beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday. (“semaine de travail”) 2000, c. 41, s. 1 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">s. 1 (1)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A> (1, 2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96760-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2008-c-15/latest/so-2008-c-15.html">2008, c. 15, s. 85</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96886-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-5/latest/so-2014-c-5.html">2014, c. 5, s. 48</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A> (1-10); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec1subsec2" id="sec1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Assignment to perform work includes training</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For greater certainty, being assigned to perform work for a client of a temporary help agency includes being assigned to the client to receive training for the purpose of performing work for the client. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 1 (11).</P>
 
<a name="sec1subsec3" id="sec1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Agreements in writing</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Unless otherwise provided, a reference in this Act to an agreement between an employer and an employee or to an employer and an employee agreeing to something shall be deemed to be a reference to an agreement in writing or to their agreeing in writing to do something.  2000, c. 41, s. 1 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec1subsec3.1" id="sec1subsec3_1"></A><P class="headnote">Electronic form</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="1" subsection="3.1" alinea="null">(3.1)</SPAN> The requirement in subsection (3) for an agreement to be in writing is satisfied if the agreement is in electronic form. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 1 (12).</P>
 
<a name="sec1subsec4" id="sec1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (3) requires an employment contract that is not a collective agreement to be in writing.  2000, c. 41, s. 1 (4).</P>
 

 
<A name="Part_II_Information_Concerning_Rights_and_Obligations_18147"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK2"></A>Part II <BR>  Information Concerning Rights and Obligations</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Director to prepare poster</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="42" data-noteup-count-display="42"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="2" data-viibes-start="1" data-viibes-end="0"><A name="BK3"></A><B><a name="sec2subsec1" id="sec2subsec1"></A><a name="sec2" id="sec2"></A>2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Director shall prepare and publish a poster providing such information about this Act and the regulations as the Director considers appropriate.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 2 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec2subsec2" id="sec2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">If poster not up to date</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the Director believes that the poster prepared under subsection (1) has become out of date, he or she shall prepare and publish a new poster.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 2 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec2subsec3" id="sec2subsec3"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN>, (4) Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 2 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec2subsec5" id="sec2subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of poster to be provided</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Every employer shall provide each of his or her employees with a copy of the most recent poster published by the Director under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 1 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 2 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec2subsec6" id="sec2subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same – translation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If an employee requests a translation of the poster into a language other than English, the employer shall make enquiries as to whether the Director has prepared a translation of the poster into that language, and if the Director has done so, the employer shall provide the employee with a copy of the translation. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 1 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 2 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec2subsec7" id="sec2subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">When copy of poster to be provided</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employer shall provide an employee with a copy of the poster within 30 days of the day the employee becomes an employee of the employer. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 1 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec2subsec8" id="sec2subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> The most recent poster prepared and published by the Minister under subsection (1) as it read immediately before the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">Restoring Ontario’s Competitiveness Act, 2019</A> </I>received Royal Assent is deemed to have been prepared and published by the Director. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 2 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec2subsec9" id="sec2subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Any translation prepared by the Minister under subsection (6), as it read immediately before the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">Restoring Ontario’s Competitiveness Act, 2019</A> </I>received Royal Assent, is deemed to have been prepared by the Director. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 2 (3).</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_IIi_HOW_THIS_ACT_APPLIES_20629"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK4"></A>PART IIi <BR>  HOW THIS ACT APPLIES</P>
 
<P class="headnote">To whom Act applies</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="52" data-noteup-count-display="52"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="3" data-viibes-start="2" data-viibes-end="1"><A name="BK5"></A><B><a name="sec3subsec1" id="sec3subsec1"></A><a name="sec3" id="sec3"></A>3 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="3" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (2) to (5), the employment standards set out in this Act apply with respect to an employee and his or her employer if,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee’s work is to be performed in Ontario; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee’s work is to be performed in Ontario and outside Ontario but the work performed outside Ontario is a continuation of work performed in Ontario.  2000, c. 41, s. 3 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec3subsec2" id="sec3subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception, federal jurisdiction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> This Act does not apply with respect to an employee and his or her employer if their employment relationship is within the legislative jurisdiction of the Parliament of Canada.  2000, c. 41, s. 3 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec3subsec3" id="sec3subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception, diplomatic personnel</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> This Act does not apply with respect to an employee of an embassy or consulate of a foreign nation and his or her employer.  2000, c. 41, s. 3 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec3subsec4" id="sec3subsec4"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 2 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec3subsec5" id="sec3subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Other exceptions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> This Act does not apply with respect to the following individuals and any person for whom such an individual performs work or from whom such an individual receives compensation:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A secondary school student who performs work under a work experience program authorized by the school board that operates the school in which the student is enrolled.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  An individual who performs work under a program approved by a college of applied arts and technology or a university.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.1  An individual who performs work under a program that is approved by a private career college registered under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="803-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2005-c-28-sch-l/latest/so-2005-c-28-sch-l.html">Private Career Colleges Act, 2005</A></I> and that meets such criteria as may be prescribed.</P>
 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, paragraph 2.1 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="5" href="#sec3subsec5_smooth">subsection 3 (5)</A> of the Act is repealed and the following substituted: (See: 2023, c. 9, Sched. 29, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" href="#sec11_smooth">s. 11</A>)</P>
 
<P class="Yparagraph">  2.1  An individual who performs work under a program that is approved by a career college registered under the <I>Ontario Career Colleges Act, 2005</I> and that meets such criteria as may be prescribed.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A participant in community participation under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-25-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-25-sch-a.html">Ontario Works Act, 1997</A></I>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  An individual who is an inmate of a correctional institution within the meaning of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="274-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-m22/latest/rso-1990-c-m22.html">Ministry of Correctional Services Act</A></I>, is an inmate of a penitentiary, is being held in a detention facility within the meaning of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="377-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p15/latest/rso-1990-c-p15.html">Police Services Act</A> </I>or is being held in a place of temporary detention or youth custody facility under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="13242-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/sc-2002-c-1/latest/sc-2002-c-1.html">Youth Criminal Justice Act </A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="13242-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/sc-2002-c-1/latest/sc-2002-c-1.html">(Canada)</A>, if the individual participates inside or outside the institution, penitentiary, place or facility in a work project or rehabilitation program.</P>
 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, paragraph 4 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="5" href="#sec3subsec5_smooth">subsection 3 (5)</A> of the Act is repealed and the following substituted: (See: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97025-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-1/latest/so-2019-c-1.html">2019, c. 1</A>, Sched. 1, s. 17 (1))</P>
 
<P class="Yparagraph">  4.  An individual who is an inmate of a correctional institution within the meaning of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="274-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-m22/latest/rso-1990-c-m22.html">Ministry of Correctional Services Act</A></I>, is an inmate of a penitentiary or is being held in a place of temporary detention or youth custody facility under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="13242-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/sc-2002-c-1/latest/sc-2002-c-1.html">Youth Criminal Justice Act</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="13242-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/sc-2002-c-1/latest/sc-2002-c-1.html"> (Canada)</A>, if the individual participates inside or outside the institution, penitentiary or place in a work project or rehabilitation program.</P>
 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, paragraph 4 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="5" href="#sec3subsec5_smooth">subsection 3 (5)</A> of the Act is amended by striking out “<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="274-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-m22/latest/rso-1990-c-m22.html">Ministry of Correctional Services Act</A></I>” and substituting “<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="44420-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2018-c-6-sch-2/latest/so-2018-c-6-sch-2.html">Correctional Services and Reintegration Act, 2018</A></I>”. (See: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97012-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-6/latest/so-2018-c-6.html">2018, c. 6</A>, Sched. 3, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="8" href="#sec8_smooth">s. 8</A>)</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  An individual who performs work under an order or sentence of a court or as part of an extrajudicial measure under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="13242-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/sc-2002-c-1/latest/sc-2002-c-1.html">Youth Criminal Justice Act </A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="13242-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/sc-2002-c-1/latest/sc-2002-c-1.html">(Canada)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  An individual who performs work in a simulated job or working environment if the primary purpose in placing the individual in the job or environment is his or her rehabilitation.</P>
 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, paragraph 6 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="5" href="#sec3subsec5_smooth">subsection 3 (5)</A> of the Act is repealed. (See: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" href="#sec2_smooth">s. 2</A>)</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A holder of political, religious or judicial office.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  A member of a quasi-judicial tribunal.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.  A holder of elected office in an organization, including a trade union.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  10.  A police officer, except as provided in Part XVI (Lie Detectors) or in a regulation made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="141" ss="2.1" href="#sec141subsec2.1_smooth">clause 141 (2.1)</A> (c).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  11.  A director of a corporation, except as provided in Part XX (Liability of Directors), Part XXI (Who Enforces this Act and What They Can Do), Part XXII (Complaints and Enforcement), Part XXIII (Reviews by the Board), Part XXIV (Collection), Part XXV (Offences and Prosecutions), Part XXVI (Miscellaneous Evidentiary Provisions), Part XXVII (Regulations) and Part XXVIII (Transition, Amendment, Repeals, Commencement and Short Title).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 11.1  If the requirements of subsection (7) are met, a business consultant or an information technology consultant.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  12.  Any prescribed individuals.  2000, c. 41, s. 3 (5); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96712-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-19/latest/so-2006-c-19.html">2006, c. 19</A>, Sched. D, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="7" href="#sec7_smooth">s. 7</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 2 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 2 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec3subsec6" id="sec3subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Dual roles</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Where an individual who performs work or occupies a position described in subsection (5) also performs some other work or occupies some other position and does so as an employee, nothing in subsection (5) precludes the application of this Act to that individual and his or her employer insofar as that other work or position is concerned.  2000, c. 41, s. 3 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec3subsec7" id="sec3subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Business and IT consultants</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> For the purposes of paragraph 11.1 of subsection (5), the following are the requirements that must be met:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The business consultant or information technology consultant provides services through,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  a corporation of which the consultant is either a director or a shareholder who is a party to a unanimous shareholder agreement, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  a sole proprietorship of which the consultant is the sole proprietor, if the services are provided under a business name of the sole proprietorship that is registered under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="43-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-b17/latest/rso-1990-c-b17.html">Business Names Act</A></I>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  There is an agreement for the consultant’s services that sets out when the consultant will be paid and the amount the consultant will be paid, which must be equal to or greater than $60 per hour, excluding bonuses, commissions, expenses, travelling allowances and benefits, or such other amount as may be prescribed, and must be expressed as an hourly rate.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The consultant is paid the amount set out in the agreement as required by paragraph 2.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Such other requirements as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 2 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec3subsec8" id="sec3subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Rules re calculation of rate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> For the purposes of paragraph 2 of subsection (7), such other rules as may be prescribed apply with respect to the calculation of a consultant’s hourly rate or other compensation. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 2 (2).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Crown bound</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="3.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec3.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=3.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="3.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="3.1" data-viibes-start="3" data-viibes-end="2"><A name="BK6"></A><B><a name="sec3.1" id="sec3_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="3.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">3.1</SPAN> </B>This Act binds the Crown. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Separate persons treated as one employer</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="4" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec4" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=4"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="4" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="124" data-noteup-count-display="124"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="4" data-viibes-start="4" data-viibes-end="3"><A name="BK7"></A><B><a name="sec4subsec1" id="sec4subsec1"></A><a name="sec4" id="sec4"></A>4 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="4" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subsection (2) applies if associated or related activities or businesses are or were carried on by or through an employer and one or more other persons. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 4 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec4subsec2" id="sec4subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The employer and the other person or persons described in subsection (1) shall all be treated as one employer for the purposes of this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 4 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec4subsec3" id="sec4subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Businesses need not be carried on at same time</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (2) applies even if the activities or businesses are not carried on at the same time.  2000, c. 41, s. 4 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec4subsec4" id="sec4subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception, individuals</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsection (2) does not apply with respect to a corporation and an individual who is a shareholder of the corporation unless the individual is a member of a partnership and the shares are held for the purposes of the partnership.  2000, c. 41, s. 4 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec4subsec4.1" id="sec4subsec4_1"></A><P class="headnote">Exception, Crown</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="4.1" alinea="null">(4.1)</SPAN> Subsection (2) does not apply to the Crown, a Crown agency or an authority, board, commission or corporation all of whose members are appointed by the Crown. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 4 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec4subsec5" id="sec4subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Joint and several liability</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Persons who are treated as one employer under this section are jointly and severally liable for any contravention of this Act and the regulations under it and for any wages owing to an employee of any of them.  2000, c. 41, s. 4 (5).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">No contracting out</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="5" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec5" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=5"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="5" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="199" data-noteup-count-display="199"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="5" data-viibes-start="5" data-viibes-end="4"><A name="BK8"></A><B><a name="sec5subsec1" id="sec5subsec1"></A><a name="sec5" id="sec5"></A>5 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="5" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (2), no employer or agent of an employer and no employee or agent of an employee shall contract out of or waive an employment standard and any such contracting out or waiver is void.  2000, c. 41, s. 5 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec5subsec2" id="sec5subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Greater contractual or statutory right</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="5" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If one or more provisions in an employment contract or in another Act that directly relate to the same subject matter as an employment standard provide a greater benefit to an employee than the employment standard, the provision or provisions in the contract or Act apply and the employment standard does not apply.  2000, c. 41, s. 5 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">No treating as if not employee</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="5.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec5.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=5.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="5.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="10" data-noteup-count-display="10"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="5.1" data-viibes-start="6" data-viibes-end="5"><A name="BK9"></A><B><a name="sec5.1subsec1" id="sec5_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec5.1" id="sec5_1"></A>5.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="5.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN><B> </B>An employer shall not treat, for the purposes of this Act, a person who is an employee of the employer as if the person were not an employee under this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec5.1subsec2" id="sec5_1subsec2"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="5.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Settlement by trade union binding</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="6" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec6" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=6"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="6" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="6" data-viibes-start="7" data-viibes-end="6"><A name="BK10"></A><B><a name="sec6" id="sec6"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="6" subsection="null" alinea="null">6</SPAN> </B>A settlement made on an employee’s behalf by a trade union that represents the employee is binding on the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 6.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">Agents</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="7" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec7" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=7"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="7" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="7" data-viibes-start="8" data-viibes-end="7"><A name="BK11"></A><B><a name="sec7" id="sec7"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="7" subsection="null" alinea="null">7</SPAN> </B>An agreement or authorization that may lawfully be made or given by an employee under this Act may be made or given by his or her agent and is binding on the employee as if it had been made or given by the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 7.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">Civil proceedings not affected</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="8" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec8" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=8"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="8" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="20" data-noteup-count-display="20"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="8" data-viibes-start="9" data-viibes-end="8"><A name="BK12"></A><B><a name="sec8subsec1" id="sec8subsec1"></A><a name="sec8" id="sec8"></A>8 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="8" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="97" href="#sec97_smooth">section 97</A>, no civil remedy of an employee against his or her employer is affected by this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 8 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec8subsec2" id="sec8subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="8" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Where an employee commences a civil proceeding against his or her employer under this Act, notice of the proceeding shall be served on the Director on a form approved by the Director on or before the date the civil proceeding is set down for trial.  2000, c. 41, s. 8 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec8subsec3" id="sec8subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Service of notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="8" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The notice shall be served on the Director,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  by being delivered to the Director’s office on a day and at a time when it is open;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  by being mailed to the Director’s office using a method of mail delivery that allows delivery to be verified; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  by being sent to the Director’s office by fax or email.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec8subsec4" id="sec8subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">When service effective</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="8" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Service under subsection (3) shall be deemed to be effected,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  in the case of service under clause (3) (a), on the day shown on a receipt or acknowledgment provided to the employee by the Director or his or her representative;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the case of service under clause (3) (b), on the day shown in the verification;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  in the case of service under clause (3) (c), on the day on which the fax or email is sent, subject to subsection (5).  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec8subsec5" id="sec8subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="8" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Service shall be deemed to be effected on the next day on which the Director’s office is not closed, if the fax or email is sent,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  on a day on which the Director’s office is closed; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  after 5 p.m. on any day.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 1</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="part_iV_continuity_of_employment_34345"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK13"></A>part iV <BR>  continuity of employment</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Sale, etc., of business</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="9" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec9" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=9"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="9" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="51" data-noteup-count-display="51"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="9" data-viibes-start="10" data-viibes-end="9"><A name="BK14"></A><B><a name="sec9subsec1" id="sec9subsec1"></A><a name="sec9" id="sec9"></A>9 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="9" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employer sells a business or a part of a business and the purchaser employs an employee of the seller, the employment of the employee shall be deemed not to have been terminated or severed for the purposes of this Act and his or her employment with the seller shall be deemed to have been employment with the purchaser for the purpose of any subsequent calculation of the employee’s length or period of employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 9 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec9subsec2" id="sec9subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="9" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply if the day on which the purchaser hires the employee is more than 13 weeks after the earlier of his or her last day of employment with the seller and the day of the sale.  2000, c. 41, s. 9 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec9subsec3" id="sec9subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="9" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> In this section, </P>
 
<P class="definition">“sells” includes leases, transfers or disposes of in any other manner, and “sale” has a corresponding meaning.  2000, c. 41, s. 9 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec9subsec4" id="sec9subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Predecessor Acts</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="9" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (1), employment with the seller includes any employment attributed to the seller under this section or a provision of a predecessor Act dealing with sales of businesses.  2000, c. 41, s. 9 (4).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">New building services provider</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="10" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec10" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=10"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="10" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="12" data-noteup-count-display="12"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="10" data-viibes-start="11" data-viibes-end="10"><A name="BK15"></A><B><a name="sec10subsec1" id="sec10subsec1"></A><a name="sec10" id="sec10"></A>10 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="10" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies if the building services provider for a building is replaced by a new provider and an employee of the replaced provider is employed by the new provider.  2000, c. 41, s. 10 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec10subsec2" id="sec10subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">No termination or severance</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="10" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The employment of the employee shall be deemed not to have been terminated or severed for the purposes of this Act and his or her employment with the replaced provider shall be deemed to have been employment with the new provider for the purpose of any subsequent calculation of the employee’s length or period of employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 10 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec10subsec3" id="sec10subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="10" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (2) does not apply if the day on which the new provider hires the employee is more than 13 weeks after the earlier of his or her last day of employment with the replaced provider and the day on which the new provider began servicing the premises.  2000, c. 41, s. 10 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec10subsec4" id="sec10subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Predecessor Acts</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="10" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (2), employment with the replaced provider includes any employment attributed to the replaced provider under this section or under a provision of a predecessor Act dealing with building services providers.  2000, c. 41, s. 10 (4).</P>
 
<A name="PART_v_PAYMENT_OF_WAGES_37263"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK16"></A>PART v <BR>  PAYMENT OF WAGES</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Payment of wages</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="11" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec11" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=11"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="11" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="142" data-noteup-count-display="142"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="11" data-viibes-start="12" data-viibes-end="11"><A name="BK17"></A><B><a name="sec11subsec1" id="sec11subsec1"></A><a name="sec11" id="sec11"></A>11 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="11" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall establish a recurring pay period and a recurring pay day and shall pay all wages earned during each pay period, other than accruing vacation pay, no later than the pay day for that period.  2000, c. 41, s. 11 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec11subsec2" id="sec11subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Method of payment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="11" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer shall pay an employee’s wages,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  by cash;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  by cheque payable only to the employee;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  by direct deposit in accordance with subsection (4); or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  by any other prescribed method of payment. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="6" href="#sec6_smooth">s. 6</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec11subsec3" id="sec11subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Place of payment by cash or cheque</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="11" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If payment is made by cash or cheque, the employer shall ensure that the cash or cheque is given to the employee at his or her workplace or at some other place agreeable to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 11 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec11subsec4" id="sec11subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Direct deposit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="11" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employer may pay an employee’s wages by direct deposit into an account of a financial institution if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the account is in the employee’s name; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  no person other than the employee or a person authorized by the employee has access to the account.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" href="#sec2_smooth">s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<P class="footnote">2000, c. 41, s. 11 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" href="#sec2_smooth">s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec11subsec5" id="sec11subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">If employment ends</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="11" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If an employee’s employment ends, the employer shall pay any wages to which the employee is entitled to the employee not later than the later of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  seven days after the employment ends; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the day that would have been the employee’s next pay day.  2000, c. 41, s. 11 (5).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Statement re wages</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="12" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec12" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=12"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="12" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="48" data-noteup-count-display="48"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="12" data-viibes-start="13" data-viibes-end="12"><A name="BK18"></A><B><a name="sec12subsec1" id="sec12subsec1"></A><a name="sec12" id="sec12"></A>12 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="12" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> On or before an employee’s pay day, the employer shall give to the employee a written statement setting out,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the pay period for which the wages are being paid;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the wage rate, if there is one;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the gross amount of wages and, unless the information is provided to the employee in some other manner, how that amount was calculated;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="3" href="#sec3subsec3_smooth">s. 3 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  the amount and purpose of each deduction from wages;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  any amount with respect to room or board that is deemed to have been paid to the employee under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23" ss="2" href="#sec23subsec2_smooth">subsection 23 (2)</A>; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (g)  the net amount of wages being paid to the employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="2" href="#sec1subsec2_smooth">s. 1 (2)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="3" href="#sec3subsec3_smooth">s. 3 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec12subsec2" id="sec12subsec2"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="12" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="4" href="#sec3subsec4_smooth">s. 3 (4)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec12subsec3" id="sec12subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Electronic copies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="12" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The statement may be provided to the employee by electronic mail rather than in writing if the employee has access to a means of making a paper copy of the statement.  2000, c. 41, s. 12 (3).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Statement re wages on termination</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="12.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec12.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=12.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="12.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="12.1" data-viibes-start="14" data-viibes-end="13"><A name="BK19"></A><B><a name="sec12.1" id="sec12_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="12.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">12.1</SPAN></B><B> </B>On or before the day on which the employer is required to pay wages under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" ss="5" href="#sec11subsec5_smooth">subsection 11 (5)</A>, the employer shall provide the employee with a written statement setting out,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the gross amount of any termination pay or severance pay being paid to the employee;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the gross amount of any vacation pay being paid to the employee;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  unless the information is provided to the employee in some other manner, how the amounts referred to in clauses (a) and (b) were calculated;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  the pay period for which any wages other than wages described in clauses (a) or (b) are being paid;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  the wage rate, if there is one;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  the gross amount of any wages referred to in clause (d) and, unless the information is provided to the employee in some other manner, how that amount was calculated;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (g)  the amount and purpose of each deduction from wages;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (h)  any amount with respect to room or board that is deemed to have been paid to the employee under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23" ss="2" href="#sec23subsec2_smooth">subsection 23 (2)</A>; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (i)  the net amount of wages being paid to the employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="5" href="#sec3subsec5_smooth">s. 3 (5)</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Deductions, etc.</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="13" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec13" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=13"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="13" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="202" data-noteup-count-display="202"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="13" data-viibes-start="15" data-viibes-end="14"><A name="BK20"></A><B><a name="sec13subsec1" id="sec13subsec1"></A><a name="sec13" id="sec13"></A>13 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="13" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall not withhold wages payable to an employee, make a deduction from an employee’s wages or cause the employee to return his or her wages to the employer unless authorized to do so under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 13 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec13subsec2" id="sec13subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Statute or court order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="13" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer may withhold or make a deduction from an employee’s wages or cause the employee to return them if a statute of Ontario or Canada or a court order authorizes it.  2000, c. 41, s. 13 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec13subsec3" id="sec13subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Employee authorization</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="13" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employer may withhold or make a deduction from an employee’s wages or cause the employee to return them with the employee’s written authorization.  2000, c. 41, s. 13 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec13subsec4" id="sec13subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="13" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsections (2) and (3) do not apply if the statute, order or written authorization from the employee requires the employer to remit the withheld or deducted wages to a third person and the employer fails to do so.  2000, c. 41, s. 13 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec13subsec5" id="sec13subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="13" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Subsection (3) does not apply if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee’s authorization does not refer to a specific amount or provide a formula from which a specific amount may be calculated;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee’s wages were withheld, deducted or required to be returned,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  because of faulty work,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  because the employer had a cash shortage, lost property or had property stolen and a person other than the employee had access to the cash or property, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (iii)  under any prescribed conditions; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the employee’s wages were required to be returned and those wages were the subject of an order under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 13 (5).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Priority of claims</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="14" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec14" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=14"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="14" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="14" data-viibes-start="16" data-viibes-end="15"><A name="BK21"></A><B><a name="sec14subsec1" id="sec14subsec1"></A><a name="sec14" id="sec14"></A>14 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="14" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite any other Act, wages shall have priority over and be paid before the claims and rights of all other unsecured creditors of an employer, to the extent of $10,000 per employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 14 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec14subsec2" id="sec14subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to a distribution made under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12759-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-b-3/latest/rsc-1985-c-b-3.html">Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12759-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-b-3/latest/rsc-1985-c-b-3.html"> (Canada)</A> or other legislation enacted by the Parliament of Canada respecting bankruptcy or insolvency.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="3" href="#sec1subsec3_smooth">s. 1 (3)</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Part_v_1_employee_tips_and_other_gratuities_44844"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK22"></A>Part v.1 <BR>  employee tips and other gratuities</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="14.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec14.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=14.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="14.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="14.1" data-viibes-start="17" data-viibes-end="16"><B><a name="sec14.1" id="sec14_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="14.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">14.1</SPAN></B> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="7" href="#sec7_smooth">s. 7</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Prohibition re tips or other gratuities</P>
