<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="14.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec14.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=14.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="14.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="14.2" data-viibes-start="18" data-viibes-end="17"><A name="BK23"></A><B><a name="sec14.2subsec1" id="sec14_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec14.2" id="sec14_2"></A>14.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="14.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall not withhold tips or other gratuities from an employee, make a deduction from an employee’s tips or other gratuities or cause the employee to return or give his or her tips or other gratuities to the employer unless authorized to do so under this Part. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec14.2subsec2" id="sec14_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Enforcement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an employer contravenes subsection (1), the amount withheld, deducted, returned or given is a debt owing to the employee and is enforceable under this Act as if it were wages owing to the employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Statute or court order</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="14.3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec14.3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=14.3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="14.3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="14.3" data-viibes-start="19" data-viibes-end="18"><A name="BK24"></A><B><a name="sec14.3subsec1" id="sec14_3subsec1"></A><a name="sec14.3" id="sec14_3"></A>14.3 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="14.3" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer may withhold or make a deduction from an employee’s tips or other gratuities or cause the employee to return or give them to the employer if a statute of Ontario or Canada or a court order authorizes it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec14.3subsec2" id="sec14_3subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.3" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply if the statute or order requires the employer to remit the withheld, deducted, returned or given tips or other gratuities to a third person and the employer fails to do <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" s="1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html#sec1_smooth">so. 2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Pooling of tips or other gratuities</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="14.4" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec14.4" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=14.4"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="14.4" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="14.4" data-viibes-start="20" data-viibes-end="19"><A name="BK25"></A><B><a name="sec14.4subsec1" id="sec14_4subsec1"></A><a name="sec14.4" id="sec14_4"></A>14.4 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="14.4" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer may withhold or make a deduction from an employee’s tips or other gratuities or cause the employee to return or give them to the employer if the employer collects and redistributes tips or other gratuities among some or all of the employer’s employees. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec14.4subsec2" id="sec14_4subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.4" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer shall not redistribute tips or other gratuities under subsection (1) to such employees as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec14.4subsec3" id="sec14_4subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Employer, etc. not to share in tips or other gratuities</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.4" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (4) and (5), an employer or a director or shareholder of an employer may not share in tips or other gratuities redistributed under subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec14.4subsec4" id="sec14_4subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception — sole proprietor, partner</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.4" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employer who is a sole proprietor or a partner in a partnership may share in tips or other gratuities redistributed under subsection (1) if he or she regularly performs to a substantial degree the same work performed by,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  some or all of the employees who share in the redistribution; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  employees of other employers in the same industry who commonly receive or share tips or other gratuities. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec14.4subsec5" id="sec14_4subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Exception — director, shareholder</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.4" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> A director or shareholder of an employer may share in tips or other gratuities redistributed under subsection (1) if he or she regularly performs to a substantial degree the same work performed by,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  some or all of the employees who share in the redistribution; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  employees of other employers in the same industry who commonly receive or share tips or other gratuities. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Transition — collective agreements</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="14.5" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec14.5" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=14.5"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="14.5" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="14.5" data-viibes-start="21" data-viibes-end="20"><A name="BK26"></A><B><a name="sec14.5subsec1" id="sec14_5subsec1"></A><a name="sec14.5" id="sec14_5"></A>14.5 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="14.5" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If a collective agreement that is in effect on the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" s="1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html#sec1_smooth">section 1</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">Protecting Employees’ Tips Act, 2015</A></I> comes into force contains a provision that addresses the treatment of employee tips or other gratuities and there is a conflict between the provision of the collective agreement and this Part, the provision of the collective agreement prevails. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec14.5subsec2" id="sec14_5subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same — expiry of agreement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.5" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Following the expiry of a collective agreement described in subsection (1), if the provision that addresses the treatment of employee tips or other gratuities remains in effect, subsection (1) continues to apply to that provision, with necessary modifications, until a new or renewal agreement comes into effect. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec14.5subsec3" id="sec14_5subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same — renewed or new agreement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="14.5" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply to a collective agreement that is made or renewed on or after the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" s="1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html#sec1_smooth">section 1</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">Protecting Employees’ Tips Act, 2015</A></I> comes into force. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96928-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-32/latest/so-2015-c-32.html">2015, c. 32, s. 1</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_vi_RECORDS_49617"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK27"></A>PART vi <BR>  RECORDS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Records</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="15" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec15" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=15"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="15" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="61" data-noteup-count-display="61"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="15" data-viibes-start="22" data-viibes-end="21"><A name="BK28"></A><B><a name="sec15subsec1" id="sec15subsec1"></A><a name="sec15" id="sec15"></A>15 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="15" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall record the following information with respect to each employee, including an employee who is a homeworker:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s name and address.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The employee’s date of birth, if the employee is a student and under 18 years of age.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The date on which the employee began his or her employment.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.1  The dates and times that the employee worked.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.2  If the employee has two or more regular rates of pay for work performed for the employer and, in a work week, the employee performed work for the employer in excess of the overtime threshold, the dates and times that the employee worked in excess of the overtime threshold at each rate of pay.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  The number of hours the employee worked in each day and each week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The information contained in each written statement given to the employee under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12" ss="1" href="#sec12subsec1_smooth">subsection 12 (1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12.1" href="#sec12.1_smooth">section 12.1</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="27" ss="2.1" href="#sec27subsec2.1_smooth">subsections 27 (2.1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="28" ss="2.1" href="#sec28subsec2.1_smooth">28 (2.1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="29" ss="1.1" href="#sec29subsec1.1_smooth">29 (1.1)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="30" ss="2.1" href="#sec30subsec2.1_smooth">30 (2.1)</A> and clause 36 (3) (b).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="7" href="#sec3subsec7_smooth">s. 3 (7)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="footnote">2000, c. 41, s. 15 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A> (6, 7); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="8" href="#sec8_smooth">s. 8</A> (1, 3).</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec2" id="sec15subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Homeworkers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> In addition to the record described in subsection (1), the employer shall maintain a register of any homeworkers the employer employs showing the following information:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s name and address.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The information that is contained in all statements required to be provided to the employee described in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12" ss="1" href="#sec12subsec1_smooth">clause 12 (1)</A> (b).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Any prescribed information.  2000, c. 41, s. 15 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec3" id="sec15subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employer is not required to record the information described in paragraph 3.1 or 4 of subsection (1) with respect to an employee who is paid a salary if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer records the number of hours in excess of those in his or her regular work week and,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  the number of hours in excess of eight that the employee worked in each day, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  if the number of hours in the employee’s regular work day is more than eight hours, the number in excess; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" href="#sec17_smooth">sections 17</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">19</A> and Part VIII (Overtime Pay) do not apply with respect to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 15 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 8 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec4" id="sec15subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Meaning of salary</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee is considered to be paid a salary for the purposes of subsection (3) if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee is entitled to be paid a fixed amount for each pay period; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the amount actually paid for each pay period does not vary according to the number of hours worked by the employee, unless he or she works more than 44 hours in a week.  2000, c. 41, s. 15 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec5" id="sec15subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Retention of records</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The employer shall retain or arrange for some other person to retain the records of the information required under this section for the following periods:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  For information referred to in paragraph 1 or 3 of subsection (1), three years after the employee ceased to be employed by the employer.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  For information referred to in paragraph 2 of subsection (1), the earlier of,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  three years after the employee’s 18th birthday, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  three years after the employee ceased to be employed by the employer.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  For information referred to in paragraph 3.1, 3.2 or 4 of subsection (1) or in subsection (3), three years after the day or week to which the information relates.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  For information referred to in paragraph 5 of subsection (1), three years after the information was given to the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="8" href="#sec3subsec8_smooth">s. 3 (8)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="footnote">2000, c. 41, s. 15 (5); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" ss="8" href="#sec3subsec8_smooth">s. 3 (8)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 8 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec6" id="sec15subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Register of homeworkers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Information pertaining to a homeworker may be deleted from the register three years after the homeworker ceases to be employed by the employer.  2000, c. 41, s. 15 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec7" id="sec15subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Retain documents re leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employer shall retain or arrange for some other person to retain all notices, certificates, correspondence and other documents given to or produced by the employer that relate to an employee taking pregnancy leave, parental leave, family medical leave, organ donor leave, family caregiver leave, critical illness leave, child death leave, crime-related child disappearance leave, domestic or sexual violence leave, sick leave, family responsibility leave, bereavement leave, emergency leave during a declared emergency or an infectious disease emergency or reservist leave for three years after the day on which the leave expired.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96706-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-13/latest/so-2006-c-13.html">2006, c. 13, s. 3 (1)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" href="#sec2_smooth">s. 2</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="8" href="#sec8_smooth">s. 8</A> (7, 8); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec8" id="sec15subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Retention of agreements re excess hours</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> An employer shall retain or arrange for some other person to retain copies of every agreement that the employer has made with an employee permitting the employee to work hours in excess of the limits set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="1" href="#sec17subsec1_smooth">subsection 17 (1)</A> for three years after the last day on which work was performed under the agreement.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec8.1" id="sec15subsec8_1"></A><P class="headnote">Retention of disconnecting from work policies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="8.1" alinea="null">(8.1)</SPAN> An employer shall retain or arrange for some other person to retain copies of every written policy on disconnecting from work required under Part VII.0.1 for three years after the policy ceases to be in effect. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" href="#sec2_smooth">s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec8.2" id="sec15subsec8_2"></A><P class="headnote">Retention of electronic monitoring policy</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="8.2" alinea="null">(8.2)</SPAN> An employer shall retain or arrange for some other person to retain copies of every written policy on electronic monitoring required under Part XI.1 for three years after the policy ceases to be in effect. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec15subsec9" id="sec15subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Retention of averaging agreements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> An employer shall retain or arrange for some other person to retain copies of every averaging agreement that the employer has made with an employee under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="22" ss="2" href="#sec22subsec2_smooth">clause 22 (2)</A> (a) for three years after the last day on which work was performed under the agreement.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 2</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Record re vacation time and vacation pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="15.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec15.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=15.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="15.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="14" data-noteup-count-display="14"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="15.1" data-viibes-start="23" data-viibes-end="22"><A name="BK29"></A><B><a name="sec15.1subsec1" id="sec15_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec15.1" id="sec15_1"></A>15.1</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="15.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall record information concerning an employee’s entitlement to vacation time and vacation pay in accordance with this section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec9" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="9" data-link-type="weak" rank="1">s. 3 (9)</SPAN>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec15.1subsec2" id="sec15_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Content of record</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The employer shall record the following information:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The amount of vacation time, if any, that the employee had earned since the start of employment but had not taken before the start of the vacation entitlement year.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The amount of vacation time that the employee earned during the vacation entitlement year.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The amount of vacation time, if any, taken by the employee during the vacation entitlement year.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  The amount of vacation time, if any, that the employee had earned since the start of employment but had not taken as of the end of the vacation entitlement year.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.1  The amount of vacation pay that the employee earned during the vacation entitlement year and how that amount was calculated.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The amount of vacation pay paid to the employee during the vacation entitlement year.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  The amount of wages on which the vacation pay referred to in paragraph 5 was calculated and the period of time to which those wages relate.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec9" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="9" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (9)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 9 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec15.1subsec3" id="sec15_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Additional requirement, alternative vacation entitlement year</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the employer establishes an alternative vacation entitlement year for an employee, the employer shall record the following information for the stub period:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The amount of vacation time that the employee earned during the stub period.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The amount of vacation time, if any, that the employee took during the stub period.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The amount of vacation time, if any, earned but not taken by the employee during the stub period.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.1  The amount of vacation pay that the employee earned during the stub period and how that amount was calculated.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  The amount of vacation pay paid to the employee during the stub period.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The amount of wages on which the vacation pay referred to in paragraph 4 was calculated and the period of time to which those wages relate.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec9" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="9" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (9)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 9 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec15.1subsec4" id="sec15_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">When information to be recorded</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employer shall record information under this section by a date that is not later than the later of, </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  seven days after the start of the next vacation entitlement year or the first vacation entitlement year, as the case may be; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the first pay day of the next vacation entitlement year or of the first vacation entitlement year, as the case may be.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec9" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="9" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (9)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec15.1subsec5" id="sec15_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Retention of records</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The employer shall retain or arrange for some other person to retain each record required under this section for five years after it was made.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec9" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="9" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (9)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 9 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec15.1subsec6" id="sec15_1subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Paragraphs 5 and 6 of subsection (2) and paragraphs 4 and 5 of subsection (3) do not apply with respect to an employee whose employer pays vacation pay in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" ss="3" href="#sec36subsec3_smooth">subsection 36 (3)</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec9" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="9" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (9)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec15.1subsec7" id="sec15_1subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="15.1" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15.1" ss="2" href="#sec15.1subsec2_smooth">Subsections 15.1 (2)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15.1" ss="3" href="#sec15.1subsec3_smooth">(3)</A>, as they read immediately before the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">section 9</A> of Schedule 1 to the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">Fair Workplaces, Better Jobs Act, 2017</A></I> came into force, continue to apply with respect to vacation entitlement years and stub periods that began before that day. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 9 (4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Availability</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="16" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec16" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=16"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="16" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="7" data-noteup-count-display="7"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="16" data-viibes-start="24" data-viibes-end="23"><A name="BK30"></A><B><a name="sec16" id="sec16"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="16" subsection="null" alinea="null">16</SPAN> </B>An employer shall ensure that all of the records and documents required to be retained under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15" href="#sec15_smooth">sections 15</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15.1" href="#sec15.1_smooth">15.1</A> are readily available for inspection as required by an employment standards officer, even if the employer has arranged for another person to retain them.  2000, c. 41, s. 16; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 3</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<A name="PART_Vii_HOURS_OF_WORK_AND_EATING_PERIODS_61456"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK31"></A>PART Vii <BR>  HOURS OF WORK AND EATING PERIODS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Limit on hours of work</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="17" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec17" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=17"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="17" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="47" data-noteup-count-display="47"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="17" data-viibes-start="25" data-viibes-end="24"><A name="BK32"></A><B><a name="sec17subsec1" id="sec17subsec1"></A><a name="sec17" id="sec17"></A>17 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="17" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (2) and (3), no employer shall require or permit an employee to work more than,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  eight hours in a day or, if the employer establishes a regular work day of more than eight hours for the employee, the number of hours in his or her regular work day; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  48 hours in a work week.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec2" id="sec17subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception: hours in a day</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee’s hours of work may exceed the limit set out in clause (1) (a) if the employee has made an agreement with the employer that he or she will work up to a specified number of hours in a day in excess of the limit and his or her hours of work in a day do not exceed the number specified in the agreement.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec3" id="sec17subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception: hours in a work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee’s hours of work may exceed the limit set out in clause (1) (b) if the employee has made an agreement with the employer that he or she will work up to a specified number of hours in a work week in excess of the limit and his or her hours of work in a work week do not exceed the number of hours specified in the agreement. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec4" id="sec17subsec4"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec5" id="sec17subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Document re employee rights</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An agreement described in subsection (2) or (3) is not valid unless,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer has, before the agreement is made, provided the employee with a copy of the most recent document published by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21.1" href="#sec21.1_smooth">section 21.1</A>; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the agreement contains a statement in which the employee acknowledges that he or she has received a document that the employer has represented is the most recent document published by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21.1" href="#sec21.1_smooth">section 21.1</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 4</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec6" id="sec17subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Revocation by employee</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> An employee may revoke an agreement described in subsection (2) or (3) two weeks after giving written notice to the employer.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 4</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec7" id="sec17subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Revocation by employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employer may revoke an agreement described in subsection (2) or (3) after giving reasonable notice to the employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 4</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec8" id="sec17subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Transition:  certain agreements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> For the purposes of this section,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an agreement to exceed the limit on hours of work in a day set out in clause (1) (a) of this section as it read on February 28, 2005 shall be treated as if it were an agreement described in subsection (2);</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  an agreement to exceed the limit on hours of work in a work week set out in clause (1) (b) of this section as it read on February 28, 2005 shall be treated as if it were an agreement described in subsection (3); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  an agreement to exceed the limit on hours of work in a work week set out in clause (2) (b) of this section as it read on February 28, 2005 shall be treated as if it were an agreement described in subsection (3).  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 4</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec9" id="sec17subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Document re employee rights – exceptions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Subsection (5) does not apply in respect of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an agreement described in subsection (8); or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  an agreement described in subsection (2) or (3) in respect of an employee who is represented by a trade union.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 4</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec17subsec10" id="sec17subsec10"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN>, (11) Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 3 (4).</P>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="17.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec17.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=17.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="17.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="10" data-noteup-count-display="10"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="17.1" data-viibes-start="26" data-viibes-end="25"><B><a name="sec17.1" id="sec17_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="17.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">17.1 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="17.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec17.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=17.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="17.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="17.2" data-viibes-start="27" data-viibes-end="26"><B><a name="sec17.2" id="sec17_2"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="17.2" subsection="null" alinea="null">17.2 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="17.3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec17.3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=17.3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="17.3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="17.3" data-viibes-start="28" data-viibes-end="27"><B><a name="sec17.3" id="sec17_3"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="17.3" subsection="null" alinea="null">17.3 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="6" href="#sec6_smooth">s. 6</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Hours free from work</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="18" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec18" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=18"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="18" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="28" data-noteup-count-display="28"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="18" data-viibes-start="29" data-viibes-end="28"><A name="BK33"></A><B><a name="sec18subsec1" id="sec18subsec1"></A><a name="sec18" id="sec18"></A>18 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="18" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall give an employee a period of at least 11 consecutive hours free from performing work in each day.  2000, c. 41, s. 18 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec10" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="10" data-link-type="weak" rank="1">s. 3 (10)</SPAN>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec18subsec2" id="sec18subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply to an employee who is on call and called in during a period in which the employee would not otherwise be expected to perform work for his or her employer.  2000, c. 41, s. 18 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="10" href="#sec10_smooth">s. 10</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec18subsec3" id="sec18subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Free from work between shifts</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employer shall give an employee a period of at least eight hours free from the performance of work between shifts unless the total time worked on successive shifts does not exceed 13 hours or unless the employer and the employee agree otherwise.  2000, c. 41, s. 18 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec18subsec4" id="sec18subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Weekly or biweekly free time requirements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employer shall give an employee a period free from the performance of work equal to,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  at least 24 consecutive hours in every work week; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  at least 48 consecutive hours in every period of two consecutive work weeks.  2000, c. 41, s. 18 (4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Exceptional circumstances</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="19" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec19" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=19"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="19" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="23" data-noteup-count-display="23"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="19" data-viibes-start="30" data-viibes-end="29"><A name="BK34"></A><B><a name="sec19" id="sec19"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="19" subsection="null" alinea="null">19</SPAN> </B>An employer may require an employee to work more than the maximum number of hours permitted under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" href="#sec17_smooth">section 17</A> or to work during a period that is required to be free from performing work under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="18" href="#sec18_smooth">section 18</A> only as follows, but only so far as is necessary to avoid serious interference with the ordinary working of the employer’s establishment or operations:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  To deal with an emergency.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If something unforeseen occurs, to ensure the continued delivery of essential public services, regardless of who delivers those services.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If something unforeseen occurs, to ensure that continuous processes or seasonal operations are not interrupted.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  To carry out urgent repair work to the employer’s plant or equipment.  2000, c. 41, s. 19.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Eating periods</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="20" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec20" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=20"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="20" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="29" data-noteup-count-display="29"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="20" data-viibes-start="31" data-viibes-end="30"><A name="BK35"></A><B><a name="sec20subsec1" id="sec20subsec1"></A><a name="sec20" id="sec20"></A>20 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="20" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall give an employee an eating period of at least 30 minutes at intervals that will result in the employee working no more than five consecutive hours without an eating period.  2000, c. 41, s. 20 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec20subsec2" id="sec20subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="20" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply if the employer and the employee agree, whether or not in writing, that the employee is to be given two eating periods that together total at least 30 minutes in each consecutive five-hour period.  2000, c. 41, s. 20 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Payment not required</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="21" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec21" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=21"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="21" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="21" data-viibes-start="32" data-viibes-end="31"><A name="BK36"></A><B><a name="sec21" id="sec21"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="21" subsection="null" alinea="null">21</SPAN> </B>An employer is not required to pay an employee for an eating period in which work is not being performed unless his or her employment contract requires such payment.  2000, c. 41, s. 21.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">Director to prepare document</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="21.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec21.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=21.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="21.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="21.1" data-viibes-start="33" data-viibes-end="32"><A name="BK37"></A><B><a name="sec21.1subsec1" id="sec21_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec21.1" id="sec21_1"></A>21.1</B> <SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="21.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Director shall prepare and publish a document that describes such rights of employees and obligations of employers under this Part and Part VIII as the Director believes an employee should be made aware of in connection with an agreement referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="2" href="#sec17subsec2_smooth">subsection 17 (2)</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="3" href="#sec17subsec3_smooth">(3)</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 5</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="7" href="#sec7_smooth">s. 7</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec21.1subsec2" id="sec21_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">If document not up to date</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="21.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the Director believes that a document prepared under subsection (1) has become out of date, he or she shall prepare and publish a new document.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 5</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_VII_0_1_WRITTEN_POLICY_ON_DISCONNECTING_FROM_WORK_69750"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK38"></A>PART VII.0.1 <BR>  WRITTEN POLICY ON DISCONNECTING FROM WORK</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Interpretation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="21.1.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec21.1.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=21.1.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="21.1.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="21.1.1" data-viibes-start="34" data-viibes-end="33"><A name="BK39"></A><B><a name="sec21.1.1" id="sec21_1_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="21.1.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">21.1.1</SPAN> </B>In this Part,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“disconnecting from work” means not engaging in work-related communications, including emails, telephone calls, video calls or the sending or reviewing of other messages, so as to be free from the performance of work. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Written policy on disconnecting from work</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="21.1.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec21.1.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=21.1.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="21.1.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="21.1.2" data-viibes-start="35" data-viibes-end="34"><A name="BK40"></A><B><a name="sec21.1.2subsec1" id="sec21_1_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec21.1.2" id="sec21_1_2"></A>21.1.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="21.1.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer that, on January 1 of any year, employs 25 or more employees shall, before March 1 of that year, ensure it has a written policy in place for all employees with respect to disconnecting from work that includes the date the policy was prepared and the date any changes were made to the policy. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec21.1.2subsec2" id="sec21_1_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of policy</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="21.1.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer shall provide a copy of the written policy with respect to disconnecting from work to each of the employer’s employees within 30 days of preparing the policy or, if an existing written policy is changed, within 30 days of the changes being made. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec21.1.2subsec3" id="sec21_1_2subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="21.1.2" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employer shall provide a copy of the written policy with respect to disconnecting from work that applies to a new employee within 30 days of the day the employee becomes an employee of the employer. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec21.1.2subsec4" id="sec21_1_2subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Prescribed information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="21.1.2" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> A written policy required under subsection (1) shall contain such information as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec21.1.2subsec5" id="sec21_1_2subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="21.1.2" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Despite subsection (1), an employer shall,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  have until the date that is six months after the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">Working for Workers Act, 2021</A> </I>receives Royal Assent instead of March 1 to comply with the requirements of subsection (1); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  determine whether it employs 25 employees or more as of the January 1 immediately preceding the date described in clause (a). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Part_VII_1_Three_Hour_Rule_72101"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK41"></A>Part VII.1 <BR>  Three Hour Rule</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Three hour rule</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="21.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec21.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=21.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="21.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="21.2" data-viibes-start="36" data-viibes-end="35"><A name="BK42"></A><B><a name="sec21.2subsec1" id="sec21_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec21.2" id="sec21_2"></A>21.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="21.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employee who regularly works more than three hours a day is required to present himself or herself for work but works less than three hours, despite being available to work longer, the employer shall pay the employee wages for three hours, equal to the greater of the following:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The sum of,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  the amount the employee earned for the time worked, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  wages equal to the employee’s regular rate for the remainder of the time.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Wages equal to the employee’s regular rate for three hours of work. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec21.2subsec2" id="sec21_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="21.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply if the employer is unable to provide work for the employee because of fire, lightning, power failure, storms or similar causes beyond the employer’s control that result in the stopping of work. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_Viii_OVERTIME_PAY_73257"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK43"></A>PART Viii <BR>  OVERTIME PAY</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Overtime threshold</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="22" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec22" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=22"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="22" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="109" data-noteup-count-display="109"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="22" data-viibes-start="37" data-viibes-end="36"><A name="BK44"></A><B><a name="sec22subsec1" id="sec22subsec1"></A><a name="sec22" id="sec22"></A>22 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="22" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (1.1), an employer shall pay an employee overtime pay of at least one and one-half times his or her regular rate for each hour of work in excess of 44 hours in each work week or, if another threshold is prescribed, that prescribed threshold.  2000, c. 41, s. 22 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96833-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2011-c-1/latest/so-2011-c-1.html">2011, c. 1</A>, Sched. 7, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 13 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec22subsec1.1" id="sec22subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same, two or more regular rates</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> If an employee has two or more regular rates for work performed for the same employer in a work week,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee is entitled to be paid overtime pay for each hour of work performed in the week after the total number of hours performed for the employer reaches the overtime threshold; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the overtime pay for each hour referred to in clause (a) is one and one-half times the regular rate that applies to the work performed in that hour. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 13 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec2" id="sec22subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Averaging</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee’s hours of work may be averaged over separate, non-overlapping, contiguous periods of two or more consecutive weeks for the purpose of determining the employee’s entitlement, if any, to overtime pay if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee has made an agreement with the employer that his or her hours of work may be averaged over periods of a specified number of weeks; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the averaging period does not exceed four weeks or the number of weeks specified in the agreement, whichever is lower. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec2.1" id="sec22subsec2_1"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec2.2" id="sec22subsec2_2"></A><P class="headnote">Transition: certain agreements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="2.2" alinea="null">(2.2)</SPAN> For the purposes of this section, each of the following agreements shall be treated as if it were an agreement described in clause (2) (a):</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  An agreement to average hours of work made under a predecessor to this Act.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  An agreement to average hours of work made under this section as it read on February 28, 2005.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  An agreement to average hours of work that complies with the conditions prescribed by the regulations made under paragraph 7 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="141" ss="1" href="#sec141subsec1_smooth">subsection 141 (1)</A> as it read on February 28, 2005.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 6 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec3" id="sec22subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Term of agreement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (3.1) and (3.2), an averaging agreement is not valid unless it provides for a start date and an expiry date. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec3.1" id="sec22subsec3_1"></A><P class="headnote">Limit on agreement, not represented by trade union</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="3.1" alinea="null">(3.1)</SPAN> If the employee is not represented by a trade union, the averaging agreement’s expiry date shall not be more than two years after the start date. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec3.2" id="sec22subsec3_2"></A><P class="headnote">Limit on agreement, collective agreement applies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="3.2" alinea="null">(3.2)</SPAN> If the employee is represented by a trade union and a collective agreement applies to the employee, an averaging agreement shall expire no later than the day a subsequent collective agreement that applies to the employee comes into operation. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec4" id="sec22subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Agreement may be renewed or replaced</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> For greater certainty, an averaging agreement may be renewed or replaced if the requirements set out in this section are met. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec5" id="sec22subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Existing agreement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Any averaging agreement that was made before the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">Restoring Ontario’s Competitiveness Act, 2019</A> </I>received Royal Assent in accordance with this section, as it read at the time, and that was approved by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="22.1" href="#sec22.1_smooth">section 22.1</A>, as it read at the time, is deemed to have met the requirements set out in subsections (2), (3), (3.1) and (3.2) and continues to be valid until the earlier of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the day the agreement is revoked under subsection (6);</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the day the Director’s approval expires; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the day the Director’s approval is revoked. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec5.1" id="sec22subsec5_1"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="5.1" alinea="null">(5.1)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 8 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec6" id="sec22subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Agreement irrevocable</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> No averaging agreement referred to in this section may be revoked before it expires unless the employer and the employee agree to revoke it.  2000, c. 41, s. 22 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec7" id="sec22subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Time off in lieu</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The employee may be compensated for overtime hours by receiving one and one-half hours of paid time off work for each hour of overtime worked instead of overtime pay if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee and the employer agree to do so; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the paid time off work is taken within three months of the work week in which the overtime was earned or, with the employee’s agreement, within 12 months of that work week.  2000, c. 41, s. 22 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec8" id="sec22subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Where employment ends</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If the employment of an employee ends before the paid time off is taken under subsection (7), the employer shall pay the employee overtime pay for the overtime hours that were worked in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" ss="5" href="#sec11subsec5_smooth">subsection 11 (5)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 22 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec22subsec9" id="sec22subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Changing work</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="22" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> If an employee who performs work of a particular kind or character is exempted from the application of this section by the regulations or the regulations prescribe an overtime threshold of other than 44 hours for an employee who performs such work, and the duties of an employee’s position require him or her to perform both that work and work of another kind or character, this Part shall apply to the employee in respect of all work performed by him or her in a work week unless the time spent by the employee performing that other work constitutes less than half the time that the employee spent fulfilling the duties of his or her position in that work week.  2000, c. 41, s. 22 (9).</P>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="22.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec22.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=22.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="22.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="22.1" data-viibes-start="38" data-viibes-end="37"><B><a name="sec22.1" id="sec22_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="22.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">22.1 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="22.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec22.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=22.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="22.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="22.2" data-viibes-start="39" data-viibes-end="38"><B><a name="sec22.2" id="sec22_2"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="22.2" subsection="null" alinea="null">22.2 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<A name="PART_ix_MINIMUM_WAGE_79903"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK45"></A>PART ix <BR>  MINIMUM WAGE</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Minimum wage</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="23" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec23" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=23"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="23" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="20" data-noteup-count-display="20"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="23" data-viibes-start="40" data-viibes-end="39"><A name="BK46"></A><B><a name="sec23subsec1" id="sec23subsec1"></A><a name="sec23" id="sec23"></A>23 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="23" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall pay employees at least the minimum wage.  2000, c. 41, s. 23 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 2 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec23subsec2" id="sec23subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Room or board</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an employer provides room or board to an employee, the prescribed amount with respect to room or board shall be deemed to have been paid by the employer to the employee as wages.  2000, c. 41, s. 23 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec23subsec3" id="sec23subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Determining compliance</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Compliance with this Part shall be determined on a pay period basis.  2000, c. 41, s. 23 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec23subsec4" id="sec23subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Hourly rate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Without restricting the generality of subsection (3), if the minimum wage applicable with respect to an employee is expressed as an hourly rate, the employer shall not be considered to have complied with this Part unless,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  when the amount of regular wages paid to the employee in the pay period is divided by the number of hours he or she worked in the pay period, other than hours for which the employee was entitled to receive overtime pay or premium pay, the quotient is at least equal to the minimum wage; and</P>
