<P class="paragraph">  (b)  when the amount of overtime pay and premium pay paid to the employee in the pay period is divided by the number of hours worked in the pay period for which the employee was entitled to receive overtime pay or premium pay, the quotient is at least equal to one and one half times the minimum wage.  2000, c. 41, s. 23 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" href="#sec2_smooth">s. 2</A> (2-4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Change to minimum wage during pay period</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="23.0.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec23.0.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=23.0.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="23.0.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="23.0.1" data-viibes-start="41" data-viibes-end="40"><A name="BK47"></A><B><a name="sec23.0.1" id="sec23_0_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="23.0.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">23.0.1</SPAN> </B>If the minimum wage rate applicable to an employee changes during a pay period, the calculations required by <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23" ss="4" href="#sec23subsec4_smooth">subsection 23 (4)</A> shall be performed as if the pay period were two separate pay periods, the first consisting of the part falling before the day on which the change takes effect and the second consisting of the part falling on and after the day on which the change takes effect. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="14" href="#sec14_smooth">s. 14</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Determination of minimum wage</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="23.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec23.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=23.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="23.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9" data-noteup-count-display="9"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="23.1" data-viibes-start="42" data-viibes-end="41"><A name="BK48"></A><B><a name="sec23.1subsec1" id="sec23_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec23.1" id="sec23_1"></A>23.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The minimum wage is the following:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  On or after January 1, 2022 but before October 1, 2022, the amount set out below for the following classes of employees:</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  For employees who are students under 18 years of age, if the student’s weekly hours do not exceed 28 hours or if the student is employed during a school holiday, $14.10 per hour.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  For the services of hunting and fishing guides, $75.00 for less than five consecutive hours in a day and $150.05 for five or more hours in a day, whether or not the hours are consecutive.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iii.  For employees who are homeworkers, $16.50 per hour.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iv.  For any other employees not listed in subparagraphs i to iii, $15.00 per hour.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  From October 1, 2022 onward, the amount determined under subsection (4). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97118-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-40/latest/so-2021-c-40.html">2021, c. 40</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec1.1" id="sec23_1subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Student homeworker</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> If an employee falls within both subparagraphs 1 i and iii of subsection (1), the employer shall pay the employee not less than the minimum wage for a homeworker. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 15 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 6 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97118-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-40/latest/so-2021-c-40.html">2021, c. 40</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec2" id="sec23_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If a class of employees that would otherwise be in the class described in subparagraph 1 iv of subsection (1) is prescribed and a minimum wage for the class is also prescribed,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  subsection (1) does not apply; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the minimum wage for the class is the minimum wage prescribed for it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 15 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 6 (5); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97118-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-40/latest/so-2021-c-40.html">2021, c. 40</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec3" id="sec23_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If a class of employees and a minimum wage for the class are prescribed under subsection (2), subsections (4) to (6) apply as if the class and the minimum wage were a class and a minimum wage under subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec4" id="sec23_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Annual adjustment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> On October 1 of each year starting in 2022, the minimum wage that applied to a class of employees immediately before October 1 shall be adjusted as follows:</P>
 
<P class="equation">Previous wage × (Index A/Index B) = Adjusted wage</P>
 
<P class="subsection">in which,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  “Previous wage” is the minimum wage that applied immediately before October 1 of the year,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  “Index A” is the Consumer Price Index for the previous calendar year,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  “Index B” is the Consumer Price Index for the calendar year immediately preceding the calendar year mentioned in the description of “Index A”, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">    “Adjusted wage” is the new minimum wage.</P>
 
<P class="footnote"><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 15 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 6 (6); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97118-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-40/latest/so-2021-c-40.html">2021, c. 40</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec5" id="sec23_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Rounding</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If the adjustment required by subsection (4) would result in an amount that is not a multiple of 5 cents, the amount shall be rounded up or down to the nearest amount that is a multiple of 5 cents. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec6" id="sec23_1subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Exception where decrease</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If the adjustment otherwise required by subsection (4) would result in a decrease in the minimum wage, no adjustment shall be made. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec7" id="sec23_1subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Publication of minimum wage</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The Minister shall, not later than April 1 of every year after 2021, publish on a website of the Government of Ontario the minimum wages that are to apply starting on October 1 of that year. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 15 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 6 (7); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97118-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-40/latest/so-2021-c-40.html">2021, c. 40</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec8" id="sec23_1subsec8"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 15 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec9" id="sec23_1subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> If, after the Minister publishes the minimum wages that are to apply starting on October 1 of a year, a minimum wage is prescribed under subsection (2) for a prescribed class of employees, the Minister shall promptly publish the new wage that will apply to that class starting on October 1 of the applicable year as a result of the wage having been prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec10" id="sec23_1subsec10"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN>, (11) Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 6 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec23.1subsec12" id="sec23_1subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Definition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="23.1" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> In this section,</P>
 
<P class="definition">“Consumer Price Index” means the Consumer Price Index for Ontario (all items) published by Statistics Canada under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12951-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-s-19/latest/rsc-1985-c-s-19.html">Statistics Act</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12951-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-s-19/latest/rsc-1985-c-s-19.html"> (Canada)</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="part_x_public_holidays_87286"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK49"></A>part x <BR>  public holidays</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Public holiday pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="24" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec24" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=24"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="24" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="35" data-noteup-count-display="35"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="24" data-viibes-start="43" data-viibes-end="42"><A name="BK50"></A><B><a name="sec24subsec1" id="sec24subsec1"></A><a name="sec24" id="sec24"></A>24 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="24" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee’s public holiday pay for a given public holiday shall be equal to,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the total amount of regular wages earned and vacation pay payable to the employee in the four work weeks before the work week in which the public holiday occurred, divided by 20; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if some other manner of calculation is prescribed, the amount determined using that manner of calculation. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="16" href="#sec16_smooth">s. 16</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 7 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec24subsec1.1" id="sec24subsec1_1"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="24" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN>, (1.2) Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 7 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec24subsec2" id="sec24subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Premium pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="24" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer who is required under this Part to pay premium pay to an employee shall pay the employee at least one and one half times his or her regular rate.  2000, c. 41, s. 24 (2).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Two kinds of work</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="25" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec25" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=25"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="25" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="25" data-viibes-start="44" data-viibes-end="43"><A name="BK51"></A><B><a name="sec25subsec1" id="sec25subsec1"></A><a name="sec25" id="sec25"></A>25 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="25" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subsection (2) applies with respect to an employee if, </P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an employee performs work of a particular kind or character in a work week in which a public holiday occurs;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the regulations exempt employees who perform work of that kind or character from the application of this Part; and </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the duties of the employee’s position also require him or her to perform work of another kind or character.  2000, c. 41, s. 25 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec2" id="sec25subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> This Part applies to the employee with respect to that public holiday unless the time spent by the employee performing the work referred to in clause (1) (b) constitutes more than half the time that the employee spent fulfilling the duties of his or her position in that work week.  2000, c. 41, s. 25 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Public holiday ordinarily a working day</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="26" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec26" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=26"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="26" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="25" data-noteup-count-display="25"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="26" data-viibes-start="45" data-viibes-end="44"><A name="BK52"></A><B><a name="sec26subsec1" id="sec26subsec1"></A><a name="sec26" id="sec26"></A>26 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="26" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If a public holiday falls on a day that would ordinarily be a working day for an employee and the employee is not on vacation that day, the employer shall give the employee the day off work and pay him or her public holiday pay for that day.  2000, c. 41, s. 26 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec26subsec2" id="sec26subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="26" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The employee has no entitlement under subsection (1) if he or she fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday.  2000, c. 41, s. 26 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Agreement to work, ordinarily a working day</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="27" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec27" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=27"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="27" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="11" data-noteup-count-display="11"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="27" data-viibes-start="46" data-viibes-end="45"><A name="BK53"></A><B><a name="sec27subsec1" id="sec27subsec1"></A><a name="sec27" id="sec27"></A>27 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="27" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee and employer may agree that the employee will work on a public holiday that would ordinarily be a working day for that employee, and if they do, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="26" href="#sec26_smooth">section 26</A> does not apply to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 27 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec27subsec2" id="sec27subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Employee’s entitlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="27" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (3) and (4), if an employer and an employee make an agreement under subsection (1),</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer shall pay to the employee wages at his or her regular rate for the hours worked on the public holiday and substitute another day that would ordinarily be a working day for the employee to take off work and for which he or she shall be paid public holiday pay as if the substitute day were a public holiday; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee and the employer agree, the employer shall pay to the employee public holiday pay for the day plus premium pay for each hour worked on that day.  2000, c. 41, s. 27 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec27subsec2.1" id="sec27subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Substitute day of holiday</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="27" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> If a day is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a), the employer shall provide the employee with a written statement, before the public holiday, that sets out,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the public holiday on which the employee will work;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the date of the day that is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the date on which the statement is provided to the employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" href="#sec17_smooth">s. 17</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec27subsec3" id="sec27subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="27" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A day that is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a) shall be,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a day that is no more than three months after the public holiday; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee and the employer agree, a day that is no more than 12 months after the public holiday.  2000, c. 41, s. 27 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec27subsec4" id="sec27subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Where certain work not performed</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="27" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employee’s entitlement under subsection (2) is subject to the following rules:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  If the employee, without reasonable cause, performs none of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday, the employee has no entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the employee, with reasonable cause, performs none of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee a substitute day off work in accordance with clause (2) (a) or, if an agreement was made under clause (2) (b), public holiday pay for the public holiday. However, if the employee also fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employee has no entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employee performs some of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday but fails, without reasonable cause, to perform all of it, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  If the employee performs some of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday but fails, with reasonable cause, to perform all of it, the employer shall give the employee wages at his or her regular rate for the hours worked on the public holiday and a substitute day off work in accordance with clause (2) (a) or, if an agreement was made under clause (2) (b), public holiday pay for the public holiday plus premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday. However, if the employee also fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  If the employee performs all of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday but fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).  2000, c. 41, s. 27 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec13" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="13" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (13)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Requirement to work on a public holiday: certain operations</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="28" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec28" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=28"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="28" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="18" data-noteup-count-display="18"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="28" data-viibes-start="47" data-viibes-end="46"><A name="BK54"></A><B><a name="sec28subsec1" id="sec28subsec1"></A><a name="sec28" id="sec28"></A>28 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="28" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employee is employed in a hospital, a continuous operation, or a hotel, motel, tourist resort, restaurant or tavern, the employer may require the employee to work on a public holiday that is ordinarily a working day for the employee and that is not a day on which the employee is on vacation, and if the employer does so, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="26" href="#sec26_smooth">sections 26</A> and<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="27" href="#sec27_smooth"> 27</A> do not apply to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 28 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec28subsec2" id="sec28subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Employee’s entitlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (3) and (4), if an employer requires an employee to work on a public holiday under subsection (1), the employer shall,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  pay to the employee wages at his or her regular rate for the hours worked on the public holiday and substitute another day that would ordinarily be a working day for the employee to take off work and for which he or she shall be paid public holiday pay as if the substitute day were a public holiday; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  pay to the employee public holiday pay for the day plus premium pay for each hour worked on that day.  2000, c. 41, s. 28 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec2.1" id="sec28subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Substitute day of holiday</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> If a day is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a), the employer shall provide the employee with a written statement, before the public holiday, that sets out,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the public holiday on which the employee will work;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the date of the day that is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the date on which the statement is provided to the employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="18" href="#sec18_smooth">s. 18</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec3" id="sec28subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A day that is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a) shall be,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a day that is no more than three months after the public holiday; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee and the employer agree, a day that is no more than 12 months after the public holiday.  2000, c. 41, s. 28 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec4" id="sec28subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Where certain work not performed</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employee’s entitlement under subsection (2) is subject to the following rules:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  If the employee, without reasonable cause, performs none of the work that he or she was required to perform on the public holiday, the employee has no entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the employee, with reasonable cause, performs none of the work that he or she was required to perform on the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee a substitute day off work in accordance with clause (2) (a) or public holiday pay for the public holiday under clause (2) (b), as the employer chooses.  However, if the employee also fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employee has no entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employee performs some of the work that he or she was required to perform on the public holiday but fails, without reasonable cause, to perform all of it, he or she is entitled to premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but has no other entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  If the employee performs some of the work that he or she was required to perform on the public holiday but fails, with reasonable cause, to perform all of it, the employer shall give the employee wages at his or her regular rate for the hours worked on the public holiday and a substitute day off work in accordance with clause (2) (a) or public holiday pay for the public holiday plus premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday under clause (2) (b), as the employer chooses.  However, if the employee also fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).  </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  If the employee performs all of the work that he or she was required to perform on the public holiday but fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).  2000, c. 41, s. 28 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec14" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="14" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (14)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Public holiday not ordinarily a working day</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="29" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec29" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=29"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="29" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="5" data-noteup-count-display="5"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="29" data-viibes-start="48" data-viibes-end="47"><A name="BK55"></A><B><a name="sec29subsec1" id="sec29subsec1"></A><a name="sec29" id="sec29"></A>29 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="29" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If a public holiday falls on a day that would not ordinarily be a working day for an employee or a day on which the employee is on vacation, the employer shall substitute another day that would ordinarily be a working day for the employee to take off work and for which he or she shall be paid public holiday pay as if the substitute day were a public holiday.  2000, c. 41, s. 29 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec29subsec1.1" id="sec29subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Substitute day of holiday</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="29" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> If a day is substituted for a public holiday under subsection (1), the employer shall provide the employee with a written statement, before the public holiday, that sets out,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the public holiday that is being substituted; </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the date of the day that is substituted for a public holiday under subsection (1); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the date on which the statement is provided to the employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec29subsec2" id="sec29subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="29" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A day that is substituted for a public holiday under subsection (1) shall be,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a day that is no more than three months after the public holiday; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee and the employer agree, a day that is no more than 12 months after the public holiday.  2000, c. 41, s. 29 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec29subsec2.1" id="sec29subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Employee on leave or lay-off</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="29" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> If a public holiday falls on a day that would not ordinarily be a working day for an employee and the employee is on a leave of absence under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="46" href="#sec46_smooth">section 46</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="48" href="#sec48_smooth">48</A> or on a layoff on that day, the employee is entitled to public holiday pay for the day but has no other entitlement under this Part with respect to the public holiday.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec15" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="15" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (15)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec29subsec2.2" id="sec29subsec2_2"></A><P class="headnote">Layoff resulting in termination</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="29" subsection="2.2" alinea="null">(2.2)</SPAN> Subsection (2.1) does not apply to an employee if his or her employment has been terminated under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" ss="1" href="#sec56subsec1_smooth">clause 56 (1)</A> (c) and the public holiday falls on or after the day on which the lay-off first exceeded the period of a temporary lay-off.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec15" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="15" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (15)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec29subsec3" id="sec29subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Agreement re: public holiday pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="29" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employer and an employee may agree that, instead of complying with subsection (1), the employer shall pay the employee public holiday pay for the public holiday, and if they do subsection (1) does not apply to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 29 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec29subsec4" id="sec29subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="29" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employee has no entitlement under subsection (1), (2.1) or (3) if he or she fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday.  2000, c. 41, s. 29 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec16" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="16" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (16)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Agreement to work where not ordinarily a working day</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="30" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec30" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=30"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="30" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="30" data-viibes-start="49" data-viibes-end="48"><A name="BK56"></A><B><a name="sec30subsec1" id="sec30subsec1"></A><a name="sec30" id="sec30"></A>30 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="30" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee and employer may agree that the employee will work on a public holiday that falls on a day that would not ordinarily be a working day for that employee or on a day on which the employee is on vacation, and if they do, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="29" href="#sec29_smooth">section 29</A> does not apply to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 30 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec30subsec2" id="sec30subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Employee’s entitlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="30" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (3) and (4), if an employer and an employee make an agreement under subsection (1), </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer shall pay to the employee wages at his or her regular rate for the hours worked on the public holiday and substitute another day that would ordinarily be a working day for the employee to take off work and for which he or she shall be paid public holiday pay as if the substitute day were a public holiday; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employer and employee agree, the employer shall pay the employee public holiday pay for the day plus premium pay for each hour worked.  2000, c. 41, s. 30 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec30subsec2.1" id="sec30subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Substitute day of holiday</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="30" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> If a day is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a), the employer shall provide the employee with a written statement, before the public holiday, that sets out,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the public holiday on which the employee will work;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the date of the day that is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the date on which the statement is provided to the employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="20" href="#sec20_smooth">s. 20</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec30subsec3" id="sec30subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="30" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A day that is substituted for a public holiday under clause (2) (a) shall be,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a day that is no more than three months after the public holiday; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee and the employer agree, a day that is no more than 12 months after the public holiday.  2000, c. 41, s. 30 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec30subsec4" id="sec30subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Where certain work not performed</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="30" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employee’s entitlement under subsection (2) is subject to the following rules:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  If the employee, without reasonable cause, performs none of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday, the employee has no entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the employee, with reasonable cause, performs none of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee a substitute day off work in accordance with clause (2) (a) or, if an agreement was made under clause (2) (b), public holiday pay for the public holiday.  However, if the employee also fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employee has no entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employee performs some of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday but fails, without reasonable cause, to perform all of it, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  If the employee performs some of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday but fails, with reasonable cause, to perform all of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee wages at his or her regular rate for the hours worked on the public holiday and a substitute day off work in accordance with clause (2) (a) or, if an agreement was made under clause (2) (b), public holiday pay for the public holiday plus premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday.  However, if the employee also fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before the public holiday or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  If the employee performs all of the work that he or she agreed to perform on the public holiday but fails, without reasonable cause, to work all of his or her last regularly scheduled day of work before or all of his or her first regularly scheduled day of work after the public holiday, the employer shall give the employee premium pay for each hour worked on the public holiday but the employee has no other entitlement under subsection (2).  2000, c. 41, s. 30 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec17" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="17" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (17)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Premium pay hours not overtime hours</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="31" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec31" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=31"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="31" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="31" data-viibes-start="50" data-viibes-end="49"><A name="BK57"></A><B><a name="sec31" id="sec31"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="31" subsection="null" alinea="null">31</SPAN> </B>If an employee receives premium pay for working on a public holiday, the hours worked shall not be taken into consideration in calculating overtime pay to which the employee may be entitled.  2000, c. 41, s. 31.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">If employment ends</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="32" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec32" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=32"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="32" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="32" data-viibes-start="51" data-viibes-end="50"><A name="BK58"></A><B><a name="sec32" id="sec32"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="32" subsection="null" alinea="null">32</SPAN> </B>If the employment of an employee ends before a day that has been substituted for a public holiday under this Part, the employer shall pay the employee public holiday pay for that day in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" ss="5" href="#sec11subsec5_smooth">subsection 11 (5)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 32.</P></div>
 
<A name="PART_xi_VACATION_WITH_PAY_108910"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK59"></A>PART xi <BR>  VACATION WITH PAY</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Right to vacation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="33" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec33" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=33"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="33" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="16" data-noteup-count-display="16"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="33" data-viibes-start="52" data-viibes-end="51"><A name="BK60"></A><B><a name="sec33subsec1" id="sec33subsec1"></A><a name="sec33" id="sec33"></A>33 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="33" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer shall give an employee a vacation of,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  at least two weeks after each vacation entitlement year that the employee completes, if the employee’s period of employment is less than five years; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  at least three weeks after each vacation entitlement year that the employee completes, if the employee’s period of employment is five years or more. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec33subsec2" id="sec33subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Active and inactive employment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="33" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Both active employment and inactive employment shall be included for the purposes of subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec33subsec3" id="sec33subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Where vacation not taken in complete weeks</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="33" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an employee does not take vacation in complete weeks, the employer shall base the number of days of vacation that the employee is entitled to,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  on the number of days in the employee’s regular work week; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee does not have a regular work week, on the average number of days the employee worked per week during the most recently completed vacation entitlement year. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec33subsec4" id="sec33subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="33" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Clause (1) (b) requires employers to provide employees with a period of employment of at least five years or more with at least three weeks of vacation after each vacation entitlement year that ends on or after December 31, 2017 but does not require them to provide additional vacation days in respect of vacation entitlement years that ended before that time. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Alternative vacation entitlement year</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Application</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="34" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec34" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=34"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="34" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="34" data-viibes-start="53" data-viibes-end="52"><A name="BK61"></A><B><a name="sec34subsec1" id="sec34subsec1"></A><a name="sec34" id="sec34"></A>34 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="34" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies if the employer establishes an alternative vacation entitlement year for an employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec34subsec2" id="sec34subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Vacation for stub period, less than five years of employment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="34" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the employee’s period of employment is less than five years, the employer shall do the following with respect to the stub period:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employer shall calculate the ratio between the stub period and 12 months.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the employee has a regular work week, the employer shall give the employee a vacation for the stub period that is equal to two weeks multiplied by the ratio calculated under paragraph 1.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employee does not have a regular work week, the employer shall give the employee a vacation for the stub period that is equal to,</P>
 
<P class="equation">2 × A × the ratio calculated under paragraph 1</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">where,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  A =  the average number of days the employee worked per work week in the stub period.</P>
 
<P class="footnote"><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec34subsec3" id="sec34subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Vacation for stub period, five years or more of employment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="34" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the employee’s period of employment is five years or more, the employer shall do the following with respect to the stub period:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employer shall calculate the ratio between the stub period and 12 months.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the employee has a regular work week, the employer shall give the employee a vacation for the stub period that is equal to three weeks multiplied by the ratio calculated under paragraph 1.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employee does not have a regular work week, the employer shall give the employee a vacation for the stub period that is equal to,</P>
 
<P class="equation">3 × A × the ratio calculated under paragraph 1</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">where,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  A =  the average number of days the employee worked per work week in the stub period.</P>
 
<P class="footnote"><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec34subsec4" id="sec34subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Active and inactive employment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="34" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Both active employment and inactive employment shall be included for the purposes of subsections (2) and (3). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec34subsec5" id="sec34subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="34" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Subsection (3) requires employers to provide employees with a period of employment of at least five years or more with vacation calculated in accordance with that subsection for any stub period that ends on or after December 31, 2017 but does not require them to provide additional vacation days in respect of a stub period that ended before that time. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Timing of vacation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="35" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec35" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=35"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="35" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="16" data-noteup-count-display="16"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="35" data-viibes-start="54" data-viibes-end="53"><A name="BK62"></A><B><a name="sec35" id="sec35"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="35" subsection="null" alinea="null">35</SPAN> </B>The employer shall determine when an employee shall take vacation for a vacation entitlement year, subject to the following rules:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The vacation must be completed no later than 10 months after the end of the vacation entitlement year for which it is given.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the employee’s period of employment is less than five years, the vacation must be a two-week period or two periods of one week each, unless the employee requests in writing that the vacation be taken in shorter periods and the employer agrees to that request.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employee’s period of employment is five years or more, the vacation must be a three-week period or a two-week period and a one-week period or three periods of one week each, unless the employee requests in writing that the vacation be taken in shorter periods and the employer agrees to that request. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Timing of vacation, alternative vacation entitlement year</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="35.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec35.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=35.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="35.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="35.1" data-viibes-start="55" data-viibes-end="54"><A name="BK63"></A><B><a name="sec35.1subsec1" id="sec35_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec35.1" id="sec35_1"></A>35.1</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="35.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies if an employer establishes an alternative vacation entitlement year for an employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="22" href="#sec22_smooth">s. 22</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec35.1subsec2" id="sec35_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="35.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The employer shall determine when the employee shall take his or her vacation for the stub period, subject to the following rules:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The vacation shall be completed no later than 10 months after the start of the first alternative vacation entitlement year.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Subject to paragraphs 3 and 4, if the vacation entitlement is equal to two or more days, the vacation shall be taken in a period of consecutive days.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Subject to paragraph 4, if the vacation entitlement is equal to more than five days, at least five vacation days shall be taken in a period of consecutive days and the remaining vacation days may be taken in a separate period of consecutive days.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Paragraphs 2 and 3 do not apply if the employee requests in writing that the vacation be taken in shorter periods and the employer agrees to that request.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec18" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="18" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (18)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Vacation pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="35.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec35.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=35.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="35.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="48" data-noteup-count-display="48"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="35.2" data-viibes-start="56" data-viibes-end="55"><A name="BK64"></A><B><a name="sec35.2" id="sec35_2"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="35.2" subsection="null" alinea="null">35.2</SPAN> </B>An employer shall pay vacation pay to an employee who is entitled to vacation under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="33" href="#sec33_smooth">section 33</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="34" href="#sec34_smooth">34</A>, equal to at least,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  4 per cent of the wages, excluding vacation pay, that the employee earned during the period for which the vacation is given, if the employee’s period of employment is less than five years; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  6 per cent of the wages, excluding vacation pay, that the employee earned during the period for which the vacation is given, if the employee’s period of employment is five years or more. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23" href="#sec23_smooth">s. 23</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">When to pay vacation pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="36" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec36" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=36"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="36" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="13" data-noteup-count-display="13"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="36" data-viibes-start="57" data-viibes-end="56"><A name="BK65"></A><B><a name="sec36subsec1" id="sec36subsec1"></A><a name="sec36" id="sec36"></A>36 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="36" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (2) to (4), the employer shall pay vacation pay to the employee in a lump sum before the employee commences his or her vacation.  2000, c. 41, s. 36 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec5" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="5" data-link-type="weak" rank="1">s. 1 (5)</SPAN>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec36subsec2" id="sec36subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="36" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the employer pays the employee his or her wages in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" ss="4" href="#sec11subsec4_smooth">subsection 11 (4)</A> or the employee does not take his or her vacation in complete weeks, the employer may pay the employee his or her vacation pay on or before the pay day for the period in which the vacation falls.  2000, c. 41, s. 36 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec36subsec3" id="sec36subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="36" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The employer may pay the employee vacation pay that accrues during a pay period on the pay day for that period if the employee agrees that it may be paid in that manner and,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the statement of wages provided for that period under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12" ss="1" href="#sec12subsec1_smooth">subsection 12 (1)</A> sets out, in addition to the information required by that subsection, the amount of vacation pay that is being paid separately from the amount of other wages that is being paid; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a separate statement setting out the amount of vacation pay that is being paid is provided to the employee at the same time that the statement of wages is provided under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12" ss="1" href="#sec12subsec1_smooth">subsection 12 (1)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 36 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec6" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="6" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (6)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A> (19, 20).</P>
 
<a name="sec36subsec4" id="sec36subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="36" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employer may pay the employee vacation pay at a time agreed to by the employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec7" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="7" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (7)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Payment during labour dispute</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="37" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec37" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=37"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="37" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="37" data-viibes-start="58" data-viibes-end="57"><A name="BK66"></A><B><a name="sec37subsec1" id="sec37subsec1"></A><a name="sec37" id="sec37"></A>37 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="37" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If the employer has scheduled vacation for an employee and subsequently the employee goes on strike or is locked out during a time for which the vacation had been scheduled, the employer shall pay to the employee the vacation pay that would have been paid to him or her with respect to that vacation.  2000, c. 41, s. 37 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec37subsec2" id="sec37subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Cancellation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="37" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies despite any purported cancellation of the vacation.  2000, c. 41, s. 37 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">If employment ends</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="38" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec38" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=38"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="38" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="38" data-noteup-count-display="38"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="38" data-viibes-start="59" data-viibes-end="58"><A name="BK67"></A><B><a name="sec38" id="sec38"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="38" subsection="null" alinea="null">38</SPAN> </B>If an employee’s employment ends at a time when vacation pay has accrued with respect to the employee, the employer shall pay the vacation pay that has accrued to the employee in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" ss="5" href="#sec11subsec5_smooth">subsection 11 (5)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 38.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">Multi-employer plans</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="39" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec39" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=39"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="39" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="39" data-viibes-start="60" data-viibes-end="59"><A name="BK68"></A><B><a name="sec39" id="sec39"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="39" subsection="null" alinea="null">39</SPAN> </B>Sections 36, 37 and 38 do not apply with respect to an employee and his or her employer if,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee is represented by a trade union; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employer makes contributions for vacation pay to the trustees of a multi-employer vacation benefit plan.  2000, c. 41, s. 39; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec8" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="8" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (8)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Vacation pay in trust</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="40" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec40" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=40"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="40" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="23" data-noteup-count-display="23"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="40" data-viibes-start="61" data-viibes-end="60"><A name="BK69"></A><B><a name="sec40subsec1" id="sec40subsec1"></A><a name="sec40" id="sec40"></A>40 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="40" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Every employer shall be deemed to hold vacation pay accruing due to an employee in trust for the employee whether or not the employer has kept the amount for it separate and apart.  2000, c. 41, s. 40 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec40subsec2" id="sec40subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="40" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An amount equal to vacation pay becomes a lien and charge upon the assets of the employer that in the ordinary course of business would be entered in books of account, even if it is not entered in the books of account.  2000, c. 41, s. 40 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Approval to forego vacation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="41" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec41" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=41"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="41" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="41" data-viibes-start="62" data-viibes-end="61"><A name="BK70"></A><B><a name="sec41subsec1" id="sec41subsec1"></A><a name="sec41" id="sec41"></A>41 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="41" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If the Director approves and an employee’s employer agrees, an employee may be allowed to forego taking vacation to which he or she is entitled under this part.  2000, c. 41, s. 41 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec41subsec2" id="sec41subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Vacation pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (1) allows the employer to forego paying vacation pay.  2000, c. 41, s. 41 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Vacation statements</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="41.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec41.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=41.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="41.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="41.1" data-viibes-start="63" data-viibes-end="62"><A name="BK71"></A><B><a name="sec41.1subsec1" id="sec41_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec41.1" id="sec41_1"></A>41.1</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="41.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to receive the following statements on making a written request:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  After the end of a vacation entitlement year, a statement in writing that sets out the information contained in the record the employer is required to keep under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15.1" ss="2" href="#sec15.1subsec2_smooth">subsection 15.1 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  After the end of a stub period, a statement in writing that sets out the information contained in the record the employer is required to keep under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15.1" ss="3" href="#sec15.1subsec3_smooth">subsection 15.1 (3)</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec21" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="21" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (21)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1subsec2" id="sec41_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">When statement to be provided</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (3), the statement shall be provided to the employee not later than the later of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  seven days after the employee makes his or her request; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the first pay day after the employee makes his or her request.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec21" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="21" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (21)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1subsec3" id="sec41_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the request is made during the vacation entitlement year or stub period to which it relates, the statement shall be provided to the employee not later than the later of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  seven days after the start of the next vacation entitlement year or the first vacation entitlement year, as the case may be; and</P>
