<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the first pay day of the next vacation entitlement year or of the first vacation entitlement year, as the case may be.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec21" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="21" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (21)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1subsec4" id="sec41_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction re frequency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employer is not required to provide a statement to an employee more than once with respect to a vacation entitlement year or stub period.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec21" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="21" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (21)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1subsec5" id="sec41_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Exception </P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> This section does not apply with respect to an employee whose employer pays vacation pay in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" ss="3" href="#sec36subsec3_smooth">subsection 36 (3)</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec21" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="21" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (21)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1subsec6" id="sec41_1subsec6"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="24" href="#sec24_smooth">s. 24</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_XI_1_WRITTEN_POLICY_ON_ELECTRONIC_MONITORING_123375"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK72"></A>PART XI.1 <BR>  WRITTEN POLICY ON ELECTRONIC MONITORING</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Written policy on electronic monitoring</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="41.1.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec41.1.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=41.1.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="41.1.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="41.1.1" data-viibes-start="64" data-viibes-end="63"><A name="BK73"></A><B><a name="sec41.1.1subsec1" id="sec41_1_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec41.1.1" id="sec41_1_1"></A>41.1.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer that, on January 1 of any year, employs 25 or more employees shall, before March 1 of that year, ensure it has a written policy in place for all employees with respect to electronic monitoring of employees. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec41.1.1subsec2" id="sec41_1_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Required information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The written policy with respect to electronic monitoring must contain the following information:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Whether the employer electronically monitors employees and if so,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  a description of how and in what circumstances the employer may electronically monitor employees, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  the purposes for which information obtained through electronic monitoring may be used by the employer.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The date the policy was prepared and the date any changes were made to the policy.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Such other information as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1.1subsec3" id="sec41_1_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of policy</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employer that is required under this section to have a written policy with respect to electronic monitoring shall provide a copy of the policy to each of the employer’s employees within 30 days from the day the employer is required to have the policy in place or, if an existing policy is changed, within 30 days of the changes being made. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1.1subsec4" id="sec41_1_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same, new employee</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employer that is required under this section to have a written policy with respect to electronic monitoring shall provide a copy of the policy to a new employee within 30 days of the day the employee becomes an employee of the employer or within 30 days from the day the employer is required to have the policy in place, whichever is later. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1.1subsec5" id="sec41_1_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same, assignment employee</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employer that is a client of a temporary help agency, and that is required under this section to have a written policy with respect to electronic monitoring shall provide an assignment employee assigned to perform work for the employer with a copy of the policy within 24 hours of the start of the assignment or within 30 days from the day the employer is required to have the policy in place, whichever is later. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1.1subsec6" id="sec41_1_1subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Complaints</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> A complaint under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="96" ss="1" href="#sec96subsec1_smooth">subsection 96 (1)</A> alleging a contravention of this section may be made only with  respect to subsections (3), (4) and (5) and, for greater certainty, a person may not file a complaint alleging a contravention of any other provision of this section or have such a complaint investigated. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1.1subsec7" id="sec41_1_1subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Use of information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> For greater certainty, nothing in this section affects or limits an employer’s ability to use information obtained through electronic monitoring of its employees. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec41.1.1subsec8" id="sec41_1_1subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="41.1.1" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Despite subsection (1), an employer shall,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  have until the date that is six months after the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">Working for Workers Act, 2022</A></I> receives Royal Assent instead of March 1 to comply with the requirements of subsection (1); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  determine whether it employs 25 employees or more as of the January 1 immediately preceding the date described in clause (a). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_Xii_EQUAL_PAY_FOR_EQUAL_WORK_127234"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK74"></A>PART Xii <BR>  EQUAL PAY FOR EQUAL WORK</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Interpretation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="41.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec41.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=41.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="41.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="41.2" data-viibes-start="65" data-viibes-end="64"><A name="BK75"></A><B><a name="sec41.2" id="sec41_2"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="41.2" subsection="null" alinea="null">41.2</SPAN> </B>In this Part,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“substantially the same” means substantially the same but not necessarily identical. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="25" href="#sec25_smooth">s. 25</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Equal pay for equal work</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="42" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec42" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=42"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="42" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="17" data-noteup-count-display="17"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="42" data-viibes-start="66" data-viibes-end="65"><A name="BK76"></A><B><a name="sec42subsec1" id="sec42subsec1"></A><a name="sec42" id="sec42"></A>42 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="42" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No employer shall pay an employee of one sex at a rate of pay less than the rate paid to an employee of the other sex when,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  they perform substantially the same kind of work in the same establishment;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  their performance requires substantially the same skill, effort and responsibility; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  their work is performed under similar working conditions.  2000, c. 41, s. 42 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec42subsec2" id="sec42subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="42" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply when the difference in the rate of pay is made on the basis of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a seniority system;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a merit system;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  a system that measures earnings by quantity or quality of production; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  any other factor other than sex.  2000, c. 41, s. 42 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 26 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 8 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec42subsec3" id="sec42subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Reduction prohibited</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="42" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> No employer shall reduce the rate of pay of an employee in order to comply with subsection (1).  2000, c. 41, s. 42 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec42subsec4" id="sec42subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Organizations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="42" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> No trade union or other organization shall cause or attempt to cause an employer to contravene subsection (1).  2000, c. 41, s. 42 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 26 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec42subsec5" id="sec42subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Deemed wages</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="42" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds that an employer has contravened subsection (1), the officer may determine the amount owing to an employee as a result of the contravention and that amount shall be deemed to be unpaid wages for that employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 42 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec42subsec6" id="sec42subsec6"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="42" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 8 (2).</P>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="42.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec42.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=42.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="42.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="16" data-noteup-count-display="16"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="42.1" data-viibes-start="67" data-viibes-end="66"><B><a name="sec42.1" id="sec42_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="42.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">42.1 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="42.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec42.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=42.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="42.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="42.2" data-viibes-start="68" data-viibes-end="67"><B><a name="sec42.2" id="sec42_2"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="42.2" subsection="null" alinea="null">42.2 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="10" href="#sec10_smooth">s. 10</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="42.3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec42.3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=42.3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="42.3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="42.3" data-viibes-start="69" data-viibes-end="68"><B><a name="sec42.3" id="sec42_3"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="42.3" subsection="null" alinea="null">42.3 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" href="#sec11_smooth">s. 11</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<A name="PART_Xiii_BENEFIT_plans_129795"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK77"></A>PART Xiii <BR>  BENEFIT plans</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definition</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="43" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec43" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=43"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="43" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="43" data-viibes-start="70" data-viibes-end="69"><A name="BK78"></A><B><a name="sec43" id="sec43"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="43" subsection="null" alinea="null">43</SPAN> </B>In this Part,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“employer” means an employer as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">subsection 1 (1)</A>, and includes a group or number of unaffiliated employers or an association of employers acting for an employer in relation to a pension plan, a life insurance plan, a disability insurance plan, a disability benefit plan, a health insurance plan or a health benefit plan.  2000, c. 41, s. 43.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Differentiation prohibited</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="44" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec44" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=44"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="44" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="29" data-noteup-count-display="29"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="44" data-viibes-start="71" data-viibes-end="70"><A name="BK79"></A><B><a name="sec44subsec1" id="sec44subsec1"></A><a name="sec44" id="sec44"></A>44 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="44" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Except as prescribed, no employer or person acting directly on behalf of an employer shall provide, offer or arrange for a benefit plan that treats any of the following persons differently because of the age, sex or marital status of employees:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Beneficiaries.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Survivors.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Dependants.  2000, c. 41, s. 44 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec44subsec2" id="sec44subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Causing contravention prohibited</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="44" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> No organization of employers or employees and no person acting directly on behalf of such an organization shall, directly or indirectly, cause or attempt to cause an employer to contravene subsection (1).  2000, c. 41, s. 44 (2).</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_XIv_LEAVES_OF_ABSENCE_131260"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK80"></A>PART XIv <BR>  LEAVES OF ABSENCE</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="45" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec45" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=45"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="45" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="45" data-viibes-start="72" data-viibes-end="71"><A name="BK81"></A><B><a name="sec45" id="sec45"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="45" subsection="null" alinea="null">45</SPAN> </B>In this Part,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“parent” includes a person with whom a child is placed for adoption and a person who is in a relationship of some permanence with a parent of a child and who intends to treat the child as his or her own, and “child” has a corresponding meaning; (“parent”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“spouse” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a spouse as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="168-current-1" s="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f3/latest/rso-1990-c-f3.html#sec1_smooth">section 1</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="168-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f3/latest/rso-1990-c-f3.html">Family Law Act</A></I>, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  either of two persons who live together in a conjugal relationship outside marriage. (“conjoint”)  2000, c. 41, s. 45; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec9" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="9" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (9)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 2</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96663-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2005-c-5/latest/so-2005-c-5.html">2005, c. 5, s. 23</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A> (1, 2).</P>
 

 
<A name="Pregnancy_Leave__132133"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK82"></A>Pregnancy Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Pregnancy leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="46" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec46" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=46"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="46" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="46" data-viibes-start="73" data-viibes-end="72"><A name="BK83"></A><B><a name="sec46subsec1" id="sec46subsec1"></A><a name="sec46" id="sec46"></A>46 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="46" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A pregnant employee is entitled to a leave of absence without pay unless her due date falls fewer than 13 weeks after she commenced employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 46 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec46subsec2" id="sec46subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">When leave may begin</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="46" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee may begin her pregnancy leave no earlier than the earlier of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the day that is 17 weeks before her due date; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the day on which she gives birth.  2000, c. 41, s. 46 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec46subsec3" id="sec46subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="46" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Clause (2) (b) does not apply with respect to a pregnancy that ends with a still-birth or miscarriage.  2000, c. 41, s. 46 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec46subsec3.1" id="sec46subsec3_1"></A><P class="headnote">Latest day for beginning pregnancy leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="46" subsection="3.1" alinea="null">(3.1)</SPAN> An employee may begin her pregnancy leave no later than the earlier of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  her due date; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the day on which she gives birth.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec10" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="10" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (10)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec46subsec4" id="sec46subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="46" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee wishing to take pregnancy leave shall give the employer,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  written notice at least two weeks before the day the leave is to begin; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employer requests it, a certificate from a legally qualified medical practitioner stating the due date.  2000, c. 41, s. 46 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec46subsec5" id="sec46subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Notice to change date</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="46" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee who has given notice to begin pregnancy leave may begin the leave,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  on an earlier day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least two weeks before that earlier day; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  on a later day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least two weeks before the day set out in the original notice.  2000, c. 41, s. 46 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec46subsec6" id="sec46subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same, complication, etc.</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="46" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If an employee stops working because of a complication caused by her pregnancy or because of a birth, still-birth or miscarriage that occurs earlier than the due date, subsection (4) does not apply and the employee shall, within two weeks after stopping work, give the employer,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  written notice of the day the pregnancy leave began or is to begin; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employer requests it, a certificate from a legally qualified medical practitioner stating,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  in the case of an employee who stops working because of a complication caused by her pregnancy, that she is unable to perform the duties of her position because of the complication and stating her due date,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  in any other case, the due date and the actual date of the birth, still-birth or miscarriage.  2000, c. 41, s. 46 (6).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Definition</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="46.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec46.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=46.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="46.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="46.1" data-viibes-start="74" data-viibes-end="73"><A name="BK84"></A><B><a name="sec46.1" id="sec46_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="46.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">46.1</SPAN></B> In <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="46" href="#sec46_smooth">section 46</A>,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“legally qualified medical practitioner” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a person who is qualified to practice as a physician,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a person who is qualified to practice as a midwife,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  a registered nurse who holds an extended certificate of registration under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="550-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1991-c-32/latest/so-1991-c-32.html">Nursing Act, 1991</A></I>, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  in the prescribed circumstances, a member of a prescribed class of medical practitioners. (“médecin dûment qualifié”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="30" href="#sec30_smooth">s. 30</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">End of pregnancy leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="47" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec47" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=47"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="47" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="5" data-noteup-count-display="5"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="47" data-viibes-start="75" data-viibes-end="74"><A name="BK85"></A><B><a name="sec47subsec1" id="sec47subsec1"></A><a name="sec47" id="sec47"></A>47 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="47" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee’s pregnancy leave ends,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  if she is entitled to parental leave, 17 weeks after the pregnancy leave began;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if she is not entitled to parental leave, on the day that is the later of,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  17 weeks after the pregnancy leave began, and</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  12 weeks after the birth, still-birth or miscarriage.  2000, c. 41, s. 47 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 31 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec47subsec1.1" id="sec47subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="47" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> Despite clause (1) (b), if an employee who is not entitled to parental leave began her pregnancy leave before January 1, 2018, her pregnancy leave ends on the day that is the later of, </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  17 weeks after the pregnancy leave began; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  six weeks after the birth, still-birth or miscarriage. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 31 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec47subsec2" id="sec47subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Ending leave early</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="47" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee may end her leave earlier than the day set out in subsection (1) by giving her employer written notice at least four weeks before the day she wishes to end her leave.  2000, c. 41, s. 47 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec47subsec3" id="sec47subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Changing end date</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="47" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee who has given notice under subsection (2) to end her pregnancy leave may end the leave,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  on an earlier day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least four weeks before the earlier day; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  on a later day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least four weeks before the day indicated in the original notice.  2000, c. 41, s. 47 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec47subsec4" id="sec47subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Employee not returning</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="47" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee who takes pregnancy leave shall not terminate her employment before the leave expires or when it expires without giving the employer at least four weeks’ written notice of the termination.  2000, c. 41, s. 47 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec47subsec5" id="sec47subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="47" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Subsection (4) does not apply if the employer constructively dismisses the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 47 (5).</P>
 

 
<A name="Parental_Leave__138404"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK86"></A>Parental Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Parental leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="48" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec48" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=48"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="48" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="5" data-noteup-count-display="5"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="48" data-viibes-start="76" data-viibes-end="75"><A name="BK87"></A><B><a name="sec48subsec1" id="sec48subsec1"></A><a name="sec48" id="sec48"></A>48 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="48" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by his or her employer for at least 13 weeks and who is the parent of a child is entitled to a leave of absence without pay following the birth of the child or the coming of the child into the employee’s custody, care and control for the first time.  2000, c. 41, s. 48 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, s. 9 (3).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec48subsec2" id="sec48subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">When leave may begin</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="48" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee may begin parental leave no later than 78 weeks after the day the child is born or comes into the employee’s custody, care and control for the first time.  2000, c. 41, s. 48 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 32 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec48subsec2.1" id="sec48subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="48" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> Despite subsection (2), an employee may begin parental leave no later than 52 weeks after the day the child is born or comes into the employee’s custody, care and control for the first time if that day was before the day subsection 32 (2) of Schedule 1 to the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">Fair Workplaces, Better Jobs Act, 2017</A> </I>came into force. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 32 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec48subsec3" id="sec48subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction if pregnancy leave taken</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="48" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee who has taken pregnancy leave must begin her parental leave when her pregnancy leave ends unless the child has not yet come into her custody, care and control for the first time.  2000, c. 41, s. 48 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec48subsec4" id="sec48subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="48" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (6), an employee wishing to take parental leave shall give the employer written notice at least two weeks before the day the leave is to begin.  2000, c. 41, s. 48 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec48subsec5" id="sec48subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Notice to change date</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="48" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee who has given notice to begin parental leave may begin the leave,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  on an earlier day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least two weeks before that earlier day; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  on a later day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least two weeks before the day set out in the original notice.  2000, c. 41, s. 48 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec48subsec6" id="sec48subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">If child earlier than expected</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="48" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If an employee stops working because a child comes into the employee’s custody, care and control for the first time earlier than expected,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee’s parental leave begins on the day he or she stops working; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee must give the employer written notice that he or she is taking parental leave within two weeks after stopping work.  2000, c. 41, s. 48 (6).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">End of parental leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="5" data-noteup-count-display="5"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49" data-viibes-start="77" data-viibes-end="76"><A name="BK88"></A><B><a name="sec49subsec1" id="sec49subsec1"></A><a name="sec49" id="sec49"></A>49 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee’s parental leave ends 61 weeks after it began, if the employee also took pregnancy leave and 63 weeks after it began, otherwise.  2000, c. 41, s. 49 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 33 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec49subsec1.1" id="sec49subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> Despite subsection (1), if the child in respect of whom the employee takes parental leave was born or came into the employee’s custody, care and control for the first time before the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="33" ss="2" href="#sec33subsec2_smooth">subsection 33 (2)</A> of Schedule 1 to the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">Fair Workplaces, Better Jobs Act, 2017</A></I>
came into force, the employee’s parental leave ends,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  35 weeks after it began, if the employee also took pregnancy leave; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  37 weeks after it began, otherwise. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 33 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec49subsec2" id="sec49subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Ending leave early</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee may end his or her parental leave earlier than the day set out in subsection (1) by giving the employer written notice at least four weeks before the day he or she wishes to end the leave.  2000, c. 41, s. 49 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec49subsec3" id="sec49subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Changing end date</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee who has given notice to end his or her parental leave may end the leave,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  on an earlier day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least four weeks before the earlier day; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  on a later day than was set out in the notice, if the employee gives the employer a new written notice at least four weeks before the day indicated in the original notice.  2000, c. 41, s. 49 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec49subsec4" id="sec49subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Employee not returning</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee who takes parental leave shall not terminate his or her employment before the leave expires or when it expires without giving the employer at least four weeks’ written notice of the termination.  2000, c. 41, s. 49 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec49subsec5" id="sec49subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Subsection (4) does not apply if the employer constructively dismisses the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 49 (5).</P>
 

 
<A name="Family_Medical_Leave__143597"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK89"></A>Family Medical Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Family medical leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49.1" data-viibes-start="78" data-viibes-end="77"><A name="BK90"></A><B><a name="sec49.1subsec1" id="sec49_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec49.1" id="sec49_1"></A>49.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“qualified health practitioner” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a person who is qualified to practise as a physician under the laws of the jurisdiction in which care or treatment is provided to the individual described in subsection (3),</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a registered nurse who holds an extended certificate of registration under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="550-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1991-c-32/latest/so-1991-c-32.html">Nursing Act, 1991</A></I> or an individual who has an equivalent qualification under the laws of the jurisdiction in which care or treatment is provided to the individual described in subsection (3), or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  in the prescribed circumstances, a member of a prescribed class of health practitioners; (“praticien de la santé qualifié”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“week” means a period of seven consecutive days beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday. (“semaine”)  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec2" id="sec49_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to a leave of absence without pay of up to 28 weeks to provide care or support to an individual described in subsection (3) if a qualified health practitioner issues a certificate stating that the individual has a serious medical condition with a significant risk of death occurring within a period of 26 weeks or such shorter period as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec3" id="sec49_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Application of subs. (2)</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (2) applies in respect of the following individuals:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A parent, step-parent or foster parent of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A child, step-child or foster child of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  A child who is under legal guardianship of the employee or the employee’s spouse.  </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  A brother, step-brother, sister or step-sister of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  A grandparent, step-grandparent, grandchild or step-grandchild of the employee or the employee’s spouse.  </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A brother-in-law, step-brother-in-law, sister-in-law or step-sister-in-law of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  A son-in-law or daughter-in-law of the employee or the employee’s spouse. </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.  An uncle or aunt of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  10.  A nephew or niece of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  11.  The spouse of the employee’s grandchild, uncle, aunt, nephew or niece.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  12.  A person who considers the employee to be like a family member, provided the prescribed conditions, if any, are met.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  13.  Any individual prescribed as a family member for the purposes of this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, s. 9 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec4" id="sec49_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Earliest date leave can begin</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employee may begin a leave under this section no earlier than the first day of the week in which the period referred to in subsection (2) begins.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec5" id="sec49_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Latest date employee can remain on leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The employee may not remain on a leave under this section after the earlier of the following dates:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The last day of the week in which the individual described in subsection (3) dies.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The last day of the 52-week period starting on the first day of the week in which the period referred to in subsection (2) begins. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec5.1" id="sec49_1subsec5_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="5.1" alinea="null">(5.1)</SPAN> For greater certainty, but subject to subsection (5), if the amount of leave that has been taken is less than 28 weeks it is not necessary for a qualified health practitioner to issue an additional certificate under subsection (2) in order for leave to be taken under this section after the end of the period referred to in subsection (2). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec6" id="sec49_1subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Two or more employees</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If two or more employees take leaves under this section in respect of a particular individual, the total of the leaves taken by all the employees shall not exceed 28 weeks during the 52-week period referred to in paragraph 2 of subsection (5) that applies to the first certificate issued for the purpose of this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec7" id="sec49_1subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Full-week periods</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employee may take a leave under this section only in periods of entire weeks.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" ss="1" href="#sec2subsec1_smooth">s. 2 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec8" id="sec49_1subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take leave under this section shall advise his or her employer in writing that he or she will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" s="3" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html#sec3_smooth">so.  2004, c. 15, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec9" id="sec49_1subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> If the employee must begin the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave in writing as soon as possible after beginning it.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec10" id="sec49_1subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of certificate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> If requested by the employer, the employee shall provide the employer with a copy of the certificate referred to in subsection (2) as soon as possible.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec11" id="sec49_1subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Further leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> If an employee takes a leave under this section and the individual referred to in subsection (3) does not die within the 52-week period referred to in paragraph 2 of subsection (5), the employee may, in accordance with this section, take another leave and, for that purpose, the reference in subsection (6) to “the first certificate” shall be deemed to be a reference to the first certificate issued after the end of that period. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec12" id="sec49_1subsec12"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12" href="#sec12_smooth">s. 12</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.1subsec13" id="sec49_1subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.1" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> If a certificate described in subsection (2) was issued before January 1, 2018, then this section, as it read immediately before January 1, 2018, applies. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 34 (4).</P>
 

 
<A name="Organ_Donor_Leave__150300"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK91"></A>Organ Donor Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Organ donor leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49.2" data-viibes-start="79" data-viibes-end="78"><A name="BK92"></A><B><a name="sec49.2subsec1" id="sec49_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec49.2" id="sec49_2"></A>49.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“legally qualified medical practitioner” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  in the case of surgery for the purpose of organ donation that takes place in Ontario, a member of the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the case of surgery for the purpose of organ donation that takes place outside Ontario, a person who is qualified to practise medicine under the laws of that jurisdiction; (“médecin dûment qualifié”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“organ” means kidney, liver, lung, pancreas, small bowel or any other organ that is prescribed for the purpose of this section; (“organe”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“organ donation” means the donation of all or part of an organ to a person; (“don d’organe”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“prescribed” means prescribed by a regulation made under this section. (“prescrit”)  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec2" id="sec49_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Application to prescribed tissue</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> References to organs in this section also apply to tissue that is prescribed for the purpose of this section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec3" id="sec49_2subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by his or her employer for at least 13 weeks and undergoes surgery for the purpose of organ donation is entitled to a leave of absence without pay.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec4" id="sec49_2subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Certificate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employer may require an employee who takes leave under this section to provide a certificate issued by a legally qualified medical practitioner confirming that the employee has undergone or will undergo surgery for the purpose of organ donation.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec5" id="sec49_2subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Length of leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The employee is entitled to take leave for the prescribed period or, if no period is prescribed, for up to 13 weeks.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec6" id="sec49_2subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Extended leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> When the leave described in subsection (5) ends, if a legally qualified medical practitioner issues a certificate stating that the employee is not yet able to perform the duties of his or her position because of the organ donation and will not be able to do so for a specified time, the employee is entitled to extend the leave for the specified time, subject to subsection (7).  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec7" id="sec49_2subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The leave may be extended more than once, but the total extension period shall not exceed 13 weeks.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec8" id="sec49_2subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">When leave begins</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> The employee may begin a leave described in subsection (5) on the day that he or she undergoes surgery for the purpose of organ donation, or on the earlier day specified in a certificate issued by a legally qualified medical practitioner.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec9" id="sec49_2subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">When leave ends</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (10) and (11), a leave under this section ends when the prescribed period has expired or, if no period is prescribed, 13 weeks after the leave began.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec10" id="sec49_2subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> If the employee extends the leave in accordance with subsection (6), the leave ends on the earlier of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the day specified in the most recent certificate under subsection (6); or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the day that is,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  if no period is prescribed for the purposes of subsection (5), 26 weeks after the leave began, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  if a period is prescribed for the purposes of subsection (5), 13 weeks after the end of the prescribed period.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec11" id="sec49_2subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Ending leave early</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> The employee may end the leave earlier than provided in subsection (9) or (10) by giving the employer written notice at least two weeks before the day the employee wishes to end the leave.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec12" id="sec49_2subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take leave under this section or to extend a leave under this section shall give the employer written notice, at least two weeks before beginning or extending the leave, if possible.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec13" id="sec49_2subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> If the employee must begin or extend the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the matter in writing as soon as possible after beginning or extending the leave.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec14" id="sec49_2subsec14"></A><P class="headnote">Duty to provide certificate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="14" alinea="null">(14)</SPAN> When the employer requires a certificate under subsection (4), (6) or (8), the employee shall provide it as soon as possible.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 2</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.2subsec15" id="sec49_2subsec15"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.2" subsection="15" alinea="null">(15)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="13" href="#sec13_smooth">s. 13</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Family_Caregiver_Leave__155563"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK93"></A>Family Caregiver Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Family caregiver leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49.3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49.3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49.3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49.3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49.3" data-viibes-start="80" data-viibes-end="79"><A name="BK94"></A><B><a name="sec49.3subsec1" id="sec49_3subsec1"></A><a name="sec49.3" id="sec49_3"></A>49.3 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“qualified health practitioner” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a person who is qualified to practise as a physician, a registered nurse or a psychologist under the laws of the jurisdiction in which care or treatment is provided to the individual described in subsection (5), or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the prescribed circumstances, a member of a prescribed class of health practitioners; (“praticien de la santé qualifié”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“week” means a period of seven consecutive days beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday. (“semaine”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec2" id="sec49_3subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to a leave of absence without pay to provide care or support to an individual described in subsection (5) if a qualified health practitioner issues a certificate stating that the individual has a serious medical condition. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec3" id="sec49_3subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Serious medical condition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> For greater certainty, a serious medical condition referred to in subsection (2) may include a condition that is chronic or episodic. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec4" id="sec49_3subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to take up to eight weeks leave under this section for each individual described in subsection (5) in each calendar year. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec5" id="sec49_3subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Application of subs. (2)</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Subsection (2) applies in respect of the following individuals:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A parent, step-parent or foster parent of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A child, step-child or foster child of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  A grandparent, step-grandparent, grandchild or step-grandchild of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The spouse of a child of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  The employee’s brother or sister.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A relative of the employee who is dependent on the employee for care or assistance.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  Any individual prescribed as a family member for the purpose of this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96958-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2016-c-23/latest/so-2016-c-23.html">2016, c. 23, s. 46</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, s. 9 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec6" id="sec49_3subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under this section shall advise his or her employer in writing that he or she will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" s="3" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html#sec3_smooth">so. 2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec7" id="sec49_3subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> If the employee must begin the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave in writing as soon as possible after beginning it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec7.1" id="sec49_3subsec7_1"></A><P class="headnote">Leave deemed to be taken in entire weeks</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="7.1" alinea="null">(7.1)</SPAN> For the purposes of an employee’s entitlement under subsection (4), if an employee takes any part of a week as leave, the employer may deem the employee to have taken one week of leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 35 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec8" id="sec49_3subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of certificate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If requested by the employer, the employee shall provide the employer with a copy of the certificate referred to in subsection (2) as soon as possible. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.3subsec9" id="sec49_3subsec9"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.3" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="14" href="#sec14_smooth">s. 14</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="_Critical_Illness_Leave__159354"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK95"></A> Critical Illness Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Critical illness leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49.4" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49.4" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49.4"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49.4" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49.4" data-viibes-start="81" data-viibes-end="80"><A name="BK96"></A><B><a name="sec49.4subsec1" id="sec49_4subsec1"></A><a name="sec49.4" id="sec49_4"></A>49.4 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“adult” means an individual who is 18 years or older; (“adulte”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“critically ill”, with respect to a minor child or adult, means a minor child or adult whose baseline state of health has significantly changed and whose life is at risk as a result of an illness or injury; (“gravement malade”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“family member”, with respect to an employee, means the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A parent, step-parent or foster parent of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A child, step-child or foster child of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  A child who is under legal guardianship of the employee or the employee’s spouse. </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  A brother, step-brother, sister or step-sister of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  A grandparent, step-grandparent, grandchild or step-grandchild of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A brother-in-law, step-brother-in-law, sister-in-law or step-sister-in-law of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  A son-in-law or daughter-in-law of the employee or the employee’s spouse. </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.  An uncle or aunt of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  10.  A nephew or niece of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  11.  The spouse of the employee’s grandchild, uncle, aunt, nephew or niece.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  12.  A person who considers the employee to be like a family member, provided the prescribed conditions, if any, are met.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  13.  Any individual prescribed as a family member for the purpose of this definition; (“membre de la famille”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“minor child” means an individual who is under 18 years of age; (“enfant mineur”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“qualified health practitioner” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a person who is qualified to practise as a physician, a registered nurse or a psychologist under the laws of the jurisdiction in which care or treatment is provided to the individual described in subsection (2) or (5), or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the prescribed circumstances, a member of a prescribed class of health practitioners; (“praticien de la santé qualifié”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“week” means a period of seven consecutive days beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday. (“semaine”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, s. 9 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec2" id="sec49_4subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave — critically ill minor child</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by his or her employer for at least six consecutive months is entitled to a leave of absence without pay to provide care or support to a critically ill minor child who is a family member of the employee if a qualified health practitioner issues a certificate that,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  states that the minor child is a critically ill minor child who requires the care or support of one or more family members; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  sets out the period during which the minor child requires the care or support. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec3" id="sec49_4subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (4), an employee is entitled to take up to 37 weeks of leave under this section to provide care or support to a critically ill minor child. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec4" id="sec49_4subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same — period less than 37 weeks</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If the certificate described in subsection (2) sets out a period of less than 37 weeks, the employee is entitled to take a leave only for the number of weeks in the period specified in the certificate. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec5" id="sec49_4subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave — critically ill adult</P>
