<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by his or her employer for at least six consecutive months is entitled to a leave of absence without pay to provide care or support to a critically ill adult who is a family member of the employee if a qualified health practitioner issues a certificate that,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  states that the adult is a critically ill adult who requires the care or support of one or more family members; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  sets out the period during which the adult requires the care or support. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec6" id="sec49_4subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (7), an employee is entitled to take up to 17 weeks of leave under this section to provide care or support to a critically ill adult. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec7" id="sec49_4subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Same — period less than 17 weeks</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> If the certificate described in subsection (5) sets out a period of less than 17 weeks, the employee is entitled to take a leave only for the number of weeks in the period specified in the certificate. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec8" id="sec49_4subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">When leave must end</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (9), a leave under this section ends no later than the last day of the period specified in the certificate described in subsection (2) or (5). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec9" id="sec49_4subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Limitation period</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> If the period specified in the certificate described in subsection (2) or (5) is 52 weeks or longer, the leave ends no later than the last day of the 52-week period that begins on the earlier of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the first day of the week in which the certificate is issued; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the first day of the week in which the minor child or adult in respect of whom the certificate was issued became critically ill. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec10" id="sec49_4subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Death of minor child or adult</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> If a critically ill minor child or adult dies while an employee is on a leave under this section, the employee’s entitlement to be on leave under this section ends on the last day of the week in which the minor child or adult dies. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec11" id="sec49_4subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Total amount of leave — critically ill minor child</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> The total amount of leave that may be taken by one or more employees under this section in respect of the same critically ill minor child is 37 weeks. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec12" id="sec49_4subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Total amount of leave — critically ill adult</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> The total amount of leave that may be taken by one or more employees under this section in respect of the same critically ill adult is 17 weeks. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec13" id="sec49_4subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">Limitation where child turns 18</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> If an employee takes leave in respect of a critically ill minor child under subsection (2), the employee may not take leave in respect of the same individual under subsection (5) before the 52-week period described in subsection (9) expires. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec14" id="sec49_4subsec14"></A><P class="headnote">Further leave — critically ill minor child</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="14" alinea="null">(14)</SPAN> If a minor child in respect of whom an employee has taken a leave under this section remains critically ill while the employee is on leave or after the employee returns to work, but before the 52-week period described in subsection (9) expires, the employee is entitled to take an extension of the leave or a new leave if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a qualified health practitioner issues an additional certificate described in subsection (2) for the minor child that sets out a different period during which the minor child requires care or support;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the amount of leave that has been taken and the amount of leave the employee takes under this subsection does not exceed 37 weeks in total; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the leave ends no later than the last day of the 52-week period described in subsection (9). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec15" id="sec49_4subsec15"></A><P class="headnote">Further leave — critically ill adult</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="15" alinea="null">(15)</SPAN> If an adult in respect of whom an employee has taken a leave under this section remains critically ill while the employee is on leave or after the employee returns to work, but before the 52-week period described in subsection (9) expires, the employee is entitled to take an extension of the leave or a new leave if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a qualified health practitioner issues an additional certificate described in subsection (5) for the adult that sets out a different period during which the adult requires care or support;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the amount of leave that has been taken and the amount of leave the employee takes under this subsection does not exceed 17 weeks in total; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the leave ends no later than the last day of the 52-week period described in subsection (9). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec16" id="sec49_4subsec16"></A><P class="headnote">Additional leaves</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="16" alinea="null">(16)</SPAN> If a minor child or adult in respect of whom an employee has taken a leave under this section remains critically ill after the 52-week period described in subsection (9) expires, the employee is entitled to take another leave and the requirements of this section apply to the new leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec17" id="sec49_4subsec17"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="17" alinea="null">(17)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under this section shall advise his or her employer in writing that he or she will be doing so and shall provide the employer with a written plan that indicates the weeks in which he or she will take the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec18" id="sec49_4subsec18"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="18" alinea="null">(18)</SPAN> If an employee must begin a leave under this section before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave in writing as soon as possible after beginning it and shall provide the employer with a written plan that indicates the weeks in which he or she will take the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec19" id="sec49_4subsec19"></A><P class="headnote">Same — change in employees plan</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="19" alinea="null">(19)</SPAN> An employee may take a leave at a time other than that indicated in the plan provided under subsection (17) or (18) if the change to the time of the leave meets the requirements of this section and,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee requests permission from the employer to do so in writing and the employer grants permission in writing; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee provides the employer with such written notice of the change as is reasonable in the circumstances. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec20" id="sec49_4subsec20"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of certificate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="20" alinea="null">(20)</SPAN> If requested by the employer, the employee shall provide the employer with a copy of the certificate referred to in subsection (2) or (5) or clause (14) (a) or (15) (a) as soon as possible. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec21" id="sec49_4subsec21"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="21" alinea="null">(21)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15" href="#sec15_smooth">s. 15</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.4subsec22" id="sec49_4subsec22"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.4" subsection="22" alinea="null">(22)</SPAN> If a certificate mentioned in subsection (2) or (12), as those subsections read immediately before the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">section 36</A> of Schedule 1 to the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">Fair Workplaces, Better Jobs Act, 2017</A></I>
came into force, was issued before that day, then this section, as it read immediately before that day, applies. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="36" href="#sec36_smooth">s. 36</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Child_Death_Leave__171439"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK97"></A>Child Death Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Child death leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49.5" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49.5" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49.5"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49.5" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49.5" data-viibes-start="82" data-viibes-end="81"><A name="BK98"></A><B><a name="sec49.5subsec1" id="sec49_5subsec1"></A><a name="sec49.5" id="sec49_5"></A>49.5 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“child” means a child, step-child, foster child or child who is under legal guardianship, and who is under 18 years of age; (“enfant”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“crime” means an offence under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12792-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-c-46/latest/rsc-1985-c-c-46.html">Criminal Code</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12792-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-c-46/latest/rsc-1985-c-c-46.html"> (Canada)</A>, other than an offence prescribed by the regulations made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" s="209.4" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html#sec209.4_smooth">paragraph 209.4</A> (f) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html">Canada Labour Code</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html">
(Canada)</A>; (“acte criminel”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“week” means a period of seven consecutive days beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday. (“semaine”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec2" id="sec49_5subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by an employer for at least six consecutive months is entitled to a leave of absence without pay of up to 104 weeks if a child of the employee dies. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec3" id="sec49_5subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee is not entitled to a leave of absence under this section if the employee is charged with a crime in relation to the death of the child or if it is probable, considering the circumstances, that the child was a party to a crime in relation to his or her death. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec4" id="sec49_5subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Single period</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee may take a leave under this section only in a single period. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec5" id="sec49_5subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Limitation period</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee may take a leave under this section only during the 105-week period that begins in the week the child dies. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec6" id="sec49_5subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Total amount of leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The total amount of leave that may be taken by one or more employees under this section in respect of a death, or deaths that are the result of the same event, is 104 weeks. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec7" id="sec49_5subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under this section shall advise the employer in writing and shall provide the employer with a written plan that indicates the weeks in which the employee will take the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec8" id="sec49_5subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If an employee must begin a leave under this section before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave in writing as soon as possible after beginning it and shall provide the employer with a written plan that indicates the weeks in which the employee will take the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec9" id="sec49_5subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same — change in employee’s plan</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> An employee may take a leave at a time other than that indicated in the plan provided under subsection (7) or (8) if the change to the time of the leave meets the requirements of this section and,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee requests permission from the employer to do so in writing and the employer grants permission in writing; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee provides the employer with four weeks written notice before the change is to take place. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec10" id="sec49_5subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes a leave under this section to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances of the employee’s entitlement to the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec11" id="sec49_5subsec11"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="16" href="#sec16_smooth">s. 16</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.5subsec12" id="sec49_5subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.5" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> If, on December 31, 2017, an employee was on a crime-related child death or disappearance leave under this section, as it read on that date, then the employee’s entitlement to the leave continues in accordance with this section as it read on that date. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Crime_Related_Child_Disappearance_Leave__175593"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK99"></A>Crime-Related Child Disappearance Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Crime-related child disappearance leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49.6" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49.6" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49.6"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49.6" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49.6" data-viibes-start="83" data-viibes-end="82"><A name="BK100"></A><B><a name="sec49.6subsec1" id="sec49_6subsec1"></A><a name="sec49.6" id="sec49_6"></A>49.6 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“child” means a child, step-child, foster child or child who is under legal guardianship, and who is under 18 years of age; (“enfant”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“crime” means an offence under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12792-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-c-46/latest/rsc-1985-c-c-46.html">Criminal Code</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12792-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-c-46/latest/rsc-1985-c-c-46.html"> (Canada)</A>, other than an offence prescribed by the regulations made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" s="209.4" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html#sec209.4_smooth">paragraph 209.4</A> (f) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html">Canada Labour Code</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html">
(Canada)</A>; (“acte criminel”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“week” means a period of seven consecutive days beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday. (“semaine”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec2" id="sec49_6subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by an employer for at least six consecutive months is entitled to a leave of absence without pay of up to 104 weeks if a child of the employee disappears and it is probable, considering the circumstances, that the child disappeared as a result of a crime. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec3" id="sec49_6subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Despite subsection (2), if the disappearance occurred before January 1, 2018, the employee is entitled to a leave of absence without pay in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49.5" href="#sec49.5_smooth">section 49.5</A> as it read on December 31, 2017. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec4" id="sec49_6subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee is not entitled to a leave of absence under this section if the employee is charged with the crime or if it is probable, considering the circumstances, that the child was a party to the crime. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec5" id="sec49_6subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Change in circumstance</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If an employee takes a leave of absence under this section and the circumstances that made it probable that the child of the employee disappeared as a result of a crime change and it no longer seems probable that the child disappeared as a result of a crime, the employee’s entitlement to leave ends on the day on which it no longer seems probable. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec6" id="sec49_6subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Child found</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The following rules apply if an employee takes a leave of absence under this section and the child is found within the 104-week period that begins in the week the child disappears:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  If the child is found alive, the employee is entitled to remain on leave under this section for 14 days after the child is found.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the child is found dead, the employee’s entitlement to be on leave under this section ends at the end of the week in which the child is found. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec7" id="sec49_6subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> For greater certainty, nothing in paragraph 2 of subsection (6) affects the employee’s eligibility for child death leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49.5" href="#sec49.5_smooth">section 49.5</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec8" id="sec49_6subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Single period</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> An employee may take a leave under this section only in a single period. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec9" id="sec49_6subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Limitation period</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Except as otherwise provided for in subsection (8), an employee may take a leave under this section only during the 105-week period that begins in the week the child disappears. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec10" id="sec49_6subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Total amount of leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> The total amount of leave that may be taken by one or more employees under this section in respect of a disappearance, or disappearances that are the result of the same event, is 104 weeks. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec11" id="sec49_6subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under this section shall advise the employer in writing and shall provide the employer with a written plan that indicates the weeks in which the employee will take the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec12" id="sec49_6subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> If an employee must begin a leave under this section before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave in writing as soon as possible after beginning it and shall provide the employer with a written plan that indicates the weeks in which the employee will take the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec13" id="sec49_6subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">Same — change in employee’s plan</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> An employee may take a leave at a time other than that indicated in the plan provided under subsection (11) or (12) if the change to the time of the leave meets the requirements of this section and,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee requests permission from the employer to do so in writing and the employer grants permission in writing; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee provides the employer with four weeks written notice before the change is to take place. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec14" id="sec49_6subsec14"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="14" alinea="null">(14)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes a leave under this section to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances of the employee’s entitlement to the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.6subsec15" id="sec49_6subsec15"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.6" subsection="15" alinea="null">(15)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" href="#sec17_smooth">s. 17</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Domestic_or_Sexual_Violence_Leave__181178"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK101"></A>Domestic or Sexual Violence Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Domestic or sexual violence leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="49.7" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec49.7" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=49.7"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="49.7" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="49.7" data-viibes-start="84" data-viibes-end="83"><A name="BK102"></A><B><a name="sec49.7subsec1" id="sec49_7subsec1"></A><a name="sec49.7" id="sec49_7"></A>49.7 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“child” means a child, step-child, foster child or child who is under legal guardianship, and who is under 18 years of age; (“enfant”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“week” means a period of seven consecutive days beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday. (“semaine”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec2" id="sec49_7subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by an employer for at least 13 consecutive weeks is entitled to a leave of absence if the employee or a child of the employee experiences domestic or sexual violence, or the threat of domestic or sexual violence, and the leave of absence is taken for any of the following purposes:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  To seek medical attention for the employee or the child of the employee in respect of a physical or psychological injury or disability caused by the domestic or sexual violence.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  To obtain services from a victim services organization for the employee or the child of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  To obtain psychological or other professional counselling for the employee or the child of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  To relocate temporarily or permanently.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  To seek legal or law enforcement assistance, including preparing for or participating in any civil or criminal legal proceeding related to or resulting from the domestic or sexual violence.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  Such other purposes as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec3" id="sec49_7subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (2) does not apply if the domestic or sexual violence is committed by the employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec4" id="sec49_7subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Length of leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to take, in each calendar year,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  up to 10 days of leave under this section; and </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  up to 15 weeks of leave under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec5" id="sec49_7subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Entitlement to paid leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If an employee takes a leave under this section, the employee is entitled to take the first five such days as paid days of leave in each calendar year and the balance of his or her entitlement under this section as unpaid leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec6" id="sec49_7subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Domestic or sexual violence leave pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (7) and (8), if an employee takes a paid day of leave under this section, the employer shall pay the employee,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  either,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  the wages the employee would have earned had they not taken the leave, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  if the employee receives performance-related wages, including commissions or a piece work rate, the greater of the employee’s hourly rate, if any, and the minimum wage that would have applied to the employee for the number of hours the employee would have worked had they not taken the leave; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if some other manner of calculation is prescribed, the amount determined using that manner of calculation. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec7" id="sec49_7subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Domestic or sexual violence leave where higher rate of wages</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> If a paid day of leave under this section falls on a day or at a time of day when overtime pay, a shift premium, or both would be payable by the employer, </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee is not entitled to more than his or her regular rate for any leave taken under this section; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee is not entitled to the shift premium for any leave taken under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec8" id="sec49_7subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Domestic or sexual violence leave on public holiday</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If a paid day of leave under this section falls on a public holiday, the employee is not entitled to premium pay for any leave taken under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec9" id="sec49_7subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Leave deemed to be taken in entire days</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> For the purposes of an employee’s entitlement under clause (4) (a), if an employee takes any part of a day as leave, the employer may deem the employee to have taken one day of leave on that day. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec10" id="sec49_7subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take leave under clause (4) (a) shall advise the employer that the employee will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">so. 2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec11" id="sec49_7subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> If an employee must begin a leave under clause (4) (a) before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave as soon as possible after beginning it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec12" id="sec49_7subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Leave deemed to be taken in entire weeks</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> For the purposes of an employee’s entitlement under clause (4) (b), if an employee takes any part of a week as leave, the employer may deem the employee to have taken one week of leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec13" id="sec49_7subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under clause (4) (b) shall advise the employer in writing that the employee will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">so. 2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec14" id="sec49_7subsec14"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="14" alinea="null">(14)</SPAN> If an employee must begin a leave under clause (4) (b) before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave in writing as soon as possible after beginning it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec15" id="sec49_7subsec15"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="15" alinea="null">(15)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes a leave under this section to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances of the employee’s entitlement to the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec16" id="sec49_7subsec16"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="16" alinea="null">(16)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="18" href="#sec18_smooth">s. 18</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec17" id="sec49_7subsec17"></A><P class="headnote">Confidentiality</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="17" alinea="null">(17)</SPAN> An employer shall ensure that mechanisms are in place to protect the confidentiality of records given to or produced by the employer that relate to an employee taking a leave under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec49.7subsec18" id="sec49_7subsec18"></A><P class="headnote">Disclosure permitted</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="49.7" subsection="18" alinea="null">(18)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (17) prevents an employer from disclosing a record where,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee has consented to the disclosure of the record;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  disclosure is made to an officer, employee, consultant or agent of the employer who needs the record in the performance of their duties;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the disclosure is authorized or required by law; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  the disclosure is prescribed as a permitted disclosure. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="38" href="#sec38_smooth">s. 38</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Sick_Leave__188573"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK103"></A>Sick Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Sick leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="50" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec50" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=50"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="50" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="55" data-noteup-count-display="55"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="50" data-viibes-start="85" data-viibes-end="84"><A name="BK104"></A><B><a name="sec50subsec1" id="sec50subsec1"></A><a name="sec50" id="sec50"></A>50 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="50" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by an employer for at least two consecutive weeks is entitled to a leave of absence without pay because of a personal illness, injury or medical emergency. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec50subsec2" id="sec50subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, limit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee’s entitlement to leave under this section is limited to a total of three days in each calendar year. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50subsec3" id="sec50subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under this section shall advise his or her employer that he or she will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">so. 2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50subsec4" id="sec50subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If the employee must begin the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave as soon as possible after beginning it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50subsec5" id="sec50subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Leave deemed to be taken in entire days</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> For the purposes of an employee’s entitlement under subsection (1), if an employee takes any part of a day as leave under this section, the employer may deem the employee to have taken one day of leave on that day. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50subsec6" id="sec50subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes leave under this section to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances that the employee is entitled to the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50subsec7" id="sec50subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Sick leave taken under employment contract</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> If an employee takes a paid or unpaid leave of absence under an employment contract in circumstances for which he or she would also be entitled to take a leave under this section, the employee is deemed to have taken the leave under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50subsec8" id="sec50subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Same, application of Act to deemed leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> All applicable requirements and prohibitions under this Act apply to a leave deemed to have been taken under subsection (7). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50subsec9" id="sec50subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same, application of subs. (5) to deemed leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Subsection (5) applies with necessary modifications to a leave deemed to have been taken under subsection (7). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Family_Responsibility_Leave__191129"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK105"></A>Family Responsibility Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Family responsibility leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="50.0.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec50.0.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=50.0.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="50.0.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="50.0.1" data-viibes-start="86" data-viibes-end="85"><A name="BK106"></A><B><a name="sec50.0.1subsec1" id="sec50_0_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec50.0.1" id="sec50_0_1"></A>50.0.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by an employer for at least two consecutive weeks is entitled to a leave of absence without pay because of any of the following:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The illness, injury or medical emergency of an individual described in subsection (3).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  An urgent matter that concerns an individual described in subsection (3). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec2" id="sec50_0_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, limit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee’s entitlement to leave under this section is limited to a total of three days in each calendar year. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec3" id="sec50_0_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Family members</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies with respect to the following individuals:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A parent, step-parent or foster parent of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A child, step-child or foster child of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  A grandparent, step-grandparent, grandchild or step-grandchild of the employee or of the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The spouse of a child of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  The employee’s brother or sister.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A relative of the employee who is dependent on the employee for care or assistance. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, s. 9 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec4" id="sec50_0_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under this section shall advise his or her employer that he or she will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">so. 2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec5" id="sec50_0_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If the employee must begin the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave as soon as possible after beginning it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec6" id="sec50_0_1subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Leave deemed to be taken in entire days</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> For the purposes of an employee’s entitlement under subsection (1), if an employee takes any part of a day as leave under this section, the employer may deem the employee to have taken one day of leave on that day. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec7" id="sec50_0_1subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes leave under this section to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances that the employee is entitled to the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec8" id="sec50_0_1subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Family responsibility leave taken under employment contract</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If an employee takes a paid or unpaid leave of absence under an employment contract in circumstances for which he or she would also be entitled to take a leave under this section, the employee is deemed to have taken the leave under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec9" id="sec50_0_1subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same, application of Act to deemed leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> All applicable requirements and prohibitions under this Act apply to a leave deemed to have been taken under subsection (8). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.1subsec10" id="sec50_0_1subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Same, application of subs. (6) to deemed leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.1" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> Subsection (6) applies with necessary modifications to a leave deemed to have been taken under subsection (8). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="_Bereavement_Leave__194821"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK107"></A> Bereavement Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Bereavement leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="50.0.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec50.0.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=50.0.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="50.0.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="50.0.2" data-viibes-start="87" data-viibes-end="86"><A name="BK108"></A><B><a name="sec50.0.2subsec1" id="sec50_0_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec50.0.2" id="sec50_0_2"></A>50.0.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee who has been employed by an employer for at least two consecutive weeks is entitled to a leave of absence without pay because of the death of an individual described in subsection (3). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec2" id="sec50_0_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, limit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee’s entitlement to leave under this section is limited to a total of two days in each calendar year. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec3" id="sec50_0_2subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Family members</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies with respect to the following individuals:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A parent, step-parent or foster parent of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A child, step-child or foster child of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  A grandparent, step-grandparent, grandchild or step-grandchild of the employee or of the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The spouse of a child of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  The employee’s brother or sister.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A relative of the employee who is dependent on the employee for care or assistance. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, s. 9 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec4" id="sec50_0_2subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee who wishes to take a leave under this section shall advise his or her employer that he or she will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">so. 2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec5" id="sec50_0_2subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If the employee must begin the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave as soon as possible after beginning it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec6" id="sec50_0_2subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Leave deemed to be taken in entire days</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> For the purposes of an employee’s entitlement under subsection (1), if an employee takes any part of a day as leave under this section, the employer may deem the employee to have taken one day of leave on that day. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec7" id="sec50_0_2subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes leave under this section to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances that the employee is entitled to the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec8" id="sec50_0_2subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Bereavement leave taken under employment contract</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If an employee takes a paid or unpaid leave of absence under an employment contract in circumstances for which he or she would also be entitled to take a leave under this section, the employee is deemed to have taken the leave under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec9" id="sec50_0_2subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same, application of Act to deemed leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> All applicable requirements and prohibitions under this Act apply to a leave deemed to have been taken under subsection (8). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.0.2subsec10" id="sec50_0_2subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Same, application of subs. (6) to deemed leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.0.2" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> Subsection (6) applies with necessary modifications to a leave deemed to have been taken under subsection (8). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="_Emergency_Leave__Declared_Emergencies_and_Infectious_Disease_Emergencies__198289"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK109"></A> Emergency Leave: Declared Emergencies and Infectious Disease Emergencies</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Emergency leave: declared emergencies and infectious disease emergencies</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="50.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec50.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=50.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="50.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9" data-noteup-count-display="9"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="50.1" data-viibes-start="88" data-viibes-end="87"><A name="BK110"></A><B><a name="sec50.1subsec1" id="sec50_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec50.1" id="sec50_1"></A>50.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“board of health” has the same meaning as in the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html">Health Protection and Promotion Act</A></I>; (“conseil de santé”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“designated infectious disease” means an infectious disease<B>
</B>designated by the regulations for the purposes of this section; (“maladie infectieuse désignée”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“public health official” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  within the meaning of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html">Health Protection and Promotion Act</A></I>,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  the Chief Medical Officer of Health or Associate Chief Medical Officer of Health,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  a medical officer of health or an associate medical officer of health, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iii)  an employee of a board of health, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a public health official of the Government of Canada; (“fonctionnaire de la santé publique”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“qualified health practitioner” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a person who is qualified to practise as a physician or nurse under the laws of the jurisdiction in which care or treatment is provided to the employee or an individual described in subsection (8), or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the prescribed circumstances, a member of a prescribed class of health practitioners. (“praticien de la santé qualifié”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.0.1" id="sec50_1subsec1_0_1"></A><P class="headnote">Interpretation, treatment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.0.1" alinea="null">(1.0.1)</SPAN> For greater certainty, in this section, a reference to treatment related to a designated infectious disease includes receiving a vaccine for the designated infectious disease and recovery from associated side effects. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.1" id="sec50_1subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Leave of absence without pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to a leave of absence without pay if the employee will not be performing the duties of his or her position,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  because of an emergency declared under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" s="7.0.1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html#sec7.0.1_smooth">section 7.0.1</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html">Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act</A></I>
and,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  because of an order that applies to him or her made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" s="7.0.2" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html#sec7.0.2_smooth">section 7.0.2</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html">Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act</A></I>,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  because of an order that applies to him or her made under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html">Health Protection and Promotion Act</A></I>,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iii)  because he or she is needed to provide care or assistance to an individual referred to in subsection (8), or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iv)  because of such other reasons as may be prescribed; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  because of one or more of the following reasons related to a designated infectious disease:</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  The employee is under individual medical investigation, supervision or treatment related to the designated infectious disease.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  The employee is acting in accordance with an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" s="22" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html#sec22_smooth">section 22</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" s="35" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html#sec35_smooth"> 35</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html">Health Protection and Promotion Act</A></I> that relates to the designated infectious disease.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iii)  The employee is in quarantine or isolation or is subject to a control measure (which may include, but is not limited to, self-isolation), and the quarantine, isolation or control measure was implemented as a result of information or directions related to the designated infectious disease issued to the public, in whole or in part, or to one or more individuals, by a public health official, a qualified health practitioner, Telehealth Ontario, the Government of Ontario, the Government of Canada, a municipal council or a board of health, whether through print, electronic, broadcast or other means.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iv)  The employee is under a direction given by his or her employer in response to a concern of the employer that the employee may expose other individuals in the workplace to the designated infectious disease.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v)  The employee is providing care or support to an individual referred to in subsection (8) because of a matter related to the designated infectious disease that concerns that individual, including, but not limited to, school or day care closures.</P>
