<P class="subpara">  (vi)  The employee is directly affected by travel restrictions related to the designated infectious disease and, under the circumstances, cannot reasonably be expected to travel back to Ontario.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (vii)  Such other reasons as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.2" id="sec50_1subsec1_2"></A><P class="headnote">Leave of absence with pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.2" alinea="null">(1.2)</SPAN> In addition to any entitlement under subsection (1.1), an employee is entitled to a paid leave of absence if the employee will not be performing the duties of the employee’s position because of one or more of the following reasons related to a designated infectious disease:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee is under individual medical investigation, supervision or treatment related to the designated infectious disease.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The employee is acting in accordance with an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" s="22" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html#sec22_smooth">section 22</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" s="35" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html#sec35_smooth"> 35</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="211-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h7/latest/rso-1990-c-h7.html">Health Protection and Promotion Act</A></I> that relates to the designated infectious disease.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The employee is in quarantine or isolation or is subject to a control measure (which may include, but is not limited to, self-isolation), and the quarantine, isolation or control measure was implemented as a result of information or directions related to the designated infectious disease issued to the public, in whole or in part, or to one or more individuals, by a public health official, a qualified health practitioner, Telehealth Ontario, the Government of Ontario, the Government of Canada, a municipal council or a board of health, whether through print, electronic, broadcast or other means.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  The employee is under a direction given by his or her employer in response to a concern of the employer that the employee may expose other individuals in the workplace to the designated infectious disease.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The employee is providing care or support to an individual referred to in subsection (8) because,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  the individual is under individual medical investigation, supervision or treatment related to the designated infectious disease, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  the individual is in quarantine or isolation or is subject to a control measure (which may include, but is not limited to, self-isolation), and the quarantine, isolation or control measure was implemented as a result of information or directions related to the designated infectious disease issued to the public, in whole or in part, or to one or more individuals, by a public health official, a qualified health practitioner, Telehealth Ontario, the Government of Ontario, the Government of Canada, a municipal council or a board of health, whether through print, electronic, broadcast or other means. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.3" id="sec50_1subsec1_3"></A><P class="headnote">Limit, number of days</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.3" alinea="null">(1.3)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (1.4), an employee is entitled to take a total of three paid days of leave under subsection (1.2). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.4" id="sec50_1subsec1_4"></A><P class="headnote">Paid leave taken under employment contract</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.4" alinea="null">(1.4)</SPAN> If, on April 19, 2021, an employee is entitled to take paid leave under an employment contract in any of the circumstances for which the employee would also be entitled to take a leave under subsection (1.2), the employee’s entitlement under subsection (1.3) is reduced by the employee’s entitlement under the contract. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.5" id="sec50_1subsec1_5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.5" alinea="null">(1.5)</SPAN> Subsection (1.4) applies only if the employer is required under the employment contract to pay the employee for the paid leave an amount that is equal to or greater than what the employee would be entitled to under subsection (1.11). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.6" id="sec50_1subsec1_6"></A><P class="headnote">Leave deemed to be taken in entire days</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.6" alinea="null">(1.6)</SPAN> If an employee takes any part of a day as paid leave under subsection (1.2), the employer may deem the employee to have taken one paid day of leave on that day for the purposes of subsection (1.3). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.7" id="sec50_1subsec1_7"></A><P class="headnote">Paid days first </P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.7" alinea="null">(1.7)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (1.8) and (1.9), an employee is entitled to take the three paid days of leave before any of the unpaid days of leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.8" id="sec50_1subsec1_8"></A><P class="headnote">Same, election re unpaid days</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.8" alinea="null">(1.8)</SPAN> If an employee is entitled to both paid leave and unpaid leave under this section, the employee may elect to take one or more days or parts of a day of leave as unpaid leave only if the employee advises the employer in writing, before the end of the pay period in which the leave occurs, that the employee has elected to take that time as unpaid leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.9" id="sec50_1subsec1_9"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.9" alinea="null">(1.9)</SPAN> If, between April 19, 2021 and the day the
<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">COVID-19 Putting Workers First Act, 2021</A></I> receives Royal Assent, an employee takes unpaid leave under subsection (1.1) in circumstances for which the employee would also be entitled to take a leave under subsection (1.2), the employee may elect to be paid for that leave only if the employee advises the employer in writing before the day that is 14 days after the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">COVID-19 Putting Workers First Act, 2021</A></I>
receives Royal Assent, that the employee has elected to take the leave as paid leave, and the employee is deemed to have taken the leave under subsection (1.2). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.10" id="sec50_1subsec1_10"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.10" alinea="null">(1.10)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" ss="1" href="#sec11subsec1_smooth">subsection 11 (1)</A>, if an employee elects to take paid leave under subsection (1.9), the employer shall pay the employee the amount to which the employee is entitled no later than the pay day for the pay period in which the employee made the election. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.11" id="sec50_1subsec1_11"></A><P class="headnote">Paid leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.11" alinea="null">(1.11)</SPAN> Subject to subsections (1.12) and (1.13), if an employee takes paid leave under subsection (1.2), the employer shall pay the employee the lesser of $200 per day and,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  either,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  the wages the employee would have earned had they not taken the leave, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  if the employee receives performance-related wages, including commissions or a piece work rate, the greater of the employee’s hourly rate, if any, and the minimum wage that would have applied to the employee for the number of hours the employee would have worked had they not taken the leave; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if some other manner of calculation is prescribed, the amount determined using that manner of calculation. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.12" id="sec50_1subsec1_12"></A><P class="headnote">Paid leave where higher rate of wages</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.12" alinea="null">(1.12)</SPAN> If a paid day of leave under subsection (1.2) falls on a day or at a time of day when overtime pay, a shift premium or both would be payable by the employer,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee is not entitled to more than the employee’s regular rate for any leave taken under subsection (1.2); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee is not entitled to the shift premium for any leave taken under subsection (1.2). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec1.13" id="sec50_1subsec1_13"></A><P class="headnote">Paid leave on public holiday</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="1.13" alinea="null">(1.13)</SPAN> If a paid day of leave under subsection (1.2) falls on a public holiday, the employee is not entitled to premium pay for any leave taken under subsection (1.2). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec2" id="sec50_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who takes leave under this section shall advise his or her employer that he or she will be doing <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96706-current-1" s="3" ss="3" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-13/latest/so-2006-c-13.html#sec3subsec3_smooth">so.  2006, c. 13, s. 3 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec3" id="sec50_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the employee begins the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave as soon as possible after beginning it.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96706-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-13/latest/so-2006-c-13.html">2006, c. 13, s. 3 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec4" id="sec50_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence of entitlement, declared emergency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes leave under clause (1.1) (a) to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances, at a time that is reasonable in the circumstances, that the employee is entitled to the leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec4.1" id="sec50_1subsec4_1"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence of entitlement, infectious disease emergency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="4.1" alinea="null">(4.1)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes leave under clause (1.1) (b) or subsection (1.2) to provide evidence reasonable in the circumstances, at a time that is reasonable in the circumstances, that the employee is entitled to the leave, but shall not require an employee to provide a certificate from a qualified health practitioner as evidence. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (2)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec5" id="sec50_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Limit, declared emergency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to take a leave under clause (1.1) (a) for as long as he or she is not performing the duties of his or her position because of an emergency declared under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" s="7.0.1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html#sec7.0.1_smooth">section 7.0.1</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html">Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act</A></I> and a reason referred to in subclauses (1.1) (a) (i) to (iv), but, subject to subsection (6), the entitlement ends on the day the emergency is terminated or disallowed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec5.1" id="sec50_1subsec5_1"></A><P class="headnote">Limit, infectious disease emergency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="5.1" alinea="null">(5.1)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to take a leave under clause (1.1) (b) starting on the prescribed date and for as long as,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  he or she is not performing the duties of his or her position because of a reason referred to in subclauses (1.1) (b) (i) to (vii); and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the infectious disease is designated by the regulations for the purposes of this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec5.2" id="sec50_1subsec5_2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, paid leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="5.2" alinea="null">(5.2)</SPAN> An employee’s entitlement to paid leave under subsection (1.2) is deemed to have started on April 19, 2021 and ends on September 25, 2021 or such later date as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (4)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec5.3" id="sec50_1subsec5_3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="5.3" alinea="null">(5.3)</SPAN> If the regulations so provide, an employee is entitled to paid leave under subsection (1.2) for such additional periods as may be prescribed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (4)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec6" id="sec50_1subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Limit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If an employee took leave because he or she was not performing the duties of his or her position because of an emergency that has been terminated or disallowed and because of an order made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" s="7.0.2" ss="4" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html#sec7.0.2subsec4_smooth">subsection 7.0.2 (4)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html">Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act</A></I><I> </I>and the order is extended under <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html#sec7.0.8subsec4" title1="Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act, RSO 1990, c E.9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="145" s="7.0.8" ss="4" data-link-type="weak">subsection 7.0.8 (4)</SPAN> of that Act, the employee’s entitlement to leave continues during the period of the extension if he or she is not performing the duties of his or her position because of the order.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96706-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-13/latest/so-2006-c-13.html">2006, c. 13, s. 3 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec7" id="sec50_1subsec7"></A><P class="headnoteitalic">Protecting a Sustainable Public Sector for Future Generations Act, 2019</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> This section applies despite the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="60002-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">Protecting a Sustainable Public Sector for Future Generations Act, 2019</A></I>, and payments made in accordance with subsection (1.11) are not an increase to existing compensation entitlements or new compensation entitlements for the purposes of that Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 2 (5)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec8" id="sec50_1subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Care, assistance, support — specified individuals</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Subclauses (1.1) (a) (iii) and (1.1) (b) (v) apply with respect to the following individuals:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A parent, step-parent or foster parent of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A child, step-child or foster child of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  A child who is under legal guardianship of the employee or the employee’s spouse. </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  A brother, step-brother, sister or step-sister of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  A grandparent, step-grandparent, grandchild or step-grandchild of the employee or the employee’s spouse. </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A brother-in-law, step-brother-in-law, sister-in-law or step-sister-in-law of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  A son-in-law or daughter-in-law of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.  An uncle or aunt of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  10.  A nephew or niece of the employee or the employee’s spouse.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  11.  The spouse of the employee’s grandchild, uncle, aunt, nephew or niece.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  12.  A person who considers the employee to be like a family member, provided the prescribed conditions, if any, are met.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  13.  Any individual prescribed as a family member for the purposes of this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (3)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97082-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-4/latest/so-2021-c-4.html">2021, c. 4</A>, Sched. 11, s. 9 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec9" id="sec50_1subsec9"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (4)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1subsec10" id="sec50_1subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Retroactive order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> If an order made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" s="7.0.2" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html#sec7.0.2_smooth">section 7.0.2</A> of the
<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="145-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html">Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act</A></I> is made retroactive pursuant to <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e9/latest/rso-1990-c-e9.html#sec7.2subsec1" title1="Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act, RSO 1990, c E.9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="145" s="7.2" ss="1" data-link-type="weak">subsection 7.2 (1)</SPAN> of that Act,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an employee who does not perform the duties of his or her position because of the declared emergency and the order is deemed to have been on leave beginning on the first day the employee did not perform the duties of his or her position on or after the date to which the order was made retroactive; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74" ss="1" href="#sec74subsec1_smooth">clauses 74 (1)</A> (a) and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" ss="1" href="#sec74.12subsec1_smooth">74.12 (1)</A> (a) apply with necessary modifications in relation to the deemed leave described in clause (a).  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96706-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-13/latest/so-2006-c-13.html">2006, c. 13, s. 3 (3)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 4 (5)</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Reimbursement of certain payments made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">s. 50.1</A></P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definition</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="50.1.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec50.1.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=50.1.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="50.1.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="50.1.1" data-viibes-start="89" data-viibes-end="88"><A name="BK111"></A><B><a name="sec50.1.1subsec1" id="sec50_1_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec50.1.1" id="sec50_1_1"></A>50.1.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“Board” means the Workplace Safety and Insurance Board, continued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" s="159" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html#sec159subsec1_smooth">subsection 159 (1)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I>, despite the definition of “Board” in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">subsection 1 (1)</A> of this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec2" id="sec50_1_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Reimbursement for paid leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer may apply to the Board, in accordance with this section, to be reimbursed for payments made to an employee for paid leave taken under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec3" id="sec50_1_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same, maximum</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employer is entitled to be reimbursed for payments made to an employee for paid leave taken under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A> up to a maximum of $200 per day, per employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec4" id="sec50_1_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same, exclusion</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.9" href="#sec50.1subsec1.9_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.9)</A>, an employer is not entitled to be reimbursed for payments made to an employee on or after the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">COVID-19 Putting Workers First Act, 2021</A></I>
receives Royal Assent for a paid leave of absence under an employment contract in circumstances for which the employee would also be entitled to take a leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec5" id="sec50_1_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same, exclusion re change to employment contract</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If, under an employment contract that was in effect on April 19, 2021, an employee was entitled to a paid leave of absence in circumstances for which the employee would also be entitled to take a leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A>, but due to a change to the employment contract on or after April 19, 2021, the employee is no longer entitled to some or all of the paid leave of absence that the employee was entitled to before the change, the employer is not entitled to be reimbursed for payments made to that employee for a paid leave of absence, whether the leave is taken under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A> or under the employment contract, to the extent that the employee was entitled to the leave of absence under the employment contract before the change. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec6" id="sec50_1_1subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same, exclusion re payments made under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> An employer is not entitled to be reimbursed for payments made to an employee for paid leave taken under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A> if the employee received benefits under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I> for the days of leave. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec7" id="sec50_1_1subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Application for reimbursement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An application under this section shall be made by filing the following with the Board:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A completed application in the form approved by the Board.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  An attestation, to be completed by the employer in the form approved by the Board that,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  confirms that the employer made a payment to the employee for paid leave taken under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A>,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  specifies the dates on which the leave was taken by the employee,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iii.  specifies the date on which the payment was made and the amount of the payment made, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iv.  confirms that, on or after April 19, 2021, the employer was not otherwise required under an employment contract to make the payment to the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A record of the payment made to the employee in the form approved by the Board.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Information about claims filed with the Board under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I> in respect of the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  Any other information required by the Board. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec8" id="sec50_1_1subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Time limit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> An application under this section shall be made within 120 days of the payment in respect of which the application is made. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec9" id="sec50_1_1subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same, final date for application</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Despite subsection (8), no application under this section shall be made by an employer or accepted by the Board,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  after January 25, 2022;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if a later date is prescribed for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="5.2" href="#sec50.1subsec5.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (5.2)</A>,<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" href="#sec120_smooth"> 120</A> days after that later date; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  if an additional period is prescribed for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="5.3" href="#sec50.1subsec5.3_smooth">subsection 50.1 (5.3)</A>,<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" href="#sec120_smooth"> 120</A> days after the last day of that period. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec10" id="sec50_1_1subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">No determination if application incomplete</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> The Board shall not make a determination regarding an employer’s entitlement to reimbursement under this section if the employer’s application does not meet the requirements of subsection (7) or is not filed within the time limits set out in subsections (8) and (9). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec11" id="sec50_1_1subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Determination of entitlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> The Board shall make a determination regarding an employer’s entitlement to reimbursement under this section after receiving the employer’s application and shall advise the employer of its determination in writing after making its determination. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec12" id="sec50_1_1subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Same, payment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> If the Board determines that an employer is entitled to be reimbursed under this section, the Board shall pay the employer the amount to which the employer is entitled. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec13" id="sec50_1_1subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">No right of reconsideration or appeal</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> A determination made by the Board regarding an employer’s entitlement to reimbursement under this section is not a final decision of the Board for the purposes of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I> and an employer has no right of reconsideration by, or appeal to, the Board or the Workplace Safety and Insurance Appeals Tribunal in respect of a determination made by the Board under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec14" id="sec50_1_1subsec14"></A><P class="headnote">Hearing not required</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="14" alinea="null">(14)</SPAN> The Board is not required to hold a hearing when making a determination or exercising a power under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec15" id="sec50_1_1subsec15"></A><P class="headnote">No complaint</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="15" alinea="null">(15)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="96" href="#sec96_smooth">Section 96</A> does not apply to a determination made by the Board under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec16" id="sec50_1_1subsec16"></A><P class="headnote">Overpayments</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="16" alinea="null">(16)</SPAN> If the Board pays an employer an amount in excess of the amount to which the employer is entitled under this section, the amount of the excess is an overpayment and is an amount owing under this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec17" id="sec50_1_1subsec17"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="17" alinea="null">(17)</SPAN> If the Board pays an employer an amount under this section and the employee in respect of whom the employer was paid subsequently receives benefits under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I> for the days of leave for which the employer was paid, the amount of the payment to the employer is an overpayment and is an amount owing under this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec18" id="sec50_1_1subsec18"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="18" alinea="null">(18)</SPAN> An overpayment made by the Board under this section may be recovered from the employer by the Board or the Ministry in accordance with the prescribed process. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec19" id="sec50_1_1subsec19"></A><P class="headnote">Ministry to make payments to Board</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="19" alinea="null">(19)</SPAN> The Ministry shall make payments to the Board to defray the costs of administering this section, including the cost of payments made to employers and the administration costs of the Board. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec20" id="sec50_1_1subsec20"></A><P class="headnote">Same, appropriation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="20" alinea="null">(20)</SPAN> Money required to defray the costs of administering this section shall be paid out of the money appropriated by the Ministry from the Consolidated Revenue Fund for that purpose by the Legislature. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec21" id="sec50_1_1subsec21"></A><P class="headnote">Repayment by Board</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="21" alinea="null">(21)</SPAN> On or before the prescribed date, the Board shall pay the Ministry any amounts paid to the Board under subsection (19) that are no longer required for the purpose of administering this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec22" id="sec50_1_1subsec22"></A><P class="headnote">Same, payments not part of insurance fund</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="22" alinea="null">(22)</SPAN> Payments made to the Board under subsection (19) shall not form a part of the insurance fund that is administered by the Board under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I>
and the Board shall not make any payments from the insurance fund for any purpose under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec23" id="sec50_1_1subsec23"></A><P class="headnote">Contract for services</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="23" alinea="null">(23)</SPAN> The Board may enter into a contract or agreement with any person for the purpose of administering this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec24" id="sec50_1_1subsec24"></A><P class="headnote">Recordkeeping</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="24" alinea="null">(24)</SPAN> The Board shall maintain such records relating to the administration of this section as are required by the Ministry, including records that are necessary to verify applications and payments made under this section, and shall provide those records to the Ministry. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec25" id="sec50_1_1subsec25"></A><P class="headnote">Collection and use of information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="25" alinea="null">(25)</SPAN> The Board may collect and use personal information within the meaning of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html">Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act</A></I> for the purpose of administering this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec26" id="sec50_1_1subsec26"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="26" alinea="null">(26)</SPAN> The Board may use information collected under the authority of this section for the purpose of administering and enforcing the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec27" id="sec50_1_1subsec27"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="27" alinea="null">(27)</SPAN> The Board may use information collected under the authority of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="635-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-16-sch-a/latest/so-1997-c-16-sch-a.html">Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997</A></I> for the purpose of administering this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec28" id="sec50_1_1subsec28"></A><P class="headnote">Disclosure of information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="28" alinea="null">(28)</SPAN> Except as otherwise provided for in this section, the Board shall not disclose any information collected under the authority of this section unless authorized or required by law to do <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" s="3" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html#sec3_smooth">so. 2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec29" id="sec50_1_1subsec29"></A><P class="headnote">False or misleading information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="29" alinea="null">(29)</SPAN> No person shall provide false or misleading information under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec30" id="sec50_1_1subsec30"></A><P class="headnote">Same, disclosure to Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="30" alinea="null">(30)</SPAN> If the Board is of the opinion that false or misleading information has been provided by an employer in an application under this section, the Board shall disclose that information to the Director. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec31" id="sec50_1_1subsec31"></A><P class="headnote">Investigation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="31" alinea="null">(31)</SPAN> An employment standards officer or other prescribed person may investigate a possible contravention of this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.1.1subsec32" id="sec50_1_1subsec32"></A><P class="headnote">Immunity</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.1.1" subsection="32" alinea="null">(32)</SPAN> No action or other proceeding for damages may be commenced against a member of the board of directors, or an officer or employee of the Board, for an act or omission done or omitted by the person in good faith in the execution or intended execution of any power or duty under this section. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="_Reservist_Leave__228727"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK112"></A> Reservist Leave</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Reservist leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="50.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec50.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=50.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="50.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="50.2" data-viibes-start="90" data-viibes-end="89"><A name="BK113"></A><B><a name="sec50.2subsec1" id="sec50_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec50.2" id="sec50_2"></A>50.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to a leave of absence without pay if the employee is a reservist and will not be performing the duties of his or her position because,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee is deployed to a Canadian Forces operation outside Canada; </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee is deployed to a Canadian Forces operation inside Canada that is or will be providing assistance in dealing with an emergency or with its aftermath;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> (b.1)  the employee is participating in Canadian Forces military skills training; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the prescribed circumstances apply.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 5 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec2" id="sec50_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Activities included in deployment outside Canada</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Participation, whether inside or outside Canada, in pre-deployment or post-deployment activities that are required by the Canadian Forces in connection with an operation described in clause (1) (a) is considered deployment to the operation for the purposes of that clause.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec3" id="sec50_2subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee is not entitled to begin a leave under this section unless he or she has been employed by the employer for at least the prescribed period or, if no period is prescribed, for at least three consecutive months.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 5 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec4" id="sec50_2subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Length of leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee is entitled to take leave under this section for the prescribed period or, if no period is prescribed, for as long as clause (1) (a), (b) or (b.1) or the circumstances set out in a regulation made under clause (1) (c) apply to him or her.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 5 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec5" id="sec50_2subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer re start of leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee who intends to take a leave under this section shall give his or her employer the prescribed period of notice of the day on which he or she will begin the leave or, if no notice period is prescribed, reasonable notice.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec6" id="sec50_2subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Despite subsection (5), if the employee must begin the leave before advising the employer, the employee shall advise the employer of the leave as soon as possible after beginning it.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec7" id="sec50_2subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Evidence of entitlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employer may require an employee who takes a leave under this section to provide evidence that the employee is entitled to the leave.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec8" id="sec50_2subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> When evidence is required under subsection (7), the employee shall,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  provide the prescribed evidence, or evidence reasonable in the circumstances if no evidence is prescribed; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  provide the evidence at the prescribed time, or at a time reasonable in the circumstances if no time is prescribed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec9" id="sec50_2subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Advising employer re end of leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> An employee who intends to end a leave taken under this section shall give his or her employer the prescribed period of notice of the day on which he or she intends to end the leave or, if no notice period is prescribed, reasonable notice.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec10" id="sec50_2subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Written notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> Notice under subsection (5), (6) or (9) shall be given in writing.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec11" id="sec50_2subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Definition, emergency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> In clause (1) (b),</P>
 
<P class="definition">“emergency” means,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a situation or an impending situation that constitutes a danger of major proportions that could result in serious harm to persons or substantial damage to property and that is caused by the forces of nature, a disease or other health risk, an accident or an act whether intentional or otherwise, or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a situation in which a search and rescue operation takes place.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec50.2subsec12" id="sec50_2subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="50.2" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> This section applies only if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the deployment described in subsection (1) begins on or after the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">Fairness for Military Families Act (Employment Standards and Health Insurance), 2007</A></I> receives Royal Assent; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  notice under subsection (5) or (6) is given on or after the day described in clause (a).  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="General_Provisions_Concerning_Leaves__233710"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK114"></A>General Provisions Concerning Leaves</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Rights during leave</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="51" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec51" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=51"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="51" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="8" data-noteup-count-display="8"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="51" data-viibes-start="91" data-viibes-end="90"><A name="BK115"></A><B><a name="sec51subsec1" id="sec51subsec1"></A><a name="sec51" id="sec51"></A>51 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="51" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> During any leave under this Part, an employee continues to participate in each type of benefit plan described in subsection (2) that is related to his or her employment unless he or she elects in writing not to do so.  2000, c. 41, s. 51 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec51subsec2" id="sec51subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Benefit plans</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="51" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies with respect to pension plans, life insurance plans, accidental death plans, extended health plans, dental plans and any prescribed type of benefit plan.  2000, c. 41, s. 51 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec51subsec3" id="sec51subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Employer contributions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="51" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> During an employee’s leave under this Part, the employer shall continue to make the employer’s contributions for any plan described in subsection (2) unless the employee gives the employer a written notice that the employee does not intend to pay the employee’s contributions, if any.  2000, c. 41, s. 51 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec51subsec4" id="sec51subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Reservist leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="51" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsections (1), (2) and (3) do not apply in respect of an employee during a leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.2" href="#sec50.2_smooth">section 50.2</A>, unless otherwise prescribed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec51subsec5" id="sec51subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="51" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Despite subsection (4), subsections (1), (2) and (3) apply in respect of an employee during a period of postponement under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="53" ss="1.1" href="#sec53subsec1.1_smooth">subsection 53 (1.1)</A>, unless otherwise prescribed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Leave and vacation conflict</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="51.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec51.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=51.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="51.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="51.1" data-viibes-start="92" data-viibes-end="91"><A name="BK116"></A><B><a name="sec51.1subsec1" id="sec51_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec51.1" id="sec51_1"></A>51.1</B> <SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="51.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee who is on leave under this Part may defer taking vacation until the leave expires or, if the employer and employee agree to a later date, until that later date if,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  under the terms of the employee’s employment contract, the employee may not defer taking vacation that would otherwise be forfeited or the employee’s ability to do so is restricted; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  as a result, in order to exercise his or her right to leave under this Part, the employee would have to,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  forfeit vacation or vacation pay, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  take less than his or her full leave entitlement.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec11" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="11" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (11)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec51.1subsec2" id="sec51_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Leave and completion of vacation conflict</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="51.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an employee is on leave under this Part on the day by which his or her vacation must be completed under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="35" ss="1" href="#sec35subsec1_smooth">paragraph 1</A> of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="35" href="#sec35_smooth">section 35</A> or paragraph 1 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="35.1" ss="2" href="#sec35.1subsec2_smooth">subsection 35.1 (2)</A>, the uncompleted part of the vacation shall be completed immediately after the leave expires or, if the employer and employee agree to a later date, beginning on that later date.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec11" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="11" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (11)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec22" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="22" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (22)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec51.1subsec3" id="sec51_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Alternative right, vacation pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="51.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee to whom this section applies may forego vacation and receive vacation pay in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="41" href="#sec41_smooth">section 41</A> rather than completing his or her vacation under this section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec11" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="11" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (11)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Length of employment</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="52" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec52" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=52"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="52" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9" data-noteup-count-display="9"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="52" data-viibes-start="93" data-viibes-end="92"><A name="BK117"></A><B><a name="sec52subsec1" id="sec52subsec1"></A><a name="sec52" id="sec52"></A>52 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="52" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The period of an employee’s leave under this Part shall be included in calculating any of the following for the purpose of determining his or her rights under an employment contract:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The length of his or her employment, whether or not it is active employment.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The length of the employee’s service whether or not that service is active.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The employee’s seniority.  2000, c. 41, s. 52 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec52subsec2" id="sec52subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="52" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The period of an employee’s leave shall not be included in determining whether he or she has completed a probationary period under an employment contract.  2000, c. 41, s. 52 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Leave taken in entire weeks</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="52.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec52.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=52.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="52.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="52.1" data-viibes-start="94" data-viibes-end="93"><A name="BK118"></A><B><a name="sec52.1subsec1" id="sec52_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec52.1" id="sec52_1"></A>52.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="52.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If a provision in this Part requires that an employee who takes a leave to provide care or support to a person take the leave in periods of entire weeks and, during a week of leave, an employee ceases to provide care or support, </P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee’s entitlement to leave continues until the end of the week; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employee may return to work during the week only if the employer agrees, whether in writing or not. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec52.1subsec2" id="sec52_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="52.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an employee returns to work under clause (1) (b), the week counts as an entire week for the purposes of any provision in this Part that limits the employee’s entitlement to leave to a certain number of weeks. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96887-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-6/latest/so-2014-c-6.html">2014, c. 6, s. 4</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Reinstatement</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="53" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec53" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=53"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="53" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="47" data-noteup-count-display="47"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="53" data-viibes-start="95" data-viibes-end="94"><A name="BK119"></A><B><a name="sec53subsec1" id="sec53subsec1"></A><a name="sec53" id="sec53"></A>53 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="53" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Upon the conclusion of an employee’s leave under this Part, the employer shall reinstate the employee to the position the employee most recently held with the employer, if it still exists, or to a comparable position, if it does not.  2000, c. 41, s. 53 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec53subsec1.1" id="sec53subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Reservist leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="53" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> Despite subsection (1), the employer of an employee who has been on leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.2" href="#sec50.2_smooth">section 50.2</A> may postpone the employee’s reinstatement until,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a prescribed day; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if no day is prescribed, the later of,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  the day that is two weeks after the day on which the leave ends, and</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  the first pay day that falls after the day on which the leave ends.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec53subsec1.2" id="sec53subsec1_2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="53" subsection="1.2" alinea="null">(1.2)</SPAN> During the period of postponement, the employee is deemed to continue to be on leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.2" href="#sec50.2_smooth">section 50.2</A> for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51.1" href="#sec51.1_smooth">sections 51.1</A> and<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth"> 52</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec53subsec2" id="sec53subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="53" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply if the employment of the employee is ended solely for reasons unrelated to the leave.  2000, c. 41, s. 53 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec53subsec3" id="sec53subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Wage rate</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="53" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The employer shall pay a reinstated employee at a rate that is equal to the greater of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the rate that the employee most recently earned with the employer; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the rate that the employee would be earning had he or she worked throughout the leave.  2000, c. 41, s. 53 (3).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Leaves apply separately</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="53.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec53.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=53.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="53.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="53.1" data-viibes-start="96" data-viibes-end="95"><A name="BK120"></A><B><a name="sec53.1" id="sec53_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="53.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">53.1</SPAN> </B>For greater certainty, every entitlement to leave under this Part applies separately from, and in addition to, every other entitlement to leave under this Part. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<A name="PART_Xv_TERMINATION_and_severance_OF_EMPLOYMENT_240829"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK121"></A>PART Xv <BR>  TERMINATION and severance OF EMPLOYMENT</P>
 
<A name="Termination_of_Employment__240928"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK122"></A>Termination of Employment</P>
 
<P class="headnote">No termination without notice</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="54" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec54" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=54"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="54" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="153" data-noteup-count-display="153"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="54" data-viibes-start="97" data-viibes-end="96"><A name="BK123"></A><B><a name="sec54" id="sec54"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="54" subsection="null" alinea="null">54</SPAN> </B>No employer shall terminate the employment of an employee who has been continuously employed for three months or more unless the employer,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  has given to the employee written notice of termination in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth">58</A> and the notice has expired; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  has complied with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="61" href="#sec61_smooth">section 61</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 54.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Prescribed employees not entitled</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="55" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec55" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=55"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="55" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="116" data-noteup-count-display="116"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="55" data-viibes-start="98" data-viibes-end="97"><A name="BK124"></A><B><a name="sec55" id="sec55"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="55" subsection="null" alinea="null">55</SPAN> </B>Prescribed employees are not entitled to notice of termination or termination pay under this Part.  2000, c. 41, s. 55.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">What constitutes termination</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="56" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec56" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=56"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="56" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="145" data-noteup-count-display="145"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="56" data-viibes-start="99" data-viibes-end="98"><A name="BK125"></A><B><a name="sec56subsec1" id="sec56subsec1"></A><a name="sec56" id="sec56"></A>56 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="56" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer terminates the employment of an employee for purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="54" href="#sec54_smooth">section 54</A> if,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer dismisses the employee or otherwise refuses or is unable to continue employing him or her;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employer constructively dismisses the employee and the employee resigns from his or her employment in response to that within a reasonable period; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the employer lays the employee off for a period longer than the period of a temporary lay-off.  2000, c. 41, s. 56 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec2" id="sec56subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Temporary lay-off</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For the purpose of clause (1) (c), a temporary layoff is,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  a lay-off of not more than 13 weeks in any period of 20 consecutive weeks;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a lay-off of more than 13 weeks in any period of 20 consecutive weeks, if the lay-off is less than 35 weeks in any period of 52 consecutive weeks and,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  the employee continues to receive substantial payments from the employer,</P>
