<P class="subclause">  (ii)  the employer continues to make payments for the benefit of the employee under a legitimate retirement or pension plan or a legitimate group or employee insurance plan,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (iii)  the employee receives supplementary unemployment benefits,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (iv)  the employee is employed elsewhere during the lay-off and would be entitled to receive supplementary unemployment benefits if that were not so,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (v)  the employer recalls the employee within the time approved by the Director, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (vi)  in the case of an employee who is not represented by a trade union, the employer recalls the employee within the time set out in an agreement between the employer and the employee; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  in the case of an employee represented by a trade union, a lay-off longer than a lay-off described in clause (b) where the employer recalls the employee within the time set out in an agreement between the employer and the trade union.  2000, c. 41, s. 56 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec12" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="12" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (12)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec3" id="sec56subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Definition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> In subsections (3.1) to (3.6),</P>
 
<P class="definition">“excluded week” means a week during which, for one or more days, the employee is not able to work, is not available for work, is subject to a disciplinary suspension or is not provided with work because of a strike or lock-out occurring at his or her place of employment or elsewhere.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec3.1" id="sec56subsec3_1"></A><P class="headnote">Lay-off, regular work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="3.1" alinea="null">(3.1)</SPAN> For the purpose of subsection (2), an employee who has a regular work week is laid off for a week if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  in that week, the employee earns less than one-half the amount he or she would earn at his or her regular rate in a regular work week; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the week is not an excluded week.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec3.2" id="sec56subsec3_2"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of excluded week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="3.2" alinea="null">(3.2)</SPAN> For the purpose of clauses (2) (a) and (b), an excluded week shall be counted as part of the periods of 20 and 52 weeks.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec3.3" id="sec56subsec3_3"></A><P class="headnote">Lay-off, no regular work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="3.3" alinea="null">(3.3)</SPAN> For the purposes of clauses (1) (c) and (2) (a), an employee who does not have a regular work week is laid off for a period longer than the period of a temporary lay-off if for more than 13 weeks in any period of 20 consecutive weeks he or she earns less than one-half the average amount he or she earned per week in the period of 12 consecutive weeks that preceded the 20-week period.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec3.4" id="sec56subsec3_4"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of excluded week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="3.4" alinea="null">(3.4)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (3.3), </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an excluded week shall not be counted as part of the 13 or more weeks but shall be counted as part of the 20-week period; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the 12-week period contains an excluded week, the average amount earned shall be calculated based on the earnings in weeks that were not excluded weeks and the number of weeks that were not excluded.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec3.5" id="sec56subsec3_5"></A><P class="headnote">Lay-off, no regular work week </P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="3.5" alinea="null">(3.5)</SPAN> For the purposes of clauses (1) (c) and (2) (b), an employee who does not have a regular work week is laid off for a period longer than the period of a temporary lay-off if for 35 or more weeks in any period of 52 consecutive weeks he or she earns less than one-half the average amount he or she earned per week in the period of 12 consecutive weeks that preceded the 52-week period.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec3.6" id="sec56subsec3_6"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of excluded week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="3.6" alinea="null">(3.6)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (3.5),</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an excluded week shall not be counted as part of the 35 or more weeks but shall be counted as part of the 52-week period; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the 12-week period contains an excluded week, the average amount earned shall be calculated based on the earnings in weeks that were not excluded weeks and the number of weeks that were not excluded.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec4" id="sec56subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Temporary lay-off not termination</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employer who lays an employee off without specifying a recall date shall not be considered to terminate the employment of the employee, unless the period of the lay-off exceeds that of a temporary lay-off.  2000, c. 41, s. 56 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec56subsec5" id="sec56subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Deemed termination date</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="56" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If an employer terminates the employment of an employee under clause (1) (c), the employment shall be deemed to be terminated on the first day of the lay-off.  2000, c. 41, s. 56 (5).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Employer notice period</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="57" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec57" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=57"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="57" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="146" data-noteup-count-display="146"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="57" data-viibes-start="100" data-viibes-end="99"><A name="BK126"></A><B><a name="sec57" id="sec57"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="57" subsection="null" alinea="null">57</SPAN> </B>The notice of termination under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="54" href="#sec54_smooth">section 54</A> shall be given,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  at least one week before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is less than one year;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  at least two weeks before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is one year or more and fewer than three years;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  at least three weeks before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is three years or more and fewer than four years;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  at least four weeks before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is four years or more and fewer than five years;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  at least five weeks before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is five years or more and fewer than six years;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  at least six weeks before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is six years or more and fewer than seven years;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (g)  at least seven weeks before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is seven years or more and fewer than eight years; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (h)  at least eight weeks before the termination, if the employee’s period of employment is eight years or more.  2000, c. 41, s. 57.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Notice, 50 or more employees</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="58" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec58" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=58"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="58" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="24" data-noteup-count-display="24"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="58" data-viibes-start="101" data-viibes-end="100"><A name="BK127"></A><B><a name="sec58subsec1" id="sec58subsec1"></A><a name="sec58" id="sec58"></A>58 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="58" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A>, the employer shall give notice of termination in the prescribed manner and for the prescribed period if the employer terminates the employment of 50 or more employees at the employer’s establishment in the same four-week period.  2000, c. 41, s. 58 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec58subsec2" id="sec58subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="58" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer who is required to give notice under this section,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  shall provide to the Director the prescribed information in a form approved by the Director; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  shall, on the first day of the notice period, post in the employer’s establishment the prescribed information in a form approved by the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 58 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec58subsec3" id="sec58subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Content</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="58" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The information required under subsection (2) may include,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the economic circumstances surrounding the terminations;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  any consultations that have been or are proposed to take place with communities in which the terminations will take place or with the affected employees or their agent in connection with the terminations;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  any proposed adjustment measures and the number of employees expected to benefit from each; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  a statistical profile of the affected employees.  2000, c. 41, s. 58 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec58subsec4" id="sec58subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">When notice effective</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="58" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The notice required under subsection (1) shall be deemed not to have been given until the Director receives the information required under clause (2) (a).  2000, c. 41, s. 58 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec58subsec5" id="sec58subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Posting</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="58" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The employer shall post the information required under clause (2) (b) in at least one conspicuous place in the employer’s establishment where it is likely to come to the attention of the affected employees and the employer shall keep that information posted throughout the notice period required under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 58 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec58subsec6" id="sec58subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Employee notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="58" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> An employee to whom notice has been given under this section shall not terminate his or her employment without first giving the employer written notice,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  at least one week before doing so, if his or her period of employment is less than two years; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  at least two weeks before doing so, if his or her period of employment is two years or more.  2000, c. 41, s. 58 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec58subsec7" id="sec58subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="58" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Subsection (6) does not apply if the employer constructively dismisses the employee or breaches a term of the employment contract, whether or not such a breach would constitute a constructive dismissal.  2000, c. 41, s. 58 (7).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Period of employment: included, excluded time</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="59" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec59" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=59"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="59" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="59" data-viibes-start="102" data-viibes-end="101"><A name="BK128"></A><B><a name="sec59subsec1" id="sec59subsec1"></A><a name="sec59" id="sec59"></A>59 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="59" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Time spent by an employee on leave or other inactive employment is included in determining his or her period of employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 59 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec59subsec2" id="sec59subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="59" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Despite subsection (1), if an employee’s employment was terminated as a result of a lay-off, no part of the lay-off period after the deemed termination date shall be included in determining his or her period of employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 59 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Requirements during notice period</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="60" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec60" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=60"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="60" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="48" data-noteup-count-display="48"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="60" data-viibes-start="103" data-viibes-end="102"><A name="BK129"></A><B><a name="sec60subsec1" id="sec60subsec1"></A><a name="sec60" id="sec60"></A>60 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="60" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> During a notice period under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth">58</A>, the employer,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  shall not reduce the employee’s wage rate or alter any other term or condition of employment;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  shall in each week pay the employee the wages the employee is entitled to receive, which in no case shall be less than his or her regular wages for a regular work week; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  shall continue to make whatever benefit plan contributions would be required to be made in order to maintain the employee’s benefits under the plan until the end of the notice period.  2000, c. 41, s. 60 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec60subsec2" id="sec60subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">No regular work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="60" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For the purposes of clause (1) (b), if the employee does not have a regular work week or if the employee is paid on a basis other than time, the employer shall pay the employee an amount equal to the average amount of regular wages earned by the employee per week for the weeks in which the employee worked in the period of 12 weeks immediately preceding the day on which notice was given.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec13" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="13" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (13)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec60subsec3" id="sec60subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Benefit plan contributions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="60" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an employer fails to contribute to a benefit plan contrary to clause (1) (c), an amount equal to the amount the employer should have contributed shall be deemed to be unpaid wages for the purpose of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">section 103</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 60 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec60subsec4" id="sec60subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="60" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (3) precludes the employee from an entitlement that he or she may have under a benefit plan.  2000, c. 41, s. 60 (4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Pay instead of notice</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="61" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec61" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=61"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="61" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="112" data-noteup-count-display="112"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="61" data-viibes-start="104" data-viibes-end="103"><A name="BK130"></A><B><a name="sec61subsec1" id="sec61subsec1"></A><a name="sec61" id="sec61"></A>61 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="61" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer may terminate the employment of an employee without notice or with less notice than is required under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth"> 58</A> if the employer,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  pays to the employee termination pay in a lump sum equal to the amount the employee would have been entitled to receive under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" href="#sec60_smooth">section 60</A> had notice been given in accordance with that section; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  continues to make whatever benefit plan contributions would be required to be made in order to maintain the benefits to which the employee would have been entitled had he or she continued to be employed during the period of notice that he or she would otherwise have been entitled to receive.  2000, c. 41, s. 61 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec14" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="14" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (14)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec61subsec1.1" id="sec61subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">No regular work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="61" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> For the purposes of clause (1) (a), if the employee does not have a regular work week or is paid on a basis other than time, the amount the employee would have been entitled to receive under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" href="#sec60_smooth">section 60</A> shall be calculated as if the period of 12 weeks referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" ss="2" href="#sec60subsec2_smooth">subsection 60 (2)</A> were the 12-week period immediately preceding the day of termination.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec15" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="15" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (15)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec61subsec2" id="sec61subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Information to Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="61" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer who terminates the employment of employees under this section and would otherwise be required to provide notices of termination under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth">section 58</A> shall comply with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" ss="2" href="#sec58subsec2_smooth">clause 58 (2)</A> (a).  2000, c. 41, s. 61 (2).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Deemed active employment</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="62" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec62" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=62"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="62" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9" data-noteup-count-display="9"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="62" data-viibes-start="105" data-viibes-end="104"><A name="BK131"></A><B><a name="sec62subsec1" id="sec62subsec1"></A><a name="sec62" id="sec62"></A>62 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="62" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employer terminates the employment of employees without giving them part or all of the period of notice required under this Part, the employees shall be deemed to have been actively employed during the period for which there should have been notice for the purposes of any benefit plan under which entitlement to benefits might be lost or affected if the employees cease to be actively employed.  2000, c. 41, s. 62 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec62subsec2" id="sec62subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Benefit plan contributions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="62" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an employer fails to contribute to a benefit plan contrary to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="61" ss="1" href="#sec61subsec1_smooth">clause 61 (1)</A> (b), an amount equal to the amount the employer should have contributed shall be deemed to be unpaid wages for the purpose of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">section 103</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 62 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec62subsec3" id="sec62subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="62" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (2) precludes the employee from an entitlement he or she may have under a benefit plan.  2000, c. 41, s. 62 (3).</P>
 
<A name="Severance_of_Employment__257536"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK132"></A>Severance of Employment</P>
 
<P class="headnote">What constitutes severance</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="63" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec63" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=63"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="63" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="51" data-noteup-count-display="51"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="63" data-viibes-start="106" data-viibes-end="105"><A name="BK133"></A><B><a name="sec63subsec1" id="sec63subsec1"></A><a name="sec63" id="sec63"></A>63 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="63" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer severs the employment of an employee if,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer dismisses the employee or otherwise refuses or is unable to continue employing the employee;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employer constructively dismisses the employee and the employee resigns from his or her employment in response within a reasonable period;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the employer lays the employee off for 35 weeks or more in any period of 52 consecutive weeks; </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  the employer lays the employee off because of a permanent discontinuance of all of the employer’s business at an establishment; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  the employer gives the employee notice of termination in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth">58</A>, the employee gives the employer written notice at least two weeks before resigning and the employee’s notice of resignation is to take effect during the statutory notice period.  2000, c. 41, s. 63 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec24" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="24" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (24)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec63subsec2" id="sec63subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Definition</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="63" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> In subsections (2.1) to (2.4),</P>
 
<P class="definition">“excluded week” means a week during which, for one or more days, the employee is not able to work, is not available for work, is subject to a disciplinary suspension or is not provided with work because of a strike or lock-out occurring at his or her place of employment or elsewhere.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec25" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="25" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (25)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec63subsec2.1" id="sec63subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Lay-off, regular work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="63" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> For the purpose of clause (1) (c), an employee who has a regular work week is laid off for a week if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  in that week, the employee earns less than one-quarter the amount he or she would earn at his or her regular rate in a regular work week; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the week is not an excluded week.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec25" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="25" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (25)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec63subsec2.2" id="sec63subsec2_2"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of excluded week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="63" subsection="2.2" alinea="null">(2.2)</SPAN> For the purposes of clause (1) (c), an excluded week shall be counted as part of the period of 52 weeks.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec25" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="25" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (25)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec63subsec2.3" id="sec63subsec2_3"></A><P class="headnote">Lay-off, no regular work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="63" subsection="2.3" alinea="null">(2.3)</SPAN> For the purpose of clause (1) (c), an employee who does not have a regular work week is laid off for 35 or more weeks in any period of 52 consecutive weeks if for 35 or more weeks in any period of 52 consecutive weeks he or she earns less than one-quarter the average amount he or she earned per week in the period of 12 consecutive weeks that preceded the 52-week period.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec25" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="25" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (25)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec63subsec2.4" id="sec63subsec2_4"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of excluded week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="63" subsection="2.4" alinea="null">(2.4)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (2.3), </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an excluded week shall not be counted as part of the 35 or more weeks, but shall be counted as part of the 52-week period; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the 12-week period contains an excluded week, the average amount earned shall be calculated based on the earnings in weeks that were not excluded weeks and the number of weeks that were not excluded.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec25" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="25" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (25)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec63subsec3" id="sec63subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Resignation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="63" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee’s employment that is severed under clause (1) (e) shall be deemed to have been severed on the day the employer’s notice of termination would have taken effect if the employee had not resigned.  2000, c. 41, s. 63 (3).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Entitlement to severance pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="64" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec64" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=64"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="64" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="101" data-noteup-count-display="101"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="64" data-viibes-start="107" data-viibes-end="106"><A name="BK134"></A><B><a name="sec64subsec1" id="sec64subsec1"></A><a name="sec64" id="sec64"></A>64 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="64" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer who severs an employment relationship with an employee shall pay severance pay to the employee if the employee was employed by the employer for five years or more and,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the severance occurred because of a permanent discontinuance of all or part of the employer’s business at an establishment and the employee is one of 50 or more employees who have their employment relationship severed within a six-month period as a result; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employer has a payroll of $2.5 million or more.  2000, c. 41, s. 64 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec64subsec2" id="sec64subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Payroll</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="64" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (1), an employer shall be considered to have a payroll of $2.5 million or more if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the total wages earned by all of the employer’s employees in the four weeks that ended with the last day of the last pay period completed prior to the severance of an employee’s employment, when multiplied by 13, was $2.5 million or more; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the total wages earned by all of the employer’s employees in the last or second-last fiscal year of the employer prior to the severance of an employee’s employment was $2.5 million or more.  2000, c. 41, s. 64 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec16" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="16" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (16)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec64subsec3" id="sec64subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exceptions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="64" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Prescribed employees are not entitled to severance pay under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 64 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec64subsec4" id="sec64subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Location deemed an establishment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="64" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> A location shall be deemed to be an establishment under subsection (1) if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  there is a permanent discontinuance of all or part of an employer’s business at the location;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the location is part of an establishment consisting of two or more locations; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the employer severs the employment relationship of 50 or more employees within a six-month period as a result.  2000, c. 41, s. 64 (4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Calculating severance pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="65" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec65" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=65"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="65" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="34" data-noteup-count-display="34"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="65" data-viibes-start="108" data-viibes-end="107"><A name="BK135"></A><B><a name="sec65subsec1" id="sec65subsec1"></A><a name="sec65" id="sec65"></A>65 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="65" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Severance pay under this section shall be calculated by multiplying the employee’s regular wages for a regular work week by the sum of,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the number of years of employment the employee has completed; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the number of months of employment not included in clause (a) that the employee has completed, divided by 12.  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec2" id="sec65subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Non-continuous employment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> All time spent by the employee in the employer’s employ, whether or not continuous and whether or not active, shall be included in determining whether he or she is eligible for severance pay under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="64" ss="1" href="#sec64subsec1_smooth">subsection 64 (1)</A> and in calculating his or her severance pay under subsection (1).  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec2.1" id="sec65subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> Despite subsection (2), when an employee in receipt of an actuarially unreduced pension benefit has his or her employment severed by an employer on or after November 6, 2009, time spent in the employer’s employ for which the employee received service credits in the calculation of that benefit shall not be included in determining whether he or she is eligible for severance pay under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="64" ss="1" href="#sec64subsec1_smooth">subsection 64 (1)</A> and in calculating his or her severance pay under subsection (1).  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96804-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-33/latest/so-2009-c-33.html">2009, c. 33</A>, Sched. 20, s. 1 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec3" id="sec65subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Where employee resigns</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an employee’s employment is severed under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="1" href="#sec63subsec1_smooth">clause 63 (1)</A> (e), the period between the day the employee’s notice of resignation took effect and the day the employer’s notice of termination would have taken effect shall not be considered in calculating the amount of severance pay to which the employee is entitled.  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec4" id="sec65subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Termination without notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If an employer terminates the employment of an employee without providing the notice, if any, required under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth">58</A>, the amount of severance pay to which the employee is entitled shall be calculated as if the employee continued to be employed for a period equal to the period of notice that should have been given and was not.  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec5" id="sec65subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Limit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee’s severance pay entitlement under this section shall not exceed an amount equal to the employee’s regular wages for a regular work week for 26 weeks.  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec6" id="sec65subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Where no regular work week</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsections (1) and (5), if the employee does not have a regular work week or if the employee is paid on a basis other than time, the employee’s regular wages for a regular work week shall be deemed to be the average amount of regular wages earned by the employee for the weeks in which the employee worked in the period of 12 weeks preceding the date on which,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employee’s employment was severed; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee’s employment was severed under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="1" href="#sec63subsec1_smooth">clause 63 (1)</A> (c) or (d), the date on which the lay-off began.  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (6); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec26" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="26" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (26)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec7" id="sec65subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">In addition to other amounts</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (8), severance pay under this section is in addition to any other amount to which an employee is entitled under this Act or his or her employment contract.  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec65subsec8" id="sec65subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Set-off, deduction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="65" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Only the following set-offs and deductions may be made in calculating severance pay under this section:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Supplementary unemployment benefits the employee receives after his or her employment is severed and before the severance pay becomes payable to the employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  An amount paid to an employee for loss of employment under a provision of the employment contract if it is based upon length of employment, length of service or seniority.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Severance pay that was previously paid to the employee under this Act, a predecessor of this Act or a contractual provision described in paragraph 2.  2000, c. 41, s. 65 (8).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Instalments</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="66" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec66" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=66"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="66" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="66" data-viibes-start="109" data-viibes-end="108"><A name="BK136"></A><B><a name="sec66subsec1" id="sec66subsec1"></A><a name="sec66" id="sec66"></A>66 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="66" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employer may pay severance pay to an employee who is entitled to it in instalments with the agreement of the employee or the approval of the Director.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec17" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="17" data-link-type="weak" rank="1">s. 1 (17)</SPAN>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec66subsec2" id="sec66subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="66" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The period over which instalments can be paid must not exceed three years.  2000, c. 41, s. 66 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec66subsec3" id="sec66subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Default</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="66" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the employer fails to make an instalment payment, all severance pay not previously paid shall become payable immediately.  2000, c. 41, s. 66 (3).</P>
 

 
<A name="Election_re_Recall_rights__268529"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK137"></A>Election re Recall rights</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Where election may be made</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="67" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec67" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=67"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="67" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="16" data-noteup-count-display="16"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="67" data-viibes-start="110" data-viibes-end="109"><A name="BK138"></A><B><a name="sec67subsec1" id="sec67subsec1"></A><a name="sec67" id="sec67"></A>67 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="67" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies if an employee who has a right to be recalled for employment under his or her employment contract is entitled to,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  termination pay under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="61" href="#sec61_smooth">section 61</A> because of a lay-off of 35 weeks or more; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  severance pay.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec2" id="sec67subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Clause (1) (b) does not apply if the employer and employee have agreed that the severance pay shall be paid in instalments under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="66" href="#sec66_smooth">section 66</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec3" id="sec67subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Nature of election</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The employee may elect to be paid the termination pay or severance pay forthwith or to retain the right to be recalled.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec4" id="sec67subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Consistency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employee who is entitled to both termination pay and severance pay shall make the same election in respect of each.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec5" id="sec67subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Deemed abandonment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employee who elects to be paid shall be deemed to have abandoned the right to be recalled.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec6" id="sec67subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Employee not represented by trade union</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If an employee who is not represented by a trade union elects to retain the right to be recalled or fails to make an election, the employer shall pay the termination pay and severance pay to which the employee is entitled to the Director in trust.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec7" id="sec67subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Employee represented by trade union</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> If an employee who is represented by a trade union elects to retain the right to be recalled or fails to make an election,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer and the trade union shall attempt to negotiate an arrangement for holding the money in trust, and, if the negotiations are successful, the money shall be held in trust in accordance with the arrangement agreed upon; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the trade union advises the Director and the employer in writing that efforts to negotiate such an arrangement have been unsuccessful, the employer shall pay the termination pay and severance pay to which the employee is entitled to the Director in trust.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec8" id="sec67subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Where employee accepts recall</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If the employee accepts employment made available under the right of recall, the amount held in trust shall be paid out of trust to the employer and the employee shall be deemed to have abandoned the right to termination pay and severance pay paid into trust.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec67subsec9" id="sec67subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Recall rights expired or renounced</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> If the employee renounces the right to be recalled or the right expires, the amount held in trust shall be paid to the employee and, if the right to be recalled had not expired, the employee shall be deemed to have abandoned the right.  2000, c. 41, s. 67 (9).</P>
 
<A name="PART_XV_1_NON_COMPETE_AGREEMENTS_271800"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK139"></A>PART XV.1 <BR>  NON-COMPETE AGREEMENTS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="67.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec67.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=67.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="67.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="67.1" data-viibes-start="111" data-viibes-end="110"><A name="BK140"></A><B><a name="sec67.1" id="sec67_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="67.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">67.1</SPAN> </B>In this Part, and for the purposes of Part XVIII (Reprisal), <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" href="#sec74.12_smooth">section 74.12</A>, Part XXI (Who Enforces this Act and What They Can Do), Part XXII (Complaints and Enforcement), Part XXIII (Reviews by the Board), Part XXIV (Collection), Part XXV (Offences and Prosecutions), Part XXVI (Miscellaneous Evidentiary Provisions) and Part XXVII (Regulations) insofar as matters concerning this Part are concerned,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“employee” means an employee as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">subsection 1 (1)</A> and includes an applicant for employment; (“employé”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“employer” means an employer as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">subsection 1 (1)</A> and includes a prospective employer; (“employeur”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“non-compete agreement” means an agreement, or any part of an agreement, between an employer and an employee that prohibits the employee from engaging in any business, work, occupation, profession, project or other activity that is in competition with the employer’s business after the employment relationship between the employee and the employer ends. (“clause de non-concurrence”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Prohibition</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="67.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec67.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=67.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="67.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="67.2" data-viibes-start="112" data-viibes-end="111"><A name="BK141"></A><B><a name="sec67.2subsec1" id="sec67_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec67.2" id="sec67_2"></A>67.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="67.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No employer shall enter into an employment contract or other agreement with an employee that is, or that includes, a non-compete agreement. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec67.2subsec2" id="sec67_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For greater certainty, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" ss="1" href="#sec5subsec1_smooth">subsection 5 (1)</A> applies and if an employer contravenes subsection (1), the non-compete agreement is void. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec67.2subsec3" id="sec67_2subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception — sale, etc., of business</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67.2" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If there is a sale of a business or a part of a business and, as a part of the sale, the purchaser and seller enter into an agreement that prohibits the seller from engaging in any business, work, occupation, profession, project or other activity that is in competition with the purchaser’s business after the sale and, immediately following the sale, the seller becomes an employee of the purchaser, subsection (1) does not apply with respect to that agreement. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec67.2subsec4" id="sec67_2subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception — executives</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67.2" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply with respect to an employee who is an executive. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec67.2subsec5" id="sec67_2subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="67.2" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> In this section,</P>
 
<P class="definition">“executive” means any person who holds the office of chief executive officer, president, chief administrative officer, chief operating officer, chief financial officer, chief information officer, chief legal officer, chief human resources officer or chief corporate development officer, or holds any other chief executive position; (“cadre supérieur”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“sale” includes a lease. (“vente”) <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_Xvi_LIE_DETECTORS_274932"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK142"></A>PART Xvi <BR>  LIE DETECTORS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="68" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec68" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=68"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="68" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="14" data-noteup-count-display="14"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="68" data-viibes-start="113" data-viibes-end="112"><A name="BK143"></A><B><a name="sec68" id="sec68"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="68" subsection="null" alinea="null">68</SPAN> </B>In this Part, and for purposes of Part XVIII (Reprisal), <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" href="#sec74.12_smooth">section 74.12</A>, Part XXI (Who Enforces this Act and What They Can Do), Part XXII (Complaints and Enforcement), Part XXIII (Reviews by the Board), Part XXIV (Collection), Part XXV (Offences and Prosecutions), Part XXVI (Miscellaneous Evidentiary Provisions), Part XXVII (Regulations) and Part XXVIII (Transition, Amendment, Repeals, Commencement and Short Title), insofar as matters concerning this Part are concerned,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“employee” means an employee as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">subsection 1 (1)</A> and includes an applicant for employment, a police officer and a person who is an applicant to be a police officer; (“employé”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“employer” means an employer as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">subsection 1 (1)</A> and includes a prospective employer and a police governing body; (“employeur”)</P>
 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, the French version of the definition of “employer” in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="68" href="#sec68_smooth">section 68</A> of the Act is amended. (See: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97025-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-1/latest/so-2019-c-1.html">2019, c. 1</A>, Sched. 4, s. 17 (2))</P>
 
<P class="definition">“lie detector test” means an analysis, examination, interrogation or test that is taken or performed,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  by means of or in conjunction with a device, instrument or machine, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  for the purpose of assessing or purporting to assess the credibility of a person. (“test du détecteur de mensonges”)  2000, c. 41, s. 68; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 2</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Right to refuse test</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="69" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec69" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=69"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="69" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="69" data-viibes-start="114" data-viibes-end="113"><A name="BK144"></A><B><a name="sec69" id="sec69"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="69" subsection="null" alinea="null">69</SPAN> </B>Subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="71" href="#sec71_smooth">section 71</A>, an employee has a right not to,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  take a lie detector test;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  be asked to take a lie detector test; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  be required to take a lie detector test.  2000, c. 41, s. 69.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Prohibition: testing</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="70" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec70" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=70"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="70" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="70" data-viibes-start="115" data-viibes-end="114"><A name="BK145"></A><B><a name="sec70subsec1" id="sec70subsec1"></A><a name="sec70" id="sec70"></A>70 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="70" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="71" href="#sec71_smooth">section 71</A>, no person shall, directly or indirectly, require, request, enable or influence an employee to take a lie detector test.  2000, c. 41, s. 70 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec70subsec2" id="sec70subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Prohibition: disclosure</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="70" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> No person shall disclose to an employer that an employee has taken a lie detector test or disclose to an employer the results of a lie detector test taken by an employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 70 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Consent to test by police</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="71" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec71" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=71"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="71" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="71" data-viibes-start="116" data-viibes-end="115"><A name="BK146"></A><B><a name="sec71" id="sec71"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="71" subsection="null" alinea="null">71</SPAN> </B>This Part shall not be interpreted to prevent a person from being asked by a police officer to take, consenting to take and taking a lie detector test administered on behalf of a police force in Ontario or by a member of a police force in Ontario in the course of the investigation of an offence.  2000, c. 41, s. 71.</P></div>
 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="71" href="#sec71_smooth">section 71</A> of the Act is amended by striking out “police force” wherever it appears and substituting in each case “police service”. (See: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97025-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-1/latest/so-2019-c-1.html">2019, c. 1</A>, Sched. 4, s. 17 (3))</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_XVii_RETAIL_BUSINESS_ESTABLISHMENTS_278239"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK147"></A>PART XVii <BR>  RETAIL BUSINESS ESTABLISHMENTS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Application of Part</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="72" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec72" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=72"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="72" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="72" data-viibes-start="117" data-viibes-end="116"><A name="BK148"></A><B><a name="sec72subsec1" id="sec72subsec1"></A><a name="sec72" id="sec72"></A>72 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="72" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This Part applies with respect to,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  retail business establishments as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="446-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r30/latest/rso-1990-c-r30.html#sec1subsec1_smooth">subsection 1 (1)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="446-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r30/latest/rso-1990-c-r30.html">Retail Business Holidays Act</A></I>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  employees employed to work in those establishments; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  employers of those employees.  2000, c. 41, s. 72 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec72subsec2" id="sec72subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="72" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> This Part does not apply with respect to retail business establishments in which the primary retail business is one that,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  sells prepared meals;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  rents living accommodations;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  is open to the public for educational, recreational or amusement purposes; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  sells goods or services incidental to a business described in clause (a), (b) or (c) and is located in the same premises as that business.  2000, c. 41, s. 72 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Right to refuse work</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="73" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec73" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=73"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="73" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="73" data-viibes-start="118" data-viibes-end="117"><A name="BK149"></A><B><a name="sec73subsec1" id="sec73subsec1"></A><a name="sec73" id="sec73"></A>73 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="73" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee may refuse to work on a public holiday or a day declared by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor to be a holiday for the purposes of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="446-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r30/latest/rso-1990-c-r30.html">Retail Business Holidays Act</A></I>.  2000, c. 41, s. 73 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec73subsec2" id="sec73subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="73" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee may refuse to work on a Sunday.  2000, c. 41, s. 73 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec73subsec3" id="sec73subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Notice of refusal</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="73" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee who agrees to work on a day referred to in subsection (1) or (2) may then decline to work on that day, but only if he or she gives the employer notice that he or she declines at least 48 hours before he or she was to commence work on that day.  2000, c. 41, s. 73 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="40" href="#sec40_smooth">s. 40</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_XVIII_REPRISAL_280251"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK150"></A>PART XVIII <BR>  REPRISAL</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Reprisal prohibited</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="245" data-noteup-count-display="245"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74" data-viibes-start="119" data-viibes-end="118"><A name="BK151"></A><B><a name="sec74subsec1" id="sec74subsec1"></A><a name="sec74" id="sec74"></A>74 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No employer or person acting on behalf of an employer shall intimidate, dismiss or otherwise penalize an employee or threaten to do so,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  because the employee,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  asks the employer to comply with this Act and the regulations,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  makes inquiries about his or her rights under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iii)  files a complaint with the Ministry under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iv)  exercises or attempts to exercise a right under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v)  gives information to an employment standards officer,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v.1)  makes inquiries about the rate paid to another employee for the purpose of determining or assisting another person in determining whether an employer is complying with Part XII (Equal Pay for Equal Work),</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v.2)  discloses the employee’s rate of pay to another employee for the purpose of determining or assisting another person in determining whether an employer is complying with Part XII (Equal Pay for Equal Work),</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (vi)  testifies or is required to testify or otherwise participates or is going to participate in a proceeding under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (vii)  participates in proceedings respecting a by-law or proposed by-law under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="446-current-1" s="4" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r30/latest/rso-1990-c-r30.html#sec4_smooth">section 4</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="446-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r30/latest/rso-1990-c-r30.html">Retail Business Holidays Act</A></I>,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (viii)  is or will become eligible to take a leave, intends to take a leave or takes a leave under Part XIV,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ix)  makes inquiries about whether a person holds a licence to operate as a temporary help agency or a licence to act as a recruiter as required under Part XVIII.1; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  because the employer is or may be required, because of a court order or garnishment, to pay to a third party an amount owing by the employer to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 74 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="41" href="#sec41_smooth">s. 41</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74subsec2" id="sec74subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Onus of proof</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="122" ss="4" href="#sec122subsec4_smooth">subsection 122 (4)</A>, in any proceeding under this Act, the burden of proof that an employer did not contravene a provision set out in this section lies upon the employer.  2000, c. 41, s. 74 (2).</P>
 

 
<A name="Part_XVIII_1_Temporary_Help_Agencies_AND_RECRUITERS_282749"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK152"></A>Part XVIII.1 <BR>  Temporary Help Agencies AND RECRUITERS</P>
 
<A name="Licensing__282852"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK153"></A>Licensing</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Types of licences</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.1" data-viibes-start="120" data-viibes-end="119"><A name="BK154"></A><B><a name="sec74.1" id="sec74_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="74.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">74.1</SPAN> </B>The following are the types of licences that may be issued under this Part:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A licence to operate as a temporary help agency.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A licence to act as a recruiter. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="8" href="#sec8_smooth">s. 8</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On January 1, 2024, the day named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, the Act is amended by adding the following sections: (See: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>)</P>
 
<P class="Yheadnote">Licence to operate as temporary help agency</P>
 
<P class="Ysection"><A name="BK155"></A><B>74.1.1 </B>(1) No person shall operate as a temporary help agency unless the person holds a licence for that purpose. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>.</P>
 
<P class="Yheadnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="Ysubsection">(2) No client shall knowingly engage or use the services of a temporary help agency unless the person who operates the temporary help agency holds a licence for that purpose as required under subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="Yheadnote">Licence to act as recruiter</P>
 
<P class="Ysection"><A name="BK156"></A><B>74.1.2 </B>(1) No person shall act as a recruiter unless the person holds a licence for that purpose. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>.</P>
 
<P class="Yheadnote">Same</P>
