<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the assignment is terminated before the end of its estimated term. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="44" href="#sec44_smooth">s. 44</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.10.1subsec2" id="sec74_10_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Amount of pay in lieu</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.10.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (1), the amount of the pay in lieu of notice shall be equal to the wages the assignment employee would have been entitled to receive had one week’s notice been given in accordance with that subsection. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="44" href="#sec44_smooth">s. 44</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.10.1subsec3" id="sec74_10_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.10.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply if the temporary help agency offers the assignment employee a work assignment with a client during the notice period that is reasonable in the circumstances and that has an estimated term of one week or more. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="44" href="#sec44_smooth">s. 44</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.10.1subsec4" id="sec74_10_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.10.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the assignment employee has been guilty of wilful misconduct, disobedience or wilful neglect of duty that is not trivial and has not been condoned by the temporary help agency or the client;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the assignment has become impossible to perform or has been frustrated by a fortuitous or unforeseeable event or circumstance; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the assignment is terminated during or as a result of a strike or lock-out at the location of the assignment. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="44" href="#sec44_smooth">s. 44</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.10.1subsec5" id="sec74_10_1subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.10.1" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> For greater certainty, for the purposes of clause (4) (b), if an assignment is terminated because the Director has refused to issue or renew, or has revoked or suspended, a licence to operate a temporary help agency under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.1.5" href="#sec74.1.5_smooth">section 74.1.5</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.1.6" href="#sec74.1.6_smooth">74.1.6</A>, the assignment has not become impossible to perform or been frustrated by a fortuitous or unforeseeable event or circumstance. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="16" href="#sec16_smooth">s. 16</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Termination and severance</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.11" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.11" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.11"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.11" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.11" data-viibes-start="148" data-viibes-end="147"><A name="BK185"></A><B><a name="sec74.11" id="sec74_11"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="74.11" subsection="null" alinea="null">74.11</SPAN> </B>For the purposes of the application of Part XV to temporary help agencies and their assignment employees, the following modifications apply:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A temporary help agency lays off an assignment employee for a week if the employee is not assigned by the agency to perform work for a client of the agency during the week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  For the purposes of paragraphs 3 and 10, “excluded week” means a week during which, for one or more days, the assignment employee is not able to work, is not available for work, refuses an offer by the agency that would not constitute constructive dismissal of the employee by the agency, is subject to a disciplinary suspension or is not assigned to perform work for a client of the agency because of a strike or lock-out occurring at the agency.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  An excluded week shall not be counted as part of the 13 or 35 weeks referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" ss="2" href="#sec56subsec2_smooth">subsection 56 (2)</A> but shall be counted as part of the 20 or 52 consecutive week periods referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" ss="2" href="#sec56subsec2_smooth">subsection 56 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" ss="3" href="#sec56subsec3_smooth">Subsections 56 (3)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" ss="3.6" href="#sec56subsec3.6_smooth">(3.6)</A> do not apply to temporary help agencies and their assignment employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.1  On and after November 6, 2009, subsection 58 (1) does not apply to a temporary help agency in respect of its assignment employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.2  On and after November 6, 2009, a temporary help agency shall give notice of termination to its assignment employees in accordance with paragraph 4.3 rather than in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> if,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  50 or more assignment employees of the agency who were assigned to perform work for the same client of the agency at the same establishment of that client were terminated in the same four-week period, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  the terminations resulted from the term of assignments ending or from the assignments being ended by the agency or by the client.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.3  In the circumstances described in paragraph 4.2, notice of termination shall be given for the prescribed period or, if no applicable periods are prescribed,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  at least eight weeks before termination, if the number of assignment employees whose employment is terminated is 50 or more but fewer than 200,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  at least 12 weeks before termination, if the number of assignment employees whose employment is terminated is 200 or more but fewer than 500, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iii.  at least 16 weeks before termination, if the number of assignment employees whose employment is terminated is 500 or more.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  A temporary help agency shall, in addition to meeting the posting requirements set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" ss="2" href="#sec58subsec2_smooth">clause 58 (2)</A> (b) and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" ss="5" href="#sec58subsec5_smooth">subsection 58 (5)</A>, provide the information required to be provided to the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" ss="2" href="#sec58subsec2_smooth">clause 58 (2)</A> (a) to each employee to whom it is required to give notice in accordance with paragraph 4.3 on the first day of the notice period or as soon after that as is reasonably possible.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" ss="1" href="#sec60subsec1_smooth">Clauses 60 (1)</A> (a) and (b) and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" ss="2" href="#sec60subsec2_smooth">subsection 60 (2)</A> do not apply to temporary help agencies and their assignment employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  A temporary help agency that gives notice of termination to an assignment employee in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> or paragraph 4.3 of this section shall, during each week of the notice period, pay the assignment employee the wages he or she is entitled to receive, which in no case shall be less than,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  in the case of any termination other than under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" ss="1" href="#sec56subsec1_smooth">clause 56 (1)</A> (c), the total amount of the wages earned by the assignment employee for work performed for clients of the agency during the 12-week period ending on the last day on which the employee performed work for a client of the agency, divided by 12, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  in the case of a termination under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" ss="1" href="#sec56subsec1_smooth">clause 56 (1)</A> (c), the total amount of wages earned by the assignment employee for work performed for clients of the agency during the 12-week period immediately preceding the deemed termination date, divided by 12.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  The lump sum that an assignment employee is entitled to be paid under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="61" ss="1" href="#sec61subsec1_smooth">clause 61 (1)</A> (a) is a lump sum equal to the amount the employee would have been entitled to receive under paragraph 7 had notice been given in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">section 57</A> or paragraph 4.3 of this section.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="61" ss="1.1" href="#sec61subsec1.1_smooth">Subsection 61 (1.1)</A> does not apply to temporary help agencies and their assignment employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.1  For purposes of the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="1" href="#sec63subsec1_smooth">clause 63 (1)</A> (e) to an assignment employee, the reference to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth">section 58</A> in that clause shall be read as a reference to paragraph 4.3 of this section.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  10.  An excluded week shall not be counted as part of the 35 weeks referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="1" href="#sec63subsec1_smooth">clause 63 (1)</A> (c) but shall be counted as part of the 52 consecutive week period referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="1" href="#sec63subsec1_smooth">clause 63 (1)</A> (c).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  11.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="2" href="#sec63subsec2_smooth">Subsections 63 (2)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="2.4" href="#sec63subsec2.4_smooth">(2.4)</A> do not apply to temporary help agencies and their assignment employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  12.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" ss="1" href="#sec65subsec1_smooth">Subsections 65 (1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" ss="5" href="#sec65subsec5_smooth">(5)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" ss="6" href="#sec65subsec6_smooth">(6)</A> do not apply to temporary help agencies and their assignment employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 12.1  For purposes of the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" ss="4" href="#sec65subsec4_smooth">subsection 65 (4)</A> to an assignment employee, the reference to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" href="#sec58_smooth">section 58</A> in that subsection shall be read as a reference to paragraph 4.3 of this section.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  13.  If a temporary help agency severs the employment of an assignment employee under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="1" href="#sec63subsec1_smooth">clause 63 (1)</A> (a), (b), (d) or (e), severance pay shall be calculated by,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  dividing the total amount of wages earned by the assignment employee for work performed for clients of the agency during the 12-week period ending on the last day on which the employee performed work for a client of the agency by 12, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  multiplying the result obtained under subparagraph i by the lesser of 26 and the sum of,</P>
 
<P class="subsubpara">  A.  the number of years of employment the employee has completed, and</P>
 
<P class="subsubpara">  B.  the number of months of employment not included in sub-subparagraph A that the employee has completed, divided by 12.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  14.  If a temporary help agency severs the employment of an assignment employee under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" ss="1" href="#sec63subsec1_smooth">clause 63 (1)</A> (c), severance pay shall be calculated by,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  dividing the total amount of wages earned by the assignment employee for work performed for clients of the agency during the 12-week period immediately preceding the first day of the lay-off by 12, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  multiplying the result obtained under subparagraph i by the lesser of 26 and the sum of,</P>
 
<P class="subsubpara">  A.  the number of years of employment the employee has completed, and</P>
 
<P class="subsubpara">  B.  the number of months of employment not included in sub-subparagraph A that the employee has completed, divided by 12.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96804-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-33/latest/so-2009-c-33.html">2009, c. 33</A>, Sched. 20, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A> (2-6).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.11.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.11.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.11.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.11.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.11.1" data-viibes-start="149" data-viibes-end="148"><A name="BK186"></A><B><a name="sec74.11.1" id="sec74_11_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="74.11.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">74.11.1</SPAN> </B>A temporary help agency that fails to meet the notice requirements of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.11" ss="4.3" href="#sec74.11subsec4.3_smooth">paragraph 4.3</A> of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.11" href="#sec74.11_smooth">section 74.11</A> during the period beginning on November 6, 2009 and ending on the day before the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96804-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-33/latest/so-2009-c-33.html">Good Government Act, 2009</A></I> receives Royal Assent has the obligations that the agency would have had if the failure had occurred on or after the day the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96804-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-33/latest/so-2009-c-33.html">Good Government Act, 2009</A></I>
receives Royal Assent.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96804-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-33/latest/so-2009-c-33.html">2009, c. 33</A>, Sched. 20, s. 1 (7).</P></div>
 

 
<A name="Reprisal_by_Client__329050"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK187"></A>Reprisal by Client</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Reprisal by client prohibited</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.12" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.12" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.12"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.12" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.12" data-viibes-start="150" data-viibes-end="149"><A name="BK188"></A><B><a name="sec74.12subsec1" id="sec74_12subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.12" id="sec74_12"></A>74.12 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.12" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No client of a temporary help agency or person acting on behalf of a client of a temporary help agency shall intimidate an assignment employee, refuse to have an assignment employee perform work for the client, terminate the assignment of an assignment employee, or otherwise penalize an assignment employee or threaten to do so,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  because the assignment employee,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  asks the client or the temporary help agency to comply with their respective obligations under this Act and the regulations,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  makes inquiries about his or her rights under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iii)  files a complaint with the Ministry under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (iv)  exercises or attempts to exercise a right under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v)  gives information to an employment standards officer,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v.1)  makes inquiries about the rate paid to an employee of the client for the purpose of determining or assisting another person in determining whether a temporary help agency complied with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="42.2" href="#sec42.2_smooth">section 42.2</A>, as it read immediately before the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="10" href="#sec10_smooth">section 10</A> of Schedule 1 to the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">Making Ontario Open for Business Act, 2018</A></I> came into force,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v.2)  discloses the assignment employee’s rate of pay to an employee of the client for the purpose of determining or assisting another person in determining whether a temporary help agency complied with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="42.2" href="#sec42.2_smooth">section 42.2</A>, as it read immediately before the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="10" href="#sec10_smooth">section 10</A> of Schedule 1 to the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">Making Ontario Open for Business Act, 2018</A></I> came into force,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (v.3)  discloses the rate paid to an employee of the client to the assignment employee’s temporary help agency for the purposes of determining or assisting another person in determining whether a temporary help agency complied with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="42.2" href="#sec42.2_smooth">section 42.2</A>, as it read immediately before the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="10" href="#sec10_smooth">section 10</A> of Schedule 1 to the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">Making Ontario Open for Business Act, 2018</A></I>
came into force,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (vi)  testifies or is required to testify or otherwise participates or is going to participate in a proceeding under this Act,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (vii)  participates in proceedings respecting a by-law or proposed by-law under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="446-current-1" s="4" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r30/latest/rso-1990-c-r30.html#sec4_smooth">section 4</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="446-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r30/latest/rso-1990-c-r30.html">Retail Business Holidays Act</A></I>,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (viii)  is or will become eligible to take a leave, intends to take a leave or takes a leave under Part XIV,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ix)  makes inquiries about whether a person holds a licence to operate as a temporary help agency or a licence to act as a recruiter as required under Part XVIII.1; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  because the client or temporary help agency is or may be required, because of a court order or garnishment, to pay to a third party an amount owing to the assignment employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="45" href="#sec45_smooth">s. 45</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="22" href="#sec22_smooth">s. 22</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" href="#sec17_smooth">s. 17</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.12subsec2" id="sec74_12subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Onus of proof</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.12" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="122" ss="4" href="#sec122subsec4_smooth">subsection 122 (4)</A>, in any proceeding under this Act, the burden of proof that a client did not contravene a provision set out in this section lies upon the client.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Reprisal_by_Recruiter__332538"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK189"></A>Reprisal by Recruiter</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Reprisal by recruiter prohibited</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.12.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.12.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.12.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.12.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.12.1" data-viibes-start="151" data-viibes-end="150"><A name="BK190"></A><B><a name="sec74.12.1subsec1" id="sec74_12_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.12.1" id="sec74_12_1"></A>74.12.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.12.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No recruiter or person acting on behalf of a recruiter shall intimidate or penalize, or attempt or threaten to intimidate or penalize, a prospective employee who engages or uses the services of the recruiter because the prospective employee,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  asks the recruiter to comply with this Act and the regulations;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  gives information to an employment standards officer;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  testifies or is required to testify or otherwise participates or is going to participate in a proceeding under this Act; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  makes inquiries about whether a person holds a licence to operate as a temporary help agency or a licence to act as a recruiter as required under Part XVIII.1. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="18" href="#sec18_smooth">s. 18</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.12.1subsec2" id="sec74_12_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Onus of proof</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.12.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="122" ss="4" href="#sec122subsec4_smooth">subsection 122 (4)</A>, in any proceeding under this Act, the burden of proof that a recruiter did not contravene a provision set out in this section lies upon the recruiter. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="18" href="#sec18_smooth">s. 18</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Enforcement__333826"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK191"></A>Enforcement</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Meeting under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" href="#sec102_smooth">s. 102</A></P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.13" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.13" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.13"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.13" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.13" data-viibes-start="152" data-viibes-end="151"><A name="BK192"></A><B><a name="sec74.13subsec1" id="sec74_13subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.13" id="sec74_13"></A>74.13 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.13" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> For the purposes of the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" href="#sec102_smooth">section 102</A> in respect of this Part, the following modifications apply:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  In addition to the circumstances set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" ss="1" href="#sec102subsec1_smooth">subsection 102 (1)</A>, the following are circumstances in which an employment standards officer may require persons to attend a meeting under that subsection:</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  The officer is investigating a complaint against a client.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  The officer, while inspecting a place under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" href="#sec91_smooth">section 91</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="92" href="#sec92_smooth">92</A>, comes to have reasonable grounds to believe that a client has contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an assignment employee.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iii.  The officer acquires information that suggests to him or her the possibility that a client may have contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iv.  The officer wishes to determine whether a client, in whose residence an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee resides, is complying with this Act.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  In addition to the persons referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" ss="2" href="#sec102subsec2_smooth">subsection 102 (2)</A>, the following persons may be required to attend the meeting:</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  The client.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  If the client is a corporation, a director or employee of the corporation.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iii.  An assignment employee or prospective assignment employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If a person who was served with a notice under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" href="#sec102_smooth">section 102</A> and who failed to comply with the notice is a client, a reference to an employer in paragraphs 1 and 2 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" ss="10" href="#sec102subsec10_smooth">subsection 102 (10)</A> is a reference to the client.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  If a person who was served with a notice under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" href="#sec102_smooth">section 102</A> and who failed to comply with the notice is an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee, a reference to an employee in paragraphs 1 and 2 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102" ss="10" href="#sec102subsec10_smooth">subsection 102 (10)</A> is a reference to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee, as the case requires.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A> (4, 5).</P>
 
<a name="sec74.13subsec2" id="sec74_13subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Interpretation, corporation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.13" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For the purposes of paragraph 3 of subsection (1), if a client is a corporation, a reference to the client includes a director or employee who was served with a notice requiring him or her to attend the meeting or to bring or make available any records or other documents.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (6).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Time for response</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.13.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.13.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.13.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.13.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.13.1" data-viibes-start="153" data-viibes-end="152"><A name="BK193"></A><B><a name="sec74.13.1subsec1" id="sec74_13_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.13.1" id="sec74_13_1"></A>74.13.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.13.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> For the purposes of the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102.1" href="#sec102.1_smooth">section 102.1</A> in respect of this Part, the following modifications apply:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  In addition to the circumstances set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102.1" ss="1" href="#sec102.1subsec1_smooth">subsection 102.1 (1)</A>, the following are circumstances in which an employment standards officer may, after giving written notice, require persons to provide evidence or submissions to the officer within the period of time that he or she specifies in the notice:</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  The officer is investigating a complaint against a client.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  The officer, while inspecting a place under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" href="#sec91_smooth">section 91</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="92" href="#sec92_smooth">92</A>, comes to have reasonable grounds to believe that a client has contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iii.  The officer acquires information that suggests to him or her the possibility that a client may have contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee.</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  iv.  The officer wishes to determine whether a client in whose residence an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee resides is complying with this Act.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If a person who was served with a notice under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102.1" href="#sec102.1_smooth">section 102.1</A> and who failed to comply with the notice is a client, a reference to an employer in paragraphs 1 and 2 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102.1" ss="1" href="#sec102.1subsec1_smooth">subsection 102.1 (1)</A> is a reference to a client.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If a person who was served with a notice under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102.1" href="#sec102.1_smooth">section 102.1</A> and who failed to comply with the notice is an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee, a reference to an employee in paragraphs 1 and 2 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="102.1" ss="3" href="#sec102.1subsec3_smooth">subsection 102.1 (3)</A> is a reference to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee as the case requires.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec74.13.1subsec2" id="sec74_13_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Interpretation, corporations </P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.13.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (1), if a client is a corporation, a reference to the client or person includes a director or employee who was served with a notice requiring him or her to attend the meeting or to bring or make available any records or other documents.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (7).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Order to recover fees</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.14" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.14" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.14"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.14" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.14" data-viibes-start="154" data-viibes-end="153"><A name="BK194"></A><B><a name="sec74.14subsec1" id="sec74_14subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.14" id="sec74_14"></A>74.14 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.14" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds that a temporary help agency charged a fee to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee in contravention of paragraph 1, 2, 3, 5 or 9 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.8" ss="1" href="#sec74.8subsec1_smooth">subsection 74.8 (1)</A>, the officer may,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  arrange with the agency that it repay the amount of the fee directly to the assignment employee or prospective assignment employee;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">a.1</A>)  order the agency to repay the amount of the fee to the assignment employee or prospective assignment employee; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  order the agency to pay the amount of the fee to the Director in trust.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="47" href="#sec47_smooth">s. 47</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.14subsec2" id="sec74_14subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Administrative costs</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.14" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An order issued under clause (1) (b) shall also require the temporary help agency to pay to the Director in trust an amount for administrative costs equal to the greater of $100 and 10 per cent of the amount owing.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.14subsec3" id="sec74_14subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Contents of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.14" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The order shall state the paragraph of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.8" ss="1" href="#sec74.8subsec1_smooth">subsection 74.8 (1)</A> that was contravened and the amount to be paid.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.14subsec4" id="sec74_14subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">s. 103 (3)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="6" href="#sec103subsec6_smooth">(6)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.14" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">Subsections 103 (3)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="6" href="#sec103subsec6_smooth">(6)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A> apply with respect to an order issued under this section with necessary modifications and for the purpose, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, a reference to an employee is a reference to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.14subsec5" id="sec74_14subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="105" href="#sec105_smooth">s. 105</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.14" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="105" href="#sec105_smooth">Section 105</A> applies with respect to repayment of fees by a temporary help agency to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee with necessary modifications, including but not limited to the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The reference to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="1" href="#sec103subsec1_smooth">clause 103 (1)</A> (a) in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="105" ss="1" href="#sec105subsec1_smooth">subsection 105 (1)</A> is a reference to clause (1) (a) of this section.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A reference to an employee is a reference to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee to whom a fee is to be paid.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Recovery of prohibited fees by client</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.15" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.15" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.15"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.15" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.15" data-viibes-start="155" data-viibes-end="154"><A name="BK195"></A><B><a name="sec74.15" id="sec74_15"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="74.15" subsection="null" alinea="null">74.15</SPAN> </B>If a temporary help agency charges a fee to a client in contravention of paragraph 8 or 9 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.8" ss="1" href="#sec74.8subsec1_smooth">subsection 74.8 (1)</A>, the client may recover the amount of the fee in a court of competent jurisdiction.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Order for compensation, temporary help agency</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.16" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.16" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.16"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.16" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.16" data-viibes-start="156" data-viibes-end="155"><A name="BK196"></A><B><a name="sec74.16subsec1" id="sec74_16subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.16" id="sec74_16"></A>74.16 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.16" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds that a temporary help agency has contravened paragraph 4, 6, 7 or 10 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.8" ss="1" href="#sec74.8subsec1_smooth">subsection 74.8 (1)</A>, the officer may order that the assignment employee or prospective assignment employee be compensated for any loss he or she incurred as a result of the contravention.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec74.16subsec2" id="sec74_16subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Terms of orders</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.16" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an order issued under this section requires a temporary help agency to compensate an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee, it shall also require the agency to,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  pay to the Director in trust,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  the amount of the compensation, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  an amount for administration costs equal to the greater of $100 and 10 per cent of the amount of compensation; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  pay the amount of the compensation to the assignment employee or prospective assignment employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="48" href="#sec48_smooth">s. 48</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.16subsec3" id="sec74_16subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Contents of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.16" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The order shall state the paragraph of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.8" ss="1" href="#sec74.8subsec1_smooth">subsection 74.8 (1)</A> that was contravened and the amount to be paid.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.16subsec4" id="sec74_16subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">s. 103 (3)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="6" href="#sec103subsec6_smooth">(6)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.16" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">Subsections 103 (3)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="6" href="#sec103subsec6_smooth">(6)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A> apply with respect to orders issued under this section with necessary modifications and for the purpose, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, a reference to an employee is a reference to an assignment employee or prospective assignment employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Order re client reprisal</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.17" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.17" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.17"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.17" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.17" data-viibes-start="157" data-viibes-end="156"><A name="BK197"></A><B><a name="sec74.17subsec1" id="sec74_17subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.17" id="sec74_17"></A>74.17 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.17" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds that <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" href="#sec74.12_smooth">section 74.12</A> has been contravened with respect to an assignment employee, the officer may order that the employee be compensated for any loss he or she incurred as a result of the contravention or that he or she be reinstated in the assignment or that he or she be both compensated and reinstated.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec74.17subsec2" id="sec74_17subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Terms of orders</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.17" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an order issued under this section requires the client to compensate an assignment employee, it shall also require the client to,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  pay to the Director in trust,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  the amount of the compensation, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  an amount for administration costs equal to the greater of $100 and 10 per cent of the amount of compensation; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  pay the amount of the compensation to the assignment employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49" href="#sec49_smooth">s. 49</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.17subsec3" id="sec74_17subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">s. 103 (3)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="5" href="#sec103subsec5_smooth">(5)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.17" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">Subsections 103 (3)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="5" href="#sec103subsec5_smooth">(5)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A> apply with respect to orders issued under this section with necessary modifications, including but not limited to the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A reference to an employer is a reference to a client.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A reference to an employee is a reference to an assignment employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.17subsec4" id="sec74_17subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Agency obligation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.17" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If an order is issued under this section requiring a client to reinstate an assignment employee in the assignment, the temporary help agency shall do whatever it can reasonably do in order to enable compliance by the client with the order.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 3</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Agency and client jointly and severally liable</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.18" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.18" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.18"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.18" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="5" data-noteup-count-display="5"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.18" data-viibes-start="158" data-viibes-end="157"><A name="BK198"></A><B><a name="sec74.18subsec1" id="sec74_18subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.18" id="sec74_18"></A>74.18 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.18" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (2), if an assignment employee was assigned to perform work for a client of a temporary help agency during a pay period, and the agency fails to pay the employee some or all of the wages described in subsection (3) that are owing to the employee for that pay period, the agency and the client are jointly and severally liable for the wages. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec74.18subsec2" id="sec74_18subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, more than one client</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.18" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an assignment employee was assigned to perform work for more than one client of a temporary help agency during a pay period, and the agency fails to pay the employee some or all of the wages described in subsection (3) that are owing to the employee for that pay period, each client is jointly and severally liable with the agency for a share of the total wages owed to the employee that is in proportion to the number of hours the employee worked for that client during the pay period relative to the total number of hours the employee worked for all clients during the pay period. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.18subsec3" id="sec74_18subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Wages for which client may be liable</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.18" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A client of a temporary help agency may be jointly and severally liable under this section for the following wages:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Regular wages that were earned during the relevant pay period.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Overtime pay that was earned during the relevant pay period.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Public holiday pay that was earned during the relevant pay period.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Premium pay that was earned during the relevant pay period. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.18subsec4" id="sec74_18subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Agency primarily responsible</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.18" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Despite subsections (1) and (2), the temporary help agency is primarily responsible for an assignment employee’s wages, but proceedings against the agency under this Act do not have to be exhausted before proceedings may be commenced to collect wages from the client of the agency. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.18subsec5" id="sec74_18subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Enforcement – client deemed to be employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.18" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> For the purposes of enforcing the liability of a client of a temporary help agency under this section, the client is deemed to be an employer of the assignment employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.18subsec6" id="sec74_18subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same – orders</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.18" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Without restricting the generality of subsection (5), an order issued by an employment standards officer against a client of a temporary help agency to enforce a liability under this section shall be treated as if it were an order against an employer for the purposes of this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="5" href="#sec5_smooth">s. 5</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Order re: recruiter reprisal</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="74.19" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec74.19" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=74.19"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="74.19" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="74.19" data-viibes-start="159" data-viibes-end="158"><A name="BK199"></A><B><a name="sec74.19subsec1" id="sec74_19subsec1"></A><a name="sec74.19" id="sec74_19"></A>74.19 </B> <SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="74.19" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds that <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12.1" href="#sec74.12.1_smooth">section 74.12.1</A> has been contravened with respect to a prospective employee who engages or uses the services of a recruiter, the officer may order that the prospective employee be compensated for any loss incurred as a result of the contravention. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec74.19subsec2" id="sec74_19subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Terms of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.19" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an order issued under this section requires the recruiter to compensate a prospective employee that has engaged or used the services of the recruiter, it shall also require the recruiter to,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  pay to the Director in trust,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  the amount of the compensation, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  an amount for administration costs equal to the greater of $100 and 10 per cent of the amount of compensation; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  pay the amount of the compensation to the prospective employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec74.19subsec3" id="sec74_19subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">s. 103 (3)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="74.19" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">Subsections 103 (3)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A> apply with respect to orders issued under this section with necessary modifications, including but not limited to the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A reference to an employer is a reference to a recruiter.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A reference to an employee is a reference to a prospective employee that has engaged or used the services of a recruiter. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">s. 19</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="PART_XIx_BUILDING_SERVICES_PROVIDERS_349924"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK200"></A>PART XIx <BR>  BUILDING SERVICES PROVIDERS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">New provider</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="75" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec75" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=75"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="75" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="13" data-noteup-count-display="13"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="75" data-viibes-start="160" data-viibes-end="159"><A name="BK201"></A><B><a name="sec75subsec1" id="sec75subsec1"></A><a name="sec75" id="sec75"></A>75 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="75" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This Part applies if a building services provider for a building is replaced by a new provider.  2000, c. 41, s. 75 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec75subsec2" id="sec75subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Termination and severance pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="75" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The new provider shall comply with Part<B> </B>XV (Termination and Severance of Employment) with respect to every employee of the replaced provider who is engaged in providing services at the premises and whom the new provider does not employ as if the new provider had terminated and severed the employee’s employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 75 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec75subsec3" id="sec75subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="75" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The new provider shall be deemed to have been the employee’s employer for the purpose of subsection (2).  2000, c. 41, s. 75 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec75subsec4" id="sec75subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="75" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The new provider is not required to comply with subsection (2) with respect to,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an employee who is retained by the replaced provider; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  any prescribed employees.  2000, c. 41, s. 75 (4).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Vacation pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="76" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec76" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=76"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="76" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="76" data-viibes-start="161" data-viibes-end="160"><A name="BK202"></A><B><a name="sec76subsec1" id="sec76subsec1"></A><a name="sec76" id="sec76"></A>76 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="76" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A provider who ceases to provide services at a premises and who ceases to employ an employee shall pay to the employee the amount of any accrued vacation pay.  2000, c. 41, s. 76 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec76subsec2" id="sec76subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="76" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A payment under subsection (1) shall be made within the later of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  seven days after the day the employee’s employment with the provider ceases; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the day that would have been the employee’s next regular pay day.  2000, c. 41, s. 76 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Information request, possible new provider</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="77" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec77" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=77"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="77" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="8" data-noteup-count-display="8"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="77" data-viibes-start="162" data-viibes-end="161"><A name="BK203"></A><B><a name="sec77subsec1" id="sec77subsec1"></A><a name="sec77" id="sec77"></A>77 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="77" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Where a person is seeking to become the new provider at a premises, the owner or manager of the premises shall upon request give to that person the prescribed information about the employees who on the date of the request are engaged in providing services at the premises.  2000, c. 41, s. 77 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec77subsec2" id="sec77subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, new provider</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="77" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Where a person becomes the new provider at a premises, the owner or manager of the premises shall upon request give to that person the prescribed information about the employees who on the date of the request are engaged in providing services for the premises.  2000, c. 41, s. 77 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec77subsec3" id="sec77subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Request by owner or manager</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="77" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an owner or manager requests a provider or former provider to provide information to the owner or manager so that the owner or manager can fulfil a request made under subsection (1) or (2), the provider or former provider shall provide the information.  2000, c. 41, s. 77 (3).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Use of information</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="78" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec78" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=78"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="78" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="78" data-viibes-start="163" data-viibes-end="162"><A name="BK204"></A><B><a name="sec78subsec1" id="sec78subsec1"></A><a name="sec78" id="sec78"></A>78 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="78" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A person who receives information under this Part shall use that information only for the purpose of complying with this Part or determining the person’s obligations or potential obligations under this Part.  2000, c. 41, s. 78 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec78subsec2" id="sec78subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Confidentiality</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="78" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A person who receives information under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="77" href="#sec77_smooth">section 77</A> shall not disclose it, except as authorized under this Part.  2000, c. 41, s. 78 (2).</P>
 
<A name="PART_Xx_LIABILITY_OF_DIRECTORS_353535"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK205"></A>PART Xx <BR>  LIABILITY OF DIRECTORS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definition</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="79" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec79" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=79"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="79" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="79" data-viibes-start="164" data-viibes-end="163"><A name="BK206"></A><B><a name="sec79" id="sec79"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="79" subsection="null" alinea="null">79</SPAN> </B>In this Part,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“director” means a director of a corporation and includes a shareholder who is a party to a unanimous shareholder agreement.  2000, c. 41, s. 79.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Application of Part</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="80" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec80" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=80"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="80" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="12" data-noteup-count-display="12"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="80" data-viibes-start="165" data-viibes-end="164"><A name="BK207"></A><B><a name="sec80subsec1" id="sec80subsec1"></A><a name="sec80" id="sec80"></A>80 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="80" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This Part applies with respect to shareholders described in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="79" href="#sec79_smooth">section 79</A> only to the extent that the directors are relieved, under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="42-current-1" s="108" ss="5" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-b16/latest/rso-1990-c-b16.html#sec108subsec5_smooth">subsection 108 (5)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="42-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-b16/latest/rso-1990-c-b16.html">Business Corporations Act</A></I> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12791-current-1" s="146" ss="5" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-c-44/latest/rsc-1985-c-c-44.html#sec146subsec5_smooth">subsection 146 (5)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12791-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-c-44/latest/rsc-1985-c-c-44.html">Canada Business Corporations Act</A></I>, of their liability to pay wages to the employees of the corporation.  2000, c. 41, s. 80 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec80subsec2" id="sec80subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Non-application</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="80" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> This Part does not apply with respect to directors of corporations to which the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="34647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2010-c-15/latest/so-2010-c-15.html">Not-for-Profit Corporations Act, 2010</A></I> applies or to which the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="80-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-c35/latest/rso-1990-c-c35.html">Co-operative Corporations Act</A></I> applies.  2000, c. 41, s. 80 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96820-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-15/latest/so-2010-c-15.html">2010, c. 15, s. 224</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec80subsec3" id="sec80subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="80" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> This Part does not apply with respect to directors, or persons who perform functions similar to those of a director, of a college of a health profession or a group of health professions that is established or continued under an Act of the Legislature.  2000, c. 41, s. 80 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec80subsec4" id="sec80subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="80" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> This Part does not apply with respect to directors of corporations,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  that have been incorporated in another jurisdiction;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  that have objects that are similar to the objects of corporations to which the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="34647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2010-c-15/latest/so-2010-c-15.html">Not-for-Profit Corporations Act, 2010</A></I> applies or to which the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="80-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-c35/latest/rso-1990-c-c35.html">Co-operative Corporations Act</A></I> applies; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  that are carried on without the purpose of gain.  2000, c. 41, s. 80 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96820-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-15/latest/so-2010-c-15.html">2010, c. 15, s. 224</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Directors’ liability for wages</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="81" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec81" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=81"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="81" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="95" data-noteup-count-display="95"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="81" data-viibes-start="166" data-viibes-end="165"><A name="BK208"></A><B><a name="sec81subsec1" id="sec81subsec1"></A><a name="sec81" id="sec81"></A>81 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="81" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The directors of an employer are jointly and severally liable for wages as provided in this Part if,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employer is insolvent, the employee has caused a claim for unpaid wages to be filed with the receiver appointed by a court with respect to the employer or with the employer’s trustee in bankruptcy and the claim has not been paid;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  an employment standards officer has made an order that the employer is liable for wages, unless the amount set out in the order has been paid or the employer has applied to have it reviewed;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  an employment standards officer has made an order that a director is liable for wages, unless the amount set out in the order has been paid or the employer or the director has applied to have it reviewed; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  the Board has issued, amended or affirmed an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" href="#sec119_smooth">section 119</A>, the order, as issued, amended or affirmed, requires the employer or the directors to pay wages and the amount set out in the order has not been paid.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec2" id="sec81subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Employer primarily responsible</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Despite subsection (1), the employer is primarily responsible for an employee’s wages but proceedings against the employer under this Act do not have to be exhausted before proceedings may be commenced to collect wages from directors under this Part.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec3" id="sec81subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Wages</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The wages that directors are liable for under this Part are wages, not including termination pay and severance pay as they are provided for under this Act or an employment contract and not including amounts that are deemed to be wages under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec4" id="sec81subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Vacation pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The vacation pay that directors are liable for is the greater of the minimum vacation pay provided in Part XI (Vacation With Pay) and the amount contractually agreed to by the employer and the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec5" id="sec81subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Holiday pay</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The amount of holiday pay that directors are liable for is the greater of the amount payable for holidays at the rate as determined under this Act and the regulations and the amount for the holidays at the rate as contractually agreed to by the employer and the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec6" id="sec81subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Overtime wages</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The overtime wages that directors are liable for are the greater of the amount of overtime pay provided in Part VIII (Overtime Pay) and the amount contractually agreed to by the employer and the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec7" id="sec81subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Directors’ maximum liability</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The directors of an employer corporation are jointly and severally liable to the employees of the corporation for all debts not exceeding six months’ wages, as described in subsection (3), that become payable while they are directors for services performed for the corporation and for the vacation pay accrued while they are directors for not more than 12 months under this Act and the regulations made under it or under any collective agreement made by the corporation.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec8" id="sec81subsec8"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50" href="#sec50_smooth">s. 50</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec9" id="sec81subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Contribution from other directors</P>
