<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> A director who has satisfied a claim for wages is entitled to contribution in relation to the wages from other directors who are liable for the claim.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (9).</P>
 
<a name="sec81subsec10" id="sec81subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Limitation periods</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="81" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> A limitation period set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="114" href="#sec114_smooth">section 114</A> prevails over a limitation period in any other Act, unless the other Act states that it is to prevail over this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 81 (10).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">No relief by contract, etc.</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="82" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec82" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=82"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="82" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="10" data-noteup-count-display="10"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="82" data-viibes-start="167" data-viibes-end="166"><A name="BK209"></A><B><a name="sec82subsec1" id="sec82subsec1"></A><a name="sec82" id="sec82"></A>82 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="82" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No provision in a contract, in the articles of incorporation or the by-laws of a corporation or in a resolution of a corporation relieves a director from the duty to act according to this Act or relieves him or her from liability for breach of it.  2000, c. 41, s. 82 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec82subsec2" id="sec82subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Indemnification of directors</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="82" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employer may indemnify a director, a former director and the heirs or legal representatives of a director or former director against all costs, charges and expenses, including an amount paid to satisfy an order under this Act, including an order which is the subject of a filing under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="126" href="#sec126_smooth">section 126</A>, reasonably incurred by the director with respect to any civil or administrative action or proceeding to which he or she is a party by reason of being or having been a director of the employer if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  he or she has acted honestly and in good faith with a view to the best interests of the employer; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the case of a proceeding or action that is enforced by a monetary penalty, he or she had reasonable grounds for believing that his or her conduct was lawful.  2000, c. 41, s. 82 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Civil remedies protected</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="83" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec83" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=83"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="83" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="8" data-noteup-count-display="8"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="83" data-viibes-start="168" data-viibes-end="167"><A name="BK210"></A><B><a name="sec83" id="sec83"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="83" subsection="null" alinea="null">83</SPAN> </B>No civil remedy that a person may have against a director or that a director may have against a person is suspended or affected by this Part.  2000, c. 41, s. 83.</P></div>
 
<A name="PART_XXi_who_enforces_this_act_and_what_they_can_do_361281"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK211"></A>PART XXi <BR>  who enforces this act and what they can do</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Minister responsible</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="84" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec84" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=84"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="84" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="84" data-viibes-start="169" data-viibes-end="168"><A name="BK212"></A><B><a name="sec84" id="sec84"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="84" subsection="null" alinea="null">84</SPAN> </B>The Minister is responsible for the administration of this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 84.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">Director</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="85" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec85" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=85"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="85" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="85" data-viibes-start="170" data-viibes-end="169"><A name="BK213"></A><B><a name="sec85subsec1" id="sec85subsec1"></A><a name="sec85" id="sec85"></A>85 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="85" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Minister shall appoint a person to be the Director of Employment Standards to administer this Act and the regulations.  2000, c. 41, s. 85 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec85subsec2" id="sec85subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Acting Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="85" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Director’s powers may be exercised and the Director’s duties may be performed by an employee of the Ministry appointed as Acting Director if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the Director is absent or unable to act; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  an individual who was appointed Director has ceased to be the Director and no new Director has been appointed.  2000, c. 41, s. 85 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec85subsec3" id="sec85subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="85" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An Acting Director shall be appointed by the Director or, in the Director’s absence, the Deputy Minister of Labour.  2000, c. 41, s. 85 (3).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Employment standards officers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="86" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec86" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=86"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="86" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="86" data-viibes-start="171" data-viibes-end="170"><A name="BK214"></A><B><a name="sec86subsec1" id="sec86subsec1"></A><a name="sec86" id="sec86"></A>86 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="86" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Such persons as are considered necessary to enforce this Act and the regulations may be appointed under Part III of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="825-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2006-c-35-sch-a/latest/so-2006-c-35-sch-a.html">Public Service of Ontario Act, 2006</A></I>
as employment standards officers.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96728-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-35/latest/so-2006-c-35.html">2006, c. 35</A>, Sched. C, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="33" href="#sec33_smooth">s. 33</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec86subsec2" id="sec86subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Certificate of appointment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="86" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Deputy Minister of Labour shall issue a certificate of appointment bearing his or her signature or a facsimile of it to every employment standards officer.  2000, c. 41, s. 86 (2).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Delegation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="87" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec87" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=87"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="87" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="87" data-viibes-start="172" data-viibes-end="171"><A name="BK215"></A><B><a name="sec87subsec1" id="sec87subsec1"></A><a name="sec87" id="sec87"></A>87 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="87" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Minister may, in writing, delegate to any person any of the Minister’s powers or duties under this Act, subject to the limitations or conditions set out in the delegation.  2000, c. 41, s. 87 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec87subsec2" id="sec87subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same: residual powers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="87" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Minister may exercise a power or perform a duty under this Act even if he or she has delegated it to a person under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 87 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Powers and duties of Director</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="88" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec88" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=88"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="88" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="47" data-noteup-count-display="47"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="88" data-viibes-start="173" data-viibes-end="172"><A name="BK216"></A><B><a name="sec88subsec1" id="sec88subsec1"></A><a name="sec88" id="sec88"></A>88 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="88" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Director may exercise the powers conferred upon the Director under this Act and shall perform the duties imposed upon the Director under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec88subsec2" id="sec88subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Policies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Director may establish policies respecting the interpretation, administration and enforcement of this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec88subsec3" id="sec88subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Authorization</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The Director may authorize an employment standards officer to exercise a power or to perform a duty conferred upon the Director under this Act, either orally or in writing.  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec88subsec4" id="sec88subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same: residual powers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The Director may exercise a power conferred upon the Director under this Act even if he or she has delegated it to a person under subsection (3).  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec88subsec5" id="sec88subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Interest</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The Director may, with the approval of the Minister, determine the rates of interest and the manner of calculating interest for,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  amounts owing under different provisions of this Act or the regulations, and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  money held by the Director in trust. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" href="#sec51_smooth">s. 51</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88subsec6" id="sec88subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Determinations not regulations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> A determination under subsection (5) is not a regulation within the meaning of Part III (Regulations) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="814-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2006-c-21-sch-f/latest/so-2006-c-21-sch-f.html">Legislation Act, 2006</A></I>.  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (6); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96714-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-21/latest/so-2006-c-21.html">2006, c. 21</A>, Sched. F, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="136" ss="1" href="#sec136subsec1_smooth">s. 136 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88subsec7" id="sec88subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Other circumstances</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Where money has been paid to the Director in trust and no provision is made for paying it out elsewhere in this Act, it shall be paid out to the person entitled to receive it together with interest at the rate and calculated in the manner determined by the Director under subsection (5).  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec88subsec8" id="sec88subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Surplus interest</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If the interest earned on money held by the Director in trust exceeds the interest paid to the person entitled to receive the money, the Director may use the difference to pay any service charges for the management of the money levied by the financial institution with which the money was deposited.  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec88subsec9" id="sec88subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Hearing not required</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> The Director is not required to hold a hearing in exercising any power or making any decision under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 88 (9).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Director may reassign an investigation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="88.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec88.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=88.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="88.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="88.1" data-viibes-start="174" data-viibes-end="173"><A name="BK217"></A><B><a name="sec88.1subsec1" id="sec88_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec88.1" id="sec88_1"></A>88.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="88.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Director may terminate the assignment of an employment standards officer to the investigation of a complaint and may assign the investigation to another employment standards officer.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96712-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-19/latest/so-2006-c-19.html">2006, c. 19</A>, Sched. M, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">s. 1 (1)</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec88.1subsec2" id="sec88_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the Director terminates the assignment of an employment standards officer to the investigation of a complaint, </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the officer whose assignment is terminated shall no longer have any powers or duties with respect to the investigation of the complaint or the discovery during the investigation of any similar potential entitlement of another employee of the employer related to the complaint; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the new employment standards officer assigned to the investigation may rely on evidence collected by the first officer and any findings of fact made by that officer.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96712-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-19/latest/so-2006-c-19.html">2006, c. 19</A>, Sched. M, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">s. 1 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88.1subsec3" id="sec88_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Inspections</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> This section applies with necessary modifications to inspections of employers by employment standards officers.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96712-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-19/latest/so-2006-c-19.html">2006, c. 19</A>, Sched. M, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="1" href="#sec1subsec1_smooth">s. 1 (1)</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Recognition of employers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="88.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec88.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=88.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="88.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="88.2" data-viibes-start="175" data-viibes-end="174"><A name="BK218"></A><B><a name="sec88.2subsec1" id="sec88_2subsec1"></A><a name="sec88.2" id="sec88_2"></A>88.2 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="88.2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Director may give recognition to an employer, upon the employer’s application, if the employer satisfies the Director that it meets the prescribed criteria. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec88.2subsec2" id="sec88_2subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Classes of employers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For greater certainty, the criteria under subsection (1) may be prescribed for different classes of employers. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88.2subsec3" id="sec88_2subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Information re recognitions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.2" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The Director may require any employer who is seeking recognition under subsection (1), or who is the subject of a recognition, to provide the Director with whatever information, records or accounts he or she may require pertaining to the recognition and the Director may make such inquiries and examinations as he or she considers necessary. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88.2subsec4" id="sec88_2subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Publication</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.2" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The Director may publish or otherwise make available to the public information relating to employers given recognition under subsection (1), including the names of employers. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88.2subsec5" id="sec88_2subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Validity of recognitions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.2" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> A recognition given under subsection (1) is valid for the period that the Director specifies in the recognition. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88.2subsec6" id="sec88_2subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Revocation, etc., of recognitions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.2" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The Director may revoke or amend a recognition. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Delegation of powers under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88.2" href="#sec88.2_smooth">s. 88.2</A></P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="88.3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec88.3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=88.3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="88.3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="88.3" data-viibes-start="176" data-viibes-end="175"><A name="BK219"></A><B><a name="sec88.3subsec1" id="sec88_3subsec1"></A><a name="sec88.3" id="sec88_3"></A>88.3 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="88.3" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Director may authorize an individual employed in the Ministry to exercise a power conferred on the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88.2" href="#sec88.2_smooth">section 88.2</A>, either orally or in writing. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec88.3subsec2" id="sec88_3subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Residual powers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.3" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Director may exercise a power conferred on the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88.2" href="#sec88.2_smooth">section 88.2</A> even if he or she has delegated it to an individual under subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec88.3subsec3" id="sec88_3subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Duty re policies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="88.3" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An individual authorized by the Director under subsection (1) shall follow any policies established by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88" ss="2" href="#sec88subsec2_smooth">subsection 88 (2)</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">s. 52</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Powers and duties of officers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="89" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec89" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=89"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="89" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="5" data-noteup-count-display="5"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="89" data-viibes-start="177" data-viibes-end="176"><A name="BK220"></A><B><a name="sec89subsec1" id="sec89subsec1"></A><a name="sec89" id="sec89"></A>89 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="89" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer may exercise the powers conferred upon employment standards officers under this Act and shall perform the duties imposed upon employment standards officers under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 89 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec89subsec2" id="sec89subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Officers to follow policies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="89" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employment standards officer shall follow any policies established by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88" ss="2" href="#sec88subsec2_smooth">subsection 88 (2)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 89 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec89subsec3" id="sec89subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Hearing not required</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="89" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employment standards officer is not required to hold a hearing in exercising any power or making any decision under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 89 (3).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Officers not compellable</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="90" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec90" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=90"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="90" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9" data-noteup-count-display="9"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="90" data-viibes-start="178" data-viibes-end="177"><A name="BK221"></A><B><a name="sec90subsec1" id="sec90subsec1"></A><a name="sec90" id="sec90"></A>90 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="90" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer is not a competent or compellable witness in a civil proceeding respecting any information given or obtained, statements made or received, or records or other things produced or received under this Act except for the purpose of carrying out his or her duties under it.  2000, c. 41, s. 90 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec90subsec2" id="sec90subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Records</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="90" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employment standards officer shall not be compelled in a civil proceeding to produce any record or other thing he or she has made or received under this Act except for the purpose of carrying out his or her duties under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 90 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Investigation and inspection powers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="91" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec91" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=91"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="91" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="34" data-noteup-count-display="34"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="91" data-viibes-start="179" data-viibes-end="178"><A name="BK222"></A><B><a name="sec91subsec1" id="sec91subsec1"></A><a name="sec91" id="sec91"></A>91 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="91" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer may, without a warrant, enter and inspect any place in order to investigate a possible contravention of this Act or to perform an inspection to ensure that this Act is being complied with.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec91subsec2" id="sec91subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Time of entry</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The power to enter and inspect a place without a warrant may be exercised only during the place’s regular business hours or, if it does not have regular business hours, during daylight hours.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec3" id="sec91subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Dwellings</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The power to enter and inspect a place without a warrant shall not be exercised to enter and inspect a part of the place that is used as a dwelling unless the occupier of the dwelling consents or a warrant has been issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="92" href="#sec92_smooth">section 92</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec4" id="sec91subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Use of force</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employment standards officer is not entitled to use force to enter and inspect a place.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec5" id="sec91subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Identification</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employment standards officer shall produce, on request, evidence of his or her appointment.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec6" id="sec91subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Powers of officer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> An employment standards officer conducting an investigation or inspection may,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  examine a record or other thing that the officer thinks may be relevant to the investigation or inspection;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  require the production of a record or other thing that the officer thinks may be relevant to the investigation or inspection;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  remove for review and copying a record or other thing that the officer thinks may be relevant to the investigation or inspection;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  in order to produce a record in readable form, use data storage, information processing or retrieval devices or systems that are normally used in carrying on business in the place; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  question any person on matters the officer thinks may be relevant to the investigation or inspection.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (6); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96712-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-19/latest/so-2006-c-19.html">2006, c. 19</A>, Sched. M, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" ss="2" href="#sec1subsec2_smooth">s. 1 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec7" id="sec91subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Written demand</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> A demand that a record or other thing be produced must be in writing and must include a statement of the nature of the record or thing required.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec8" id="sec91subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Obligation to produce and assist</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer demands that a record or other thing be produced, the person who has custody of the record or thing shall produce it and, in the case of a record, shall on request provide any assistance that is reasonably necessary to interpret the record or to produce it in a readable form.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec9" id="sec91subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Records and things removed from place</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> An employment standards officer who removes a record or other thing under clause (6) (c) shall provide a receipt and return the record or thing to the person within a reasonable time.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (9).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec10" id="sec91subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Copy admissible in evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> A copy of a record that purports to be certified by an employment standards officer as being a true copy of the original is admissible in evidence to the same extent as the original, and has the same evidentiary value.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (10).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec10.1" id="sec91subsec10_1"></A><P class="headnote">Self-audit</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="10.1" alinea="null">(10.1)</SPAN> In addition to the powers set out in subsection (6), an employment standards officer conducting an inspection may, by giving written notice, require an employer to conduct an examination of the employer’s records, practices or both in relation to one or more provisions of this Act or the regulations. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec10.2" id="sec91subsec10_2"></A><P class="headnote">Examination and report</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="10.2" alinea="null">(10.2)</SPAN> If an employer is required to conduct an examination under subsection (10.1), the employer shall conduct the examination and report the results of the examination to the employment standards officer in accordance with the notice. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec10.3" id="sec91subsec10_3"></A><P class="headnote">Notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="10.3" alinea="null">(10.3)</SPAN> A notice given under subsection (10.1) shall specify,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the period to be covered by the examination;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the provision or provisions of this Act or the regulations to be covered by the examination; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the date by which the employer must provide a report of the results of the examination to the employment standards officer. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec10.4" id="sec91subsec10_4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="10.4" alinea="null">(10.4)</SPAN> A notice given under subsection (10.1) may specify,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the method to be used in carrying out the examination;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the format of the report; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  such information to be included in the employer’s report as the employment standards officer considers appropriate. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec10.5" id="sec91subsec10_5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="10.5" alinea="null">(10.5)</SPAN> Without restricting the generality of clause (10.4) (c), a notice given under subsection (10.1) may require the employer to include in the report to the employment standards officer,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  an assessment of whether the employer has complied with this Act or the regulations;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if, pursuant to clause (a), the employer has included an assessment that the employer has not complied with this Act or the regulations;</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  an assessment of whether one or more employees are owed wages, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  a description of the measures that the employer has taken or will take to ensure that this Act or the regulations will be complied with; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  if, pursuant to subclause (b) (i), the employer has included an assessment that one or more employees are owed wages, the name of every employee who is owed wages, the amount of wages owed to each employee and an explanation of how the amount of wages owed to each employee was determined. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="3" href="#sec3_smooth">s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec11" id="sec91subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Obstruction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> No person shall hinder, obstruct or interfere with or attempt to hinder, obstruct or interfere with an employment standards officer conducting an investigation or inspection.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (11).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec12" id="sec91subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> No person shall,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  refuse to answer questions on matters that an employment standards officer thinks may be relevant to an investigation or inspection; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  provide an employment standards officer with information on matters the officer thinks may be relevant to an investigation or inspection that the person knows to be false or misleading.  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (12).</P>
 
<a name="sec91subsec13" id="sec91subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">Separate inquiries</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="91" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> No person shall prevent or attempt to prevent an employment standards officer from making inquiries of any person separate and apart from another person under clause (6) (e).  2000, c. 41, s. 91 (13).</P>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="91.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec91.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=91.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="91.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="91.1" data-viibes-start="180" data-viibes-end="179"><B><a name="sec91.1" id="sec91_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="91.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">91.1 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97103-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-25/latest/so-2021-c-25.html">2021, c. 25</A>, Sched. 6, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Warrant</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="92" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec92" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=92"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="92" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="92" data-viibes-start="181" data-viibes-end="180"><A name="BK223"></A><B><a name="sec92subsec1" id="sec92subsec1"></A><a name="sec92" id="sec92"></A>92 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="92" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A justice of the peace may issue a warrant authorizing an employment standards officer named in the warrant to enter premises specified in the warrant and to exercise any of the powers mentioned in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="6" href="#sec91subsec6_smooth">subsection 91 (6)</A>, if the justice of the peace is satisfied on information under oath that,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the officer has been prevented from exercising a right of entry to the premises under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="1" href="#sec91subsec1_smooth">subsection 91 (1)</A> or has been prevented from exercising a power under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="6" href="#sec91subsec6_smooth">subsection 91 (6)</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  there are reasonable grounds to believe that the officer will be prevented from exercising a right of entry to the premises under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="1" href="#sec91subsec1_smooth">subsection 91 (1)</A> or will be prevented from exercising a power under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="6" href="#sec91subsec6_smooth">subsection 91 (6)</A>; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  there are reasonable grounds to believe that an offence under this Act or the regulations has been or is being committed and that information or other evidence will be obtained through the exercise of a power mentioned in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="6" href="#sec91subsec6_smooth">subsection 91 (6)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 92 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96803-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-32/latest/so-2009-c-32.html">2009, c. 32, s. 51 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec92subsec2" id="sec92subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Expiry of warrant</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="92" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A warrant issued under this section shall name a date on which it expires, which date shall not be later than 30 days after the warrant is issued.  2000, c. 41, s. 92 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec92subsec3" id="sec92subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Extension of time</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="92" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Upon application without notice by the employment standards officer named in a warrant issued under this section, a justice of the peace may extend the date on which the warrant expires for an additional period of no more than 30 days.  2000, c. 41, s. 92 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec92subsec4" id="sec92subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Use of force</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="92" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employment standards officer named in a warrant issued under this section may call upon a police officer for assistance in executing the warrant.  2000, c. 41, s. 92 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec92subsec5" id="sec92subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Time of execution</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="92" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> A warrant issued under this section may be executed only between 8 a.m. and 8 p.m., unless the warrant specifies otherwise.  2000, c. 41, s. 92 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec92subsec6" id="sec92subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Other matters</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="92" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="4" href="#sec91subsec4_smooth">Subsections 91 (4)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="13" href="#sec91subsec13_smooth">(13)</A> apply with necessary modifications to an officer executing a warrant issued under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 92 (6); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec27" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="27" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (27)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec92subsec7" id="sec92subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="92" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Without restricting the generality of subsection (6), if a warrant is issued under this section, the matters on which an officer executing the warrant may question a person under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" ss="6" href="#sec91subsec6_smooth">clause 91 (6)</A> (e) are not limited to those that aid in the effective execution of the warrant but extend to any matters that the officer thinks may be relevant to the investigation or inspection.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96803-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-32/latest/so-2009-c-32.html">2009, c. 32, s. 51 (2)</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Posting of notices</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="93" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec93" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=93"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="93" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="93" data-viibes-start="182" data-viibes-end="181"><A name="BK224"></A><B><a name="sec93" id="sec93"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="93" subsection="null" alinea="null">93</SPAN> </B>An employment standards officer may require an employer to post and to keep posted in or upon the employer’s premises in a conspicuous place or places where it is likely to come to the attention of the employer’s employees,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  any notice relating to the administration or enforcement of this Act or the regulations that the officer considers appropriate; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a copy of a report or part of a report made by the officer concerning the results of an investigation or inspection.  2000, c. 41, s. 93.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Powers under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html">Canada Labour Code</A></I></P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="94" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec94" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=94"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="94" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="94" data-viibes-start="183" data-viibes-end="182"><A name="BK225"></A><B><a name="sec94" id="sec94"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="94" subsection="null" alinea="null">94</SPAN> </B>If a regulation is made under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html">Canada Labour Code</A></I> incorporating by reference all or part of this Act or a regulation under it, the Board and any person having powers under this Act may exercise the powers conferred under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12876-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-l-2/latest/rsc-1985-c-l-2.html">Canada Labour Code</A></I> regulation.  2000, c. 41, s. 94.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote">Service of documents</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="95" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec95" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=95"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="95" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="37" data-noteup-count-display="37"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="95" data-viibes-start="184" data-viibes-end="183"><A name="BK226"></A><B><a name="sec95subsec1" id="sec95subsec1"></A><a name="sec95" id="sec95"></A>95 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="95" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Except as otherwise provided in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="8" href="#sec8_smooth">section 8</A>, where service of a document on a person is required or permitted under this Act, it may be served,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  in the case of service on an individual, personally, by leaving a copy of the document with the individual;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the case of service on a corporation, personally, by leaving a copy of the document with an officer, director or agent of the corporation, or with an individual at any place of business of the corporation who appears to be in control or management of the place of business;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  by mail addressed to the person’s last known business or residential address using any method of mail delivery that permits the delivery to be verified;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  by fax or email if the person is equipped to receive the fax or email;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  by a courier service;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  by leaving the document, in a sealed envelope addressed to the person, with an individual who appears to be at least 16 years of age at the person’s last known business or residential address; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (g)  in a manner ordered by the Board under subsection (8). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="10" href="#sec10_smooth">s. 10</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec2" id="sec95subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Service of a document by means described in clause (1) (a), (b) or (f) is effective when it is left with the individual.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec3" id="sec95subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (6), service of a document by mail is effective five days after the document is mailed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec4" id="sec95subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (6), service of a document by a fax or email sent on a Saturday, Sunday or a public holiday or on any other day after 5 p.m. is effective on the next day that is not a Saturday, Sunday or public holiday.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec5" id="sec95subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (6), service of a document by courier is effective two days after the courier takes the document.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec6" id="sec95subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Subsections (3), (4) and (5) do not apply if the person establishes that the service was not effective at the time specified in those subsections because of an absence, accident, illness or cause beyond the person’s control.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec7" id="sec95subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> If the Director considers that a manner of service other than one described in clauses (1) (a) to (f) is appropriate in the circumstances, the Director may direct the Board to consider the manner of service.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec8" id="sec95subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If the Board is directed to consider the manner of service, it may order that service be effected in the manner that the Board considers appropriate in the circumstances.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec9" id="sec95subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> In an order for service, the Board shall specify when service in accordance with the order is effective.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec10" id="sec95subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Proof of issuance and service</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> A certificate of service made by the employment standards officer who issued an order or notice under this Act is evidence of the issuance of the order or notice, the service of the order or notice on the person and its receipt by the person if, in the certificate, the officer,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  certifies that the copy of the order or notice is a true copy of it;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  certifies that the order or notice was served on the person; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  sets out in it the method of service used.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec95subsec11" id="sec95subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Proof of service</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="95" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> A certificate of service made by the person who served a document under this Act is evidence of the service of the document on the person served and its receipt by that person if, in the certificate, the person who served the document,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  certifies that the copy of the document is a true copy of it;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  certifies that the document was served on the person; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  sets out in it the method of service used.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="part_xxii_complaints_and_enforcement_388051"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK227"></A>part xxii <BR>  complaints and enforcement</P>
 
<A name="Complaints__388139"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK228"></A>Complaints</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Complaints</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="96" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec96" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=96"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="96" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="85" data-noteup-count-display="85"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="96" data-viibes-start="185" data-viibes-end="184"><A name="BK229"></A><B><a name="sec96subsec1" id="sec96subsec1"></A><a name="sec96" id="sec96"></A>96 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="96" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A person alleging that this Act has been or is being contravened may file a complaint with the Ministry in a written or electronic form approved by the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 96 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec96subsec2" id="sec96subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of failure to use form</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="96" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A complaint that is not filed in a form approved by the Director shall be deemed not to have been filed.  2000, c. 41, s. 96 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec96subsec3" id="sec96subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Limitation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="96" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A complaint regarding a contravention that occurred more than two years before the day on which the complaint was filed shall be deemed not to have been filed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec18" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="18" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (18)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="96.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec96.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=96.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="96.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="96.1" data-viibes-start="186" data-viibes-end="185"><B><a name="sec96.1" id="sec96_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="96.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">96.1 </SPAN></B>Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="53" href="#sec53_smooth">s. 53</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">When civil proceeding not permitted</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="97" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec97" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=97"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="97" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="41" data-noteup-count-display="41"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="97" data-viibes-start="187" data-viibes-end="186"><A name="BK230"></A><B><a name="sec97subsec1" id="sec97subsec1"></A><a name="sec97" id="sec97"></A>97 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="97" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee who files a complaint under this Act with respect to an alleged failure to pay wages or comply with Part XIII (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1507-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-286-01/latest/o-reg-286-01.html">Benefit Plans</A>) may not commence a civil proceeding with respect to the same matter.  2000, c. 41, s. 97 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec97subsec2" id="sec97subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, wrongful dismissal</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="97" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who files a complaint under this Act alleging an entitlement to termination pay or severance pay may not commence a civil proceeding for wrongful dismissal if the complaint and the proceeding would relate to the same termination or severance of employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 97 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec97subsec3" id="sec97subsec3"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="97" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="20" href="#sec20_smooth">s. 20</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec97subsec4" id="sec97subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Withdrawal of complaint</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="97" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Despite subsections (1) and (2), an employee who has filed a complaint may commence a civil proceeding with respect to a matter described in those subsections if he or she withdraws the complaint within two weeks after it is filed.  2000, c. 41, s. 97 (4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">When complaint not permitted</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="98" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec98" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=98"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="98" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="32" data-noteup-count-display="32"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="98" data-viibes-start="188" data-viibes-end="187"><A name="BK231"></A><B><a name="sec98subsec1" id="sec98subsec1"></A><a name="sec98" id="sec98"></A>98 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="98" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employee who commences a civil proceeding with respect to an alleged failure to pay wages or to comply with Part<B> </B>XIII (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1507-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-286-01/latest/o-reg-286-01.html">Benefit Plans</A>) may not file a complaint with respect to the same matter or have such a complaint investigated.  2000, c. 41, s. 98 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec98subsec2" id="sec98subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, wrongful dismissal</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="98" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who commences a civil proceeding for wrongful dismissal may not file a complaint alleging an entitlement to termination pay or severance pay or have such a complaint investigated if the proceeding and the complaint relate to the same termination or severance of employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 98 (2).</P>
 
<A name="Enforcement_under_Collective_Agreement__390960"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK232"></A>Enforcement under Collective Agreement</P>
 
<P class="headnote">When collective agreement applies</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="99" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec99" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=99"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="99" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="94" data-noteup-count-display="94"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="99" data-viibes-start="189" data-viibes-end="188"><A name="BK233"></A><B><a name="sec99subsec1" id="sec99subsec1"></A><a name="sec99" id="sec99"></A>99 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="99" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employer is or has been bound by a collective agreement, this Act is enforceable against the employer as if it were part of the collective agreement with respect to an alleged contravention of this Act that occurs,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  when the collective agreement is or was in force;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  when its operation is or was continued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" s="58" ss="2" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html#sec58subsec2_smooth">subsection 58 (2)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html">Labour Relations Act, 1995</A></I>; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  during the period that the parties to the collective agreement are or were prohibited by <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" s="86" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html#sec86subsec1_smooth">subsection 86 (1)</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html">Labour Relations Act, 1995</A></I> from unilaterally changing the terms and conditions of employment.  2000, c. 41, s. 99 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec99subsec2" id="sec99subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Complaint not permitted</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="99" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee who is represented by a trade union that is or was a party to a collective agreement may not file a complaint alleging a contravention of this Act that is enforceable under subsection (1) or have such a complaint investigated.  2000, c. 41, s. 99 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec99subsec3" id="sec99subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Employee bound</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="99" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An employee who is represented by a trade union that is or was a party to a collective agreement is bound by any decision of the trade union with respect to the enforcement of this Act under the collective agreement, including a decision not to seek that enforcement.  2000, c. 41, s. 99 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec99subsec4" id="sec99subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Membership status irrelevant</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="99" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsections (2) and (3) apply even if the employee is not a member of the trade union.  2000, c. 41, s. 99 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec99subsec5" id="sec99subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Unfair representation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="99" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (3) or (4) prevents an employee from filing a complaint with the Board alleging that a decision of the trade union with respect to the enforcement of this Act contravenes <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" s="74" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html#sec74_smooth">section 74</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="611-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1995-c-1-sch-a/latest/so-1995-c-1-sch-a.html">Labour Relations Act, 1995</A></I>.  2000, c. 41, s. 99 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec99subsec6" id="sec99subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="99" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Despite subsection (2), the Director may permit an employee to file a complaint and may direct an employment standards officer to investigate it if the Director considers it appropriate in the circumstances.  2000, c. 41, s. 99 (6).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">If arbitrator finds contravention</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="100" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec100" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=100"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="100" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="7" data-noteup-count-display="7"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="100" data-viibes-start="190" data-viibes-end="189"><A name="BK234"></A><B><a name="sec100subsec1" id="sec100subsec1"></A><a name="sec100" id="sec100"></A>100 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="100" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an arbitrator finds that an employer has contravened this Act, the arbitrator may make any order against the employer that an employment standards officer could have made with respect to that contravention but the arbitrator may not issue a notice of contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 100 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec100subsec2" id="sec100subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same: Part XIII</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="100" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an arbitrator finds that an employer has contravened Part XIII (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1507-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-286-01/latest/o-reg-286-01.html">Benefit Plans</A>), the arbitrator may make any order that the Board could make under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="121" href="#sec121_smooth">section 121</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 100 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec100subsec3" id="sec100subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Directors and collective agreement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="100" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An arbitrator shall not require a director to pay an amount, take an action or refrain from taking an action under a collective agreement that the director could not be ordered to pay, take or refrain from taking in the absence of the collective agreement.  2000, c. 41, s. 100 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec100subsec4" id="sec100subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Conditions respecting orders under this section</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="100" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The following conditions apply with respect to an arbitrator’s order under this section:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  In an order requiring the payment of wages or compensation, the arbitrator may require that the amount of the wages or compensation be paid,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  to the trade union that represents the employee or employees concerned, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  directly to the employee or employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="21" href="#sec21_smooth">s. 21</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The order is not subject to review under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">section 116</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 100 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec100subsec5" id="sec100subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of decision to Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="100" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> When an arbitrator makes a decision with respect to an alleged contravention of this Act, the arbitrator shall provide a copy of it to the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 100 (5).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Arbitration and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">s. 4</A></P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="101" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec101" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=101"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="101" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="45" data-noteup-count-display="45"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="101" data-viibes-start="191" data-viibes-end="190"><A name="BK235"></A><B><a name="sec101subsec1" id="sec101subsec1"></A><a name="sec101" id="sec101"></A>101 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="101" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies if, during a proceeding before an arbitrator, other than the Board, concerning an alleged contravention of this Act, an issue is raised concerning whether the employer to whom the collective agreement applies or applied and another person are to be treated as one employer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">section 4</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec101subsec2" id="sec101subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The arbitrator shall not decide the question of whether the employer and the other person are to be treated as one employer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">section 4</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec101subsec3" id="sec101subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Reference to Board</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the arbitrator finds it is necessary to make a finding concerning the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">section 4</A>, the arbitrator shall refer that question to the Board by giving written notice to the Board.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec101subsec4" id="sec101subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Content of notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The notice to the Board shall,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  state that an issue has arisen in an arbitration proceeding with respect to whether the employer and another person are to be treated as one employer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">section 4</A>; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  set out the decisions made by the arbitrator on the other matters in dispute.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec101subsec5" id="sec101subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Decision by Board</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The Board shall decide whether the employer and the other person are one employer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">section 4</A>, but shall not vary any decision of the arbitrator concerning the other matters in dispute.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec101subsec6" id="sec101subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (7), the Board may make an order against the employer and, if it finds that the employer and the other person are one employer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="4" href="#sec4_smooth">section 4</A>, it may make an order against the other person.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec101subsec7" id="sec101subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
