<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The Board shall not require the other person to pay an amount or take or refrain from taking an action under a collective agreement that the other person could not be ordered to pay, take or refrain from taking in the absence of the collective agreement.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec101subsec8" id="sec101subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Application</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="100" href="#sec100_smooth">Section 100</A> applies, with necessary modifications, with respect to an order under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 101 (8).</P>
 
<A name="Enforcement_by_Employment_Standards_Officer__398060"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK236"></A>Enforcement by Employment Standards Officer</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Settlement by employment standards officer</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="101.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec101.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=101.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="101.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="101.1" data-viibes-start="192" data-viibes-end="191"><A name="BK237"></A><B><a name="sec101.1subsec1" id="sec101_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec101.1" id="sec101_1"></A>101.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="101.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer assigned to investigate a complaint may attempt to effect a settlement.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (9).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec101.1subsec2" id="sec101_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the employer and employee agree to a settlement under this section and do what they agreed to do under it,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the settlement is binding on them;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the complaint is deemed to have been withdrawn; </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the investigation is terminated; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  any proceeding respecting the contravention alleged in the complaint, other than a prosecution, is terminated.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (9).</P>
 
<a name="sec101.1subsec3" id="sec101_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="4" href="#sec112subsec4_smooth">s. 112 (4)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="5" href="#sec112subsec5_smooth">(5)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="7" href="#sec112subsec7_smooth">(7)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="9" href="#sec112subsec9_smooth">(9)</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="4" href="#sec112subsec4_smooth">Subsections 112 (4)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="5" href="#sec112subsec5_smooth">(5)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="7" href="#sec112subsec7_smooth">(7)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="9" href="#sec112subsec9_smooth">(9)</A> apply, with necessary modifications, in respect of a settlement under this section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (9).</P>
 
<a name="sec101.1subsec4" id="sec101_1subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Application to void settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="101.1" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If, upon application to the Board, the employee or employer demonstrates that he, she or it entered into a settlement under this section as a result of fraud or coercion, </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the settlement is void;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the complaint is deemed never to have been withdrawn;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the investigation of the complaint is resumed; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  any proceeding respecting the contravention alleged in the complaint that was terminated is resumed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (9).</P>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="101.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec101.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=101.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="101.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="101.2" data-viibes-start="193" data-viibes-end="192"><B><a name="sec101.2" id="sec101_2"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="101.2" subsection="null" alinea="null">101.2 </SPAN></B>Repealed:  2000, c. 41, s. 101.2 (7).</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Meeting may be required</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="102" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec102" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=102"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="102" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="8" data-noteup-count-display="8"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="102" data-viibes-start="194" data-viibes-end="193"><A name="BK238"></A><B><a name="sec102subsec1" id="sec102subsec1"></A><a name="sec102" id="sec102"></A>102 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="102" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer may, after giving at least 15 days written notice, require any of the persons referred to in subsection (2) to attend a meeting with the officer in the following circumstances:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The officer is investigating a complaint against an employer.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The officer, while inspecting a place under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" href="#sec91_smooth">section 91</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="92" href="#sec92_smooth">92</A>, comes to have reasonable grounds to believe that an employer has contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The officer acquires information that suggests to him or her the possibility that an employer may have contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  The officer wishes to determine whether the employer of an employee who resides in the employer’s residence is complying with this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 102 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96803-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-32/latest/so-2009-c-32.html">2009, c. 32, s. 51 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec2" id="sec102subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Attendees</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Any of the following persons may be required to attend the meeting:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The employer.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employer is a corporation, a director or employee of the corporation.  2000, c. 41, s. 102 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec3" id="sec102subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The notice referred to in subsection (1) shall specify the time and place at which the person is to attend and shall be served on the person in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 5 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec4" id="sec102subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Documents</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The employment standards officer may require the person to bring to the meeting or make available for the meeting any records or other documents specified in the notice.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 5 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec5" id="sec102subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The employment standards officer may give directions on how to make records or other documents available for the meeting.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 5 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec6" id="sec102subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Compliance</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> A person who receives a notice under this section shall comply with it.  2000, c. 41, s. 102 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec7" id="sec102subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Use of technology</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The employment standards officer may direct that a meeting under this section be held using technology, including but not limited to teleconference and videoconference technology, that allows the persons participating in the meeting to participate concurrently.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 5 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec8" id="sec102subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Where an employment standards officer gives directions under subsection (7) respecting a meeting, he or she shall include in the notice referred to in subsection (1) such information additional to that required by subsection (3) as the officer considers appropriate.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 5 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec9" id="sec102subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Participation in a meeting by means described in subsection (7) is attendance at the meeting for the purposes of this section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 5 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec10" id="sec102subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Determination if person fails to attend, etc.</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> If a person served with a notice under this section fails to attend the meeting or fails to bring or make available any records or other documents as required by the notice, the officer may determine whether an employer has contravened or is contravening this Act on the basis of the following factors:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  If the employer failed to comply with the notice, </P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  any evidence or submissions provided by or on behalf of the employer before the meeting, and </P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  any evidence or submissions provided by or on behalf of the employee before or during the meeting.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the employee failed to comply with the notice, </P>
 
<P class="subpara">  i.  any evidence or submissions provided by or on behalf of the employee before the meeting, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  ii.  any evidence or submissions provided by or on behalf of the employer before or during the meeting. </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Any other factors that the officer considers relevant.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (10).</P>
 
<a name="sec102subsec11" id="sec102subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Employer includes representative</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (10), if the employer is a corporation, a reference to an employer includes a director or employee who was served with a notice requiring him or her to attend the meeting or to bring or make available any records or other documents.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (10).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Time for response</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="102.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec102.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=102.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="102.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="102.1" data-viibes-start="195" data-viibes-end="194"><A name="BK239"></A><B><a name="sec102.1subsec1" id="sec102_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec102.1" id="sec102_1"></A>102.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="102.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer may, in any of the following circumstances and after giving notice, require an employee or an employer to provide evidence or submissions to the officer within the time that he or she specifies in the notice:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The officer is investigating a complaint against an employer.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The officer, while inspecting a place under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" href="#sec91_smooth">section 91</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="92" href="#sec92_smooth">92</A>, comes to have reasonable grounds to believe that an employer has contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The officer acquires information that suggests to him or her the possibility that an employer may have contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  The officer wishes to determine whether the employer of an employee who resides in the employer’s residence is complying with this Act.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (11).</P>
 
<a name="sec102.1subsec2" id="sec102_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Service of notice</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The notice shall be served on the employer or employee in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (11).</P>
 
<a name="sec102.1subsec3" id="sec102_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Determination if person fails to respond</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="102.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If a person served with a notice under this section fails to provide evidence or submissions as required by the notice, the officer may determine whether the employer has contravened or is contravening this Act on the basis of the following factors:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Any evidence or submissions provided by or on behalf of the employer or the employee before the notice was served.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Any evidence or submissions provided by or on behalf of the employer or the employee in response to and within the time specified in the notice.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Any other factors that the officer considers relevant.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96821-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2010-c-16/latest/so-2010-c-16.html">2010, c. 16</A>, Sched. 9, s. 1 (11).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Order to pay wages</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="103" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec103" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=103"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="103" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="403" data-noteup-count-display="403"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="103" data-viibes-start="196" data-viibes-end="195"><A name="BK240"></A><B><a name="sec103subsec1" id="sec103subsec1"></A><a name="sec103" id="sec103"></A>103 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="103" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds that an employer owes wages to an employee, the officer may,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  arrange with the employer that the employer pay the wages directly to the employee;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">a.1</A>)  order the employer to pay wages to the employee; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  order the employer to pay the amount of wages to the Director in trust.  2000, c. 41, s. 103 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="54" href="#sec54_smooth">s. 54</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec2" id="sec103subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Administrative costs</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An order issued under clause (1) (b) shall also require the employer to pay to the Director in trust an amount for administrative costs equal to the greater of $100 and 10 per cent of the wages owing.  2000, c. 41, s. 103 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec3" id="sec103subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">If more than one employee</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A single order may be issued with respect to wages owing to more than one employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 103 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec4" id="sec103subsec4"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN>, (4.1) Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 7 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec5" id="sec103subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Contents of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The order shall contain information setting out the nature of the amount found to be owing to the employee or be accompanied by that information.  2000, c. 41, s. 103 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec6" id="sec103subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Service of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The order shall be served on the employer in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 6</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec7" id="sec103subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Notice to employee</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employment standards officer who issues an order with respect to an employee under this section shall advise the employee of its issuance by serving a letter, in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>, on the employee.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 6</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec7.1" id="sec103subsec7_1"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="7.1" alinea="null">(7.1)</SPAN>-(7.2) Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 6</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec8" id="sec103subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Compliance</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Every employer against whom an order is issued under this section shall comply with it according to its terms.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 6</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec9" id="sec103subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> If an employer fails to apply under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">section</A><B><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">
</A></B><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">116</A> for a review of an order issued under this section within the time allowed for applying for that review, the order becomes final and binding against the employer.  2000, c. 41, s. 103 (9).</P>
 
<a name="sec103subsec10" id="sec103subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="103" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> Subsection (9) applies even if a review hearing is held under this Act to determine another person’s liability for the wages that are the subject of the order.  2000, c. 41, s. 103 (10).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Orders for compensation or reinstatement</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="104" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec104" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=104"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="104" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="63" data-noteup-count-display="63"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="104" data-viibes-start="197" data-viibes-end="196"><A name="BK241"></A><B><a name="sec104subsec1" id="sec104subsec1"></A><a name="sec104" id="sec104"></A>104 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="104" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds a contravention of any of the following Parts with respect to an employee, the officer may order that the employee be compensated for any loss he or she incurred as a result of the contravention or that he or she be reinstated or that he or she be both compensated and reinstated:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Part XIV (Leaves of Absence).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Part XVI (Lie Detectors).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Part XVII (Retail Business Establishments).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Part XVIII (Reprisal).  2000, c. 41, s. 104 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 7</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec104subsec2" id="sec104subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Order to hire</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="104" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employment standards officer who finds a contravention of Part XVI may order that an applicant for employment or an applicant to be a police officer be hired by an employer as defined in that Part or may order that he or she be compensated by an employer as defined in that Part or that he or she be both hired and compensated.  2000, c. 41, s. 104 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec104subsec3" id="sec104subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Terms of orders</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="104" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an order made under this section requires a person to compensate an employee, it shall also require the person to,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  pay to the Director in trust,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  the amount of the compensation, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  an amount for administration costs equal to the greater of $100 and 10 per cent of the amount of compensation; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  pay the amount of the compensation to the employee. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="55" href="#sec55_smooth">s. 55</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec104subsec4" id="sec104subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">How orders apply</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="104" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="3" href="#sec103subsec3_smooth">Subsections 103 (3)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="5" href="#sec103subsec5_smooth">(5)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A> apply, with necessary modifications, with respect to orders issued under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 104 (4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Employee cannot be found</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="105" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec105" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=105"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="105" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="105" data-viibes-start="198" data-viibes-end="197"><A name="BK242"></A><B><a name="sec105subsec1" id="sec105subsec1"></A><a name="sec105" id="sec105"></A>105 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="105" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer has arranged with an employer or ordered an employer to pay wages under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="1" href="#sec103subsec1_smooth">clause 103 (1)</A> (a) or (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">a.1</A>) to the employee and the employer is unable to locate the employee despite having made reasonable efforts to do so, the employer shall pay the wages to the Director in trust. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="56" href="#sec56_smooth">s. 56</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec105subsec2" id="sec105subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Settlements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="105" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer has received money for an employee under a settlement but the employee cannot be located, the money shall be paid to the Director in trust.  2000, c. 41, s. 105 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec105subsec3" id="sec105subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">When money vests in Crown</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="105" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Money paid to or held by the Director in trust under this section vests in the Crown but may, without interest, be paid out to the employee, the employee’s estate or such other person as the Director considers is entitled to it.  2000, c. 41, s. 105 (3).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Order against director, Part XX</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="106" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec106" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=106"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="106" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="58" data-noteup-count-display="58"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="106" data-viibes-start="199" data-viibes-end="198"><A name="BK243"></A><B><a name="sec106subsec1" id="sec106subsec1"></A><a name="sec106" id="sec106"></A>106 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="106" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer makes an order against an employer that wages be paid, he or she may make an order to pay wages for which directors are liable under Part XX against some or all of the directors of the employer and may serve a copy of the order in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A> on them together with a copy of the order to pay against the employer.  2000, c. 41, s. 106 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 8 (1)</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec106subsec2" id="sec106subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="106" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the directors do not comply with the order or do not apply to have it reviewed, the order becomes final and binding against those directors even though a review hearing is held to determine another person’s liability under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 106 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec106subsec3" id="sec106subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Orders, insolvent employer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="106" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an employer is insolvent and the employee has caused a claim for unpaid wages to be filed with the receiver appointed by a court with respect to the employer or with the employer’s trustee in bankruptcy, and the claim has not been paid, the employment standards officer may issue an order to pay wages for which directors are liable under Part XX against some or all of the directors and shall serve it on them in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 106 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 8 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec106subsec4" id="sec106subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Procedure</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="106" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsection (2) applies with necessary modifications to an order made under subsection (3).  2000, c. 41, s. 106 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec106subsec5" id="sec106subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Maximum liability</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="106" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Nothing in this section increases the maximum liability of a director beyond the amounts set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="81" href="#sec81_smooth">section 81</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 106 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec106subsec6" id="sec106subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Payment to Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="106" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> At the discretion of the Director, a director who is subject to an order under this section may be ordered to pay the wages in trust to the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 106 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec106subsec7" id="sec106subsec7"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="106" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN>-(9)  Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 8 (3)</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Further order, Part XX</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="107" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec107" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=107"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="107" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="17" data-noteup-count-display="17"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="107" data-viibes-start="200" data-viibes-end="199"><A name="BK244"></A><B><a name="sec107subsec1" id="sec107subsec1"></A><a name="sec107" id="sec107"></A>107 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="107" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer may make an order to pay wages for which directors are liable under Part XX against some or all of the directors of an employer who were not the subject of an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" href="#sec106_smooth">section 106</A>, and may serve it on them in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  after an employment standards officer has made an order against the employer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">section 103</A> that wages be paid and they have not been paid and the employer has not applied to have the order reviewed;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  after an employment standards officer has made an order against directors under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" ss="1" href="#sec106subsec1_smooth">subsection 106 (1)</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" ss="3" href="#sec106subsec3_smooth">(3)</A> and the amount has not been paid and the employer or the directors have not applied to have it reviewed;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  after the Board has issued, amended or affirmed an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" href="#sec119_smooth">section 119</A> if the order, as issued, amended or affirmed, requires the employer or the directors to pay wages and the amount set out in the order has not been paid.  2000, c. 41, s. 107 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 9 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec107subsec2" id="sec107subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Payment to Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="107" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> At the discretion of the Director, a director who is subject to an order under this section may be ordered to pay the wages in trust to the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 107 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec107subsec3" id="sec107subsec3"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="107" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 9 (2)</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Compliance order</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="108" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec108" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=108"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="108" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="34" data-noteup-count-display="34"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="108" data-viibes-start="201" data-viibes-end="200"><A name="BK245"></A><B><a name="sec108subsec1" id="sec108subsec1"></A><a name="sec108" id="sec108"></A>108 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="108" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds that a person has contravened a provision of this Act or the regulations, the officer may,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  order that the person cease contravening the provision;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  order what action the person shall take or refrain from taking in order to comply with the provision; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  specify a date by which the person must do so.  2000, c. 41, s. 108 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec108subsec2" id="sec108subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Payment may not be required</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="108" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> No order under this section shall require the payment of wages, fees or compensation.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 10</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec108subsec3" id="sec108subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Other means not a bar</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="108" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (2) precludes an employment standards officer from issuing an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" href="#sec106_smooth">106</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="107" href="#sec107_smooth">107</A> and an order under this section in respect of the same contravention.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 10</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, s. 22 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec108subsec4" id="sec108subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="6" href="#sec103subsec6_smooth">s. 103 (6)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="108" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="6" href="#sec103subsec6_smooth">Subsections 103 (6)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" ss="9" href="#sec103subsec9_smooth">(9)</A> apply with respect to orders issued under this section with necessary modifications, including but not limited to the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A reference to an employer includes a reference to a client of a temporary help agency, a recruiter or a prospective employer who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find or attempt to find an employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A reference to an employee includes a reference to an assignment employee, a prospective assignment employee or a prospective employee who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find employment in Ontario.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 10</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="57" href="#sec57_smooth">s. 57</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="22" href="#sec22_smooth">s. 22</A> (2, 3).</P>
 
<a name="sec108subsec5" id="sec108subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Injunction proceeding</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="108" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> At the instance of the Director, the contravention of an order made under subsection (1) may be restrained upon an application, made without notice, to a judge of the Superior Court of Justice.  2000, c. 41, s. 108 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec108subsec6" id="sec108subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="108" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Subsection (5) applies with respect to a contravention of an order in addition to any other remedy or penalty for its contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 108 (6).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Money paid when no review</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="109" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec109" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=109"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="109" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="109" data-viibes-start="202" data-viibes-end="201"><A name="BK246"></A><B><a name="sec109subsec1" id="sec109subsec1"></A><a name="sec109" id="sec109"></A>109 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="109" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Money paid to the Director under an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" href="#sec106_smooth">106</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="107" href="#sec107_smooth"> 107</A> shall be paid to the person with respect to whom the order was issued unless an application for review is made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">section 116</A> within the period required under that section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 11</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23" href="#sec23_smooth">s. 23</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec109subsec2" id="sec109subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Money distributed rateably</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="109" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the money paid to the Director under one of those orders is not enough to pay all of the persons entitled to it under the order the full amount to which they are entitled, the Director shall distribute that money, including money received with respect to administrative costs, to the persons in proportion to their entitlement.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 11</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec109subsec3" id="sec109subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">No proceeding against Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="109" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> No proceeding shall be instituted against the Director for acting in compliance with this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 109 (3).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Refusal to issue order</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="110" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec110" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=110"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="110" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="7" data-noteup-count-display="7"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="110" data-viibes-start="203" data-viibes-end="202"><A name="BK247"></A><B><a name="sec110subsec1" id="sec110subsec1"></A><a name="sec110" id="sec110"></A>110 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="110" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If, after a person files a complaint alleging a contravention of this Act in respect of which an order could be issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="108" href="#sec108_smooth">108</A>, an employment standards officer assigned to investigate the complaint refuses to issue such an order, the officer shall, in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>, serve a letter on the person advising the person of the refusal.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 12</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="24" href="#sec24_smooth">s. 24</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec110subsec2" id="sec110subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Deemed refusal</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="110" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If no order is issued with respect to a complaint described in subsection (1) within two years after it was filed, an employment standards officer shall be deemed to have refused to issue an order and to have served a letter on the person advising the person of the refusal on the last day of the second year.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 12</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Time limit on recovery, employee’s complaint</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="111" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec111" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=111"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="111" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="207" data-noteup-count-display="207"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="111" data-viibes-start="204" data-viibes-end="203"><A name="BK248"></A><B><a name="sec111subsec1" id="sec111subsec1"></A><a name="sec111" id="sec111"></A>111 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="111" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employee files a complaint alleging a contravention of this Act or the regulations, the employment standards officer investigating the complaint may not issue an order for wages that became due to the employee under the provision that was the subject of the complaint or any other provision of this Act or the regulations if the wages became due more than two years before the complaint was filed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec22" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="22" data-link-type="weak" rank="1">s. 1 (22)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 8 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec111subsec2" id="sec111subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same, another employee’s complaint</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="111" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If, in the course of investigating a complaint, an employment standards officer finds that an employer has contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an employee who did not file a complaint, the officer may not issue an order for wages that became due to that employee as a result of that contravention if the wages became due more than two years before the complaint was filed.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec22" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="22" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (22)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 8 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec111subsec3" id="sec111subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Same, inspection</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="111" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer finds during an inspection that an employer has contravened this Act or the regulations with respect to an employee, the officer may not issue an order for wages that became due to the employee more than two years before the officer commenced the inspection.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec22" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="22" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (22)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 8 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec111subsec3.1" id="sec111subsec3_1"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="111" subsection="3.1" alinea="null">(3.1)</SPAN>-(8) Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, s. 8 (6).</P>
 

 
<A name="Settlements__422591"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK249"></A>Settlements</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Settlement</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="112" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec112" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=112"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="112" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="58" data-noteup-count-display="58"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="112" data-viibes-start="205" data-viibes-end="204"><A name="BK250"></A><B><a name="sec112subsec1" id="sec112subsec1"></A><a name="sec112" id="sec112"></A>112 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="112" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (8), if an employee and an employer who have agreed to a settlement respecting a contravention or alleged contravention of this Act inform an employment standards officer in writing of the terms of the settlement and do what they agreed to do under it,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the settlement is binding on the parties;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  any complaint filed by the employee respecting the contravention or alleged contravention is deemed to have been withdrawn;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  any order made in respect of the contravention or alleged contravention is void; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  any proceeding, other than a prosecution, respecting the contravention or alleged contravention is terminated.  2000, c. 41, s. 112 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec2" id="sec112subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Compliance orders</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Clause (1) (c) does not apply with respect to an order issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="108" href="#sec108_smooth">section 108</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 112 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec3" id="sec112subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Notices of contravention</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> This section does not apply with respect to a notice of contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 112 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec4" id="sec112subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Payment by officer</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer receives money for an employee under this section, the officer may pay it directly to the employee or to the Director in trust.  2000, c. 41, s. 112 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec5" id="sec112subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If money is paid in trust to the Director under subsection (4), the Director shall pay it to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 112 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec6" id="sec112subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Administrative costs and collector fees</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If the settlement concerns an order to pay, the Director is, despite clause (1) (c), entitled to be paid,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  that proportion of the administrative costs that were ordered to be paid that is the same as the proportion of the amount of wages, fees or compensation ordered to be paid that the employee is entitled to receive under the settlement; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  that proportion of the collector’s fees and disbursements that were added to the amount of the order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="128" ss="2" href="#sec128subsec2_smooth">subsection 128 (2)</A> that is the same as the proportion of the amount of wages, fees or compensation ordered to be paid that the employee is entitled to receive under the settlement. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 58 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec7" id="sec112subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Restrictions on settlements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> No person shall enter into a settlement which would permit or require that person or any other person to engage in future contraventions of this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 112 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec7.1" id="sec112subsec7_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="7.1" alinea="null">(7.1)</SPAN> For greater certainty, no person shall enter into a settlement that would permit or require a temporary help agency or recruiter to operate or continue to operate without a licence in contravention of this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, s. 25 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec8" id="sec112subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Application to void settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If, upon application to the Board, the employee demonstrates that he or she entered into the settlement as a result of fraud or coercion,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the settlement is void;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the complaint is deemed never to have been withdrawn;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  any order made in respect of the contravention or alleged contravention is reinstated;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  any proceedings respecting the contravention or alleged contravention that were terminated shall be resumed.  2000, c. 41, s. 112 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec112subsec9" id="sec112subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Application to Part XVIII.1</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="112" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> For the purposes of the application of this section in respect of Part XVIII.1, the following modifications apply:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A reference to an employer includes a reference to a client of a temporary help agency, a recruiter or a prospective employer who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find or attempt to find an employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A reference to an employee includes a reference to an assignment employee, a prospective assignment employee or a prospective employee who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find employment in Ontario.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 13 (2)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 58 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="25" href="#sec25_smooth">s. 25</A> (2, 3).</P>
 

 
<A name="Notices_of_Contravention__427231"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK251"></A>Notices of Contravention</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Notice of contravention</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="113" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec113" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=113"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="113" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="54" data-noteup-count-display="54"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="113" data-viibes-start="206" data-viibes-end="205"><A name="BK252"></A><B><a name="sec113subsec1" id="sec113subsec1"></A><a name="sec113" id="sec113"></A>113 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="113" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employment standards officer believes that a person has contravened a provision of this Act, the officer may issue a notice to the person setting out the officer’s belief and specifying the amount of the penalty for the contravention. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 59 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec113subsec1.1" id="sec113subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Amount of penalty</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> The amount of the penalty shall be determined in accordance with the regulations. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 59 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec1.2" id="sec113subsec1_2"></A><P class="headnote">Penalty within range</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="1.2" alinea="null">(1.2)</SPAN> If a range has been prescribed as the penalty for a contravention, the employment standards officer shall determine the amount of the penalty in accordance with the prescribed criteria, if any. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 59 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec2" id="sec113subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The notice shall contain or be accompanied by information setting out the nature of the contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 113 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec3" id="sec113subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Service</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A notice issued under this section shall be served on the person in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 14 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec4" id="sec113subsec4"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 14 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec5" id="sec113subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Deemed contravention</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The person shall be deemed to have contravened the provision set out in the notice if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the person fails to apply to the Board for a review of the notice within the period set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="122" ss="1" href="#sec122subsec1_smooth">subsection 122 (1)</A>; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the person applies to the Board for a review of the notice and the Board finds that the person contravened the provision set out in the notice.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec6" id="sec113subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Penalty</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> A person who is deemed to have contravened this Act shall pay to the Minister of Finance the penalty for the deemed contravention and the amount of any collector’s fees and disbursements added to the amount under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="128" ss="2" href="#sec128subsec2_smooth">subsection 128 (2)</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (23)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec6.1" id="sec113subsec6_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="6.1" alinea="null">(6.1)</SPAN> The payment under subsection (6) shall be made within 30 days after the day the notice of contravention was served or, if the notice of contravention is appealed, within 30 days after the Board finds that there was a contravention.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec23" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="23" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (23)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec29" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="29" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (29)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec6.2" id="sec113subsec6_2"></A><P class="headnote">Publication re notice of contraventions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="6.2" alinea="null">(6.2)</SPAN> If a person, including an individual, is deemed under subsection (5) to have contravened this Act after being issued a notice of contravention, the Director may publish or otherwise make available to the general public the name of the person, a description of the deemed contravention, the date of the deemed contravention and the penalty for the deemed contravention. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 59 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec6.3" id="sec113subsec6_3"></A><P class="headnote">Internet publication</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="6.3" alinea="null">(6.3)</SPAN> Authority to publish under subsection (6.2) includes authority to publish on the Internet. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 59 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec6.4" id="sec113subsec6_4"></A><P class="headnote">Disclosure</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="6.4" alinea="null">(6.4)</SPAN> Any disclosure made under subsection (6.2) shall be deemed to be in compliance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" s="42" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html#sec42subsec1_smooth">clause 42 (1)</A> (e) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html">Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act</A></I>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 59 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec7" id="sec113subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Other means not a bar</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> An employment standards officer may issue a notice to a person under this section even though an order has been or may be issued against the person under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="108" href="#sec108_smooth">108</A> or the person has been or may be prosecuted for or convicted of an offence with respect to the same contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 113 (7); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 14 (2)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="26" href="#sec26_smooth">s. 26</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec8" id="sec113subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Trade union</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> This section does not apply with respect to a contravention of this Act with respect to an employee who is represented by a trade union.  2000, c. 41, s. 113 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec113subsec9" id="sec113subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="113" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> This section does not apply with respect to a contravention of this Act by a director or officer of an employer that is a corporation.  2000, c. 41, s. 113 (9).</P>
 

 
<A name="Limitation_Period__431797"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK253"></A>Limitation Period</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Limitation period re orders and notices</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="114" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec114" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=114"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="114" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="51" data-noteup-count-display="51"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="114" data-viibes-start="207" data-viibes-end="206"><A name="BK254"></A><B><a name="sec114subsec1" id="sec114subsec1"></A><a name="sec114" id="sec114"></A>114 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="114" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> An employment standards officer shall not issue an order to pay wages, fees or compensation or a notice of contravention with respect to a contravention of this Act concerning an employee,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  if the employee filed a complaint about the contravention, more than two years after the complaint was filed;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the employee did not file a complaint but another employee of the same employer did file a complaint, more than two years after the other employee filed his or her complaint if the officer discovered the contravention with respect to the employee while investigating the complaint; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  if the employee did not file a complaint and clause (b) does not apply, more than two years after an employment standards officer commenced an inspection with respect to the employee’s employer for the purpose of determining whether a contravention occurred.  2000, c. 41, s. 114 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 15 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec114subsec2" id="sec114subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Complaints from different employees</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="114" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an employee files a complaint about a contravention of this Act by his or her employer and another employee of the same employer has previously filed a complaint about substantially the same contravention, subsection (1) shall be applied as if the employee who filed the subsequent complaint did not file a complaint.  2000, c. 41, s. 114 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec114subsec3" id="sec114subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="114" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (2) does not apply if, prior to the day on which the subsequent complaint was filed, an employment standards officer had, with respect to the earlier complaint, already issued an order or advised the complainant that he or she was refusing to issue an order.  2000, c. 41, s. 114 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec114subsec4" id="sec114subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction on rescission or amendment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="114" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An employment standards officer shall not amend or rescind an order to pay wages, fees or compensation after the last day on which he or she could have issued that order under subsection (1) unless the employer against whom the order was issued and the employee with respect to whom it was issued consent to the rescission or amendment.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec24" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="24" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (24)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 15 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec114subsec5" id="sec114subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="114" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> An employment standards officer shall not amend or rescind a notice of contravention after the last day on which he or she could have issued that notice under subsection (1) unless the employer against whom the notice was issued consents to the rescission or amendment.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec24" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="24" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (24)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec114subsec6" id="sec114subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Application to Part XVIII.1</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="114" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> For the purposes of the application of this section in respect of Part XVIII.1, the following modifications apply:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A reference to an employer includes a reference to a client of a temporary help agency, a recruiter or a prospective employer who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find or attempt to find an employee.</P>
