<P class="paragraph">  2.  A reference to an employee includes a reference to an assignment employee, a prospective assignment employee or a prospective employee who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find employment in Ontario.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 15 (3)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" href="#sec60_smooth">s. 60</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="27" href="#sec27_smooth">s. 27</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Meaning of “substantially the same”</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="115" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec115" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=115"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="115" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9" data-noteup-count-display="9"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="115" data-viibes-start="208" data-viibes-end="207"><A name="BK255"></A><B><a name="sec115subsec1" id="sec115subsec1"></A><a name="sec115" id="sec115"></A>115 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="115" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> For the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="114" href="#sec114_smooth">section 114</A>, contraventions with respect to two employees are substantially the same if both employees became entitled to recover money under this Act as a result of the employer’s failure to comply with the same provision of this Act or the regulations or with identical or virtually identical provisions of their employment contracts.  2000, c. 41, s. 115 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec115subsec1.1" id="sec115subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Application to Part XVIII.1</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="115" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> For the purposes of the application of subsection (1) in respect of Part XVIII.1, the following modifications apply:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A reference to an employer includes a reference to a client of a temporary help agency, a recruiter or a prospective employer who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find or attempt to find an employee.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  A reference to an employee includes a reference to an assignment employee, a prospective assignment employee or a prospective employee who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find employment in Ontario.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 16</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="61" href="#sec61_smooth">s. 61</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="28" href="#sec28_smooth">s. 28</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec115subsec2" id="sec115subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Exception, payment of wages, deductions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="115" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Despite subsection (1), contraventions with respect to two employees are not substantially the same merely because both employees became entitled to recover money under this Act as a result of a contravention of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" href="#sec11_smooth">section 11</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="13" href="#sec13_smooth"> 13</A> if the contravention of the section was with respect to wages due under different provisions of this Act or the regulations or under provisions of their employment contracts which are not identical or virtually identical.  2000, c. 41, s. 115 (2).</P>
 

 
<A name="part_xxiII_reviews_by_the_board_437291"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK256"></A>part xxiII <BR>  reviews by the board</P>
 
<A name="Reviews_of_Orders__437374"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK257"></A>Reviews of Orders</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Interpretation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="115.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec115.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=115.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="115.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="115.1" data-viibes-start="209" data-viibes-end="208"><A name="BK258"></A><B><a name="sec115.1" id="sec115_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="115.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">115.1</SPAN> </B>In this Part, a reference to an employee includes a reference to an assignment employee, a prospective assignment employee or a prospective employee who engages or uses the services of a recruiter to find employment in Ontario.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 17</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="62" href="#sec62_smooth">s. 62</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="29" href="#sec29_smooth">s. 29</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Review</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="116" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec116" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=116"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="116" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="18941" data-noteup-count-display="18k"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="116" data-viibes-start="210" data-viibes-end="209"><A name="BK259"></A><B><a name="sec116subsec1" id="sec116subsec1"></A><a name="sec116" id="sec116"></A>116 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="116" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A person against whom an order has been issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" href="#sec106_smooth">106</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="107" href="#sec107_smooth">107</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="108" href="#sec108_smooth"> 108</A> is entitled to a review of the order by the Board if, within the period set out in subsection (4), the person,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  applies to the Board in writing for a review;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the case of an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, pays the amount owing under the order to the Director in trust or provides the Director with an irrevocable letter of credit acceptable to the Director in that amount; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  in the case of an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">section 74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A>, pays the lesser of the amount owing under the order and $10,000 to the Director in trust or provides the Director with an irrevocable letter of credit acceptable to the Director in that amount.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="30" href="#sec30_smooth">s. 30</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec2" id="sec116subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Employee seeks review of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an order has been issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth"> 104</A> with respect to an employee, the employee is entitled to a review of the order by the Board if, within the period set out in subsection (4), the employee applies to the Board in writing for a review.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="30" href="#sec30_smooth">s. 30</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec3" id="sec116subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Employee seeks review of refusal</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an employee has filed a complaint alleging a contravention of this Act or the regulations and an order could be issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="108" href="#sec108_smooth"> 108</A> with respect to such a contravention, the employee is entitled to a review of an employment standards officer’s refusal to issue such an order if, within the period set out in subsection (4), the employee applies to the Board in writing for such a review.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="30" href="#sec30_smooth">s. 30</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec4" id="sec116subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Period for applying for review</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> An application for a review under subsection (1), (2) or (3) shall be made within 30 days after the day on which the order, letter advising of the order or letter advising of the refusal to issue an order, as the case may be, is served.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec5" id="sec116subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Extension of time</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The Board may extend the time for applying for a review under this section if it considers it appropriate in the circumstances to do so and, in the case of an application under subsection (1),</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the Board has enquired of the Director whether the Director has paid to the employee the wages, fees or compensation that were the subject of the order and is satisfied that the Director has not done so; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the Board has enquired of the Director whether a collector’s fees or disbursements have been added to the amount of the order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="128" ss="2" href="#sec128subsec2_smooth">subsection 128 (2)</A> and, if so, the Board is satisfied that fees and disbursements were paid by the person against whom the order was issued.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec6" id="sec116subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Hearing</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="118" ss="2" href="#sec118subsec2_smooth">subsection 118 (2)</A>, the Board shall hold a hearing for the purposes of the review.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec7" id="sec116subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Parties</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The following are parties to the review:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The applicant for the review of an order.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  If the person against whom an order was issued applies for the review, the employee with respect to whom the order was issued.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  If the employee applies for the review of an order, the person against whom the order was issued.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  If the employee applies for a review of a refusal to issue an order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="108" href="#sec108_smooth">108</A>, the person against whom such an order could be issued.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  If a director of a corporation applies for the review, the applicant and each director, other than the applicant, on whom the order was served.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  The Director.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  Any other persons specified by the Board.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="30" href="#sec30_smooth">s. 30</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec8" id="sec116subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Parties given full opportunity</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> The Board shall give the parties full opportunity to present their evidence and make their submissions.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec116subsec9" id="sec116subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Practice and procedure for review</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="116" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> The Board shall determine its own practice and procedure with respect to a review under this section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 18</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Money held in trust pending review</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="117" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec117" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=117"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="117" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="31" data-noteup-count-display="31"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="117" data-viibes-start="211" data-viibes-end="210"><A name="BK260"></A><B><a name="sec117subsec1" id="sec117subsec1"></A><a name="sec117" id="sec117"></A>117 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="117" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies if money with respect to an order to pay wages, fees or compensation is paid to the Director in trust and the person against whom the order was issued applies to the Board for a review of the order.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 19</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec117subsec2" id="sec117subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Interest-bearing account</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="117" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The money held in trust shall be held in an interest-bearing account while the application for review is pending.  2000, c. 41, s. 117 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec117subsec3" id="sec117subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">If settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="117" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the matter is settled under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" href="#sec112_smooth">section 112</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" href="#sec120_smooth">120</A>, the amount held in trust shall, subject to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" ss="6" href="#sec112subsec6_smooth">subsection 112 (6)</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" ss="6" href="#sec120subsec6_smooth">120 (6)</A>, be paid out in accordance with the settlement, with interest, calculated at the rate and in the manner determined by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88" ss="5" href="#sec88subsec5_smooth">subsection 88 (5)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 117 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec117subsec4" id="sec117subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">If no settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="117" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If the matter is not settled under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="112" href="#sec112_smooth">section 112</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" href="#sec120_smooth">120</A>, the amount paid into trust shall be paid out in accordance with the Board’s decision together with interest calculated at the rate and in the manner determined by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88" ss="5" href="#sec88subsec5_smooth">subsection 88 (5)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 117 (4).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Rules of practice</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="118" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec118" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=118"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="118" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="29" data-noteup-count-display="29"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="118" data-viibes-start="212" data-viibes-end="211"><A name="BK261"></A><B><a name="sec118subsec1" id="sec118subsec1"></A><a name="sec118" id="sec118"></A>118 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="118" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The chair of the Board may make rules,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  governing the Board’s practice and procedure and the exercise of its powers; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  providing for forms and their use.  2000, c. 41, s. 118 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec27" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="27" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (27)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec118subsec2" id="sec118subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Expedited decisions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="118" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The chair of the Board may make rules to expedite decisions about the Board’s jurisdiction, and those rules,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  may provide that the Board is not required to hold a hearing; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" ss="8" href="#sec116subsec8_smooth">subsection 116 (8)</A>, may limit the extent to which the Board is required to give full opportunity to the parties to present their evidence and to make their submissions.  2000, c. 41, s. 118 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec118subsec3" id="sec118subsec3"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="118" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23" href="#sec23_smooth">s. 23</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec118subsec4" id="sec118subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Conflict with <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="474-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-s22/latest/rso-1990-c-s22.html">Statutory Powers Procedure Act</A></I></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="118" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If there is a conflict between the rules made under this section and the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="474-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-s22/latest/rso-1990-c-s22.html">Statutory Powers Procedure Act</A></I>, the rules under this section prevail.  2000, c. 41, s. 118 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec118subsec5" id="sec118subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Rules not regulations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="118" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Rules made under this section are not regulations within the meaning of Part III (Regulations) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="814-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2006-c-21-sch-f/latest/so-2006-c-21-sch-f.html">Legislation Act, 2006</A></I>.  2000, c. 41, s. 118 (5); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96714-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-21/latest/so-2006-c-21.html">2006, c. 21</A>, Sched. F, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="136" ss="1" href="#sec136subsec1_smooth">s. 136 (1)</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Powers of Board</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="119" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec119" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=119"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="119" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="283" data-noteup-count-display="283"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="119" data-viibes-start="213" data-viibes-end="212"><A name="BK262"></A><B><a name="sec119subsec1" id="sec119subsec1"></A><a name="sec119" id="sec119"></A>119 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="119" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section sets out the Board’s powers in a review under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">section 116</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec119subsec2" id="sec119subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Persons to represent groups</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If a group of parties have the same interest or substantially the same interest, the Board may designate one or more of the parties in the group to represent the group.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec3" id="sec119subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Quorum</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The chair or a vice-chair of the Board constitutes a quorum for the purposes of this section and is sufficient for the exercise of the jurisdiction and powers of the Board under it.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec4" id="sec119subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Posting of notices</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The Board may require a person to post and to keep posted any notices that the Board considers appropriate even if the person is not a party to the review.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec5" id="sec119subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If the Board requires a person to post and keep posted notices, the person shall post the notices and keep them posted in a conspicuous place or places in or upon the person’s premises where it is likely to come to the attention of other persons having an interest in the review.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec6" id="sec119subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Powers of Board</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The Board may, with necessary modifications, exercise the powers conferred on an employment standards officer under this Act and may substitute its findings for those of the officer who issued the order or refused to issue the order.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec7" id="sec119subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Dealing with order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Without restricting the generality of subsection (6),</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  on a review of an order, the Board may amend, rescind or affirm the order or issue a new order; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  on a review of a refusal to issue an order, the Board may issue an order or affirm the refusal.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec8" id="sec119subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Labour relations officers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> Any time after an application for review is made, the Board may direct a labour relations officer to examine any records or other documents and make any inquiries it considers appropriate, but it shall not direct an employment standards officer to do so.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec9" id="sec119subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Powers of labour relations officers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="91" href="#sec91_smooth">Sections 91</A> and<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="92" href="#sec92_smooth"> 92</A> apply with necessary modifications with respect to a labour relations officer acting under subsection (8).  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (9).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec10" id="sec119subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Wages or compensation owing</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> Subsection (11) applies if, during a review of an order requiring the payment of wages, fees or compensation or a review of a refusal to issue such an order,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the Board finds that a specified amount of wages, fees or compensation is owing; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  there is no dispute that a specified amount of wages, fees or compensation is owing.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (10); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 20 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec11" id="sec119subsec11"></A><P class="headnote">Interim order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> The Board shall affirm the order to the extent of the specified amount or issue an order to the extent of that amount, even though the review is not yet completed.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (11).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec12" id="sec119subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Interest</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> If the Board issues, amends or affirms an order or issues a new order requiring the payment of wages, fees or compensation, the Board may order the person against whom the order was issued to pay interest at the rate and calculated in the manner determined by the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88" ss="5" href="#sec88subsec5_smooth">subsection</A><B><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88" ss="5" href="#sec88subsec5_smooth">
</A></B><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="88" ss="5" href="#sec88subsec5_smooth">88 (5)</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 20 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec13" id="sec119subsec13"></A><P class="headnote">Decision final</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="13" alinea="null">(13)</SPAN> A decision of the Board is final and binding upon the parties to the review and any other parties as the Board may specify.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (13).</P>
 
<a name="sec119subsec14" id="sec119subsec14"></A><P class="headnote">Judicial review</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="119" subsection="14" alinea="null">(14)</SPAN> Nothing in subsection (13) prevents a court from reviewing a decision of the Board under this section, but a decision of the Board concerning the interpretation of this Act shall not be overturned unless the decision is unreasonable.  2000, c. 41, s. 119 (14).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Settlement through labour relations officer</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="120" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec120" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=120"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="120" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9594" data-noteup-count-display="9.6k"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="120" data-viibes-start="214" data-viibes-end="213"><A name="BK263"></A><B><a name="sec120subsec1" id="sec120subsec1"></A><a name="sec120" id="sec120"></A>120 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="120" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Board may authorize a labour relations officer to attempt to effect a settlement of the matters raised in an application for review under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">section 116</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 120 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec120subsec2" id="sec120subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Certain matters not bar to settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="120" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A settlement may be effected under this section even if,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the employment standards officer who issued the order or refused to issue the order does not participate in the settlement discussions or is not advised of the discussions or settlement; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the review under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">section 116</A> has started.  2000, c. 41, s. 120 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec120subsec3" id="sec120subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Compliance orders</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="120" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A settlement respecting a compliance order shall not be made if the Director has not approved the terms of the settlement.  2000, c. 41, s. 120 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec120subsec4" id="sec120subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Effect of settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="120" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If the parties to a settlement under this section do what they agreed to do under the settlement,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the settlement is binding on the parties;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the review concerns an order, the order is void; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the review is terminated.  2000, c. 41, s. 120 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec120subsec5" id="sec120subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Application to void settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="120" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If, upon application to the Board, the employee demonstrates that he or she entered into the settlement as a result of fraud or coercion,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the settlement is void;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the review concerned an order, the order is reinstated; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  the review shall be resumed.  2000, c. 41, s. 120 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec120subsec6" id="sec120subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Distribution</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="120" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If the order that was the subject of the application required the payment of money to the Director in trust, the Director,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  shall distribute the amount held in trust with respect to wages, fees or compensation in accordance with the settlement; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  despite clause (4) (b), is entitled to be paid,</P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (i)  that proportion of the administrative costs that were ordered to be paid that is the same as the proportion of the amount of wages, fees or compensation ordered to be paid that the employee is entitled to receive under the settlement, and </P>
 
<P class="subpara">  (ii)  that proportion of the collector’s fees and disbursements that were added to the amount of the order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="128" ss="2" href="#sec128subsec2_smooth">subsection 128 (2)</A> that is the same as the proportion of the amount of wages, fees or compensation ordered to be paid that the employee is entitled to receive under the settlement. 2000, c. 41, s. 120 (6); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 21</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="63" href="#sec63_smooth">s. 63</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Referral_of_Matter_under_Part_XIII__453069"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK264"></A>Referral of Matter under Part XIII</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Referral</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="121" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec121" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=121"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="121" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="121" data-viibes-start="215" data-viibes-end="214"><A name="BK265"></A><B><a name="sec121subsec1" id="sec121subsec1"></A><a name="sec121" id="sec121"></A>121 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="121" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If, as a result of a complaint or otherwise, the Director comes to believe that an employer, an organization of employers, an organization of employees or a person acting directly on behalf of any of them may have contravened Part XIII (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1507-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-286-01/latest/o-reg-286-01.html">Benefit Plans</A>), the Director may refer the matter to the Board.  2000, c. 41, s. 121 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec121subsec2" id="sec121subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Hearing</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="121" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If a matter is referred to the Board under subsection (1), the Board shall hold a hearing and determine whether the employer, organization or person contravened Part XIII.  2000, c. 41, s. 121 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec121subsec3" id="sec121subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Powers of Board</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="121" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the Board determines that the employer, organization or person acting directly on behalf of an employer or organization contravened Part XIII, the Board may order the employer, organization or person,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  to cease contravening that Part and to take whatever action the Board considers necessary to that end; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  to compensate any person or persons who may have suffered loss or been disadvantaged as a result of the contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 121 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec121subsec4" id="sec121subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Certain review provisions applicable</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="121" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" ss="8" href="#sec116subsec8_smooth">Subsections 116 (8)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" ss="9" href="#sec116subsec9_smooth">(9)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="118" ss="1" href="#sec118subsec1_smooth">118 (1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="118" ss="4" href="#sec118subsec4_smooth">(4)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="118" ss="5" href="#sec118subsec5_smooth">(5)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="1" href="#sec119subsec1_smooth">119 (1)</A> to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="5" href="#sec119subsec5_smooth">(5)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="8" href="#sec119subsec8_smooth">(8)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="9" href="#sec119subsec9_smooth">(9)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="13" href="#sec119subsec13_smooth">(13)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="14" href="#sec119subsec14_smooth">(14)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" ss="1" href="#sec120subsec1_smooth">120 (1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" ss="4" href="#sec120subsec4_smooth">(4)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="120" ss="5" href="#sec120subsec5_smooth">(5)</A> apply, with necessary modifications, with respect to a proceeding under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 121 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="24" href="#sec24_smooth">s. 24</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Review_of_Notice_of_Contravention__454790"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK266"></A>Review of Notice of Contravention</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Review of notice of contravention</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="122" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec122" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=122"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="122" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="225" data-noteup-count-display="225"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="122" data-viibes-start="216" data-viibes-end="215"><A name="BK267"></A><B><a name="sec122subsec1" id="sec122subsec1"></A><a name="sec122" id="sec122"></A>122 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="122" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A person against whom a notice of contravention has been issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="113" href="#sec113_smooth">section 113</A><B> </B>may dispute the notice if the person makes a written application to the Board for a review,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  within 30 days after the date of service of the notice; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the Board considers it appropriate in the circumstances to extend the time for applying, within the period specified by the Board.  2000, c. 41, s. 122 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec122subsec2" id="sec122subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Hearing</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="122" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Board shall hold a hearing for the purposes of the review.  2000, c. 41, s. 122 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec122subsec3" id="sec122subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Parties</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="122" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The parties to the review are the person against whom the notice was issued and the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 122 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec122subsec4" id="sec122subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Onus</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="122" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> On a review under this section, the onus is on the Director to establish, on a balance of probabilities, that the person against whom the notice of contravention was issued contravened the provision of this Act indicated in the notice.  2000, c. 41, s. 122 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec122subsec5" id="sec122subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Decision</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="122" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The Board may,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  find that the person did not contravene the provision and rescind the notice;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  find that the person did contravene the provision and affirm the notice; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  find that the person did contravene the provision but amend the notice by reducing the penalty.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec28" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="28" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (28)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec122subsec6" id="sec122subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Collector’s fees and disbursements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="122" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If the Board finds that the person contravened the provision and if it extended the time for applying for a review under clause (1) (b),</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  before issuing its decision, it shall enquire of the Director whether a collector’s fees and disbursements have been added to the amount set out in the notice under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="128" ss="2" href="#sec128subsec2_smooth">subsection 128 (2)</A>; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if they have been added to that amount, the Board shall advise the person of that fact and of the total amount, including the collector’s fees and disbursements, when it issues its decision.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec28" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="28" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (28)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec122subsec7" id="sec122subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Certain provisions applicable</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="122" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" ss="8" href="#sec116subsec8_smooth">Subsections 116 (8)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" ss="9" href="#sec116subsec9_smooth">(9)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="118" ss="1" href="#sec118subsec1_smooth">118 (1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="118" ss="4" href="#sec118subsec4_smooth">(4)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="118" ss="5" href="#sec118subsec5_smooth">(5)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="3" href="#sec119subsec3_smooth">119 (3)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="4" href="#sec119subsec4_smooth">(4)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="5" href="#sec119subsec5_smooth">(5)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="13" href="#sec119subsec13_smooth">(13)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="119" ss="14" href="#sec119subsec14_smooth">(14)</A> apply, with necessary modifications, to a review under this section.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec28" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="28" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (28)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="25" href="#sec25_smooth">s. 25</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="General_Provisions_Respecting_the_Board__457615"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK268"></A>General Provisions Respecting the Board</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Persons from Board not compellable</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="123" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec123" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=123"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="123" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="10" data-noteup-count-display="10"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="123" data-viibes-start="217" data-viibes-end="216"><A name="BK269"></A><B><a name="sec123subsec1" id="sec123subsec1"></A><a name="sec123" id="sec123"></A>123 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="123" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Except with the consent of the Board, none of the following persons may be compelled to give evidence in a civil proceeding or in a proceeding before the Board or another board or tribunal with respect to information obtained while exercising his or her powers or performing his or her duties under this Act:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A Board member.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The registrar of the Board.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  An employee of the Board.  2000, c. 41, s. 123 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec123subsec2" id="sec123subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Non-disclosure</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="123" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A labour relations officer who receives information or material under this Act shall not disclose it to any person or body other than the Board unless the Board authorizes the disclosure.  2000, c. 41, s. 123 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">When no decision after six months</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="124" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec124" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=124"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="124" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="124" data-viibes-start="218" data-viibes-end="217"><A name="BK270"></A><B><a name="sec124subsec1" id="sec124subsec1"></A><a name="sec124" id="sec124"></A>124 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="124" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies if the Board has commenced a hearing to review an order, refusal to issue an order or notice of contravention, six months or more have passed since the last day of hearing and a decision has not been made.  2000, c. 41, s. 124 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec124subsec2" id="sec124subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Termination of proceeding</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="124" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> On the application of a party in the proceeding, the chair may terminate the proceeding.  2000, c. 41, s. 124 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec124subsec3" id="sec124subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Re-institution of proceeding</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="124" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If a proceeding is terminated according to subsection (2), the chair shall re-institute the proceeding upon such terms and conditions as the chair considers appropriate.  2000, c. 41, s. 124 (3).</P>
 
<A name="PART_XXIV_COLLECTION_459468"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK271"></A>PART XXIV <BR>  COLLECTION</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Third party demand</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="125" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec125" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=125"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="125" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="10" data-noteup-count-display="10"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="125" data-viibes-start="219" data-viibes-end="218"><A name="BK272"></A><B><a name="sec125subsec1" id="sec125subsec1"></A><a name="sec125" id="sec125"></A>125 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="125" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employer, director or other person is liable to make a payment under this Act and the Director believes or suspects that a person owes money to or is holding money for, or will within 365 days owe money to or hold money for the employer, director or other person, the Director may demand that the person pay all or part of the money that would otherwise be payable to the employer, director or other person to the Director in trust on account of the liability under this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96923-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-27/latest/so-2015-c-27.html">2015, c. 27</A>, Sched. 4, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec125subsec1.1" id="sec125subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same, duration</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> A demand made under subsection (1) remains in force for 365 days from the date the notice of the demand is served. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96923-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2015-c-27/latest/so-2015-c-27.html">2015, c. 27</A>, Sched. 4, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">s. 1</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125subsec2" id="sec125subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Client of temporary help agency</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), that subsection applies where a client of a temporary help agency owes money to or is holding money for a temporary help agency.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 22</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="64" href="#sec64_smooth">s. 64</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125subsec3" id="sec125subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Service</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The Director shall, in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A>, serve notice of the demand on the person to whom the demand is made.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 22</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125subsec4" id="sec125subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Discharge</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> A person who pays money to the Director in accordance with a demand under this section is relieved from liability for the amount owed to or held for the employer, director or other person who is liable to make a payment under this Act, to the extent of the payment.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 22</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125subsec5" id="sec125subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Liability</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If a person who receives a demand under this section makes a payment to the employer, director or other person with respect to whom the demand was made without complying with the demand, the person shall pay to the Director an amount equal to the lesser of,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the amount paid to the employer, director or other person; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the amount of the demand.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 22</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Security for amounts owing</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="125.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec125.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=125.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="125.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="125.1" data-viibes-start="220" data-viibes-end="219"><A name="BK273"></A><B><a name="sec125.1" id="sec125_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="125.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">125.1</SPAN> </B>If the Director considers it advisable to do so, the Director may accept security for the payment of any amounts owing under this Act in any form that the Director considers satisfactory. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P></div>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Warrant</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="125.2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec125.2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=125.2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="125.2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="125.2" data-viibes-start="221" data-viibes-end="220"><A name="BK274"></A><B><a name="sec125.2" id="sec125_2"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="125.2" subsection="null" alinea="null">125.2</SPAN> </B>If an order to pay money has been made under this Act, the Director may issue a warrant, directed to the sheriff for an area in which any property of the employer, director or other person liable to make a payment under this Act is located, to enforce payment of the following amounts, and the warrant has the same force and effect as a writ of execution issued out of the Superior Court of Justice:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The amount the order requires the person to pay, including any applicable interest.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The costs and expenses of the sheriff. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Lien on real property</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="125.3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec125.3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=125.3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="125.3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="125.3" data-viibes-start="222" data-viibes-end="221"><A name="BK275"></A><B><a name="sec125.3subsec1" id="sec125_3subsec1"></A><a name="sec125.3" id="sec125_3"></A>125.3 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an order to pay money has been made under this Act, the amount the order requires the person to pay, including any applicable interest is, upon registration by the Director in the proper land registry office of a notice claiming a lien and charge conferred by this section, a lien and charge on any interest the employer, director or other person has in the real property described in the notice. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec2" id="sec125_3subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Lien on personal property</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If an order to pay money has been made under this Act, the amount the order requires the person to pay, including any applicable interest is, upon registration by the Director with the registrar under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html">Personal Property Security Act</A></I> of a notice claiming a lien and charge under this section, a lien and charge on any interest in personal property in Ontario owned or held at the time of registration or acquired afterwards by the employer, director or other person liable to make a payment. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec3" id="sec125_3subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Amounts included and priority</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The lien and charge conferred by subsection (1) or (2) is in respect of all amounts the order requires the person to pay, including any applicable interest at the time of registration of the notice or any renewal of it and all amounts for which the person afterwards becomes liable while the notice remains registered and, upon registration of a notice of lien and charge, the lien and charge has priority over,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  any perfected security interest registered after the notice is registered;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  any security interest perfected by possession after the notice is registered; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  any encumbrance or other claim that is registered against or that otherwise arises and affects the employer, director or other person’s property after the notice is registered. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec4" id="sec125_3subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Exception</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> For the purposes of subsection (3), a notice of lien and charge under subsection (2) does not have priority over a perfected purchase money security interest in collateral or its proceeds and is deemed to be a security interest perfected by registration for the purpose of the priority rules under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="30" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec30_smooth">section 30</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html">Personal Property Security Act</A></I>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec5" id="sec125_3subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Lien effective</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> A notice of lien and charge under subsection (2) is effective from the time assigned to its registration by the registrar and expires on the fifth anniversary of its registration unless a renewal notice of lien and charge is registered under this section before the end of the five-year period, in which case the lien and charge remains in effect for a further five-year period from the date the renewal notice is registered. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec6" id="sec125_3subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> If an amount payable under this Act remains outstanding and unpaid at the end of the period, or its renewal, referred to in subsection (5), the Director may register a renewal notice of lien and charge; the lien and charge remains in effect for a five-year period from the date the renewal notice is registered until the amount is fully paid, and is deemed to be continuously registered since the initial notice of lien and charge was registered under subsection (2). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec7" id="sec125_3subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Where person not registered owner</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Where an employer, director or other person liable to make a payment has an interest in real property but is not shown as its registered owner in the proper land registry office,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the notice to be registered under subsection (1) shall recite the interest of the employer, director or other person liable to make a payment in the real property; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a copy of the notice shall be sent to the registered owner at the owner’s address to which the latest notice of assessment under the
<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="25-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-a31/latest/rso-1990-c-a31.html">Assessment Act</A></I> has been sent. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec8" id="sec125_3subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Secured party</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> In addition to any other rights and remedies, if amounts owed by an employer, director or other person liable to make a payment remain outstanding and unpaid, the Director has, in respect of a lien and charge under subsection (2),</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  all the rights, remedies and duties of a secured party under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="17" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec17_smooth">sections 17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="59" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec59_smooth">59</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="61" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec61_smooth">61</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="62" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec62_smooth">62</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="63" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec63_smooth">63</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="64" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec64_smooth">64</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="65" ss="4" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec65subsec4_smooth">subsections 65 (4)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="65" ss="5" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec65subsec5_smooth">(5)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="65" ss="6" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec65subsec6_smooth">(6)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="65" ss="6.1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec65subsec6.1_smooth">(6.1)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="65" ss="7" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec65subsec7_smooth">(7)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" s="66" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html#sec66_smooth">section 66</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html">Personal Property Security Act</A></I>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  a security interest in the collateral for the purpose of clause 63 (4) (c) of that Act; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  a security interest in the personal property for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="442-current-1" s="15" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r25/latest/rso-1990-c-r25.html#sec15_smooth">sections 15</A> and<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="442-current-1" s="16" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r25/latest/rso-1990-c-r25.html#sec16_smooth"> 16</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="442-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-r25/latest/rso-1990-c-r25.html">Repair and Storage Liens Act</A></I>, if it is an article as defined in that Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec9" id="sec125_3subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Registration of documents</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> A notice of lien and charge under subsection (2) or any renewal of it shall be in the form of a financing statement or a financing change statement as prescribed under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="372-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p10/latest/rso-1990-c-p10.html">Personal Property Security Act</A></I> and may be tendered for registration under Part IV of that Act, or by mail addressed to an address prescribed under that Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec10" id="sec125_3subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Errors in documents</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> A notice of lien and charge or any renewal thereof is not invalidated nor is its effect impaired by reason only of an error or omission in the notice or in its execution or registration, unless a reasonable person is likely to be materially misled by the error or omission. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec11" id="sec125_3subsec11"></A><P class="headnote"><I>Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act</I>
(Canada) unaffected</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="11" alinea="null">(11)</SPAN> Subject to Crown rights provided under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="87" href="#sec87_smooth">section 87</A> of that Act, nothing in this section affects or purports to affect the rights and obligations of any person under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12759-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-b-3/latest/rsc-1985-c-b-3.html">Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12759-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-b-3/latest/rsc-1985-c-b-3.html"> (Canada)</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec125.3subsec12" id="sec125_3subsec12"></A><P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="125.3" subsection="12" alinea="null">(12)</SPAN> In this section,</P>
 
<P class="definition">“real property” includes fixtures and any interest of a person as lessee of real property. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="65" href="#sec65_smooth">s. 65</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Filing of order</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="126" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec126" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=126"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="126" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="126" data-viibes-start="223" data-viibes-end="222"><A name="BK276"></A><B><a name="sec126subsec1" id="sec126subsec1"></A><a name="sec126" id="sec126"></A>126 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="126" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an order to pay money has been made under this Act, the Director may cause a copy of the order, certified by the Director to be a true copy, to be filed in a court of competent jurisdiction.  2000, c. 41, s. 126 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec126subsec2" id="sec126subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Advice to person against whom order was made</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="126" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the Director files a copy of the order, he or she shall serve a letter in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="95" href="#sec95_smooth">section 95</A> upon the person against whom the order was issued advising the person of the filing.  2000, c. 41, s. 126 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec126subsec3" id="sec126subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Certificate enforceable</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="126" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The Director may enforce an order filed under subsection (1) in the same manner as a judgment or order of the court.  2000, c. 41, s. 126 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec126subsec4" id="sec126subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Notices of contravention</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="126" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Subsections (1), (2) and (3) apply, with necessary modifications, to a notice of contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 126 (4).</P>
 
<A name="Collectors__470585"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK277"></A>Collectors</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Director may authorize collector</P>
