<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="127" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec127" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=127"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="127" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="13" data-noteup-count-display="13"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="127" data-viibes-start="224" data-viibes-end="223"><A name="BK278"></A><B><a name="sec127subsec1" id="sec127subsec1"></A><a name="sec127" id="sec127"></A>127 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="127" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Director may authorize a collector to exercise those powers that the Director specifies in the authorization to collect amounts owing under this Act or under an order made by a reciprocating state to which <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="130" href="#sec130_smooth">section 130</A> applies.  2000, c. 41, s. 127 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec127subsec2" id="sec127subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="127" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Director may specify his or her powers under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="125" href="#sec125_smooth">sections 125</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="125.1" href="#sec125.1_smooth">125.1</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="125.2" href="#sec125.2_smooth">125.2</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="125.3" href="#sec125.3_smooth">125.3</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="126" href="#sec126_smooth">126</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="130" href="#sec130_smooth">130</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="135" ss="3" href="#sec135subsec3_smooth">subsection 135 (3)</A> and the Board’s powers under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="474-current-1" s="19" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-s22/latest/rso-1990-c-s22.html#sec19_smooth">section 19</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="474-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-s22/latest/rso-1990-c-s22.html">Statutory Powers Procedure Act</A></I> in an authorization under subsection (1).  2000, c. 41, s. 127 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 66 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec127subsec3" id="sec127subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Costs of collection</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="127" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="22" href="#sec22_smooth">clause 22</A> (a) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="58-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-c14/latest/rso-1990-c-c14.html">Collection and Debt Settlement Services Act</A></I>, the Director may also authorize the collector to collect a reasonable fee or reasonable disbursements or both from each person from whom the collector seeks to collect amounts owing under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 127 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96875-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2013-c-13/latest/so-2013-c-13.html">2013, c. 13</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12" href="#sec12_smooth">s. 12</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec127subsec4" id="sec127subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="127" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The Director may impose conditions on an authorization under subsection (3) and may determine what constitutes a reasonable fee or reasonable disbursements for the purposes of that subsection.  2000, c. 41, s. 127 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec127subsec5" id="sec127subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Exception re disbursements</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="127" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The Director shall not authorize a collector who is required to be registered under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="58-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-c14/latest/rso-1990-c-c14.html">Collection and Debt Settlement Services Act</A></I> to collect disbursements.  2000, c. 41, s. 127 (5); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96875-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2013-c-13/latest/so-2013-c-13.html">2013, c. 13</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="12" href="#sec12_smooth">s. 12</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec127subsec6" id="sec127subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Disclosure</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="127" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The Director may disclose, or allow to be disclosed, information collected under the authority of this Act or the regulations to a collector for the purpose of collecting an amount payable under this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 66 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec127subsec7" id="sec127subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="127" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Any disclosure of personal information made under subsection (6) shall be deemed to be in compliance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" s="42" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html#sec42subsec1_smooth">clause 42 (1)</A> (d) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html">Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act</A></I>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 66 (2).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Collector’s powers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="128" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec128" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=128"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="128" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="240" data-noteup-count-display="240"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="128" data-viibes-start="225" data-viibes-end="224"><A name="BK279"></A><B><a name="sec128subsec1" id="sec128subsec1"></A><a name="sec128" id="sec128"></A>128 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="128" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A collector may exercise any of the powers specified in an authorization of the Director under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="127" href="#sec127_smooth">section 127</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 128 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec128subsec2" id="sec128subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Fees and disbursements part of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="128" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If a collector is seeking to collect an amount owing under an order or notice of contravention, any fees and disbursements authorized under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="127" ss="3" href="#sec127subsec3_smooth">subsection 127 (3)</A> shall be deemed to be owing under and shall be deemed to be added to the amount of the order or notice of contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 128 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec128subsec3" id="sec128subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Distribution of money collected re wages or compensation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="128" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (4), a collector,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  shall pay any amount collected with respect to wages, fees or compensation,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  to the Director in trust, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  with the written consent of the Director, to the person entitled to the wages, fees or compensation;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  shall pay any amount collected with respect to administrative costs to the Director;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  shall pay any amount collected with respect to a notice of contravention to the Minister of Finance; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  may retain any amount collected with respect to the fees and disbursements.  2000, c. 41, s. 128 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 23</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec128subsec4" id="sec128subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Apportionment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="128" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If the money collected is less than the full amount owing to all persons, including the Director and the collector, the money shall be apportioned among those to whom it is owing in the proportion each is owed and paid to them.  2000, c. 41, s. 128 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec128subsec5" id="sec128subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Disclosure by collector</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="128" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> A collector may disclose to the Director or allow to be disclosed to the Director any information that was collected under the authority of this Act or the regulations for the purpose of collecting an amount payable under this Act. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="67" href="#sec67_smooth">s. 67</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec128subsec6" id="sec128subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="128" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Any disclosure of personal information made under subsection (5) shall be deemed to be in compliance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" s="42" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html#sec42subsec1_smooth">clause 42 (1)</A> (d) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html">Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act</A></I>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="67" href="#sec67_smooth">s. 67</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Settlement by collector</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="129" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec129" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=129"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="129" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="129" data-viibes-start="226" data-viibes-end="225"><A name="BK280"></A><B><a name="sec129subsec1" id="sec129subsec1"></A><a name="sec129" id="sec129"></A>129 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="129" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A collector may agree to a settlement with the person from whom he or she seeks to collect money, but only with the written agreement of,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  the person to whom the money is owed; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  in the case of a notice of contravention, the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 129 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec129subsec2" id="sec129subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="129" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A collector shall not agree to a settlement under clause (1) (a) without the Director’s written approval if the person to whom the money is owed would receive less than,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  75 per cent of the money to which he or she was entitled; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if another percentage is prescribed, the prescribed percentage of the money to which he or she was entitled.  2000, c. 41, s. 129 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec129subsec3" id="sec129subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Orders void where settlement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="129" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If an order to pay has been made under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.14" href="#sec74.14_smooth">section 74.14</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.16" href="#sec74.16_smooth">74.16</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.17" href="#sec74.17_smooth">74.17</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.19" href="#sec74.19_smooth">74.19</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="103" href="#sec103_smooth">103</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="104" href="#sec104_smooth">104</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" href="#sec106_smooth">106</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="107" href="#sec107_smooth">107</A> and a settlement respecting the money that was found to be owing is made under this section, the order is void and the settlement is binding if the person against whom the order was issued does what the person agreed to do under the settlement unless, on application to the Board, the individual to whom the money was ordered to be paid demonstrates that the settlement was entered into as a result of fraud or coercion.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 24 (1)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="31" href="#sec31_smooth">s. 31</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec129subsec4" id="sec129subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Notice of contravention</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="129" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If a settlement respecting money that is owing under a notice of contravention is made under this section, the notice is void if the person against whom the notice was issued does what the person agreed to do under the settlement.  2000, c. 41, s. 129 (4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 24 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec129subsec5" id="sec129subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Payment</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="129" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The person who owes money under a settlement shall pay the amount agreed upon to the collector, who shall pay it out in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="128" href="#sec128_smooth">section 128</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 129 (5).</P>
 

 
<A name="Reciprocal_Enforcement_of_Orders__477667"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK281"></A>Reciprocal Enforcement of Orders</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="130" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec130" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=130"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="130" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="130" data-viibes-start="227" data-viibes-end="226"><A name="BK282"></A><B><a name="sec130subsec1" id="sec130subsec1"></A><a name="sec130" id="sec130"></A>130 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="130" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="definition">“order” includes a judgment and, in the case of a state whose employment standards legislation contains a provision substantially similar to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="126" ss="1" href="#sec126subsec1_smooth">subsection 126 (1)</A>, includes a certificate of an order for the payment of money owing under that legislation; (“ordonnance”)</P>
 
<P class="definition">“state” includes another province or territory of Canada, a foreign state and a political subdivision of a state. (“État”)  2000, c. 41, s. 130 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec130subsec2" id="sec130subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Reciprocating states</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="130" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The prescribed states are reciprocating states for the purposes of this section and the prescribed authorities with respect to those states are the authorities who may make applications under this section.  2000, c. 41, s. 130 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec130subsec3" id="sec130subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Application for enforcement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="130" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The designated authority of a reciprocating state may apply to the Director for enforcement of an order for the payment of money issued under the employment standards legislation of that state.  2000, c. 41, s. 130 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec130subsec4" id="sec130subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Copy of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="130" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> The application shall be accompanied by a copy of the order, certified as a true copy,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  by the court in which the order was filed, if the employment standards legislation of the reciprocating state provides for the filing of the order in a court; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  by the designated authority, if the employment standards legislation of the reciprocating state does not provide for the filing of the order in a court.  2000, c. 41, s. 130 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec130subsec5" id="sec130subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Enforcement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="130" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The Director may file a copy of the order in a court of competent jurisdiction and, upon its filing, the order is enforceable as a judgment or order of the court,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  at the instance and in favour of the Director; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  at the instance and in favour of the designated authority.  2000, c. 41, s. 130 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec130subsec6" id="sec130subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Costs</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="130" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The Director or the designated authority, as the case may be,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  is entitled to the costs of enforcing the order as if it were an order of the court in which the copy of it was filed; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  may recover those costs in the same manner as sums payable under such an order may be recovered.  2000, c. 41, s. 130 (6).</P>
 
<A name="PART_XXV_OFFENCES_and_prosecutions_480393"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK283"></A>PART XXV <BR>  OFFENCES and prosecutions</P>
 
<A name="Offences__480479"></A><P class="heading1"><A name="BK284"></A>Offences</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Offence to keep false records</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="131" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec131" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=131"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="131" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="131" data-viibes-start="228" data-viibes-end="227"><A name="BK285"></A><B><a name="sec131subsec1" id="sec131subsec1"></A><a name="sec131" id="sec131"></A>131 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="131" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No person shall make, keep or produce false records or other documents that are required to be kept under this Act or participate or acquiesce in the making, keeping or production of false records or other documents that are required to be kept under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 131 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec131subsec2" id="sec131subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">False or misleading information</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="131" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> No person shall provide false or misleading information under this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 131 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">General offence</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="132" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec132" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=132"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="132" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="132" data-viibes-start="229" data-viibes-end="228"><A name="BK286"></A><B><a name="sec132" id="sec132"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="132" subsection="null" alinea="null">132</SPAN> </B>A person who contravenes this Act or the regulations or fails to comply with an order, direction or other requirement under this Act or the regulations is guilty of an offence and on conviction is liable,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  if the person is an individual, to a fine of not more than $50,000 or to imprisonment for a term of not more than 12 months or to both;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  subject to clause (c), if the person is a corporation, to a fine of not more than $100,000; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  if the person is a corporation that has previously been convicted of an offence under this Act or a predecessor to it,</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (i)  if the person has one previous conviction, to a fine of not more than $250,000, and</P>
 
<P class="subclause">  (ii)  if the person has more than one previous conviction, to a fine of not more than $500,000.  2000, c. 41, s. 132.</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Additional orders</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="133" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec133" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=133"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="133" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="133" data-viibes-start="230" data-viibes-end="229"><A name="BK287"></A><B><a name="sec133subsec1" id="sec133subsec1"></A><a name="sec133" id="sec133"></A>133 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="133" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employer is convicted under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="132" href="#sec132_smooth">section 132</A> of contravening <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74" href="#sec74_smooth">section 74</A> or paragraph 4, 6, 7 or 10 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.8" ss="1" href="#sec74.8subsec1_smooth">subsection 74.8 (1)</A>, if a client is convicted under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="132" href="#sec132_smooth">section 132</A> of contravening <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" href="#sec74.12_smooth">section 74.12</A> or if a recruiter is convicted under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="132" href="#sec132_smooth">section 132</A> of contravening <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12.1" href="#sec74.12.1_smooth">section 74.12.1</A>, the court shall, in addition to any fine or term of imprisonment that is imposed, order that the employer, client or recruiter, as the case may be, take specific action or refrain from taking specific action to remedy the contravention. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="32" href="#sec32_smooth">s. 32</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec133subsec2" id="sec133subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="133" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Without restricting the generality of subsection (1), the order made by the court may require one or more of the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  A person be paid any wages that are owing to him or her.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  In the case of a conviction under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="132" href="#sec132_smooth">section 132</A> of contravening <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74" href="#sec74_smooth">section 74</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" href="#sec74.12_smooth">74.12</A>, a person be reinstated.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  A person be compensated for any loss incurred by him or her as a result of the contravention.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 25</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec133subsec3" id="sec133subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Part XVI</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="133" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If the contravention of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74" href="#sec74_smooth">section 74</A> was in relation to Part<B> </B>XVI (Lie Detectors) and the contravention affected an applicant for employment or an applicant to be a police officer, the court may require that the employer hire the applicant or compensate him or her or both hire and compensate him or her.  2000, c. 41, s. 133 (3).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Offence re order for reinstatement</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="134" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec134" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=134"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="134" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="134" data-viibes-start="231" data-viibes-end="230"><A name="BK288"></A><B><a name="sec134" id="sec134"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="134" subsection="null" alinea="null">134</SPAN> </B>A person who fails to comply with an order issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="133" href="#sec133_smooth">section 133</A> is guilty of an offence and on conviction is liable,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  if the person is an individual, to a fine of not more than $2,000 for each day during which the failure to comply continues or to imprisonment for a term of not more than six months or to both; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  if the person is a corporation, to a fine of not more than $4,000 for each day during which the failure to comply continues.  2000, c. 41, s. 134; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 26</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Additional orders re other contraventions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="135" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec135" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=135"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="135" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="135" data-viibes-start="232" data-viibes-end="231"><A name="BK289"></A><B><a name="sec135subsec1" id="sec135subsec1"></A><a name="sec135" id="sec135"></A>135 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="135" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employer is convicted under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="132" href="#sec132_smooth">section 132</A> of contravening a provision of this Act other than <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74" href="#sec74_smooth">section 74</A> or paragraph 4, 6, 7 or 10 of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.8" ss="1" href="#sec74.8subsec1_smooth">subsection 74.8 (1)</A>, the court shall, in addition to any fine or term of imprisonment that is imposed, assess any amount owing to an employee affected by the contravention and order the employer to pay the amount assessed to the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 135 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 27</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec135subsec2" id="sec135subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Collection by Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="135" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Director shall attempt to collect the amount ordered to be paid under subsection (1) and if he or she is successful shall distribute it to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 135 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec135subsec3" id="sec135subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Enforcement of order</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="135" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> An order under subsection (1) may be filed by the Director in a court of competent jurisdiction and upon filing shall be deemed to be an order of that court for the purposes of enforcement.  2000, c. 41, s. 135 (3).</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Offence re directors’ liability</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="136" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec136" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=136"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="136" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="136" data-viibes-start="233" data-viibes-end="232"><A name="BK290"></A><B><a name="sec136subsec1" id="sec136subsec1"></A><a name="sec136" id="sec136"></A>136 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="136" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A director of a corporation is guilty of an offence if the director,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  fails to comply with an order of an employment standards officer under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" href="#sec106_smooth">section 106</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="107" href="#sec107_smooth">107</A> and has not applied for a review of that order; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  fails to comply with an order issued under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="106" href="#sec106_smooth">section 106</A> or<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="107" href="#sec107_smooth"> 107</A> that has been amended or affirmed by the Board on a review of the order under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="116" href="#sec116_smooth">section 116</A> or with a new order issued by the Board on such a review.  2000, c. 41, s. 136 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec136subsec2" id="sec136subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Penalty</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="136" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> A director convicted of an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine of not more than $50,000.  2000, c. 41, s. 136 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Offence re permitting offence by corporation</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="137" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec137" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=137"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="137" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="137" data-viibes-start="234" data-viibes-end="233"><A name="BK291"></A><B><a name="sec137subsec1" id="sec137subsec1"></A><a name="sec137" id="sec137"></A>137 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="137" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If a corporation contravenes this Act or the regulations, an officer, director or agent of the corporation or a person acting or claiming to act in that capacity who authorizes or permits the contravention or acquiesces in it is a party to and guilty of the offence and is liable on conviction to the fine or imprisonment provided for the offence.  2000, c. 41, s. 137 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec137subsec2" id="sec137subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="137" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies whether or not the corporation has been prosecuted or convicted of the offence.  2000, c. 41, s. 137 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec137subsec3" id="sec137subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Onus of proof</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="137" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> In a trial of an individual who is prosecuted under subsection (1), the onus is on the individual to prove that he or she did not authorize, permit or acquiesce in the contravention.  2000, c. 41, s. 137 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec137subsec4" id="sec137subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Additional penalty</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="137" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If an individual is convicted under this section, the court may, in addition to any other fine or term of imprisonment that is imposed, assess any amount owing to an employee affected by the contravention and order the individual to pay the amount assessed to the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 137 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec137subsec5" id="sec137subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Collection by Director</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="137" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> The Director shall attempt to collect the amount ordered to be paid under subsection (4) and if he or she is successful shall distribute it to the employee.  2000, c. 41, s. 137 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec137subsec6" id="sec137subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">No prosecution without consent</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="137" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> No prosecution shall be commenced under this section without the consent of the Director.  2000, c. 41, s. 137 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec137subsec7" id="sec137subsec7"></A><P class="headnote">Proof of consent</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="137" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The production of a document that appears to show that the Director has consented to a prosecution under this section is admissible as evidence of the Director’s consent.  2000, c. 41, s. 137 (7).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Prosecution of employment standards officer</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="137.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec137.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=137.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="137.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="137.1" data-viibes-start="235" data-viibes-end="234"><A name="BK292"></A><B><a name="sec137.1subsec1" id="sec137_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec137.1" id="sec137_1"></A>137.1</B> <SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="137.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> No prosecution of an employment standards officer shall be commenced with respect to an alleged contravention of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="89" ss="2" href="#sec89subsec2_smooth">subsection 89 (2)</A> without the consent of the Deputy Attorney General.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec29" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="29" data-link-type="weak" rank="1">s. 1 (29)</SPAN>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec137.1subsec2" id="sec137_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Proof of consent</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="137.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The production of a document that appears to show that the Deputy Attorney General has consented to a prosecution of an employment standards officer is admissible as evidence of his or her consent.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec29" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="29" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (29)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Where prosecution may be heard</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="138" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec138" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=138"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="138" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="138" data-viibes-start="236" data-viibes-end="235"><A name="BK293"></A><B><a name="sec138subsec1" id="sec138subsec1"></A><a name="sec138" id="sec138"></A>138 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="138" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="29" href="#sec29_smooth">section 29</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="397-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-p33/latest/rso-1990-c-p33.html">Provincial Offences Act</A></I>, the prosecution of an offence under this Act may be heard and determined by the Ontario Court of Justice sitting in the area where the accused is resident or carries on business, if the prosecutor so elects.  2000, c. 41, s. 138 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec138subsec2" id="sec138subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Election to have judge preside</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="138" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Attorney General or an agent for the Attorney General may by notice to the clerk of the court require that a judge of the court hear and determine the prosecution.  2000, c. 41, s. 138 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Publication re convictions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="138.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec138.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=138.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="138.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="138.1" data-viibes-start="237" data-viibes-end="236"><A name="BK294"></A><B><a name="sec138.1subsec1" id="sec138_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec138.1" id="sec138_1"></A>138.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="138.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If a person, including an individual, is convicted of an offence under this Act, the Director may publish or otherwise make available to the general public the name of the person, a description of the offence, the date of the conviction and the person’s sentence.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 9</A>.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec138.1subsec2" id="sec138_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Internet publication</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="138.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Authority to publish under subsection (1) includes authority to publish on the Internet.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 9</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec138.1subsec3" id="sec138_1subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Disclosure</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="138.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Any disclosure made under subsection (1) shall be deemed to be in compliance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" s="42" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html#sec42subsec1_smooth">clause 42 (1)</A> (e) of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="169-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-f31/latest/rso-1990-c-f31.html">Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act</A></I>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 9</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96727-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-34/latest/so-2006-c-34.html">2006, c. 34</A>, Sched. C, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23" href="#sec23_smooth">s. 23</A>.</P>
 

 
<P class="headnote">Limitation period</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="139" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec139" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=139"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="139" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="139" data-viibes-start="238" data-viibes-end="237"><A name="BK295"></A><B><a name="sec139" id="sec139"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="139" subsection="null" alinea="null">139</SPAN> </B>No prosecution shall be commenced under this Act more than two years after the date on which the offence was committed or alleged to have been committed.  2000, c. 41, s. 139.</P></div>
 
<A name="PART_XXVI_MISCELLANEOUS_EVIDENTIARY_PROVISIONS_490976"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK296"></A>PART XXVI <BR>  MISCELLANEOUS EVIDENTIARY PROVISIONS</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Copy constitutes evidence</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="140" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec140" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=140"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="140" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="6" data-noteup-count-display="6"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="140" data-viibes-start="239" data-viibes-end="238"><A name="BK297"></A><B><a name="sec140subsec1" id="sec140subsec1"></A><a name="sec140" id="sec140"></A>140 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="140" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In a prosecution or other proceeding under this Act, a copy of an order or notice of contravention that appears to be made under this Act or the regulations and signed by an employment standards officer or the Board is evidence of the order or notice and of the facts appearing in it without proof of the signature or office of the person appearing to have signed the order or notice.  2000, c. 41, s. 140 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec140subsec2" id="sec140subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="140" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> In a prosecution or other proceeding under this Act, a copy of a record or other document or an extract from a record or other document that appears to be certified as a true copy or accurate extract by an employment standards officer is evidence of the record or document or the extracted part of the record or document and of the facts appearing in the record, document or extract without proof of the signature or office of the person appearing to have certified the copy or extract or any other proof.  2000, c. 41, s. 140 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec140subsec2.1" id="sec140subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="140" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> In a prosecution or other proceeding under this Act, a copy of a record or other document or an extract from a record or other document that appears to be certified as a true copy or accurate extract by the Workplace Safety and Insurance Board is evidence of the record or document or the extracted part of the record or document and of the facts appearing in the record, document or extract without proof of the signature or office of the person appearing to have certified the copy or extract or any other proof. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 4</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec140subsec3" id="sec140subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Certificate of Director constitutes evidence</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="140" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> In a prosecution or other proceeding under this Act, a certificate that appears to be signed by the Director setting out that the records of the ministry indicate that a person has failed to make the payment required by an order or a notice of contravention issued under this Act is evidence of the failure to make that payment without further proof.  2000, c. 41, s. 140 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 28</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec140subsec4" id="sec140subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Same, collector</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="140" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> In a prosecution or other proceeding under this Act, a certificate shown by a collector that appears to be signed by the Director setting out any of the following facts is evidence of the fact without further proof:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  The Director has authorized the collector to collect amounts owing under this Act.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  The Director has authorized the collector to collect a reasonable fee or reasonable disbursements or both.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  The Director has, or has not, imposed conditions on an authorization described in paragraph 2 and has, or has not, determined what constitutes a reasonable fee or reasonable disbursements.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Any conditions imposed by the Director on an authorization described in paragraph 2.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  The Director has approved a settlement under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="129" ss="2" href="#sec129subsec2_smooth">subsection 129 (2)</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 140 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec140subsec5" id="sec140subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Same, date of complaint</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="140" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> In a prosecution or other proceeding under this Act, a certificate that appears to be signed by the Director setting out the date on which the records of the ministry indicate that a complaint was filed is evidence of that date without further proof.  2000, c. 41, s. 140 (5).</P>
 

 
<A name="part_xxvII_regulations_494661"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK298"></A>part xxvII <BR>  regulations</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Regulations</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="141" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec141" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=141"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="141" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="141" data-viibes-start="240" data-viibes-end="239"><A name="BK299"></A><B><a name="sec141subsec1" id="sec141subsec1"></A><a name="sec141" id="sec141"></A>141 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="141" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations for carrying out the purposes of this Act and, without restricting the generality of the foregoing, may make the following regulations:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Prescribing anything for the purposes of any provision of this Act that makes reference to a thing that is prescribed.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.1  Prescribing a method of payment for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="11" ss="2" href="#sec11subsec2_smooth">clause 11 (2)</A> (d) and establishing any terms, conditions or limitations on its use.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Establishing rules respecting the application of the minimum wage provisions of this Act and the regulations.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 2.0.1  Prescribing a class of employees that would otherwise be in the class described in subparagraph 1 iv of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23.1" ss="1" href="#sec23.1subsec1_smooth">subsection 23.1 (1)</A> and prescribing the minimum wage that applies to the class for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="23.1" ss="2" href="#sec23.1subsec2_smooth">subsection 23.1 (2)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 2.0.2  Repealed: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 69 (3).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.1  Establishing a maximum pay period, a maximum period within which payments made to an employee shall be reconciled with wages earned by the employee or both.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Exempting any class of employees or employers from the application of this Act or any Part, section or other provision of it.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Prescribing what constitutes the performance of work.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  5.  Prescribing what information concerning the terms of an employment contract should be provided to an employee in writing.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  6.  Defining an industry and prescribing for that industry one or more terms or conditions of employment that apply to employers and employees in the industry or one or more requirements or prohibitions that apply to employers and employees in the industry. </P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  7.  Providing that any term, condition, requirement or prohibition prescribed under paragraph 6 applies in place of or in addition to one or more provisions of this Act or the regulations.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  8.  Providing that a regulation made under paragraph 6 or 7 applies only in respect of workplaces in the defined industry that have characteristics specified in the regulation, including but not limited to characteristics related to location.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  9.  Providing that an agreement under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="2" href="#sec17subsec2_smooth">subsection 17 (2)</A> to work hours in excess of those referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="1" href="#sec17subsec1_smooth">clause 17 (1)</A> (a) that was made at the time of the employee’s hiring and that has been approved by the Director is, despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="6" href="#sec17subsec6_smooth">subsection 17 (6)</A>, irrevocable unless both the employer and the employee agree to its revocation.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  10.  Providing a formula for the determination of an employee’s regular rate that applies instead of the formula that would otherwise be applicable under the definition of “regular rate” in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">section 1</A> in such circumstances as are set out in the regulation.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  11.  Providing for the establishment of committees to advise the Minister on any matters relating to the application or administration of this Act.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 11.0.1 Providing for exemptions from Part XI.1, or any provision of it, including providing that employers are not required to have policies in respect of certain forms of electronic monitoring in the circumstances specified in the regulation.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 11.0.2 Prescribing one or more terms or conditions of employment related to electronic monitoring that apply to employers who are subject to Part XI.1 and their employees or one or more requirements or prohibitions related to electronic monitoring that apply to those employers and their employees.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 11.0.3 Prescribing that any term, condition, requirement or prohibition prescribed under paragraph 11.0.2 applies in place of or in addition to one or more provisions of this Act or the regulations.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 11.1  Providing, for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="4" href="#sec51subsec4_smooth">subsection 51 (4)</A>, that <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="1" href="#sec51subsec1_smooth">subsections 51 (1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="2" href="#sec51subsec2_smooth">(2)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="3" href="#sec51subsec3_smooth">(3)</A> apply in respect of an employee during a leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.2" href="#sec50.2_smooth">section 50.2</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 11.2  Providing, for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="5" href="#sec51subsec5_smooth">subsection 51 (5)</A>, that <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="1" href="#sec51subsec1_smooth">subsections 51 (1)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="2" href="#sec51subsec2_smooth">(2)</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" ss="3" href="#sec51subsec3_smooth">(3)</A> do not apply in respect of an employee during a period of postponement under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="53" ss="1.1" href="#sec53subsec1.1_smooth">subsection 53 (1.1)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  12.  Prescribing the manner and form in which notice of termination must or may be given and the content of such notice.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  13.  Prescribing what constitutes a constructive dismissal.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  14.  Providing that the common law doctrine of frustration does not apply to an employment contract and that an employer is not relieved of any obligation under Part XV because of the occurrence of an event that would frustrate an employment contract at common law except as prescribed.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 14.1  Providing that payments to an employee by way of pension benefits, insurance benefits, workplace safety and insurance benefits, bonus, employment insurance benefits, supplementary employment insurance benefits or similar arrangements shall or shall not be taken into account in determining the amount that an employer is required to pay to an employee under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="60" ss="1" href="#sec60subsec1_smooth">clause 60 (1)</A> (b), <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="61" href="#sec61_smooth">section 61</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="64" href="#sec64_smooth">section 64</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  15.  Providing for and governing the consolidation of hearings under this Act.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  16.  Prescribing the minimum number of hours in a day or week for which an employee is entitled to be paid the minimum wage or a contractual wage rate and imposing conditions in respect of that entitlement.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> 16.1  Governing penalties for contraventions for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="113" ss="1" href="#sec113subsec1_smooth">subsection 113 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  17.  Defining any word or expression used in this Act that is not defined in it.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  18.  Prescribing the manner in which the information required by <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="58" ss="2" href="#sec58subsec2_smooth">subsection 58 (2)</A> shall be given to the Director.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  19.  Respecting any matter necessary or advisable to carry out effectively the intent and purpose of this Act.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec30" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="30" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (30)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96598-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html">2002, c. 18</A>, Sched. J, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2002-c-18/latest/so-2002-c-18.html#sec3subsec30" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2002, SO 2002, c 18 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96598" s="3" ss="30" data-link-type="weak">s. 3 (30)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 10</A> (1, 2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html#sec6subsec1" title1="Fairness for Military Families Act (Employment Standards and Health Insurance), 2007, SO 2007, c 16 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96745" s="6" ss="1" data-link-type="weak">s. 6 (1)</SPAN>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96891-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2014-c-10/latest/so-2014-c-10.html">2014, c. 10</A>, Sched. 2, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="9" href="#sec9_smooth">s. 9</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="69" href="#sec69_smooth">s. 69</A> (1-4); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 26 (1); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97118-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-40/latest/so-2021-c-40.html">2021, c. 40</A>, Sched. 9, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="2" href="#sec2_smooth">s. 2</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 6 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec1.1" id="sec141subsec1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Restricted application</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> A regulation made under paragraph 11.1 or 11.2 of subsection (1) may be restricted in its application to one or more of the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  1.  Specified benefit plans.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  2.  Employees who are members of prescribed classes.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  3.  Employers who are members of prescribed classes.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  4.  Part of a leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.2" href="#sec50.2_smooth">section 50.2</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96745-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html">2007, c. 16</A>, Sched. A, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2007-c-16/latest/so-2007-c-16.html#sec6subsec2" title1="Fairness for Military Families Act (Employment Standards and Health Insurance), 2007, SO 2007, c 16 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96745" s="6" ss="2" data-link-type="weak">s. 6 (2)</SPAN>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2" id="sec141subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re Part XIII</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting any matter or thing necessary or advisable to carry out the intent and purpose of Part XIII (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1507-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-286-01/latest/o-reg-286-01.html">Benefit Plans</A>), and without restricting the generality of the foregoing, may make regulations,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  exempting a benefit plan, part of a benefit plan or the benefits under such a plan or part from the application of Part XIII;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  permitting a differentiation in a benefit plan between employees or their beneficiaries, survivors or dependants because of the age, sex or marital status of the employees;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  suspending the application of Part XIII to a benefit plan, part of a benefit plan or benefits under such a plan or part for the periods of time specified in the regulation;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  prohibiting a reduction in benefits to an employee in order to comply with Part XIII;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  providing the terms under which an employee may be entitled or disentitled to benefits under a benefit plan.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96641-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-15/latest/so-2004-c-15.html">2004, c. 15, s. 5</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.0.1" id="sec141subsec2_0_1"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re organ donor leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.1" alinea="null">(2.0.1)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  prescribing other organs for the purpose of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49.2" href="#sec49.2_smooth">section 49.2</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  prescribing tissue for the purpose of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49.2" href="#sec49.2_smooth">section 49.2</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  prescribing one or more periods for the purpose of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="49.2" ss="5" href="#sec49.2subsec5_smooth">subsection 49.2 (5)</A>.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.0.2" id="sec141subsec2_0_2"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.2" alinea="null">(2.0.2)</SPAN> A regulation made under clause (2.0.1) (c) may prescribe different periods with respect to the donation of different organs and prescribed tissue.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96787-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-16/latest/so-2009-c-16.html">2009, c. 16, s. 3</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.0.3" id="sec141subsec2_0_3"></A><P class="headnote">Transitional regulations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.3" alinea="null">(2.0.3)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations providing for any transitional matter that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary or advisable in connection with the implementation of the amendments made by the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">Fair Workplaces, Better Jobs Act, 2017</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">. 2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 69 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.0.3.1" id="sec141subsec2_0_3_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.3.1" alinea="null">(2.0.3.1)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations providing for any transitional matter that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary or advisable in connection with the implementation of the amendments made by the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">Making Ontario Open for Business Act, 2018</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">. 2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 26 (2).</P>

<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.3.2" alinea="null">(2.0.3.2)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations providing for any transitional matter that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary or advisable in connection with the implementation of the amendments made by the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">Restoring Ontario’s Competitiveness Act, 2019</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">. 2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 11 (1).</P>

<a name="sec141subsec2.0.3.4" id="sec141subsec2_0_3_4"></A><P class="headnote">Transitional regulations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.3.4" alinea="null">(2.0.3.4)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations providing for any transitional matter that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary or advisable in connection with the implementation of the amendments made by the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">COVID-19 Putting Workers First Act, 2021</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">. 2021, c. 9</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" s="5" ss="1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html#sec5subsec1_smooth">s. 5 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.0.3.5" id="sec141subsec2_0_3_5"></A><P class="headnote">Transitional regulations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.3.5" alinea="null">(2.0.3.5)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations providing for any transitional matter that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary or advisable in connection with the implementation of the amendments made by the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">Working for Workers Act, 2021</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">. 2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, s. 33 (1).</P>
