<a name="sec141subsec2.0.4" id="sec141subsec2_0_4"></A><P class="headnote">Conflict with transitional regulations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.0.4" alinea="null">(2.0.4)</SPAN> In the event of a conflict between this Act or the regulations and a regulation made under subsection (2.0.3), (2.0.3.1), (2.0.3.2), (2.0.3.3), (2.0.3.4), (2.0.3.5) or (2.0.3.6), the regulation made under subsection (2.0.3), (2.0.3.1), (2.0.3.2), (2.0.3.3), (2.0.3.4), (2.0.3.5) or (2.0.3.6) prevails. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 69 (5); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97020-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2018-c-14/latest/so-2018-c-14.html">2018, c. 14</A>, Sched. 1, s. 26 (3); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97028-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-4/latest/so-2019-c-4.html">2019, c. 4</A>, Sched. 9, s. 11 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 5 (2)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 5 (2)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, s. 33 (2); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 6 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.1" id="sec141subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re infectious disease emergencies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  designating an infectious disease for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">section 50.1</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  prescribing, for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="5.1" href="#sec50.1subsec5.1_smooth">subsection 50.1 (5.1)</A>, the date on which the entitlement to emergency leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.1" href="#sec50.1subsec1.1_smooth">clause 50.1 (1.1)</A> (b) starts or is deemed to have started;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> (b.1)  prescribing, for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="5.2" href="#sec50.1subsec5.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (5.2)</A>, a later date on which the entitlement to paid leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A> ends;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> (b.2)  prescribing, for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="5.3" href="#sec50.1subsec5.3_smooth">subsection 50.1 (5.3)</A>, additional periods during which employees are entitled to paid leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.2" href="#sec50.1subsec1.2_smooth">subsection 50.1 (1.2)</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  providing that <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">section 50.1</A> or any provision of it applies to police officers and prescribing one or more terms or conditions of employment or one or more requirements or prohibitions respecting emergency leave for infectious disease emergencies that shall apply to police officers and their employers;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  exempting a class of employees from the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">section 50.1</A> or any provision of it, and prescribing one or more terms or conditions of employment or one or more requirements or prohibitions respecting emergency leave for infectious disease emergencies that shall apply to employees in the class and their employers;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph"> (d.1)  exempting the Crown, a Crown agency, or an authority, board, commission or corporation, all of whose members are appointed by the Crown, from the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">section 50.1</A> or any provision of it;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  providing that a term, condition, requirement or prohibition prescribed under clause (c) or (d) applies in place of, or in addition to, a provision of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">section 50.1</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 5 (3)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 5 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.1.1" id="sec141subsec2_1_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same, police officers</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.1.1" alinea="null">(2.1.1)</SPAN> A regulation made under clause (2.1) (c) may also provide that <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="15" ss="7" href="#sec15subsec7_smooth">subsection 15 (7)</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51" href="#sec51_smooth">sections 51</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="51.1" href="#sec51.1_smooth">51.1</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="52" href="#sec52_smooth">52</A> and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="53" href="#sec53_smooth">53</A>, Part XVIII (Reprisal), <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" href="#sec74.12_smooth">section 74.12</A>, Part XXI (Who Enforces this Act and What They Can Do), Part XXII (Complaints and Enforcement), Part XXIII (Reviews by the Board), Part XXIV (Collection), Part XXV (Offences and Prosecutions), Part XXVI (Miscellaneous Evidentiary Provisions) and Part XXVII (Regulations) apply to police officers and their employers for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">section 50.1</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 5 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.2" id="sec141subsec2_2"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re emergency leaves, declared emergencies, infectious disease emergencies</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.2" alinea="null">(2.2)</SPAN> A regulation made under subsection (2.0.3.3), (2.0.3.4), (2.0.3.6) or (2.1), or a regulation prescribing a reason for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.1" href="#sec50.1subsec1.1_smooth">subclause 50.1 (1.1)</A> (a) (iv) or (b) (vii) may,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  provide that it has effect as of the date specified in the regulation;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  provide that an employee who does not perform the duties of his or her position because of the declared emergency and the prescribed reason, or because of the prescribed reason related to a designated infectious disease, as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" href="#sec50.1_smooth">section 50.1</A>, is deemed to have taken leave beginning on the first day the employee does not perform the duties of his or her position on or after the date specified in the regulation; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  provide that <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74" ss="1" href="#sec74subsec1_smooth">clauses 74 (1)</A> (a) and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.12" ss="1" href="#sec74.12subsec1_smooth">74.12 (1)</A> (a) apply, with necessary modifications, in relation to the deemed leave described in clause (b). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 5 (3)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 5 (4)</A>; <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97127-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2022-c-7/latest/so-2022-c-7.html">2022, c. 7</A>, Sched. 2, s. 6 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.2.1" id="sec141subsec2_2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Retroactive regulation</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.2.1" alinea="null">(2.2.1)</SPAN> A regulation referred to in subsection (2.2) that specifies a date may specify a date that is earlier than the day on which the regulation is made. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 5 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.3" id="sec141subsec2_3"></A><P class="headnote">Regulation extending leave</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.3" alinea="null">(2.3)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make a regulation providing that the entitlement of an employee to take leave under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.1" href="#sec50.1subsec1.1_smooth">clause 50.1 (1.1)</A> (a) is extended beyond the day on which the entitlement would otherwise end under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="5" href="#sec50.1subsec5_smooth">subsection 50.1 (5)</A> or <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="6" href="#sec50.1subsec6_smooth">(6)</A>, if the employee is still not performing the duties of his or her position because of the effects of the declared emergency and because of a reason referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="1.1" href="#sec50.1subsec1.1_smooth">subclause 50.1 (1.1)</A> (a) (i), (ii), (iii) or (iv). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97045-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-3/latest/so-2020-c-3.html">2020, c. 3, s. 5 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.4" id="sec141subsec2_4"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.4" alinea="null">(2.4)</SPAN> A regulation made under subsection (2.3) may limit the duration of the extended leave and may set conditions that must be met in order for the employee to be entitled to the extended leave.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96706-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2006-c-13/latest/so-2006-c-13.html">2006, c. 13, s. 3 (4)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.5" id="sec141subsec2_5"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1.1" href="#sec50.1.1_smooth">s. 50.1.1</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.5" alinea="null">(2.5)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  prescribing the process for overpayment recovery under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1.1" ss="18" href="#sec50.1.1subsec18_smooth">subsection 50.1.1 (18)</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  prescribing the date by which the Board is required to repay the Ministry under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1.1" ss="21" href="#sec50.1.1subsec21_smooth">subsection 50.1.1 (21)</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  prescribing, for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1.1" ss="31" href="#sec50.1.1subsec31_smooth">subsection 50.1.1 (31)</A>, persons who may investigate possible contraventions of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1.1" href="#sec50.1.1_smooth">section 50.1.1</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  prescribing the powers under this Act that a person prescribed under clause (c) may exercise;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  specifying the parts of this Act that apply, with necessary modifications, if a person prescribed under clause (c) investigates a possible contravention of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1.1" href="#sec50.1.1_smooth">section 50.1.1</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  exempting the Crown, a Crown agency, or an authority, board, commission or corporation, all of whose members are appointed by the Crown, from the application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1.1" href="#sec50.1.1_smooth">section 50.1.1</A> or any provision of it. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 5 (5)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.6" id="sec141subsec2_6"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re: Part XVIII.1</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.6" alinea="null">(2.6)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting the licensing of temporary help agencies and recruiters under Part XVIII.1 (Temporary Help Agencies and Recruiters), and without restricting the generality of the foregoing, may make regulations,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  governing requirements for the issuance or renewal of a licence, including requirements relating to compliance with laws that apply to the applicant;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  governing applications for the issuance or renewal of a licence including requiring information to be provided for different types of licences, which may include information about compliance with laws that apply to the applicant;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  prescribing circumstances in which an application for the issuance or renewal of a licence may be refused, which may include non-compliance with laws that apply to the applicant;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (d)  prescribing circumstances in which a licence may be revoked or suspended, which may include non-compliance with laws that apply to the applicant;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (e)  prescribing the processes to be followed by the Director in refusing to issue or renew a licence under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.1.5" href="#sec74.1.5_smooth">section 74.1.5</A>, which shall include providing an applicant with an opportunity to show evidence of compliance with licensing requirements before the licence or renewal is refused;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (f)  prescribing the processes to be followed by the Director in revoking or suspending a licence under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.1.6" href="#sec74.1.6_smooth">section 74.1.6</A>, which shall include providing an applicant with an opportunity to show evidence of compliance with licensing requirements before the licence is revoked or suspended;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (g)  governing the terms and conditions of licences;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (h)  governing licensing fees, including prescribing the amount of fees or the manner of determining fees, and prescribing the manner in which and the period within which fees must be paid;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (i)  governing security for licensing, including prescribing the amount of security and prescribing the manner in which and the method by which security must be provided to the Director and the uses for which security may be used, including to satisfy obligations owing under this Act or under the <I>Employment Protection for Foreign Nationals Act, 2009</I>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (j)  governing the public record that the Director is required to publish and maintain under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.1.12" href="#sec74.1.12_smooth">section 74.1.12</A>;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (k)  prescribing timelines for the purposes of review hearings held under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.1.13" href="#sec74.1.13_smooth">section 74.1.13</A> and providing that the Board may grant extensions to those timelines;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (l)  governing the application of Part XVIII.1 for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="74.2.1" href="#sec74.2.1_smooth">section 74.2.1</A>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, s. 33 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec2.7" id="sec141subsec2_7"></A><P class="headnote">Same, retroactive regulations</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="2.7" alinea="null">(2.7)</SPAN> A regulation made under paragraph 3 of subsection (1) in respect of the application of Part XVIII.1 is, if it so provides, effective with reference to a period before it is filed. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97113-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-35/latest/so-2021-c-35.html">2021, c. 35</A>, Sched. 2, s. 33 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec3" id="sec141subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re Part XIX</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations prescribing information for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="77" href="#sec77_smooth">section 77</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec3.1" id="sec141subsec3_1"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re Part XXII</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="3.1" alinea="null">(3.1)</SPAN> A regulation made under paragraph 16.1 of subsection (1) may,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  establish different penalties or ranges of penalties for different types of contraventions or the method of determining those penalties or ranges;</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  specify that different penalties, ranges or methods of determining a penalty or range apply to contraveners who are individuals and to contraveners that are corporations; or</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (c)  prescribe criteria an employment standards officer is required or permitted to consider when imposing a penalty. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96994-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2017-c-22/latest/so-2017-c-22.html">2017, c. 22</A>, Sched. 1, s. 69 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec4" id="sec141subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations re Part XXV</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> If the Lieutenant Governor in Council is satisfied that laws are or will be in effect in the state for the enforcement of orders made under this Act on a basis substantially similar to that set out in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="126" href="#sec126_smooth">section 126</A>, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation,</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  declare a state to be a reciprocating state for the purposes of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="130" href="#sec130_smooth">section 130</A>; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  designate an authority of that state as the authority who may make applications under <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="130" href="#sec130_smooth">section 130</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec5" id="sec141subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Classes</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> A regulation made under this section may be restricted in its application to any class of employee or employer and may treat different classes of employee or employer in different ways.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec5.1" id="sec141subsec5_1"></A><P class="headnote">Regulations may be conditional</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="5.1" alinea="null">(5.1)</SPAN> A regulation made under this section may provide that it applies only if one or more conditions specified in it are met.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 10 (3)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec6" id="sec141subsec6"></A><P class="headnote">Terms and conditions of employment for an industry</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> Without restricting the generality of paragraphs 6 and 7 of subsection (1), a regulation made under paragraph 6 or 7 may establish requirements for the industry respecting such matters as a minimum wage, the scheduling of work, maximum hours of work, eating periods and other breaks from work, posting of work schedules, conditions under which the maximum hours of work set out in the regulation may be exceeded, overtime thresholds and overtime pay, vacations, vacation pay, working on public holidays and public holiday pay and treating some public holidays differently than others for those purposes.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (6); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 10 (4)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec7" id="sec141subsec7"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 10 (5)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec8" id="sec141subsec8"></A><P class="headnote">Conditions, revocability of approval</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> A regulation made under paragraph 9 of subsection (1) may authorize the Director to impose conditions in granting an approval and may authorize the Director to rescind an approval.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec9" id="sec141subsec9"></A><P class="headnote">Restriction where excess hours agreements approved</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> An employer may not require an employee who has made an agreement approved by the Director under a regulation made under paragraph 9 of subsection (1) to work more than 10 hours in a day, except in the circumstances described in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="19" href="#sec19_smooth">section 19</A>.  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (9).</P>
 
<a name="sec141subsec10" id="sec141subsec10"></A><P class="headnote">Revocability of part of approved excess hours agreement</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="141" subsection="10" alinea="null">(10)</SPAN> If an employee has agreed to work hours in excess of those referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="1" href="#sec17subsec1_smooth">clause 17 (1)</A> (a) and hours in excess of those referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="1" href="#sec17subsec1_smooth">clause 17 (1)</A> (b), the fact that the Director has approved the agreement in accordance with a regulation made under paragraph 9 of subsection (1) does not prevent the employee from revoking, in accordance with <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="6" href="#sec17subsec6_smooth">subsection 17 (6)</A>, that part of the agreement dealing with the hours in excess of those referred to in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="17" ss="1" href="#sec17subsec1_smooth">clause 17 (1)</A> (b).  2000, c. 41, s. 141 (10); <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96647-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2004-c-21/latest/so-2004-c-21.html">2004, c. 21, s. 10 (6)</A>.</P>
 

 
<A name="part_xxViiI_Transition_520812"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK300"></A>part xxViiI <BR>  Transition</P>
 
<P class="headnote">Transition</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="142" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec142" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=142"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="142" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="142" data-viibes-start="241" data-viibes-end="240"><A name="BK301"></A><B><a name="sec142subsec1" id="sec142subsec1"></A><a name="sec142" id="sec142"></A>142 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="142" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Part XIV.1 of the <I>Employment Standards Act</I>, as it read immediately before its repeal by this Act, continues to apply only with respect to wages that became due and owing before the Employee Wage Protection Program was discontinued and only if the employee to whom the wages were owed provided a certificate of claim, on a form prepared by the Ministry, to the Program Administrator before the day on which this section comes into force.  2000, c. 41, s. 142 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec142subsec2" id="sec142subsec2"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="142" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96780-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2009-c-9/latest/so-2009-c-9.html">2009, c. 9, s. 29</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec142subsec3" id="sec142subsec3"></A><P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="142" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN>-(5) Repealed:  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96556-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html">2001, c. 9</A>, Sched. I, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="1" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2001-c-9/latest/so-2001-c-9.html#sec1subsec32" title1="Government Efficiency Act, 2001, SO 2001, c 9 (Ontario)" concatenated-id="96556" s="1" ss="32" data-link-type="weak">s. 1 (32)</SPAN>.</P>
 

 
<A name="Part_XXIX_Incorporation_of_the_Protecting_a_Sustainable_Public_Sector_for_Future_Generations_Act__2019_521598"></A><P class="partnum"><A name="BK302"></A>Part XXIX <BR>  Incorporation of the <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="60002-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">Protecting a Sustainable Public Sector for Future Generations Act, 2019</A></P>
 
<P class="headnote">Incorporation of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="60002-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">Protecting a Sustainable Public Sector for Future Generations Act, 2019</A></I></P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="143" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec143" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=143"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="143" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="143" data-viibes-start="242" data-viibes-end="241"><A name="BK303"></A><B><a name="sec143subsec1" id="sec143subsec1"></A><a name="sec143" id="sec143"></A>143 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="143" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The provisions of the
<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="60002-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">Protecting a Sustainable Public Sector for Future Generations Act, 2019</A></I> shall be deemed to form part of this Act and apply to,</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (a)  Ontario Power Generation Inc. and each of its subsidiaries; and</P>
 
<P class="paragraph">  (b)  the employees of any the employers referred to in clause (a). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97036-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">2019, c. 12, s. 42 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec143subsec2" id="sec143subsec2"></A><P class="headnote">Conflict</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="143" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If there is a conflict between the provisions incorporated into this Act under subsection (1) and <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">sections 1</A> to<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="142" href="#sec142_smooth"> 142</A> of this Act, the provisions incorporated under subsection (1) prevail only for the purposes of those incorporated provisions. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97036-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">2019, c. 12, s. 42 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec143subsec2.1" id="sec143subsec2_1"></A><P class="headnote">Same</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="143" subsection="2.1" alinea="null">(2.1)</SPAN> For greater certainty, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="50.1" ss="7" href="#sec50.1subsec7_smooth">subsection 50.1 (7)</A> of this Act prevails over the provisions incorporated into this Act under subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97087-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2021-c-9/latest/so-2021-c-9.html">2021, c. 9, s. 6</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec143subsec3" id="sec143subsec3"></A><P class="headnote">No complaints</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="143" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> No complaint may be made under this Act, and no employment standards officer may inspect or investigate any matter or take any enforcement action, in respect of the provisions incorporated into this Act under subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97036-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">2019, c. 12, s. 42 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec143subsec4" id="sec143subsec4"></A><P class="headnote">Non-application of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="132" href="#sec132_smooth">section 132</A></P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="143" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="132" href="#sec132_smooth">Section 132</A> of this Act does not apply in respect of the provisions incorporated into this Act under subsection (1). <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97036-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">2019, c. 12, s. 42 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<a name="sec143subsec5" id="sec143subsec5"></A><P class="headnote">Minister responsible</P>
 
<P class="subsection"><SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="143" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> For greater certainty, for the purposes of the provisions incorporated into this Act under subsection (1), Minister means the President of the Treasury Board or such other member of the Executive Council to whom the administration of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="60002-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">Protecting a Sustainable Public Sector for Future Generations Act, 2019</A></I> is assigned or transferred under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="136-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e25/latest/rso-1990-c-e25.html">Executive Council Act</A></I>. <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97036-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">2019, c. 12, s. 42 (1)</A>.</P>
 
<P class="Pnote">Note: On a day to be named by proclamation of the Lieutenant Governor, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="713-current-1" s="143" href="#sec143_smooth">section 143</A> of the Act is repealed. (See: <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97036-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2019-c-12/latest/so-2019-c-12.html">2019, c. 12, s. 42 (2)</A>)</P>
 

 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="144" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec144" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=144"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="144" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="19" data-noteup-count-display="19"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="144" data-viibes-start="243" data-viibes-end="242"><B><a name="sec144" id="sec144"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="144" subsection="null" alinea="null">144 </SPAN></B>Omitted (amends or repeals other Acts).  2000, c. 41, s. 144.</P></div>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="145" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec145" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=145"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="145" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="145" data-viibes-start="244" data-viibes-end="243"><B><a name="sec145" id="sec145"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="145" subsection="null" alinea="null">145 </SPAN></B>Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Act).  2000, c. 41, s. 145.</P></div>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="146" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec146" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=146"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="146" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section" data-viibes-parag="146" data-viibes-start="245" data-viibes-end="244"><B><a name="sec146" id="sec146"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="146" subsection="null" alinea="null">146 </SPAN></B>Omitted (enacts short title of this Act).  2000, c. 41, s. 146.</P></div>

let citedByUrl = "/legislationTabs/citedBy/count/?legislationId=713&lang=en";

$.get(citedByUrl, function(data) {
	$("#citedBy-spinner").hide("fast");
	$("#citedBy-count").html("(" + data + ")");
})
.fail(function(jqXHR) {
	console.error(jqXHR);
})
.always(function() {
	$("#citedBy-spinner").hide("fast");
});

// load noteup counts only when the tab is selected
var loadedCitedBy = false;
$('a#noteup-tab').on('shown.bs.tab', function (e) {
	if (loadedCitedBy == false) {
		$.get("/legislationTabs/citedBy/content/?legislationId=713&lang=en", function(data) {
			$("#noteupContent").html(data);
			$("#noteup-spinner").hide("fast");
		})
		.fail(function(jqXHR) {
			console.error(jqXHR);
			$("#noteupContent").html("<p>An error occured while loading this tab.</p>");
		})
		.always(function() {
			$("#noteup-spinner").hide("fast");
		});
		
		loadedCitedBy = true;
	}
});

    <DIV class="WordSection1 node-law">
 

 
<P class="shorttitle-e"><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="96543-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html">Employment Standards Act, 2000</A></P>
 
<P class="regnumber-e">ONTARIO REGULATION 285/01</P>
 
<P class="regtitle-e">When Work deemed to be performed, Exemptions and special rules</P>
 
<P class="ConsolidationPeriod"><B>Consolidation Period:</B> From May 1, 2022 to the <U>e-Laws currency date</U>.</P>
 
<P class="comment-e">Last amendment: 361/22.</P>
 

 
<P class="version-e">This is the English version of a bilingual regulation.</P>
 

 
<P class="MsoNormal">   </P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Definitions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="14" data-noteup-count-display="14"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="1" data-viibes-start="0">  <A name="BK0"></A><B><a name="sec1" id="sec1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="1" subsection="null" alinea="null">1.</SPAN></B><B> </B>In this Regulation,</P></div>
 
<P class="firstdef-e">“construction employee” means,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (a)  an employee employed at the site in any of the activities described in the definition of “construction industry”, or</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (b)  an employee who is engaged in off-site work, in whole or in part, but is commonly associated in work or collective bargaining with an employee described in clause (a); (“employé de la construction”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“construction industry” means the businesses that are engaged in constructing, altering, decorating, repairing or demolishing buildings, structures, roads, sewers, water or gas mains, pipe lines, tunnels, bridges, canals or other works at the site; (“industrie de la construction”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“domestic worker” means a person who is employed by a householder to perform services in the household or to provide care, supervision or personal assistance to children, senior or disabled members of the household, but does not include a sitter who provides care, supervision or personal assistance to children on an occasional, short-term basis; (“travailleur domestique”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“election official” means,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (a)  an employee appointed as a returning officer under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="142-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e6/latest/rso-1990-c-e6.html">Election Act</A></I>,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (b)  an employee who is employed on a temporary basis to assist in the administration of a general election or by-election under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="142-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e6/latest/rso-1990-c-e6.html">Election Act</A></I> and who is managed or supervised, directly or indirectly, by a returning officer, and</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (c)  an employee of the Chief Electoral Officer who is assigned on a temporary basis to provide support to returning officers in the administration of a general election or by-election under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="142-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e6/latest/rso-1990-c-e6.html">Election Act</A></I> within a region made up of one or more, but not all, electoral districts as determined under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="40078-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2015-c-31-sch-1/latest/so-2015-c-31-sch-1.html">Representation Act, 2015</A></I>; (“membre du personnel électoral”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“hotel, motel, tourist resort, restaurant and tavern” means an establishment that provides accommodation, lodging, meals or beverages for payment, and includes hotels, motels, motor hotels, tourist homes, tourist camps, tourist cabins and cottages, tourist inns, catering establishments and all other establishments of a similar nature; (“hôtel, motel, lieu de villégiature, restaurant et taverne”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“information technology professional” means an employee who is primarily engaged in the investigation, analysis, design, development, implementation, operation or management of information systems based on computer and related technologies through the objective application of specialized knowledge and professional judgment; (“professionnel en technologie de l’information”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“recorded visual and audio-visual entertainment production industry” means the industry of producing visual or audio-visual recorded entertainment that is intended to be replayed in cinemas or on the Internet, as part of a television broadcast, or on a VCR or DVD player or a similar device, but does not include the industry of producing commercials (other than trailers), video games or educational material; (“industrie de la production de divertissements visuels et audio-visuels enregistrés”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“residential care worker” means a person who is employed to supervise and care for children or developmentally handicapped persons in a family-type residential dwelling or cottage and who resides in the dwelling or cottage during work periods, but does not include a foster parent; (“préposé aux soins en établissement”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“road building” means the preparation, construction, reconstruction, repair, alteration, remodelling, renovation, demolition, finishing and maintenance of streets, highways or parking lots, including structures such as bridges, tunnels or retaining walls in connection with streets or highways, and all foundations, installation of equipment, appurtenances and work incidental thereto; (“construction de routes”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“seasonal employee” means an employee who works not more than 16 weeks in a calendar year for an employer; (“employé saisonnier”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“taxi cab” means a vehicle, with seating accommodation for not more than nine persons exclusive of the driver, used to carry persons for hire; (“taxi”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“wage rate” means, where an employee is paid for piecework, the rate paid per piece and if there is more than one piece rate, each of the piece rates, and the number of pieces paid at each rate; (“taux de salaire”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“wilderness guide” means a person who is employed to guide, teach or assist one or more persons while those persons are engaged in activities in a wilderness environment, including the following activities:</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (a)  back-country skiing and snowshoeing,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (b)  canoeing, kayaking, and rafting,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (c)  dogsledding,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (d)  hiking,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (e)  horseback riding,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (f)  rock climbing,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (g)  operating all-terrain vehicles or snowmobiles,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (h)  wildlife viewing,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (i)  survival training,</P>
 
<P class="Sdefinition-e">but does not include,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (j)  a hunting or fishing guide, or</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (k)  a student under 18 years of age who works 28 hours each week or less or who is employed during a school holiday. (“guide d’aventure”) O. Reg. 285/01, s. 1; O. Reg. 552/05, s. 1; O. Reg. 97/18, s. 1; O. Reg. 147/19, s. 1.</P>
 
<A name="When_Work_Deemed_to_be_Performed__6602"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK1"></A>When Work Deemed to be Performed</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">When work deemed to be performed</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="1.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec1.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=1.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="1.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="15" data-noteup-count-display="15"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="1.1" data-viibes-start="1" data-viibes-end="0"><B>  <A name="BK2"></A><a name="sec1.1subsec1" id="sec1_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec1.1" id="sec1_1"></A>1.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="1.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Subject to subsection (2), work shall be deemed to be performed by an employee for the employer,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  where work is,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (i)  permitted or suffered to be done by the employer, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ii)  in fact performed by an employee although a term of the contract of employment expressly forbids or limits hours of work or requires the employer to authorize hours of work in advance; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  where the employee is not performing work and is required to remain at the place of employment,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (i)  waiting or holding himself or herself ready for call to work, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ii)  on a rest or break-time other than an eating period. O. Reg. 526/17, s. 2.</P>
 
<a name="sec1.1subsec2" id="sec1_1subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="1.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Work shall not be deemed to be performed for an employer during the time the employee,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  is entitled to,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (i)  take time off work for an eating period,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ii)  take at least six hours or such longer period as is established by contract, custom or practice for sleeping and the employer furnishes sleeping facilities, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (iii)  take time off work in order to engage in the employee’s own private affairs or pursuits as is established by contract, custom or practice; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  is not at the place of employment and is waiting or holding himself or herself ready for call to work. O. Reg. 526/17, s. 2.</P>
 
<A name="Exemptions_re_Various_Parts_of_Act__8389"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK3"></A>Exemptions re Various Parts of Act</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Exemptions from Parts VII to XI of Act</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="2" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec2" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=2"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="2" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="30" data-noteup-count-display="30"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="2" data-viibes-start="2" data-viibes-end="1">  <A name="BK4"></A><B><a name="sec2subsec1" id="sec2subsec1"></A><a name="sec2" id="sec2"></A>2.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="2" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Parts VII, VII.1, VIII, IX, X and XI of the Act do not apply to a person employed,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  as a duly qualified practitioner of,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (i)  architecture,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ii)  law,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (iii)  professional engineering,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (iv)  public accounting,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (v)  surveying, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (vi)  veterinary science;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  as a duly registered practitioner of,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (i)  chiropody,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ii)  chiropractic,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (iii)  dentistry,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (iv)  massage therapy,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (v)  medicine,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (vi)  optometry,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (vii)  pharmacy,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (viii)  physiotherapy, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ix)  psychology;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  as a duly registered practitioner under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="837-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2007-c-10-sch-p/latest/so-2007-c-10-sch-p.html">Naturopathy Act, 2007</A></I>;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (d)  as a teacher as defined in the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="500-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-t2/latest/rso-1990-c-t2.html">Teaching Profession Act</A></I>;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (e)  as a student in training for an occupation mentioned in clause (a), (b), (c) or (d);</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (f)  in commercial fishing;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (g)  as a salesperson or broker, as those terms are defined in the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="759-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2002-c-30-sch-c/latest/so-2002-c-30-sch-c.html">Real Estate and Business Brokers Act, 2002</A></I>; or</P>
 
<P class="Pnote-e">Note: On December 1, 2023, the day <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97043-current-1" s="1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-1/latest/so-2020-c-1.html#sec1_smooth">section 1</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="97043-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2020-c-1/latest/so-2020-c-1.html">Trust in Real Estate Services Act, 2020</A></I> comes into force, clause 2 (1) (g) of the Regulation is amended by striking out “<I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="759-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2002-c-30-sch-c/latest/so-2002-c-30-sch-c.html">Real Estate and Business Brokers Act, 2002</A></I>” and substituting “<I>Trust in Real Estate Services Act, 2002</I>”<I>.
</I>(See: O. Reg. 361/22, s. 1)</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (h)  as a salesperson, other than a route salesperson, who is entitled to receive all or any part of his or her remuneration as commissions in respect of offers to purchase or sales that,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (i)  relate to goods or services, and</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ii)  are normally made away from the employer’s place of business.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 2 (1); O. Reg. 92/06, s. 1; O. Reg. 498/18, s. 1 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec2subsec2" id="sec2subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subject to sections 24, 25, 25.1, 26 and 27 of this Regulation, Parts VII, VII.1, VIII, IX, X and XI of the Act do not apply to a person employed on a farm whose employment is directly related to the primary production of eggs, milk, grain, seeds, fruit, vegetables, maple products, honey, tobacco, herbs, pigs, cattle, sheep, goats, poultry, deer, elk, ratites, bison, rabbits, game birds, wild boar and cultured fish.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 2 (2); O. Reg. 498/18, s. 1 (2).</P>
 
<A name="Exemption_for_the_Crown_and_Certain_Public_Bodies__11449"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK5"></A>Exemption for the Crown and Certain Public Bodies</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Crown, etc., exemption</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="2.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec2.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=2.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="2.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="2.1" data-viibes-start="3" data-viibes-end="2">  <A name="BK6"></A><B><a name="sec2.1subsec1" id="sec2_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec2.1" id="sec2_1"></A>2.1 </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="2.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The Crown, a Crown agency or an authority, board, commission or corporation all of whose members are appointed by the Crown, and any employees of such an employer, are exempt from every provision of the Act except for those listed in subsection (2). O. Reg. 498/18, s. 2.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec2.1subsec2" id="sec2_1subsec2"></A><P class="headnote-e">Provisions that apply</P>
 
<P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="2.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Only the following provisions of the Act apply with respect to an employer or employee described in subsection (1):</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  Part I (Definitions).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  Part III (How This Act Applies), subject to the application of subsection 4 (4.1).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  3.  Part IV (Continuity of Employment).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  4.  <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="14" href="#sec14_smooth">Section 14</A>.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  5.  Part VI (Records).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  6.  Part IX (Minimum Wage).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  7.  Part XI (Vacation with Pay).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  8.  Part XII (Equal Pay for Equal Work).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  9.  Part XIII (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1507-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-286-01/latest/o-reg-286-01.html">Benefit Plans</A>).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  10.  Part XIV (Leaves of Absence).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  11.  Part XV (Termination and Severance of Employment).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  12.  Part XVI (Lie Detectors).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  13.  Part XVIII (Reprisal), except for subclause 74 (1) (a) (vii) and clause 74 (1) (b).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  14.  Part XIX (Building Services Providers).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  15.  Part XXI (Who Enforces This Act and What They Can Do).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  16.  Part XXII (Complaints and Enforcement).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  17.  Part XXIII (Reviews by the Board).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  18.  Part XXVI (Miscellaneous Evidentiary Provisions).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  19.  Part XXVII (Regulations).</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  20.  Part XXVIII (Transition). O. Reg. 498/18, s. 2.</P>

<A name="Exemption_re_Certain_Deductions__etc___14451"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK9"></A>Exemption re Certain Deductions, etc.</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Fees, s. 28 of <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="813-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2006-c-2/latest/so-2006-c-2.html">Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System Act, 2006</A></I></P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="3" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec3" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=3"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="3" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="3" data-viibes-start="6" data-viibes-end="5">  <A name="BK10"></A><B><a name="sec3" id="sec3"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="3" subsection="null" alinea="null">3</SPAN></B><B>.1 </B>(1) An employer is exempted from the application of <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="13" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">section 13</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN> if the employer participates in an OMERS pension plan under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="813-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2006-c-2/latest/so-2006-c-2.html">Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System Act, 2006</A></I>,<I> </I>but only with respect to fees that a by-law made under section 28 of that Act requires employees to pay.  O. Reg. 444/07, s. 1.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec3subsec2" id="sec3subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="3" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies only if the employer remits the fees in accordance with the by-law.  O. Reg. 444/07, s. 1.</P>
 
<A name="Exemptions_re_Hours_of_Work_and_Eating_Periods__15194"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK11"></A>Exemptions re Hours of Work and Eating Periods</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Exemptions from Part VII of Act</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="4" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec4" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=4"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="4" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="7" data-noteup-count-display="7"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="4" data-viibes-start="7" data-viibes-end="6">  <A name="BK12"></A><B><a name="sec4subsec1" id="sec4subsec1"></A><a name="sec4" id="sec4"></A>4.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="4" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="17" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Sections 17</SPAN>, <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="18" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">18</SPAN> and<SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="19" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1"> 19</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN> do not apply to, </P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  a person employed as a firefighter as defined in <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="649-current-1" s="1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-4/latest/so-1997-c-4.html#sec1_smooth">section 1</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="649-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-4/latest/so-1997-c-4.html">Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997</A></I>;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  a person whose work is supervisory or managerial in character and who may perform non-supervisory or non-managerial tasks on an irregular or exceptional basis;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  a person employed as a hunting or fishing guide or a wilderness guide;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (d)  a construction employee;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (e)  a person who is employed as the superintendent, janitor or caretaker of a residential building and resides in the building; </P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (f)  a person employed as an embalmer or funeral director; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (g)  subject to subsection (1.1), an election official. O. Reg. 285/01, s. 4 (1); O. Reg. 97/18, s. 2 (1); O. Reg. 147/19, s. 2.</P>
 
<a name="sec4subsec1.1" id="sec4subsec1_1"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="1.1" alinea="null">(1.1)</SPAN> The exemption in clause (1) (g) only applies during a period that begins with the issue of a writ for a general election or by-election under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="142-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-e6/latest/rso-1990-c-e6.html">Election Act</A></I> and ends on the day after polling day. O. Reg. 97/18, s. 2 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec4subsec2" id="sec4subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="17" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">Sections 17</SPAN> and<SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="19" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713"> 19</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">Act</SPAN> do not apply to a person employed, </P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  as a landscape gardener; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  to install and maintain swimming pools.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 4 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec4subsec3" id="sec4subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="4" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Part VII of the Act does not apply to,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  a person whose employment is directly related to,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (i)  the growing of mushrooms,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (ii)  the growing of flowers for the retail and wholesale trade,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (iii)  the growing, transporting and laying of sod,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (iv)  the growing of trees and shrubs for the wholesale and retail trade,</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (v)  the breeding and boarding of horses on a farm, or</P>
 
<P class="subclause-e">  (vi)  the keeping of furbearing mammals, as defined in the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="650-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-1997-c-41/latest/so-1997-c-41.html">Fish and Wildlife Conservation Act, 1997</A></I>, for propagation or the production of pelts for commercial purposes;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e"> (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="1" href="#sec1_smooth">a.1</A>)  Revoked: O. Reg. 498/18, s. 5.</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  an information technology professional; or </P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  a person employed in the recorded visual and audio-visual entertainment production industry.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 4 (3); O. Reg. 552/05, s. 2; O. Reg. 448/18, s. 1; O. Reg. 498/18, s. 5.</P>
 
<A name="Exemptions_re_Three_Hour_Rule__18066"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK13"></A>Exemptions re Three Hour Rule</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Exemptions from Part VII.1 of Act</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="4.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec4.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=4.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="4.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="4.1" data-viibes-start="8" data-viibes-end="7">  <A name="BK14"></A><B><a name="sec4.1" id="sec4_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="4.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">4.1</SPAN> </B><SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="21.2" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Section 21.2</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN> does not apply to,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  a person who is employed as a student in a recreational program operated by a charitable organization registered under Part I of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12707-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-1-5th-supp/latest/rsc-1985-c-1-5th-supp.html">Income Tax Act</A></I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="12707-current-1" href="/en/ca/laws/stat/rsc-1985-c-1-5th-supp/latest/rsc-1985-c-1-5th-supp.html"> (Canada)</A> and whose work or duties are directly connected with the recreational program unless the person is a wilderness guide;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  a person employed as a student to instruct or supervise children unless the person is a wilderness guide;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  a person employed as a student at a camp for children unless the person is a wilderness guide; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (d)  a person who is employed as the superintendent, janitor or caretaker of a residential building and resides in the building. O. Reg. 498/18, s. 6; O. Reg. 147/19, s. 3.</P>
 
<A name="Rules_re_Minimum_Wage__19094"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK15"></A>Rules re Minimum Wage</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Room and board</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="5" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec5" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=5"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="5" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="21" data-noteup-count-display="21"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="5" data-viibes-start="9" data-viibes-end="8">  <A name="BK16"></A><B><a name="sec5subsec1" id="sec5subsec1"></A><a name="sec5" id="sec5"></A>5. </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="5" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employer provides room or board to an employee, the following are the amounts that shall be deemed to have been paid as wages for the purposes of determining whether the minimum wage has been paid:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  For room, $31.70 a week if the room is private and $15.85 a week if the room is not private.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  For board, $2.55 a meal and not more than $53.55 a week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  3.  For both room and board, $85.25 a week if the room is private and $69.40 a week if the room is not private. O. Reg. 526/17, s. 7 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec5subsec2" id="sec5subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="5" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The amount provided in subsection (1) in respect of a room shall be deemed to have been paid as wages only if the room is,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  reasonably furnished and reasonably fit for human habitation;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  supplied with clean bed linen and towels; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  reasonably accessible to proper toilet and wash-basin facilities. O. Reg. 526/17, s. 7 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec5subsec3" id="sec5subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="5" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Room or board shall not be deemed to have been paid by the employer to an employee as wages unless the employee has received the meals or occupied the room. O. Reg. 526/17, s. 7 (2).</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="5.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec5.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=5.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="5.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="5.1" data-viibes-start="10" data-viibes-end="9">  <B><a name="sec5.1" id="sec5_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="5.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">5.1 </SPAN></B>Revoked: O. Reg. 526/17, s. 8.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Minimum wage for wilderness guides</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="6" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec6" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=6"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="6" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="31" data-noteup-count-display="31"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="6" data-viibes-start="11" data-viibes-end="10">  <A name="BK17"></A><B><a name="sec6subsec1" id="sec6subsec1"></A><a name="sec6" id="sec6"></A>6. </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="6" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Wilderness guides are prescribed as a class of employees for the purposes of <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="23.1" ss="2" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">subsection 23.1 (2)</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN>. O. Reg. 147/19, s. 4.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec6subsec2" id="sec6subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="6" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The minimum wage prescribed for the services of a wilderness guide is the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  On or after January 1, 2022 but before October 1, 2022, $75.00 for less than five consecutive hours in a day and $150.05 for five or more hours in a day, whether or not the hours are consecutive.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  From October 1, 2022 onwards, the amount determined under <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="23.1" ss="4" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">subsection 23.1 (4)</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">Act</SPAN>. O. Reg. 835/21, s. 1.</P>
 
<A name="Exemptions_re_Minimum_Wage__21364"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK18"></A>Exemptions re Minimum Wage</P>
