<P class="clause-e">  (h)  a person who is employed as the superintendent, janitor or caretaker of a residential building and resides in the building;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (i)  a person employed as a taxi cab driver; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (j)  a person who is employed as a seasonal employee in a hotel, motel, tourist resort, restaurant or tavern and provided with room and board.</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (k)  Revoked:  O. Reg. 443/08, s. 1.</P>
 
<P class="footnote-e">O. Reg. 285/01, s. 9 (1); O. Reg. 443/08, s. 1; O. Reg. 147/19, s. 7.</P>
 
<a name="sec9subsec2" id="sec9subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="9" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Part X of the Act does not apply to a construction employee who works in the construction industry if,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  the employee’s period of employment is less than five years and the employee receives 7.7 per cent or more of his or her hourly rate or wages for vacation pay or holiday pay; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  the employee’s period of employment is five years or more and the employee receives 9.7 per cent or more of his or her hourly rate or wages for vacation pay or holiday pay. O. Reg. 526/17, s. 10.</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="9.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec9.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=9.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="9.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="9.1" data-viibes-start="15" data-viibes-end="14">  <B><a name="sec9.1" id="sec9_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="9.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">9.1 </SPAN></B>Revoked: O. Reg. 498/18, s. 8.</P></div>
 
<A name="Exemption_re_Retail_Business_Establishments__28130"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK24"></A>Exemption re Retail Business Establishments</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Application of <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="73" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">s. 73</SPAN> of <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">Act</SPAN></P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="10" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec10" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=10"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="10" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="10" data-viibes-start="16" data-viibes-end="15">  <A name="BK25"></A><B><a name="sec10subsec1" id="sec10subsec1"></A><a name="sec10" id="sec10"></A>10.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="10" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite section 73 of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN>, an employee in a retail business establishment shall not refuse to work on a Sunday if he or she agreed, at the time of being hired, to work on Sundays.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 10 (1).</P></div>
 
<P class="subsection-e"><B>  </B>(2) Subsection (1) does not apply to an employee who declines to work on a Sunday for reasons of religious belief or religious observance.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 10 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec10subsec3" id="sec10subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="10" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The employer shall not make an employee’s agreement to work on Sundays a condition of being hired if the condition would be contrary to <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="202-current-1" s="11" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h19/latest/rso-1990-c-h19.html#sec11_smooth">section 11</A> of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="202-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-h19/latest/rso-1990-c-h19.html">Human Rights Code</A></I>.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 10 (3).</P>
 
<A name="Exemptions_re_Temporary_Help_Agencies__29009"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK26"></A>Exemptions re Temporary Help Agencies</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Exemptions from Part XVIII.1 of Act</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="10.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec10.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=10.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="10.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="10.1" data-viibes-start="17" data-viibes-end="16">  <A name="BK27"></A><B><a name="sec10.1" id="sec10_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="10.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">10.1</SPAN> </B>Part XVIII.1 of the Act does not apply in relation to an individual who is an assignment employee assigned to provide professional services, personal support services or homemaking services within the meaning of <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="82599-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-187-22/latest/o-reg-187-22.html">Ontario Regulation 187/22</A> (<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="82599-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-187-22/latest/o-reg-187-22.html">Home and Community Care Services</A>) made under the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="48788-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2019-c-5-sch-1/latest/so-2019-c-5-sch-1.html">Connecting Care Act, 2019</A></I> if the assignment is made under a contract between,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  the individual and a local health integration network within the meaning of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="827-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2006-c-4/latest/so-2006-c-4.html">Local Health System Integration Act, 2006</A></I>; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  an employer of the individual and a local health integration network within the meaning of the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="827-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2006-c-4/latest/so-2006-c-4.html">Local Health System Integration Act, 2006</A></I>. O. Reg. 196/22, s. 1.</P>
 
<A name="Special_Rules_re_Homemakers__29957"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK28"></A>Special Rules re Homemakers</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Homemakers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="11" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec11" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=11"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="11" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="11" data-viibes-start="18" data-viibes-end="17">  <A name="BK29"></A><B><a name="sec11subsec1" id="sec11subsec1"></A><a name="sec11" id="sec11"></A>11.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="11" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section, </P></div>
 
<P class="firstdef-e">“homemaker” means a person who is employed,</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (a)  to perform homemaking services for a householder or member of a household in the householder’s private residence, and</P>
 
<P class="defclause-e">  (b)  by a person other than the householder.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 11 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec11subsec2" id="sec11subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="11" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="1.1" href="#sec1.1_smooth">section 1.1</A>, the hours of work in respect of which a homemaker is to be paid at least the minimum wage shall be not more than 12 hours in a day.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 11 (2); O. Reg. 526/17, s. 12.</P>
 
<a name="sec11subsec3" id="sec11subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="11" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Parts VII (Hours of Work and Eating Periods) and VIII (Overtime Pay) and paragraph 4 of subsection 15 (1)<B> </B>(record of hours worked) of the Act do not apply to a homemaker who is paid in accordance with subsection (2).  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 11 (3).</P>
 
<A name="Special_Rules_re_Homeworkers__31017"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK30"></A>Special Rules re Homeworkers</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Homeworkers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="12" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec12" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=12"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="12" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="12" data-viibes-start="19" data-viibes-end="18">  <A name="BK31"></A><B><a name="sec12subsec1" id="sec12subsec1"></A><a name="sec12" id="sec12"></A>12.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="12" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> The employer of a homeworker shall advise the homeworker in writing of the type of work that he or she is being employed to perform and,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  if the homeworker is to be paid according to the number of hours worked, of the amount to be paid for an hour of work in a regular work week;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  if the homeworker is to be paid according to the number of articles or things manufactured, of the amount to be paid for each article or thing manufactured in a regular work week; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  if the homeworker is to be paid on some other basis, the basis on which he or she is to be paid.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 12 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec12subsec2" id="sec12subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="12" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the employer of a homeworker who is paid according to the number of articles or things manufactured requires the manufacture of a certain number of articles or things to be completed by a certain date or time, the employer shall advise the homeworker of those requirements in writing.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 12 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec12subsec3" id="sec12subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="12" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> In this section, </P>
 
<P class="firstdef-e">“manufacture” includes preparation, improvement, repair, alteration, assembly or completion.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 12 (3).</P>
 
<A name="Special_Rules_and_Exemptions_re_Overtime_Pay__32444"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK32"></A>Special Rules and Exemptions re Overtime Pay</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Road building</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="13" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec13" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=13"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="13" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="9" data-noteup-count-display="9"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="13" data-viibes-start="20" data-viibes-end="19">  <A name="BK33"></A><B><a name="sec13subsec1" id="sec13subsec1"></A><a name="sec13" id="sec13"></A>13.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="13" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite Part VIII of the Act, in the case of an employee engaged at the site of road building in relation to streets, highways or parking lots, </P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  subject to clause (b), the employer shall pay overtime pay for each hour worked in excess of 55 hours in a work week, at an amount not less than one and one-half times the employee’s regular rate; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  if the employee works less than 55 hours in a work week, the difference between 55 hours and the number of hours actually worked, up to an amount not exceeding 22 hours, may be added to the maximum set out in clause (a) for the purpose of determining the employee’s overtime pay for the next work week.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 13 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec13subsec2" id="sec13subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="13" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Despite Part VIII of the Act, in the case of an employee engaged at the site of road building in relation to structures such as bridges, tunnels or retaining walls in connection with streets or highways,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  subject to clause (b), the employer shall pay overtime pay for each hour worked in excess of 50 hours in a work week, at an amount not less than one and one-half times the employee’s regular rate; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  if the employee works less than 50 hours in a work week, the difference between 50 hours and the number of hours actually worked, up to an amount not exceeding 22 hours, may be added to the maximum set out in clause (a) for the purpose of determining the employee’s overtime pay for the next work week.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 13 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Hotels, motels, tourist resorts, restaurants and taverns</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="14" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec14" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=14"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="14" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="14" data-viibes-start="21" data-viibes-end="20">  <A name="BK34"></A><B><a name="sec14" id="sec14"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="14" subsection="null" alinea="null">14.</SPAN></B><B> </B>Despite Part VIII of the Act, the employer shall pay an employee who works for the owner or operator of a hotel, motel, tourist resort, restaurant or tavern for 24 weeks or less in a calendar year and who is provided with room and board overtime pay for each hour worked in excess of 50 hours in a work week, at an amount not less than one and one-half times the employee’s regular rate.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 14.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Fresh fruit and vegetable processing</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="15" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec15" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=15"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="15" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="15" data-viibes-start="22" data-viibes-end="21">  <A name="BK35"></A><B><a name="sec15" id="sec15"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="15" subsection="null" alinea="null">15.</SPAN></B><B> </B>Despite Part VIII of the Act, the employer shall pay a seasonal employee whose employment is directly related to the canning, processing and packing of fresh fruits or vegetables or their distribution by the canner, processor or packer overtime pay for each hour worked in excess of 50 hours in a work week, at an amount not less than one and one-half times the employee’s regular rate.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 15.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Sewer and watermain construction</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="16" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec16" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=16"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="16" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="4" data-noteup-count-display="4"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="16" data-viibes-start="23" data-viibes-end="22">  <A name="BK36"></A><B><a name="sec16" id="sec16"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="16" subsection="null" alinea="null">16.</SPAN></B><B> </B>Despite Part VIII of the Act, the employer shall pay an employee who is employed in laying, altering, repairing or maintaining sewers and watermain and in work incidental thereto, or in guarding the site during the laying, altering, repairing or maintaining of sewers and watermain, overtime pay for each hour worked in excess of 50 hours in a work week, at an amount not less than one and one-half times the employee’s regular rate.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 16.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Local cartage</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="17" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec17" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=17"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="17" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="3" data-noteup-count-display="3"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="17" data-viibes-start="24" data-viibes-end="23">  <A name="BK37"></A><B><a name="sec17subsec1" id="sec17subsec1"></A><a name="sec17" id="sec17"></A>17.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="17" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite Part VIII of the Act, the employer shall pay an employee who is a driver of a vehicle or a driver’s helper overtime pay for each hour worked in excess of 50 hours in a work week, at an amount not less than one and one-half times the employee’s regular rate.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 17 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec17subsec2" id="sec17subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="17" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies to employees who are,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  drivers of vehicles used in the business of carrying goods for hire within a municipality or to any point not more than five kilometres beyond the municipality’s limits; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  drivers’ helpers on such vehicles.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 17 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Highway transport</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="18" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec18" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=18"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="18" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="13" data-noteup-count-display="13"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="18" data-viibes-start="25" data-viibes-end="24">  <A name="BK38"></A><B><a name="sec18subsec1" id="sec18subsec1"></A><a name="sec18" id="sec18"></A>18. </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="18" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite Part VIII of the Act, the employer shall pay an employee to whom this subsection applies overtime pay for each hour worked in excess of 60 hours in a work week, at an amount not less than one and one-half times the employee’s regular rate.  O. Reg. 18/06, s. 1.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec18subsec2" id="sec18subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Subsection (1) applies to an employee who is the driver of any of the following:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  A truck whose operator held an operating licence under the former Act on December 31, 2005.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  A truck whose operator held a certificate of intercorporate exemption under the former Act on December 31, 2005, if after that date the truck is operated to carry, for compensation, goods of another person who is not an affiliated corporation under the former Act, such that the operator would be required to hold an operating licence under the former Act if it were still in force.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  3.  A truck that is operated to carry goods of another person for compensation, if the operator,</P>
 
<P class="subpara-e">  i.  did not hold an operating licence or a certificate of intercorporate exemption under the former Act on December 31, 2005, and</P>
 
<P class="subpara-e">  ii.  would be required to hold an operating licence under the former Act<I> </I>if it were still in force.  O. Reg. 18/06, s. 1.</P>
 
<a name="sec18subsec3" id="sec18subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> For the purposes of paragraph 2 of subsection (2), subsection 3 (6) of the former Act does not apply.  O. Reg. 18/06, s. 1.</P>
 
<a name="sec18subsec4" id="sec18subsec4"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> For the purposes of subparagraph 3 ii of subsection (2), subsections 3 (5) and (6) of the former Act do not apply.  O. Reg. 18/06, s. 1.</P>
 
<a name="sec18subsec5" id="sec18subsec5"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> Subsection (1) does not apply to an employee to whom <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="17" href="#sec17_smooth">section 17</A> applies.  O. Reg. 18/06, s. 1.</P>
 
<a name="sec18subsec6" id="sec18subsec6"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> For the purposes of this section, in computing the number of hours worked by an employee in a week, only the hours during which he or she is directly responsible for the truck shall be included.  O. Reg. 18/06, s. 1.</P>
 
<a name="sec18subsec7" id="sec18subsec7"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="18" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> In this section,</P>
 
<P class="firstdef-e">“commercial motor vehicle” has the same meaning as in the former Act; (“véhicule automobile utilitaire”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“former Act” means the <I><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="503-current-1" href="/en/on/laws/stat/rso-1990-c-t22/latest/rso-1990-c-t22.html">Truck Transportation Act</A></I>; (“ancienne loi”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“operate” has the same meaning as in the former Act, and “operator” has a corresponding meaning; (“exploiter”, “exploitant”)</P>
 
<P class="definition-e">“truck” means a commercial motor vehicle or the combination of a commercial motor vehicle and trailer or trailers drawn by it. (“camion”)  O. Reg. 18/06, s. 1.</P>
 
<A name="Special_Rules_re_Domestic_Workers__39545"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK39"></A>Special Rules re Domestic Workers</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Domestic workers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="19" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec19" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=19"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="19" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="19" data-viibes-start="26" data-viibes-end="25"><B>  <A name="BK40"></A><a name="sec19subsec1" id="sec19subsec1"></A><a name="sec19" id="sec19"></A>19.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="19" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> A householder shall provide the domestic worker with written particulars of employment respecting,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  the regular hours of work, including the starting and finishing times; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  the hourly rate of pay.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 19 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec19subsec2" id="sec19subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="19" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the householder provides room or board to the domestic worker, the following are the amounts that shall be deemed to have been paid as wages for the purposes of determining whether the minimum wage has been paid:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  For a private room, $31.70 a week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  For a non-private room, $0.00.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  3.  For board, $2.55 a meal and not more than $53.55 a week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  4.  For both room and board, $85.25 a week if the room is private and $53.55 a week if the room is not private. O. Reg. 31/14, s. 3 (1); O. Reg. 526/17, s. 13.</P>
 
<a name="sec19subsec3" id="sec19subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="19" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The amount provided in subsection (2) in respect of a room shall be deemed to have been paid as wages only if the room is,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  reasonably furnished and reasonably fit for human habitation;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  supplied with clean bed linen and towels; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  reasonably accessible to proper toilet and wash-basin facilities.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 19 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec19subsec4" id="sec19subsec4"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="19" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Room or board shall not be deemed to have been paid by the householder to the domestic worker as wages unless the employee has received the meals or occupied the room.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 19 (4); O. Reg. 31/14, s. 3 (2).</P>
 
<A name="Special_Rules_re_Residential_Care_Workers__41421"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK41"></A>Special Rules re Residential Care Workers</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Residential care workers</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="20" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec20" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=20"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="20" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="20" data-viibes-start="27" data-viibes-end="26"><B>  <A name="BK42"></A><a name="sec20subsec1" id="sec20subsec1"></A><a name="sec20" id="sec20"></A>20.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="20" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> In this section,</P></div>
 
<P class="firstdef-e">“day” means the 24-hour period between 12:00 midnight on a day and 12:00 midnight on the next day.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 20 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec20subsec2" id="sec20subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="20" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="1.1" href="#sec1.1_smooth">section 1.1</A> and subject to subsection (3), the employer shall pay to a residential care worker for each day of work wages in a minimum amount, not less than an amount calculated by multiplying 12 hours by the worker’s regular rate, which shall not be less than the minimum wage.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 20 (2); O. Reg. 526/17, s. 14.</P>
 
<a name="sec20subsec3" id="sec20subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="20" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> If a residential care worker, by arrangement with the employer, is free from the performance of normal and regular duties in a day and as a result works less than 12 hours, the worker shall be paid wages not less than an amount calculated by multiplying the number of hours actually worked by the worker’s regular rate as mentioned in subsection (2).  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 20 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec20subsec4" id="sec20subsec4"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="20" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> In addition to the wage payable under subsection (2), the employer shall pay to a residential care worker not less than the worker’s regular rate for not more than three additional hours worked in excess of 12 hours of work in a day, if the worker,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  makes and keeps an accurate daily record of the number of hours worked in the day; and </P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  provides the record to the employer on or before the first pay day after the pay day for the pay period in which the work is performed.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 20 (4).</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Free time</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="21" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec21" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=21"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="21" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="21" data-viibes-start="28" data-viibes-end="27">  <A name="BK43"></A><B><a name="sec21subsec1" id="sec21subsec1"></A><a name="sec21" id="sec21"></A>21.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="21" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="18" href="#sec18_smooth">section 18</A> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN>, every employer shall give to a residential care worker not less than 36 hours in each work week, either consecutive or as may be arranged with the consent of the worker, free from the performance of any duties for the employer.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 21 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec21subsec2" id="sec21subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="21" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> If the residential care worker consents, at the employer’s request, to do work during a free hour mentioned in subsection (1), </P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  that hour shall be added to one of the next eight 36-hour periods of free time; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  the employer shall pay the residential care worker at least one and one-half times the worker’s regular rate for the time spent doing work during a free hour.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 21 (2).</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">When work deemed not to be performed</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="22" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec22" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=22"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="22" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="22" data-viibes-start="29" data-viibes-end="28">  <A name="BK44"></A><B><a name="sec22" id="sec22"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="22" subsection="null" alinea="null">22.</SPAN></B><B> </B>Despite <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="1.1" href="#sec1.1_smooth">section 1.1</A>, work shall be deemed not to be performed during any time that satisfies the following conditions:</P></div>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  The residential care worker spends the time at the dwelling or cottage,</P>
 
<P class="subpara-e">  i.  attending to private affairs or pursuits, or</P>
 
<P class="subpara-e">  ii.  resting, sleeping or eating.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  The time is, by agreement with the employer, free from the performance of any duties.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 22; O. Reg. 526/17, s. 15.</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Exemptions</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="23" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec23" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=23"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="23" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="23" data-viibes-start="30" data-viibes-end="29">  <A name="BK45"></A><B><a name="sec23" id="sec23"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="23" subsection="null" alinea="null">23.</SPAN></B><B> </B>Parts VII (Hours of Work and Eating Periods) and VIII (Overtime Pay) and paragraph 4 of subsection 15 (1) (record of hours worked) of the Act do not apply to or in respect of a residential care worker.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 23.</P></div>
 
<A name="Special_Rules_re_Fruit__Vegetable_and_Tobacco_Harvesters__45089"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK46"></A>Special Rules re Fruit, Vegetable and Tobacco Harvesters</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Application</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="24" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec24" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=24"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="24" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="24" data-viibes-start="31" data-viibes-end="30">  <A name="BK47"></A><B><a name="sec24" id="sec24"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="24" subsection="null" alinea="null">24.</SPAN></B><B> </B><A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="25" href="#sec25_smooth">Sections 25</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="25.1" href="#sec25.1_smooth">25.1</A>, <A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="26" href="#sec26_smooth">26</A> and<A class="reflex2-link" concatenated-id="1502-current-1" s="27" href="#sec27_smooth"> 27</A> apply to an employee who is employed on a farm to harvest fruit, vegetables or tobacco for marketing or storage.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 24; O. Reg. 498/18, s. 9.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Minimum wage</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="25" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec25" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=25"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="25" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="25" data-viibes-start="32" data-viibes-end="31"><B>  <A name="BK48"></A><a name="sec25subsec1" id="sec25subsec1"></A><a name="sec25" id="sec25"></A>25.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="25" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> For each pay period, the employer shall pay to each employee an amount that is at least equal to the amount the employee would have earned at the minimum wage. O. Reg. 31/14, s. 4 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec25subsec2" id="sec25subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The employer shall be deemed to comply with subsection (1) if employees are paid a piece work rate that is customarily and generally recognized in the area as having been set so that an employee exercising reasonable effort would, if paid such a rate, earn at least the minimum wage.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 25 (2); O. Reg. 401/03, s. 4 (2); O. Reg. 294/07, s. 4 (2); O. Reg. 31/14, s. 4 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec3" id="sec25subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Subsection (2) does not apply in respect of an employee described in subparagraph 1 i of <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="23.1" ss="1" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">subsection 23.1 (1)</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">Act</SPAN>.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 25 (3); O. Reg. 401/03, s. 4 (3); O. Reg. 294/07, s. 4 (3); O. Reg. 31/14, s. 4 (3); O. Reg. 526/17, s. 16 (1); O. Reg. 498/18, s. 10.</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec4" id="sec25subsec4"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> For the purposes of this section, </P>
 
<P class="firstdef-e">“piece work rate” means a rate of pay calculated on<I> </I>the basis of<I> </I>a unit of work performed.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 25 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec5" id="sec25subsec5"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> If an employer provides room or board to an employee, the following are the amounts which shall be deemed to have been paid by the employer to the employee as wages for the purposes of determining whether the minimum wage has been paid:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  For serviced housing accommodation, $99.35 a week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  For housing accommodation, $73.30 a week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  3.  For room, $31.70 a week if the room is private and $15.85 a week if the room is not private.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  4.  For board, $2.55 a meal and not more than $53.55 a week.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  5.  For both room and board, $85.25 a week if the room is private and $69.40 a week if the room is not private. O. Reg. 31/14, s. 4 (4); O. Reg. 526/17, s. 16 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec6" id="sec25subsec6"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The amount provided in subsection (5) in respect of housing accommodation shall be deemed to have been paid as wages only if the accommodation,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  is reasonably fit for human habitation;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  includes a kitchen with cooking facilities;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  includes at least two bedrooms or a bedroom and a living room; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (d)  has its own private toilet and washing facilities.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 25 (6).</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec7" id="sec25subsec7"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> The amount provided in subsection (5) in respect of serviced housing accommodation shall be deemed to have been paid as wages only if,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  the accommodation complies with clauses (6) (a) to (d); and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  light, heat, fuel, water, gas or electricity are provided at the employer’s expense.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 25 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec8" id="sec25subsec8"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> The amount provided in subsection (5) in respect of a room shall be deemed to have been paid as wages only if the room is,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  reasonably furnished and reasonably fit for human habitation;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  supplied with clean bed linen and towels; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  reasonably accessible to proper toilet and wash-basin facilities.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 25 (8).</P>
 
<a name="sec25subsec9" id="sec25subsec9"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="25" subsection="9" alinea="null">(9)</SPAN> Room or board shall not be deemed to have been paid by the employer to an employee as wages unless the employee has received the meals or occupied the room.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 25 (9).</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Three hour rule</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="25.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec25.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=25.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="25.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="25.1" data-viibes-start="33" data-viibes-end="32">  <A name="BK49"></A><B><a name="sec25.1" id="sec25_1"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="25.1" subsection="null" alinea="null">25.1</SPAN> </B>Part VII.1 of the Act applies to an employee described in section 24 of this Regulation. O. Reg. 498/18, s. 11.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Vacation or vacation pay</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="26" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec26" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=26"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="26" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="26" data-viibes-start="34" data-viibes-end="33"><B>  <A name="BK50"></A><a name="sec26subsec1" id="sec26subsec1"></A><a name="sec26" id="sec26"></A>26.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="26" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> If an employee has been employed by the employer for 13 weeks or more, the employer shall, in accordance with Part XI of the Act,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  give the employee a vacation with pay; or</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  pay the employee vacation pay.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 26 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec26subsec2" id="sec26subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="26" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> An employee entitled to vacation pay under subsection (1) earns vacation pay from the commencement of his or her employment.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 26 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec26subsec3" id="sec26subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="26" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="41" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">Section 41</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713">Act</SPAN> does not apply to the employee.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 26 (3).</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Public holidays</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="27" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec27" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=27"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="27" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="27" data-viibes-start="35" data-viibes-end="34">  <A name="BK51"></A><B><a name="sec27subsec1" id="sec27subsec1"></A><a name="sec27" id="sec27"></A>27.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="27" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Part X of the Act applies to an employee who has been employed by an employer for a period of 13 weeks or more.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 27 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec27subsec2" id="sec27subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="27" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For the purposes of this section, an employee shall be deemed to be employed in a continuous operation.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 27 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec27subsec3" id="sec27subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="27" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> Revoked:  O. Reg. 443/08, s. 2.</P>
 
<A name="Special_Rules_re_Commission_Automobile_Sales_Sector__50669"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK52"></A>Special Rules re Commission Automobile Sales Sector</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Commission automobile sales sector</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="28" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec28" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=28"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="28" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="2" data-noteup-count-display="2"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="28" data-viibes-start="36" data-viibes-end="35"><B>  <A name="BK53"></A><a name="sec28subsec1" id="sec28subsec1"></A><a name="sec28" id="sec28"></A>28.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="28" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> This section applies with respect to employees who sell automobiles partially or exclusively on a commission basis.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (1).</P></div>
 
<a name="sec28subsec2" id="sec28subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> For each pay period, the employer shall pay to each employee an amount that is at least equal to the amount the employee would have earned at the minimum wage.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (2); O. Reg. 401/03, s. 5; O. Reg. 294/07, s. 5; O. Reg. 31/14, s. 5 (1).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec3" id="sec28subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> A pay period shall not exceed one month.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (3).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec4" id="sec28subsec4"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="4" alinea="null">(4)</SPAN> Payments made to an employee shall be reconciled with wages earned by the employee for each reconciliation period.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (4).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec5" id="sec28subsec5"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="5" alinea="null">(5)</SPAN> No balance shall be carried forward past any reconciliation period.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (5).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec6" id="sec28subsec6"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="6" alinea="null">(6)</SPAN> The reconciliation of payments made to an employee and wages earned by an employee shall not result in any employee receiving less than the minimum wage for any pay period.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (6); O. Reg. 31/14, s. 5 (2).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec7" id="sec28subsec7"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="7" alinea="null">(7)</SPAN> For each year, the reconciliation periods shall be:</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  1.  January 1 - March 31.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  2.  April 1 - June 30.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  3.  July 1 - September 30.</P>
 
<P class="paragraph-e">  4.  October 1 - December 31.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (7).</P>
 
<a name="sec28subsec8" id="sec28subsec8"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="28" subsection="8" alinea="null">(8)</SPAN> If an employee’s employment terminates before the end of a reconciliation period, payments made to the employee shall be reconciled with wages earned by him or her, and subsection (6) applies.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 28 (8).</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="29" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec29" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=29"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="29" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="29" data-viibes-start="37" data-viibes-end="36">  <B><a name="sec29" id="sec29"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="29" subsection="null" alinea="null">29. </SPAN></B>Revoked:  O. Reg. 443/08, s. 3.</P></div>
 
<A name="Director_s_Approvals__52690"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK54"></A>Director’s Approvals</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="30.__31" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec30.__31" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=30.__31"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="30.__31" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="30.__31" data-viibes-start="38" data-viibes-end="37"><B>  <a name="sec30.__31" id="sec30___31"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="30.__31" subsection="null" alinea="null">30., 31. </SPAN></B>Revoked:  O. Reg. 50/05, s. 1.</P></div>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Certain approved agreements irrevocable</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="32" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec32" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=32"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="32" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="32" data-viibes-start="39" data-viibes-end="38"><B>  <A name="BK55"></A><a name="sec32subsec1" id="sec32subsec1"></A><a name="sec32" id="sec32"></A>32.</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="32" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> Despite subsection 17 (6) of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN>, an agreement under <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="17" ss="2" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">subsection 17 (2)</SPAN> of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN> that was made at the time of the employee’s hiring and that has been approved by the Director is irrevocable unless both the employer and the employee agree to its revocation.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 32 (1); O. Reg. 50/05, s. 2.</P></div>
 
<a name="sec32subsec2" id="sec32subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="32" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The Director may impose conditions in granting an approval.  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 32 (2).</P>
 
<A name="Exemption_re_Certain_Existing_Arrangements__53407"></A><P class="heading1-e"><A name="BK56"></A>Exemption re Certain Existing Arrangements</P>
 
<P class="headnote-e">Existing arrangements for long shifts</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="32.1" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec32.1" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=32.1"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="32.1" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-pen-to-square"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="32.1" data-viibes-start="40" data-viibes-end="39">  <A name="BK57"></A><B><a name="sec32.1subsec1" id="sec32_1subsec1"></A><a name="sec32.1" id="sec32_1"></A>32.1</B><B> </B><SPAN class="canlii_section_with_subsection" section="32.1" subsection="1" alinea="null">(1)</SPAN> <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" s="17" ss="1" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Clause 17 (1)</SPAN> (a) of the <SPAN class="reflex2-link" link-count="2" link1="/en/on/laws/astat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title1="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id1="96543" link2="/en/on/laws/stat/so-2000-c-41/latest/so-2000-c-41.html" title2="Employment Standards Act, 2000, SO 2000, c 41 (Ontario)" concatenated-id2="713" rank="1">Act</SPAN> does not apply with respect to the class of employees each of whom,</P></div>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  has an arrangement described in subsection (2) with an employer to whom a permit was issued under section 18 of the <I>Employment Standards Act</I>; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  is not required by the employer to work more than 10 hours a day.  O. Reg. 361/01, s. 1.</P>
 
<a name="sec32.1subsec2" id="sec32_1subsec2"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="32.1" subsection="2" alinea="null">(2)</SPAN> The arrangement,</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (a)  provides that the employee is willing to work, at the employer’s request, more hours per day than the number of hours in his or her regular work day;</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (b)  was made at or before the time of the employee’s hiring and before September 4, 2001; and</P>
 
<P class="clause-e">  (c)  has not been revoked by the mutual consent of the employer and employee.  O. Reg. 361/01, s. 1.</P>
 
<a name="sec32.1subsec3" id="sec32_1subsec3"></A><P class="subsection-e">  <SPAN class="canlii_subsection" section="32.1" subsection="3" alinea="null">(3)</SPAN> The terms of the arrangement need not be reduced to writing.  O. Reg. 361/01, s. 1.</P>
 
<div class="paragWrapper" data-lbh-p-number="33" data-lbh-p-anchor="sec33" data-lbh-p-noteup-link="/en/#search/origin1=/en/on/laws/regu/o-reg-285-01/latest/o-reg-285-01.html&linkedNoteup=&section1=33"><div class="bootstrap unselectable viibes-marker-toolbox lbh-p-tools" data-with-parag="33" title="Paragraph tools"><div class="dropdown dropleft"><i data-toggle="dropdown" class="fa-thin fa-message-pen" data-noteup-count="1" data-noteup-count-display="1"></i><div class="dropdown-menu lbh-p-tools-menu"></div></div></div><P class="section-e" data-viibes-parag="33" data-viibes-start="41" data-viibes-end="40">  <B><a name="sec33" id="sec33"></A><SPAN class="canlii_section" section="33" subsection="null" alinea="null">33.</SPAN></B> Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 285/01, s. 33.</P></div>
 
<P class="section-e"> </P>

// load noteup counts only when the tab is selected
var loadedCitedBy = false;
$('a#noteup-tab').on('shown.bs.tab', function (e) {
	if (loadedCitedBy == false) {
		$.get("/legislationTabs/citedBy/content/?legislationId=1502&lang=en", function(data) {

			$("#noteup-spinner").hide("fast");

		.fail(function(jqXHR) {
			console.error(jqXHR);
			$("#noteupContent").html("<p>An error occured while loading this tab.</p>");

		.always(function() {
			$("#noteup-spinner").hide("fast");
		});
		
		loadedCitedBy = true;
	}
});

				Benefit Plans, O Reg 286/01, &lt;<a href='https://canlii.ca/t/5327z'>https://canlii.ca/t/5327z</a>&gt; retrieved on 2023-10-17
			</div>
